reviews.review_text: Pros: The unit is lightweight and easy to move. It has a variety of included attachments to tackle almost all jobs around the home. One nice feature is the adjustable spray tip on the wide-angle wand. The unit has a lot of power for an electrical pressure washer -- more than enough to clean driveways, decks, grills, mowers, etc. Cons: As mentioned in many other reviews, the plastic hose adapter leaks water, right in the middle where the two washers meet. The leaking is so bad as to make the unit unusable, unless you enjoy being sprayed with a torrent of water while you work. The solution: go down to your local hardware store and buy a brass male-to-male hose adapter for 8 bucks. Now you are in business. The high-pressure hose that runs from the unit to the spray-gun is made from a stiff plastic that tangles easily and is hard to manage as you move around. I am currently researching buying an after-market hose made from high quality rubber to avoid this problem. Also, don't bother storing the hose using the built-in reel. It is fussy work trying to get the hose on and off, and bending the hose in tight circles makes it that much easier to tangle when you use it. Simply coil the hose loosely and drop it around the top of the handle. This will save you lots of time. Final thoughts: This unit provides a good value among other electric pressure washers, if you don't mind upgrading the hose adapter and dealing with a slightly annoying hose.

reviews.review_header: Exellent product, even better customer service.
reviews.review_text: The pressure washer does its job beautifully. It has a really long electric cord which was one of the requirements for me since I didn't want to mess with extension cords. The hose is actually pretty long too, so you don't have to drag the pressure washer around when you wash your car for example. Just set it in one place and the length of the hose will be enough reach all around. The pressure washer comes with 2 wands. One has a rotating tip and the other one has a tip that can be adjusted for different spray angles so you don't really need to buy any extra tips. It also has a bottle for cleaning chemicals. All accessories, electric cord and hose have their place right on the unit and they fit quiet nicely. Don't forget, it has 1900 PSI which is really pretty high pressure for non-commercial pressure washers. I don't know what's inside the unit, but it just feels sturdy and solid. I don't usually write reviews but what made me do it is AR North America's customer service. After testing the unit, I ordered an extra accessory from them directly (flat surface cleaner to clean cement surfaces). They have phone #'s and email addresses of their entire staff listed on their web side, so I asked few questions which were answered immediately. So I placed my order and couple of days later they informed me that the part I ordered was on back-order, so they offered to refund the money if I didn't feel like waiting. You know, usually companies will make you wait even if it's couple of weeks. I asked them how long I'd have to wait and they told me about a week which wasn't a big deal for me at all, so I was prepared to wait. The next day I received another email from them saying that they would send me a $90 surface cleaner instead of $30 one I had ordered...get this... at no extra charge. I buy stuff on-line very often and I have never seen anything like that before. Great product, great customer service. It's very comforting to know that a company stands behind their product in case you need it and most importantly, easily accessible.

Works Great, No Leaks! Whatever you have read up to this point or after this point (10/20/11) forget it, pay it no mind... This puppy does the job! In all fairness to the negative reviews, I believe the product presently being sold now, right here on Amazon, may have gone through some upgrades. I put this unit to the test right out of the box and there were absolutely no leaks... not one drop... BONE DRY! I think it is largely to do with a newly included part that the "leak issue" stated in many of the comments, has been eliminated and no longer exists. Another stated issue that no longer exists is the difficulty to put this Blue Wonder together... There are five screws: 4 to put the attachment holder on the back of the unit and 1 screw to attach a plastic piece that assists in holding the electrical cord to wrap around the attachment holder. Maybe with previously models, the handle and the pressure hose reel (which is only for storage) had to be attached (I don't know) but there are presently no other parts to attach than what I have mentioned. The problem with the directions is that they now include an insert telling you about the new (leak-free) part included but the old part (which is no longer included) is still referenced in the main direction booklet. Although, when I called the toll-free number, which is clearly marked on the box lid and on another insert included with the directions, I immediately got a person on the phone that was not only pleasant but helpful too. They explained that this new part is included and answered all of my questions as to the negative complaints that I had read on Amazon (another reported complaint about getting a human on the phone that does not exist). In fact, I called twice and got another person who was also pleasant and helpful because I forget to ask the previous person about the lance removal issue that is also mentioned in the comments. If you don't push the lance into the spring-loaded insert opening on the end of the gun-handle and then twist it, the lance will just keep turning around and around, and it won't come out. I must admit, when I tried to remove the lance after inserting it but before powering the unit up and taking it out for a test, it was confusing... but when the pressure washer was on and the safety lock on the handle was in-gauged, the lance came out without issue with a push inward and a turned to get it out. I myself found the hose storage wheel not helpful because the pressure hose had a mind of its own and it did not want to go on the wheel without a fight. Also, the rubber protector on the end of this hose kept hitting the unit at the top and bottom position when winding it, which slowed down the process. I might only use this storage wheel for winter storage... I much prefer wrapping both the power cord and the pressure hose (one at a time) around may hand and elbow to wind them in a circle and then lasso them over the pressure washer handle which holds both cord and hose very well. I agonized over this purchase because most of the negative comments had the same complaints threaded through each negative review. I thought to myself, if these people don't know each other (which they don't) how then could each negative comment have the same or similar issues mentioned in each review. So I bought and un-bought this product in my head many times until one day I just closed my eyes and took the plunge in spite of it all. I believe, for me, it was the price, the 1900 psi and the reputable manufacturer of the pump that push me over the edge to buy this product and the fact that I knew Amazon would stand behind it and take it back (no questions asked) if I had an issue. The biggest change I made to my purchase process, was to test and use the product the day it arrived so it didn't sit here unboxed waiting to be opened months later only to find that I was past the return date without ever powering it up once. Let's see... have I left anything out... Oh yea, IT WORKS! I will try to make a video so you can see for yourself that it works. I hope this is helpful and addresses any negative comment you may have read. P.S. The threads on the AR383 are metric so if you purchase an American threaded part and attach it to the AR383, it WILL leak.

DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT if you're going to use it to wash your car. The dispensor from the soap dispensing bottle came off and put a big dent into my brand new car. Horrible product, i would give it negative star

Very disappointed in this unit. The unit failed after about a half dozen uses over a year and a half. One day while using the pressure washer sounded as though it was no longer connected to the pump and the water was no longer pressurized. Upon further inspection, the gears driving the pump had come apart. Long story short, I was told that the unit was out of warranty and I am SOL. Lesson learned, pay a bit more for a quality product.

reviews.review_header: ~~Works Great, My Wife Won't Put It Down~~
reviews.review_text: We bought the AR Blue Clean 1,900 PSI to use around the house for various projects, but mainly to clean up our 10 year old wood fence. The unit arrived in 2 days in perfect condition, we unpacked it and had it assembled in about 10 minutes without any problem. I had read in some reviews that the connector for the garden hose leaked, so I was anticipation having to deal with that, but to my pleasant surprise it did not and has not leaked even a drop! Well we fired it up and this little machine really preformed great right from the start and all I had to do was get the hang of it. My wife and I have been using it for the last two days on our fence and it is making an old dirty fence look like new again. So easy to use that I can't get my wife to put it down.... The only thing my wife was wishing that the trigger would lock so she did not have to hole it constantly, so I just got a zip tie and tied it around the trigger and it works perfectly and to release the trigger just slide the zip tie down.... So bottom line is yes I would not hesitate for one second to recommend this to anyone.

reviews.review_header: Excellent Product! Powerful, Easy to Setup, No Leaks, Works Flawlessly!
reviews.review_text: I don't know why Amazon says the AR383 is 11 amps - it's actually 14 amps. Also, most sites rounded the flow rate down to 1.5gpm - the manual actually states it flows 1.58gpm max (which is closer to the 1.6gpm rating of the AR390). The manufacturer page is below: [...] I used mine for 3 hours straight the other day and it worked exceptionally. The narrow stream was powerful enough to actually remove old rust stains on our concrete walkway from the iron rail ... Be careful though, because it was actually powerful enough to remove (read, create and remove) some loose areas of concrete as well... I used the turbo nozzle for the majority of my patio cleaning project and it worked great, then I switched to the regular spray nozzle, set it to narrow and blasted off the rust stains and black Rustoleum spray paint that had gotten embedded into the concrete during touch ups of the rail. I've uploaded a shot from when I first received it and was just testing it out. That's more than 4 years of embedded crap on the patio, not just surface gunk! Thus far I've pressure washed the entire patio/entry steps and walkway, some siding and my wife's car! This thing's addictive!

reviews.review_header: THE reason I use Amazon: REVIEWS!!!
reviews.review_text: Excellent pressure washer. See my video. Wow. Plenty of Power. Nice and quiet. Addictive. ALSO, Phenomenal customer service. As in, I HAVE ONLY ONCE BEFORE encountered a company with this level of customer service. Even if you are not sure the pressure washer will handle your residential job (but it can handle it, don't worry), buy it just because if you ever need customer service, you will feel you have entered heaven. No, actually seriously, almost. I just googled their website and they have their contact info all right there; I emailed and explained the issue. The response was nearly immediate -- they are sending out a replacement part to me. They definitely have my recommendation!

reviews.review_header: It looks like the saying "you get what you pay for" holds ...
reviews.review_text: It's been 3 months since I purchased the AR383. I've been using it exclusively with the AR Foam Cannon for my weekly car washes. It looks like the saying "you get what you pay for" holds true when it comes to presser washers. For the first month everything worked very well. I wasn't a fan of the build quality, but what do you expect for a $150 pressure washer, right? The weakest link to the unit is the hose. An optional rubber hose would have really made things easier. The included hose is very rigid and makes it a pain to either wrap or unwind. As others have noted, the wind up mechanism is only used for storage (don't let the photo fool you). The first issue I encountered was leaking. The rubber washer at the end which connects to the spray gun breaks down very easily. Once it starts to break down you'll have a terrible leak. At first I lived with the water spraying down my leg, but eventually it impacted performance. Every 15 seconds the motor would rev up. I fixed this with some aftermarket rubber washers (they look like little donuts) from home depot. The unit worked well for another 4 weeks, but now it's developed another problem. The washer at the other end of the hose (connects to unit) is now shredded up. Also the cheap plastic connector for the hose is developing issues. I may try replacing that with an all metal hook up and forget the filter like others have mentioned. My recommendation is that you always leave the hose connected to your gun and the unit itself. If AR Blue just offered a standard rubber hose and normal connectors I'm sure this unit would be great. From a performance standpoint it delivers above and beyond my expectations. However, it's always a toss up whether I can use it so I couldn't recommend it.

Piece of junk. Used it last spring to clean deck and sidewalk - approximately 4 hours over a couple of days. Took it out yesterday to begin spring cleaning. After an hour the motor appears to have burned up. Completely inoperable.

This is the second AR pressure washer I have purchased. I owned the AR Blue Clean hand held unit previously for a mobile cleaning service I operate. It was a great unit until I left it in the back of my truck overnight last winter and it froze. (Stupid I know, but I live in Arizona!) In the six months I owned it I was completely impressed with it's function but not with the convenience of storage to usage and back to storage. It had great power for the size and quick response when you squeezed the trigger. The AR383 is awesome. More power for more uses. Extremely light weight and compact. Great price (especially with A-Prime)! I use the "Hose" reel to wrap the power cord since I only need about 10 ft of power cord at any given time. If you wrap the High Pressure Hose on the reel you will have many headaches getting it straightened out for usage, and it does not wind the hose while attached to the unit anyway. I simply remove the wands from the high pressure hose, place the wands in their holders and coil the high pressure hose to about 8 - 10 inches in diameter and drape it behind the wands on the back of the washer. This is faster and more convenient than the reel anyway. Leaks? I have no problems. Take your time with assembly (which is very minimal). Be sure to thread the hose connections properly and do not CROSS THREAD the inlet/outlets. Use a little Vasoline on the inlet and outlet hose threads. This will stop any small leaks and will allow you to remove hoses easily if needed. I use quick connect adapters as well. No water Pressure / Will not pump? Make sure you let your inlet water hose run for a minute to be sure all air is out of the hose BEFORE you attach it to the Pressure Washer so you're getting water right to the unit. If you don't do this you could burn up the pump. You may also squeeze the wand trigger a few times after turning the washer on to allow flow through the washer then release the trigger and it will build the proper pressure. I operate from a storage tank with no pump and have never had an issue with this washer. Make sure you have water to the unit BEFORE you turn it on. I would encourage anyone interested in this product to ignore any review under 4 stars. OK, sometimes we get a lemon, but I truly believe most problematic issues are due to improper OWNER assembly or improper OWNER usage. AR could not possibly make this product any simpler to use. The design and engineering of this unit are about as good as it gets. I use this unit almost every day, way more than most ever will, and I have had ZERO issues. Have used units twice the size and weight and they do not even come close. This unit should handle any cleaning needs that any average consumer should encounter. (And, NO, I don't work for AR North America :-)) *** UPDATE: 7/19/2012 *** Just purchased my second AR383 - Great Machine, but a few changes have been made. *** *** Definately purchase new brass connections for the washer's water inlet. You could get away with the old plastic connection on previous models, but the new disign will never hold up. It looks fancy with a see through case and filter, but is very flimsy for major water connection. I took the old filter from inside the inlet housing on my old washer and transferred it to the new one and then installed the brass connectors. (you will not have this option, but as long as your water source is your hose at the house you should be OK. Run your hose a little before connecting to the washer to get rid of any sediment or debris settled in the hose. *** The connection for the pressure hose is now the same as most other washer or hose brands. AR includes an adaptor now in case you run into an odd size replacement pressure hose. If you need to replace the pressure hose, suck it up and by the entire hose / wand assembly from AR. A little more money, but it works best with this washer. *** Wrap your pressure hose with heavy electrical tape or some Gorilla Tape and it will last 5 times longer. The smallest nick in the pressure hose and that's it. Replace it. I have been whacked in the face when a pressure hose failed, and trust me, it was like a right cross. I worked out the amout of hours I used this washer and formulated a lifespan for normal use. If you used this washer for 3 hours a month, 12 months a year, you would have to use it for 15 years to put the same amount of hours on this washer that I have since purchased. Not too bad for a non-commercial washer. Still five stars from my point of view. *** See my photos.

reviews.review_header: Worked great once-second use 2 weeks later started leaking from inside.
reviews.review_text: I just printed my return label for this item. I read the reviews and was a little wary of buying this because of the number on Amazon that had problems (10% of reviews gave 1 star) but since so many had 4 and 5 star rating I decided to give it a shot. I have owned an electric pressure washer before and it had worked well for a couple of uses then began leaking. A replacement part was received but after using once, the same thing happened and I gave up. I decided to cut my losses this time and return it before the return period was up just in case the same thing happened. I assembled the unit carefully following the owners manual. The first time I used it, everything was great-no leaks like many others had experienced. I did try to use a heavy extension cord and had to find a closer outlet to get enough power but with the cord it was fine. The turbo nozzle was not of much use unless you wanted to cut into something but the adjustable one worked well cleaning a very dirty concrete sidewalk and also a wooden porch. Drained everything according to the directions and put away. I am glad I did not write my review immediately. Two weeks later when I went to use it again, it worked well again for about 10 minutes. Then I noticed that the pressure was not as high as it had been-no more than you would get from a spray nozzle on a regular garden hose-and the motor kept running as if still trying to build up pressure and there was suddenly a lot of water spewing out. I turned off and checked the quick connect and the water output hoses and they were properly connected. The water was coming from the bottom of the unit which led me to believe there was a leak somewhere internally that was not allowing the water pressure to be maintained. I had to wait until a week day to reach customer service. At first they tried to tell me that I must have connected the quick connect adapters in reverse but I confirmed that everything was correct. I reconnected everything before my call so I could explain where the leak was coming from. I peered inside the vents near the bottom of the unit and saw water spewing out from around a component inside but the exterior connections were not leaking. When the unit power was turned on, the amount of water leaking increased greatly but it was leaking even when the unit was off once the water supply was turned on.After having me remove the screen filter on the quick connect, the rep determined that if the leak was coming from the pump or elsewhere internally, the unit would have to be returned and replaced as it could not be repaired. Since the unit had been used only an hour or two at most and fully following operating instructions, I decided that the quality was questionable enough that I did not want to get another unit and have the same thing happen. I would not be able to recommend this product based on my experience. I am going back to the drawing board in my search for a durable electric power washer. This time I will look for reviews indicating that the product is good over a longer period of time and not just on the first use. Even though the customer service reps assured me that these problems are rare and they produce some of the best power washers available, I would have to disagree.

reviews.review_header: Perfect for OCD/DIY housewife that likes big bang for her buck!
reviews.review_text: I am reading all of the reviews on this amazing pressure washer and notice that a majority of them are UE (user error). I am just a housewife that is obsessed with a clean home and I am not the most mechanically inclined person; however, I did read the manual and carefully threaded the pressure hose as well as the garden hose to the machine. Because I made sure that I did not cross thread, nor force the piece to fit, it has absolutely no leaks and has been delight to use. When you first get the machine, take your time on the connections to 'feel the fit' of the attachments and it will be smooth sailing from then on. I absolutely love this powerful machine. My husband first asked me to rent a professional machine to strip and retreat our pergola. We live in San Antonio, so the wood gets a beating. After much agony and research I decided on this one. I am so happy that I decided to purchase our pressure washer than renting one. This one has enough power to clean all what I want it to, and this is without chemicals. I haven't even tried pre-treating the areas that I am going to pressure wash! After testing it out on our pergola, I got fired up to wash the entire front of our house, including the newly installed tile on our patio, stucco siding, front concrete walkway and all the windows! It is so easy to use and the noise was not obnoxious me a bit because once you release the trigger, the machine goes quiet. My neighbors like that part! The only thing is that after a while of washing the walkways, siding, windows, tile and pergola; my fingers started to hurt from pulling the trigger and holding the gun to clean. That is only because I was out there for a while using the machine, the trigger is not hard to press when operating. I will try to follow up on this review with a video of the quality of the cleaning on my driveway. UPDATE: Wed, June 24, 2015 After using it approx. 4 times the GFCI plug is tripping and I must get a new one. I can see that there is some condensation on the test light area of the plug. It is plugged into an outdoor receptacle that is around moisture (I am pressure washing) but has never been submerged nor sitting on the ground where it could have got wet. I am not sure how water got into the plug. So it is currently inoperable and I am really bummed. I planned on pressure washing my neighbor's driveway for $100!!!! But that project is currently on the back burner till I can get in contact with the AR Blue Clean customer service. There is some hiccup in my customer service experience. I have called and left a message; there is no person that has picked up the phone. So I am currently awaiting a call back to see if they can send me another GFCI plug to replace the one that I have. On a good note, the replacement seems very straight forward. There is no video tutorial on how to replace so some searching around allowed me to find out how to do it. It is simply unscrewing the unit by 4 screws, unscrew the positive and negative wire, then swap out the new receptacle by placing the two wires onto correct contact points with a phillips screw. Secure wires by tightening the two screws and then place the protective cap back onto the plug and you are done! **UPDATE 2: I am keeping my 5 star status on this machine; not only because I am in love with it but because I am in LOVE with the customer service!!!! I just tried calling now and Tom S. picked up the phone and trouble shooted me through the GFCI issue. He was very patient and took me through several ways to try to get the receptacle to deliver power to my washer. He even called me back after 5 minutes (so that I could have some time to hook it up outside) and..........he got it to work!!!! I had plugged it to the water, pulled the trigger to make sure that there was water running to the unit. I then plugged it in and pressed the test button, to make sure that it is off. I then pressed the on button (the minus sign). He had me then hold the trigger of the gun while I held in the reset button and WHALLA!!! It started to work again and stayed on! I have my precious pressure washer operating again and I don't have to wait for them to send me a replacement part! Prior to us going through the troubleshooting, he was going to send me the replacement part for free! I just had to email him my proof of purchase and it would be on it's way. I am so happy that I have my precious pressure washer back! Can I say again, I FREGGIN LOVE THIS THING!

I am obsessed with this power washer. I got a quote on pro washing which was $800 for siding, concrete and fence, all of which there's a lot but bought this instead. Great purchase. Turns old dirty blackened concrete to sparkling new! Also worked fantastic on our composite deck.

Have never encountered a piece of equipment with this many design flaws. You would think a company would experiment with a prototype before going into production. I’ve got some modifications to suggest. Here goes: The SWITCH is hidden in a dark recess in back instead of the front where you need it. It’s poorly marked so you will fumble to discover ON vs OFF. Since the pump shuts down automatically, this is not as odd as it sounds. You don’t readily know if it is electrically OFF or the GFCI has been triggered or it is just in the completely quiet auto-pause mode. Both the electrical cord and the hose are the same color (ouch) and roughly the same diameter which will annoy you frequently as they become entangled. The 30 foot long ELECTRICAL CORD has a GFCI plug which you are NOT going to want to drag along the ground connected to your extension cord. (How many jobs are within a 30 foot range of a receptacle?) PLUS, the GFCI will need to be reset as it halts your activity on startup and other occasions. You have to make trips back and forth to your receptacle! Better would have been a simple six inch cord that exits the machine near the top rather than the bottom (where it is vulnerable) Others have mentioned the useless CORD REEL. Here’s a way to make use of it and solve the GFCI problem. Drag out the machine’s electrical cord full length then return the plug towards the unit... thus having exactly halved the cord. Insert the midway loop into the center of the cord reel and roll it all up. Now string the GFCI plug through the big hole in the unit’s handle and let it dangle or tie it up there.... safely off the ground, and consequently voiding use of that obnoxious electrical cord entirely. NOW you can attach YOUR extension cord AT the machine AND be near when the GFCI gets triggered. The plastic (and vulnerable) WATER SUPPLY CONNECTION is, once again, near the bottom of the machine. It has a quick release connect but no turn-off. SO each time you stop work, you have to return to your faucet. Turn it off. Return to the machine. Trigger the spray hose to release pressure. Only then can you release your hose. Here’s what works best for me. Purchase (hardware supply store or on-line) a “hose end turn-off unit” and a “quick-release connect” (all brass lasts a LOT longer). Install these on the end of your water supply hose... then right to THEIR plastic quick-release connect. Now you can turn off the water supply AT the machine, release pressure from the spray gun and disconnect your water supply from their machine’s plastic coupling. Otherwise you are stuck with having to unscrew that plastic piece from your hose every single time you quit. ....AND then return the darn thing back to the machine. With my solution you are going to want a SECOND “quick-release connect” for whatever you normally use at the end of your hose. The WHEELS are virtually worthless. Their pressure hose exits in the back at the bottom! Tilting the machine to utilize the wheels scraps it on the pavement. In addition you are going to eventually break off their plastic connect if you try to tilt and wheel the machine on the job with your heavy water supply hose connected. You wind up carrying the machine everywhere. The ACCESSORY HOLDER on the back of the unit does not hold the pressure gun firmly with its nozzle in place. You have to take it apart! So wheeling the machine about during a job is annoying with the pressure gun plus nozzle. OUCH. All this said... Well, tt works. The pressure is good. The adjustable spray nozzle is fine. Others say the pump is well made. I will not return it. BUT WHEW!

reviews.review_header: Leaking Problem Solved- Excellent Washer Now
reviews.review_text: (FOR THOSE WHO DON'T WANT TO READ, FAST FIX FOR LEAKING: TWO RED RUBBER HOSE WASHERS IN THE CLEAR PLASTIC CONNECTOR THAT GOES TO THE WASHER AND HAND TIGHTEN AS TIGHT AS YOU CAN- DO NOT USE THE BLACK WASHER PROVIDED) I just received the pressure washer a few ago. It did a great job of cleaning my 15 year old 30 x 15 ft deck of all the dirt and crud. First, let me tell you, don't buy the Gilmour 7FHS7FH Double Female Swivel Brass Connector, 3/4-Inch by 3/4-Inch and Gilmour 09QCGT 2-Piece Green Thumb Brass Quick Connector Set for Hose. These are the one recommended in the reviews. I read all 527 reviews before buying and knew what to expect, which is why I purchased these. There is nothing wrong with them, but they are not needed. I put everything together and used the brass fittings, when I turned on the maching I got the leak at the hose to washer connection that everyone has talked about. It was quite a bit of spray in that area. I tried using teflon tape and vasiline on the threads, I tried the plastic connector, same spray leak, nothing worked. I proceeded to use the machine anyway and was very impressed. I decided that the machine was so good that I could live with the leaking. I did half my deck the first day, during the night, I reread all the reviews to compile the fixes for the leak. The only thing I didn't try was adding an extra washer at the hose connection. The next morning I went to Home Depot and bought a pack of hose washers, the red rubber ones for $2. I didn't expect too much, maybe lessen the leak. I decided to give the plastic connector a try again. Took out the washer that came with the unit and put two hose washers in and tightened as hard as I could by hand. Turned on and no leak, not a drop. Used the rest of the day with no problem. A fix so simple. And the plastic connector worked great. I like it over the brass because when you disconnect the hose at the quick release the water flow is stopped unlike the brass, where I have to shut the water off with the handle at the other end. I could have saved $12 by not buying the brass fittings. I would say to use the plastic connector as it functions great, and if you ever need to replace then buy the brass. I was afraid I was going to damage the fitting on the washer as I was tightening the fittings as hard as I could with a wrench to stop the leak. When all it took is two hose washers and hand tightening.

reviews.review_header: Stop looking - this is the PW to buy!
reviews.review_text: I was very leery of buying any electric pressure washer but hate dealing with gas engines that sit unused for extended periods of time & I knew that I wouldn't be using it all that frequently. After reading all I could about various electric models I ordered this one & couldn't be happier, or more relieved that I made the right choice. My first use was to clean 18 years of mold off 300' of an 8' wooden picket privacy fence using the adjustable spray wand. I ran the washer for hours at a time, which scares me with inexpensive electric motors, but it never appeared to overheat or give me any reason for concern & did a great job. A few days later I cleaned a neighbor's concrete driveway using the high pressure wand. Again, I ran it continuously for a couple of hours & was very happy with the results. I made a complete pass over the entire surface with only water, then for about 20% of the surface with the most stubborn mold, I poured on generic bleach & swished it around with an old broom, then let it sit for a few minutes. The bleach cleaned up the rest of the mold & I just washed the bleach away with the pressure washer. Both of those jobs were a bit slow but not physically taxing for a 60 year old man in decent condition but I wouldn't mind if the high pressure wand was a little longer (I'm 6'-0" tall). Even though cleaning the driveway was pretty easy using the high pressure wand, I ordered the 10" deck/flat surface cleaner for when I clean my own driveway. I also bought a brass double female coupling since I'd read about so many people having leaking issues at the input hose connection. Well, I haven't even taken it out of the package because I have had no leaks other than the minor drips that I'd expect from any hose fittings. My only negative comments about this machine have to do with the tool caddy, the output hose reel & the power plug. I'd guess that a marketing team came up with the tool caddy & hose reel specs. because while they sound like great ideas, the implementation is pretty much useless. The only reason for the tool caddy might be to keep your wands attached to the unit when storing it. The hose reel should probably not be used because it coils the hose too severely & the slot for holding the hose end in place while initially reeling in the hose creates a kink in the hose near the coupling. A reel like this could be OK if the hose was a flexible material but it's pretty stiff & any kink will eventually damage it. My issue with the power plug is that it's huge! It's a GFI-like plug that is physically way oversized, to the point that it makes coiling the cord around the take up "ears" (on the tool caddy) a bit more of an issue than it should be - meaning that you have to wind it in such a way as to end up with the plug supported rather than leave it dangling. I ended up totally removing the hose reel & the tool caddy. So I wind the power cord around the handle, creating a nice little "nest" for the plug & I store the gun, wands & output hose separately. Removing the tool caddy has the additional benefit of eliminating the useless projections at the back of the unit & making it possible to lay it down in storage or if throwing it in a car. In summary, I love this pressure washer & the fact that I find the tool caddy, hose reel & power plug to be poorly implemented doesn't bother me in the least because otherwise it's a great little machine that can handle just about any pressure washing task that a non-commercial user is likely to have. I'm typically overly critical of products so coming from me that's high praise!

reviews.review_header: Half of a decent power washer.
reviews.review_text: Where to begin. I bought this machine to power wash the stucco exterior of my house, although I also intended (and did) use this machine to wash my car, patio, outdoor furniture. You get the picture. Light duty homeowner stuff. I had 4 requirements 1) minimum of 1600psi 2) price less than 200 3) electric powered and 4) external detergent reservoir (i.e one that pulls the detergent at the spray head rather then mixing it in the pump as some do) This fit the bill. I also took the advice of a fellow amazon reviewer who recommended getting a brass male to male adapter to replace the awful garden hose quick connect that come with the unit. That was a big help. Ultimately the machine works , but to get it to a place where it is not nearly useless you need to spend money on upgrades. Essentially the machine has 3 near fatal flaws 1) the spray gun, hose, spray heads etc are trash. They feel and look more like toy laser guns then they do a tool. The spray handle is light flimsy plastic. The trigger and safety are fiddly and prone to sticking. 2) the pressure hose is stiff and difficult to use ( ignore the onboard hose storage spindle it is nonsense) almost feels like a length or pex with brass fittings on the ends And...3) All the attachments are proprietary and crappy and difficult to use ( one of those push and twist cam locks). This set up prevents you from getting an extension wand or better hose or better gun. But if you are willing to spend another 60 or 70 usd on a better hose, and better spray gun then you have a decent machine and the flexibility to add angled spray heads or extension wands or anything else out there that is much higher quality and using the standard pressure washer hardware. So ultimately my all in cost went above my 200 dollar cap but at least now I have a machine that does what I need it to.

I just tested this model for the first time today, March 8th, 2014. What I want to warn other would-be buyers is that the supplied plastic hose connector is a piece of garbage. Shame on the manufactures/supplier to force their customers to visit a hardware store and buy a better model that fits properly and does not leak. The supplied garden hose adapter kit that connect this unit to your garden hose is just very poorly made and leaks a lot of water. It is not about tightening more as the water leaks where this 2-part adapter connect together. There is nothing a user can do. So I was forced to visit my hardware store and buy a new Gilmour hose adapter that works just fine, no more leaks. So be ready to buy a better hose adapter if you decide to buy this model. Also, the 20 foot power pressure hose is just too short to wash your car comfortably. I was forced to keep moving this unit closer to where I was power washing. I wish this pressure hose was at least 5-10 feet longer. It is not very practical as it is not possible to wash a car without moving the unit around with you. The water spraying pressure was OK and adequate. I just don't know about this model's durability. I hope it will last a long time, a good many years. I am a light user, maybe I will wash my car once a week, so it is not unreasonable of me to expect several years of good use. Only time will tell, and I will update this review if I experience any unexpected failures or problems. When you turn the power switch on, from 0 to 1, the unit does not start until you pull the trigger gun, so it is a nice feature to have it start automatically, and it does stop when your release the trigger. I hope this company reads these reviews and improve their models. They should start providing better hose adapters and a longer pressure hose. I bought this model here at Amazon for about $130 with free shipping which I believe to be a good and fair price. I have noticed that the price keeps changing, so keep an eye on it. I hope I helped you.

reviews.review_header: The best pressure washer for the money.
reviews.review_text: Wonderful pressure washer, fairly quiet. I have had it for less than a year, and have used it for about 40 hours of runtime. It has had no issues so far. When i first got it, the spray nozzle was clogged. The unit came with a little tool for un clogging the spray nozzle though, so no big deal. It has never been clogged since, even with unfiltered well water. There is an inline screen with the included hose quick disconnect attachment. Many people say the plastic hose disconnect is fragile, and this probably is true, so you must either be careful with it, or use a brass adapter. I have used the plastic thing the entire time Ive owned it, and I really like it. You have to be careful when moving the pressure washer around that you arent pulling the hose sideways, but this is good practice anyways so i think the plastic thing is a good reminder to be gentle with your pressure washer. The hose reel is stupid. I have the cord wrapped in the reel, and never unroll it. Instead I just bring my extension cord over to the machine. The hose is not particularly flexible, I disconnect my hose and roll it up and hang it on top of the machine every time I use it, and on cold days this task is not as easy, but still doable. The length of the hose is okay, but a few more feet would be perfect. If i place the washer at the side of my vw golf, I can get to every part of the car without moving the pressure washer. However, if I place it infront of my 2 door, short bed truck, i cant get to the tail gate.

reviews.review_header: This is great home use pressure cleaner
reviews.review_text: This is great home use pressure cleaner. No leaks and does everything as advertised. A few notes: There is not a way to lock the handle, so if you are doing a large area, your hand is going to get tired Given it is not recommended to be used with an extension power cord, its a good idea to get the 25 foot extension hose Do not purchase the 80006 universal pressure washer adapter. Its not needed and it the threads are not compatible The factory hose is nearly impossible to get on the reel, no point, just loop around as others state. The garden hose adapter is exposed if you leave it attached to the unit and would be easy to break. remove it after each use. The soap dispenser dispenses at hose pressure, not pressurized via the pump. I have used this is clean my patio and underside patio roofing, about 800 square feet. It didn't complain or get hot ( but your hands will sore from the constant squeezing of the handle). If you are considering this unit, you really cant go wrong and I have recommended it to others.

reviews.review_header: The hole reel is a joke - there is no way to easily wind up the pressure hose as it kinks and ...
reviews.review_text: I bought this just over a year ago and have used it fairly infrequently - just to blast my tires and outdoor kitchen. The inlet hose (low pressure) leaked as promised by the other reviews. This didn't really bother me as I use it outside, so it just wastes a bit of water. The hole reel is a joke - there is no way to easily wind up the pressure hose as it kinks and the reel is so cheaply made. Just loop it and toss it over the handle. Every so often the unit would "cough" and stop working. I would check for kinks in the low pressure hose (none), verify the water source (no issue), then restart it and it would work again. After about 13 months, a massive leak developed where the high pressure hose hits the plastic wand. It is now useless unless you are wearing a rain suit. Problem is that the warranty is 12 months, so I'm out of luck. Don't waste your money.

reviews.review_header: I was going to buy the Binford 9000 Pressure Washer until........
reviews.review_text: I saw this one. Unlike some reviewers that pulled it out of the box and went right to the computer and wrote a gushing review, I actually used this for about 20 hours before I wrote mine. I have found it to do anything that has been asked and then some. This replaced an old hard to start heavy gas pressure washer that I gave up on last year. I also bought the deck cleaning attachment that is simply amazing. It works great washing cars, windows and decks. My wife told me that it was my turn to scrub down our tiled shower - usually a good 2 hour job with doing the glass. Not with this baby! Brought the wand thru the window, Hit it with some TSP and BAMM! Done in 20 minutes flat. Of course Mrs. Johnson was not home at the time and I'm not about to tell her my secret. You might be a redneck if...... The latest project has been removing mold from a second story wood deck in preparation for sealing. I used a mixture of TSP and bleach, some light scrubbing and the crap has rolled right off. Looks like new. I did take advice from past reviews and bought the double female brass fitting right off the git go to replace the one that came with it that is prone to cracking. I do wish that the detergent bottle was bigger as you drain it pretty quick. One thing I have noticed is that if you release the trigger and immediately reengage it the machine will cavate and not respond. No big deal. Just count to 1 before you squeeze the trigger again. All in all a great machine to have in the arsenal. UPDATE NOV 2014 The double brass female coupler I bought with this snapped in two. I made up a 2 foot hose with a female hose end on each side. It now has much less stress on the fitting with the added benefit of it is much easier to connect the garden hose and the machine is more stable.

Having only what I considered light washing duties around the house, I figured I'd buy an electric power washer. This unit has one of the highest PSI ratings at 1900 than most electric units which are 1600-1700 PSI. First off, the most annoying thing is the inlet water hose, the outlet pressure hose and the electric cord constantly get tangled up. The outlet hose and electric cord are on the back and the inlet hose connects on the front. If you have to go a distance from the electric outlet and need to use an extension cord, add that into the mix of things getting tangled. Next, unless you are using the jet spray adjustment, which by the way is like writing with a fine liner Sharpie pen, you're not really removing any dirt. If you use a wider angle spray, you have to get within an inch or so of the surface for it to remove the dirt. Now I'm talking about an aluminum awning with just a years worth of dust and dirt on it, nothing else. I used a cleaner designed for power washers, sprayed it on with a pump sprayer, let it sit for the recommended time and used the power washer to remove the dirt. The dirt just laughed at me until I got within that 1-2 inches. I had better luck using a brush and garden hose like I used to use in the past and hoped I didn't need to do that anymore with this power washer. But again at the jet stream setting, it works fine. So much for washing my house siding and outside gutters.

reviews.review_header: Replacement O-ring size information and sources
reviews.review_text: I have had the AR383 for over 3 years and have several broken or missing O-rings. I found O-rings at my local home center that fit perfectly. The AR383 is working now as it did when it was brand new, and I have no leaks anywhere. The replacement O-rings I found are about 50 cents each. Standard fractional inch sizes found at home centers work perfectly. Here is the information I have gathered. Hope it helps others easily find replacement O-rings without measuring and without multiple trips to the local store to get the correct sizes: Manufacturer's O-ring replacement kit (Qty) Size Large end of pressure hose (1) 10 mm x 2.5mm-N90 Bayonet/Soap Bottle (3) 8.0mm x 2.0mm-N70 Pressure Hose to spray gun (1) 5.2mm x 1.5mm-N70 MM (Millimeters) I.D. (Cross Section) Large end of pressure hose 10 (2.5) Bayonet/Soap Bottle 8.0 (2.0) Pressure Hose to spray gun 5.2 (1.5) Decimal Inches I.D. (Cross Section) Large end of pressure hose .394 (.098) Bayonet/Soap Bottle .315 (.078) Pressure Hose to spray gun .204 (.059) Fractional Inches I.D. (Cross Section) Large end of pressure hose 3/8 (3/32) Bayonet/Soap Bottle 5/16 (5/64) Pressure Hose to spray gun 1/4 (1/16) Local Hardware/Home Center Thrifco Plumbing Brand Cost Note Large end of pressure hose 550T I.D 3/8” O.D. 9/16” Wall 3/32” $0.99 for 2 Works perfectly, no leaking Bayonet/Soap Bottle 544T I.D 5/16 “ O.D. 7/16” Wall 1/16” $0.99 for 2 Works perfectly, no leaking Pressure Hose to spray gun 546T I.D 1/4” O.D. 3/8” Wall 1/16” $0.99 for 2 Works perfectly, no leaking The O-ring used for the large end of pressure hose appears to be the same size as the supply hose quick coupling O-ring. Keep O-rings lubricated with Moen grease for protection and ease of assembly.

reviews.review_header: ... ordered this unit two years ago and it works great! EXCEPT
reviews.review_text: I ordered this unit two years ago and it works great! EXCEPT... The GFI plug had to be replaced within a few weeks. The company was very responsive and sent out a new GFI plug overnight. And they told me this was a problem they were aware of. Replaced the GFI finished my work and stored it until three hours ago. Same problem the GFI will not allow a reset. I only use my pressure washer in the spring and I would like to use it when I need it. This time they told me to take the unit off and send it to them and if it was faulty they would replace it, or I could go to my local hardware and replace it at my cost. I have tested it on various outlets and with and without properly rated extension cords. VERY Frustrating

I have a Model AR383 which is 14 months old. It has only been used 4 – 5 times and worked well for light residential cleaning, but recently stopped working. When the on/off switch was turned on, the motor ran continuously with or without the trigger pulled. Water was running and it squirted out when the trigger was pulled, but only as a very weak stream, i.e. no high pressure. I contacted AR Blue Clean Customer Service via email and was extremely impressed with their response for the following reasons: 1. They called me back directly rather than replying by email. 2. They responded within 1 business day of receiving my email. 3. They were willing to take time to troubleshoot the problem on the phone rather than having me take the unit to a service center or sending it back for evaluation/repair. 4. They gave me time to setup the unit and then call them back to troubleshoot it. 5. They identified several issues with the way I had assembled including • reversing the garden hose (blue/black) adapter with the water intake (clear) adapter • cleaning dirt and debris from the screen inside the water intake adapter • ensuring there was enough water pressure from my garden hose to operate the unit properly 6. They offered a more rugged, longer life, metal adapter to replace the included plastic adapters. They had my unit back up and running again within minutes! Their excellent customer service made me a happy customer and fan of AR Blue Clean!

reviews.review_header: Great Value pressure washer for a small to mid size homeowner
reviews.review_text: For the price, the average do-it-yourself homeowner will be satisfied with the product. The multiple spray wands offer a wide range of cleaning options. This product provides ample water spray pressure for an electric power washer, It took off years of dirt and gunk build up on my driveway and fence. The spray hose is fairly flexible and resists kinks for the most part. The spray bottle attachment works great so you can use a cleaning additive to help get the hard stains off (I used Simple green pro hd). Winding the hose is cumbersome, but doable with some patience. The option is to wrap separate with a Velcro tie. Not a major issue. Ensure that the spray nozzle is fully locked onto the handle or it will fly off when pressure is applied. We lost a nozzle in the water in short order while spraying our dock area, into the deep water never to be seen again! This was our issue by failing to properly lock the nozzle. Overall this is a good machine. Time will tell if it can stand up to repeated uses. Very good product that I would recommend.

This is my first pressure washer and I must say I'm glad I bough it.. It's taking care of 7 yrs of build-up on my side-walk, drive way, front entrance concrete and back patio. This pressure washer has plenty of power for any cleaning job I would use it for.. People who say it has "no more power than a regular garden hose" obviously do NOT have the unit POWERED ON. I followed all the instructions and I've had NO PROBLEM with leaks.. I think others may have leaks because of cross-threading the connections.. So just make sure not to cross-thread them.... Also, when connecting your water hose to the front of the machine, "push it all the way in UNTIL IT CLICKS", so that it won't leak. I'm very glad I also bought the AR Blue Clean 10" Deck, Patio & Flat Surface Cleaner. Save time, water and energy on your next cleaning project. Ideal accessory for cleaning patios, decks and driveways ... This thing is a must-have attachment if you're going to do driveways or sidewalks.. It really does work!.. It's a real time saver compared to just using the wand attachment. I haven't used any cleaning solution yet since plain water is getting the job done with no problem. I highly recommend this pressure washer along with the 10" Deck attachment.. The cleaning I've done really looks great!

I read as many of the negative comments about the unit as I cared to, but bought the unit anyway. After assembling the unit, I took a breath, turned it on and waited to see if my experience would be as negative as I'd read. After a few minutes of use, none of the issues arose, and "man did the thing blow away the mold and dirt" I'd been agonizing and grimacing about for months. It didn't leak. It had the pressure. It performed, nicely. I was looking for something else to wash when I was done.

reviews.review_header: Has some good features -- but proprietary parts and breaking within one year (and three days) was less than acceptable
reviews.review_text: Initially, we thought this was a reasonably good product. When it works (see more below), the pressure washing generally does a good job. I would say that it's respectable for power washing the sides of house and Trex decking. We let our friends borrow it to do their wood deck, and they found that it did not really work well for them. We also bought a separate adapter to power wash our concrete patio. That did relatively well but also was of poor quality, which meant that it could take hours to power wash the concrete. [This was my experience both last summer and this spring.] Again, we lent this attachment to our friends for their wood deck, and it didn't work for them. If these were all the issues we faced, I would probably give it 3-4 stars. We experienced a series of problems, however, justifying a 2* rating. Most importantly, it BROKE within one year and three days of purchase. That meant the manufacturer wouldn't lift a finger to help us. That was incredibly depressing considering the amount of our fiscal investment. The other challenge that we had is that the fittings for the power washer are proprietary and not adaptable to other types of machines. The "rubber hit the road" for us on this when we tried to use this pressure washer to power wash our gutters. After hours and weeks of research, my husband was unable to find any adapter that permitted this aspect and the manufacturer doesn't supply one. So we were surprised to find that we were completely unable to use this for one of the primary reasons we purchased it. Although we couldn't use this to power wash gutters and it BROKE (sorry for all caps, it's still painful) within a year, we used it reasonably well on our decking and siding (although our friends had problem with their wood deck). So I give it 2* in total. Sorry to burst your bubble about this machine. We wanted to love it. We truly did. But we just didn't. Then again, my husband said: "I'm not so sad about it breaking in a way, because I'd really like to replace it." Think about that before investing your money.

reviews.review_header: AR383 review after 20 hours of use
reviews.review_text: I waited until I got my money's worth out of this purchase before reviewing. After cleaning the driveways, patios and walkways of two small properties I own I have already gotten enough use out of this to break even over the cost of paying someone to do the job. Cleaned my barbecue too. The noise level is better than other units I have seen and heard my neighbors use, no high pitched whine. The power cord and pressure hose are of a good useful length. The handle design is less than ideal - the button to lock the trigger off is of no value but there is a serious need for a button to lock the trigger ON to avoid hand cramps. I had to change hands constantly to avoid hand cramps due to the resistance of the trigger. One of the wands is worthless and I could do without it, the other one is adjustable for varied applications. I bought a bottle of antifreeze/lubricant and use it after every job. Seems like a good idea although I suspect it is just automotive antifreeze. The power was only enough for a 1 inch swath of cleaning in my applications but I did find it can clean a two inch swath of siding. I refuse to power clean my siding as it is too hard on the paint and it forces water into walls.
Literally used 4 times. Water squirts everywhere & GFI plug died. Called company & advised to replace the plug with a NON-GFI. That worked and power to the unit but nothing else....Threw it out!

reviews.review_header: Not only was this product superior to the others I’ve owned
reviews.review_text: I have owned a couple of mid-level pressure washers during the past 8 years. Each were electric powered washers generating between 1500 - 1900 psi. None compare to the cleaning performance of the Blue Clean AR 383. Not only was this product superior to the others I’ve owned, but the AR America’s customer service was SUPER. In this day & age most complaints/problems forwarded to customer service departments are inadaquately addressed and seldom resolved to the customer’s satisfaction. Not in my case. A power anonmaly occurred in my AR 383. I had intermentint electrical surges. Instead of requesting tons of documentation and/or returning the power washer to the MFG, after a simple e-mail, a brand new AR 383 was deleived to my door within 10 days. The new machine works perfectly.

After extensively researching pressure washers on multiple websites, the AR Blue Clean AR383 was the hands-down winner for residential use. This is a solidly built product that is compact, easy to use, and easy to store. I've had it now for several months and had ZERO problems with it. I've used it to strip stain from our wooden deck and fence, pressure wash our garage, and pressure was our sidewalks, each time using the turbo nozzle. The regular nozzle is worthless for such jobs. I've yet to use it for car washing or gentler uses, but will gladly employ the regular nozzle for those duties. On concrete, all you need is the turbo nozzle; no need for chemicals or cleaners! It hasn't slowed down or overheated despite sometimes using it for 2 to 3 hours without a break. If you're looking for a high quality product that works well at a great price, look no further. This is it!

reviews.review_header: I had a problem with the washer and contacted AR ...
reviews.review_text: I had a problem with the washer and contacted AR VIA their web site. Within less than 5 minutes I received a telephone call and they walked me through the solution. (a blockage to the jet which they instructed me how to clean out.) they are located in mid-America and speak English. The also provided me with their direct phone number should I have any further need to contact them. The response is incredible the product is also top-of-the-line.

I was a bit of a skeptic about purchasing this based on some of the negative comments posted but based on the price, the intended use and the fact everything else I tried using regular nozzles and scrub brushes failed. I gave it a shot. My review summary in a word: WOW!! I have an in-ground pool surrounded by a concrete patio that is 16 yrs old. I have never power washed the concrete. Even though I hosed it down weekly, the concrete has accumulated ground in dirt along with mold and mildew spots over the years. A strong pressure hose nozzle did not work. I have flower beds bordering the concrete so use of bleach, chlorine or other chemicals was out of the question. I scrubbed the concrete with a stiff broom and baking soda with limited success. I could not totally remove the mold and mildew. After receiving it, I was anxious to try it out, assembled the hose fittings (held off on the tool holder just so I could see how it worked) hooked up the hose and power cord and using the adjustable sprayer, tried it immediately on the mold/mildew and ground in dirt. WOW (again)! The pressure and spray removed the the spots and the dirt immediately! No cleaner solution required! I spent a weekend scrubbing and sweating with little success but after using this, I told myself I should have gotten it sooner! I bought the brass fitting as some recommended but used the plastic fittings first to see how they would work, No Problems, no leaks, no drips, I can hold the wand and grip with one hand for easy control. I just wanted to try it out but ended up cleaning half my concrete deck in about an hour. I could have kept going but it was getting dark. I also purchased the attachment for flat surfaces but haven't tried that out yet. I'll try that out for routine cleaning. Bottom line, this thing is great and at a great price. I don't really care about the storage attachments, I bought it for what it does. Can't wait to try it on my wood deck, vinyl siding and asphalt driveway!

reviews.review_header: Great product for whatever your home project is.
reviews.review_text: I was cautious buying an electric pressure washer, having only used gasoline powered ones in the past. Read over a dozen forums on electric ones and settled on this one since everyone said it was the best out there. I can say that I was concerned about the adjustable spray wand since I only ever used the kind where the nozzel must be changed out. And finally I was concerned about the plastic speed hose connector, since this is a high stress location. First off I had no reason to be concerned. True the plastic speed hose connector could easily have been metal and not significantly increased price for the strength increase; however it does function properly and when it finnaly breaks, it just screws on where the water hose would, so just buy a metal connector set and be done with it. About the adjustable wand: it is a high pressure nozzel that has a movable "diffuser" so you have very high pressure, or you can "diffuse" it and it will be lower pressure (clever and ingenious design). The electric pressure unit is fantastic, you cannot "quick trigger" it like a paint gun but its not a paint gun, its a pressure washer, so you don't need to. I was very please with the orbital scrubbing wand that came with it; it performed phenominally. All in all for what my opinion is worth, this lives up to its reputation as a legitimate power house pressure washer. I used it to remove surface algea from vinyl siding and brought my home back to looking like new siding in about an hour after 10 years of growth. I also used it to remove about 10 years worth of algea and weathering from my steps, it worked so well it made them match my brand new deck (although if you are going to do this you definitely need to weather seal the wood as soon as the water dries off. All in all for what my opinion is worth, this lives up to its reputation as a legitimate power house pressure washer. Clearly I cannot speak to its longevity, since I have only had it a month. But I would have paid nearly as much to rent one as I paid to own this one.
No power, no pressure. Very cheap product. It would not even clear the moss on the porch. Do not recommend.

reviews.review_header: Surprisingly Strong and Easy to Manage
reviews.review_text: Ignore some of the negative feedback that others have posted and follow the directions. This pressure washer is small and compact and was powerful enough to use to clean my vinyl siding of mold without using chemicals or cleaners. I also used it to clean two Adirondack chairs that are made of trex-type materials. As others commented, the hose reel is just for storage and you need to unwind the complete hose to use it, but that was not a problem. The pressure washer is space conscience, besides the hose reel, it has a very good cord wrap, storage for the two nozzles, handle, and sprayer bottle. It takes up very little room in my garage, and is not falling over or causing me to trip over the hose or cord. Also the cord was long enough for me to use around the house and I could easily spray 1 1/2 stories when cleaning. I found it better to do continuous bursts rather than quick short ones, as if you are too quick between bursts the pump will not be primed, so just pause a bit longer. One additional note I had no leaks at all. I used the plastic quick-connect adapter that came with pressure washer and attached this to a short hose which I installed a quick-connect at the other end to attach to my main hoses. This way I had a quick-connect at both ends and using the short hose just to attach the pressure washer to my hose.

Works flawlessly. I've had it for about a year now, and even though I purchased the adapter that others have recommended, I did not need it at all. It seems that the leaking issue has been resolved. It has more than enough pressure for everything I need it for. As a matter of fact, I was surprised that it had so much pressure! Love it!

Bought this for washing my cars and it is super easy to setup and use. Bought the separate AR Blue Clean Foamer Kit AR Blue Clean Foamer Kit with 34oz Bottle & Blue Clean Fittings and couldn't be happier. I can get my 3 cars washed & dried in less than 1 1/2 (Including setup and cleanup). The bad thing is my neighbors see how well it works and try to get a free wash out of the deal. I have washed up to 5 cars in succession and this sprayer ran flawless and nonstop without any issues. At $12 to have my car washed it's already paid for itself two times over.

reviews.review_header: More powerful than expected, and better than these reviews
reviews.review_text: What's the fuss? Many of these reviews have some complaints that had me so-so on purchasing this pressure washer. My experience has been great. First off, the thing was simple to assemble. Second, it didn't leak. Not one part of it leaked. Third, the GFCI is a bit of a concern... It must be reset every time I first start to use the system. This is weird, and the reviews warning of needing replacements had me concerned when the unit wouldn't work without pressing reset button. Fourth, it is very powerful. I had a Briggs and Stratton gas powered unit prior to this one, and well this one does the job just as well and is much quieter. Plus, I don't have to worry about dealing with gasoline. Finally, in regards to the plastic parts. Well I just replaced my Gas version, 4 years old, and not being plastic every part of it was rusted. I like the plastic on this one and expect it to last a while, if only 2 years before replacing plastic parts, then the money savings will have been made over the more expensive gas pressure washer. I highly recommend this pressure washer!

reviews.review_header: Great pressure washer, AMAZING customer service!
reviews.review_text: First things first, this is a great pressure washer. The two nozzles, one adjustable, works great. I like that they include the bottle for using pressure washer soap. However, I had an issue where the pressure washer stopped working. I'd like everyone to know how wonderful their customer service is. I found their customer service number, and called it. After one ring, a live friendly, knowledgeable person (Tom S.) picks up, no automated message to "press 1 for this, press 2 for that". Then, Tom was able to directly answer all my questions, without needing to transfer me to 5 different people. I wasn't at home with my pressure washer when I called, so he was willing to set up an after-hours appointment to troubleshoot the pressure washer with me. He called me at 6:30 pm, AFTER he was already home from work for the day. Then, we went step-by-step through several tests to determine what was wrong with the pressure washer. It ended up needing a new GFCI plug-in. He gave me his email address, told me to send him a copy of my Amazon receipt, and he would send me a new GFCI plug-in with instruction on how to install it. You just do not find customer service like this anymore. It was so easy, fast, accommodating, and friendly. Support this Minnesota company.

Ive used a few pressure washers over time and basing this only on similar kinds, I was a bit disappointed. Yeah it might be water efficient but really, the difference of a couple gallons efficiency isnt going to affect your city water supply or your bill but it makes the unit somewhat less effective. I have used ones that claim less pressure than this one yet you couldnt put your hand in front of them. This one is not powerful enough so of course when using it to remove dirt from any object such as a car or concrete, it really is only marginally effective. Also if you go from spraying to release the trigger then spray again as a person normally might do when washing something, if you dont wait a couple of seconds for the unit to recover itself, the motor will run but no pressure will be produced. It will however work again if you wait a few seconds.. Rather annoying tho. The unit is pretty light weight. The storage for the other spray nozzles is cheap and awkward although many brands unfortunately dont seem to put much thought into that. Also its hose reel is very pathetic and barely a selling point. Also, dont plan to use the unit unless you unreel the entire hose and remove it from the reel, because you cant. To put the hose in the reel or remove it is rather lame and the clips to hold the hose are bound to break or damage the hose in short time. The hose is also cheap feeling. The cord storage seems like an after thought and is wrapped behind all the accessories with some brackets that barely accommodate it and speaking of accessories, it only comes with basics.. no fancy patterns or pulse sprays just and adjustable fan to a point and a separate soap bottle dispenser. Another annoyance, since I have used the unit only a few times and far between, I forget which water connection is the in and which is out because it is not marked nor blatantly obvious until you try to shove the hose in the wrong hole and it marginally becomes apparent. Overall, I would definitely recommend looking at other units. For what it has to offer, its price is way to high!

Unit worked fine the first time. However the second time we tried to use it, it would not work with certain attachments. the motor would simply kick off when you pulled the trigger and would not come back on. We were able to get it to work with the adjustable nozzle but after about 30 seconds the threads blew off and the nozzle head came apart. product now not usable. I reached out to the manufacture yesterday and they got back to me this morning. They provided some recommendations to remedy the situation and have offered to replace the Turbo nozzle with the bad threads. VERY Good customer service so far. will update this review later.

reviews.review_header: Very good pressure washer and even a better customer service
reviews.review_text: Have this washer for 2 months and tried it several times before posting this review. First, my decision to buy this one over the other ones offered in Amazon is that it has a triplex pump, that is supposed to last longer than the circular pump in the best selling one. The first time I used it was OK, but then on the second time, there was a significant leaking in the water inlet. I did not realize that I placed the connectors the wrong way, since they are designed for a (for me) counter-intuitive placement: the clear plastic piece goes in the body of the washer, and the blue connector goes in the garden hose. It seems that the first time worked without leaking by pure chance and, really, it was my fault since I did not pay close attention to the drawing showing the way to place those connectors (and you'll need a magnifying lens to see it). I contacted the customer service and it really shocked me the way they responded: it is superb!!! They ask me to call them on the very same they I sent the email and clarified my mistake (that was based on the way the connections were made in a previous washer I had). They also offered a metallic adapter as part of the warranty, completely free of charge, that I received a couple of days later. I have used the pressure washer 2 more times, both using the plastic adapters initially included with it (this time I placed them the right way) and also the metallic adapter: not a single drop of water leaked. The washer is very easy to use, much lighter and not as noisy as other electric pressure washers, and provides a pretty powerful water stream that made cleaning my driveway a cinch. Even if it is not perfect (the lances require some care to insert and the hose reel is not very user friendly) it merits 5 stars mostly because of the magnificent experience with a customer service that you would always dream to have with any other manufacturer.

reviews.review_header: Works as intended with zero problems...
reviews.review_text: Got mine yesterday to replace my worn out 1300 PSI. Have a gas pressure washer too, but its powerful and needed to blast the crud off the bottoms my slipped boats. For light duty use, this unit powerful enough for me. Ran it for a hour messing around the house/shop with zero problems. And I mean ZERO! I read all the reviews too. And as 14 Amps, that about all you well get on a 110v outlet circuit. You want more power, then you must get away from 1.5 GPM electric, and go gas 2.5 GPM. Thats the power needed for big jobs. Now I don't know if some who had problems were caused by "operator error", or a bad part that made it past QC. But it does not leak a DROP. ANYWHERE! But I did (and always do)..lubed all connections with Silicone (Plumbers Valve lubricant and sealant). Simple silicone paste in a tube, slather it on the threads, O-Rings (Google search just how a O-Rings works,, and you will understand), and the nozzle to gun. They should include a small tube with it, and directions, but its simple enough. And when moving the unit, don't drag the hose with it. Grab a bit of the hose, and drag it all at one time. Now of some the nit pics. Yes, on the GFCI reset, it should have been made with a short extension cord for the plug, so easy to fit in covered outdoor sockets. But I have a short 2 foot 3 way heavy duty EXT cord, and works anywhere. And if longer reach needed, use a heavy duty cord. On the wand? Yep a little short, and a longer one as a accessory item would be handy. But not a problem me. On the stiff hose? Well, I've had a lot of PW's, and wasn't one hose on any that was not a PITA. Nature of the beast, and needed for the pressure so not bursting. Also forget the hose reel. Nice gimmick, but not really "workable" in the real world. Just pop the gun (I LIKE the quick disconnect much better that screw in type!) loop the hose loosely and hang it on the handle. On the power cord? Leave the attachment piece on, leave the attachments off, wrap 1/2 close the back of it, rest on the place intended. Plenty of room. And on pressure? Always run the hose first to clear any air pockets out. My shop is uphill from the front hose outlet, running through 100 feet hose. Had zero problems with the unit. Hope this helps someone. Works as expected for me.

reviews.review_header: Happy with the first use of this pressure washer.
reviews.review_text: I've only used this pressure washer once. I bought this because it's low cost and electric. I'm very happy with it so far for things around the house. I used the bottle with it, mixing 3 to 1 bleach in the bottle, spraying on exterior posts before painting soon. Using the bottle, it doesn't spray with great force, but it works great to get bleach on something to clean, a few minutes later, using one of two wands to wash/clean off the bleach and mildew. One thing i like about the bottle, when using bleach, it doesn't go through the pump, but is at the end of the wand, so i know the bleach wont affect o rings and such. Using the wand, the force and cleaning power is fine. Not as strong as a 2700 psi gas driven pressure washer, but not the cost either. I have only used this to prepare a few doors and posts for painting, but i can see using it to pressure wash my porch, windows, patio furniture. I wont need to rent a pressure washer any longer, this one will do the jobs around my home fine. So for my review, again, I've only used it once. It didn't leak at all as some other posts mentioned, has plenty of cleaning power for the normal jobs around the home. 5 stars because of cost, and it does what it's advertised to do.

I can easily get over the cheaper feeling plastic parts. For the most part everything connected fine. As most everyone says, the hose connector is absolute junk and leaks when not connected to the power washer. My biggest issue is the motor. I received my unit and right out of the box the motor was faulty. It was loud and supplied little to no pressure beyond the household pressure it was receiving. I contacted Amazon and received a replacement very quickly. This replacement unit worked just fine out of the box. After using it for a relatively short period of time, the replacement unit's motor developed the exact same behavior as the original unit. I would not recommend this pressure washer. When working, the pressure seemed pretty good overall but to have 2 motors that are faulty on 2 units is really poor.

Really love this one. works great. The right amount of pressure. I use it to clean bird cages and it does the job quickly. Let me tell you trying to get dried bird poop off a cage is a task and this thing does it fast and easy. I was worried about it tipping over but it stays up very well. It rolls easy when you are moving it from one place to another. has a good reach with the hose. Not a fan of the hose roller but its not a deal breaker. For the price its a good one. I am Beyond happy with it. Just to let everyone know I did NOT get this at a discount or free for my review. I paid full price and I am reviewing it to help other people know about it. I am very glad i went with this model.

What a great product! I have had my washer for almost a year and it is so versatile. I had a gas powered washer before and always dreaded the noise. The Gas washer also was frankly too powerful for most of my intended uses. This Washer is easy to set up and move. It is much quieter and has plenty of power for me.
