The only drawback is common to all electric washers, that the extra cord is something to contend with. I have not tried the soap attachment but plan to in the Spring when I clean my deck. I am very satisfied.

The unit itself is good and works as expected, but I do not have any previous experience with other pressure washers. For the price, I would say it exceeds what I would expect. However... and this will most likely not effect 99% of people who will purchase this unit or similar... All fitting and sizes used on this unit appears to be a custom proprietary size made by AR Blue. They have their own version of a "quick-connect" to quickly change out their tips, which I believe is inferior to the standard quick-connect design, but I bought the MTM foam cannon along with the AR Blue Clean and they are NOT compatible nor can I find a way to make the AR Blue gun fit. I researched online and seems like there is a connector from AR Blue that allows for more standard connections so placed an order for that, but probably should have called them as the adapter for this is not a standard from what I have found (Somewhere around a 3/4" pipe size if I remember) and they may actually have that. All of the sizing occurred at a business that specializes with pipe and hose fittings, something like 20,000 sq feet warehouse full of hose and pipe fittings. Either case, I wanted to use that foam cannon, so I basically had that business to do a custom job on the AR Blue Clean hose line. Below is what I used for anyone that is interested. 1. Cut the end of the hose that connects to the main unit (the thread appears to also be a custom proprietary fitting). This part now sticks out like 8 inches out. Call this hose #1 2. Add a male quick-connect to hose #1 3. Cut the other end of the hose that connects to the gun. Call this hose #3. Hose #2 would be the longest piece. 4. Add a male quick-connect to hose #3. This allows me to still be able to use the AR Blue's gun. 5. For hose #2 (the main hose), Added a female quick-connect on both ends. 6. Bought a new gun to connect to the new foam cannon. Gun is heavy and feels like the quality is good (essentially a brass gun with a plastic shell). The job done was superb. This was not a barb hose fitting that will essentially add a small hose reduction in the line, the connections they did went over the hose and crimped on top of them. Basically the same thing AR Blue did on their side with the gun's quick-connect tip (which appears to be a modified 1/4 male quick-connect, lathed to have a flat spot). Overall the cost was around $100 (minus cost of the new foam cannon). I am happy to have this done and believe it was well worth it. However, if I knew this from the start, I would have looked for a setup that uses standard sizes in the first place, which is probably any other setup. On the plus side, If I need to change out the hose to be longer, or use different adapter tips, I have the ability to do that fairly quickly, but most likely will not need this at all. Some other gripes on the unit: 1. Plastic hose fittings... replaced those to brass ones as well. This one is a standard size since it has to fit to the hose sizes that people actually own. Some smaller gripes on the unit: 1. Now for the reason I broken the hose line into 3 parts: machine, hose, gun. If I am not mistaken, I believe the instructions for the AR Blue clean states that it is recommended to disconnect everything. Not sure if needed to be honest and probably does not matter, but the hose reeler they have does not work in a way I thought it should and I think it asks to disconnect from the machine to properly reel it up (to look pretty). I was basically not using it and was just coiling the hoses and hanging it over the handle or store it somewhere else if I find a better place. 2. A "full" plastic gun. Not too sure how I feel about this, but does feel cheap in the hand even though it functions as expected. A word to AR Blue: Please AR Blue, please stop using these proprietary fittings. I do not believe there is a single person that will say "I'm sure glad they made these parts difficult for me to replace or fit other components on to this". I understand it will force people to buy directly from you if something breaks, but honestly this is just the wrong way to do this. The unit is good so please do not waste money to make the molds for all the special parts. I think the unit itself speaks for itself for how well it works. I can overlook the smaller gripes as it should not change how it works, but if the unit does die, I will most likely be buying a different system where the majority of the reason being the power of the unit and not so much on having the adapter fitment issues, which I have resolved.

The gas powered pressure washers generally supply higher pressures than the electric ones, but they are more expensive, require more maintenance, and are very heavy. I wanted a unit that I could carry around by hand and transport it easily to other locations. This unit had good reviews and was rated at 1900 psi, a high pressure for an electric pressure washer. I have had this product for over a year now, and it is still working well. I have used the unit to power wash my deck, the entire siding on my house, my daughter's deck and lattice work, my concrete driveway (before staining/sealing it), my concrete sidewalk (before repairing it), my truck (on a regular basis), my travel trailer, garbage cans, bird baths, and probably a few more things that I may have forgotten about. One of the biggest problems with this product is that it leaks. I almost gave it a 4-star rating because of this problem, but I have used this pressure washer successfully for so many things and have overcome the leak problem, so I gave it 5 stars. The unit itself has a male fitting for water inlet, so you can not connect a garden hose directly to it. Instead, they provide a plastic fitting with female joints on each end and a filter in between. I was unable to stop it from leaking badly with this connection, so I purchased a Gilmour 7FHS7FH Double Female Swivel Brass Connector, 3/4-Inch by 3/4-Inch, sold by Amazon, and used this to connect the unit to a garden hose. I then leave the double female brass connector on the pressure washer all the time, and connect the garden hose to it when I need to use it. This connection solved the leak problem for the most part, although there is still a constant slow drip most of the time -- not much of a problem since you are using it outside. Another thing you may want to consider is how much pressure do you need for the job you want to do. If you want to strip all the paint from a deck, this unit may not be suitable. When I used it on my daughter's deck, it removed all of the loose paint and then some, but did not remove all of the paint (okay for our purpose). When I used it on my deck, I just wanted to clean it up before re-staining, and it worked fine for that. While it cleans my truck well, it does not remove all of the brake dust from the hub caps. My unit, purchased 1 1/2 years ago, came with two lances, a turbo lance and an adjustable lance. The turbo lance spins the spray jet, while the adjustable lance can focus the jet from a point to a broad fan-shaped spray. I used the adjustable lance most often because it provided more pressure, and most of the time I would use it in a fan spray. I purchased an older house about 1 1/2 years ago and it had green algae particularly on the north side of the white house. When the siding was power washed (using the fan spray of the adjustable lance) the green cast on the house turned white, so you could easily see what was cleaned and what was not cleaned. It was necessary to hold the end of the nozzle a few inches (3-6 inches the best to my recollection) away from the siding in order to wash off the algae. This means that the width of the spray band hitting the house was narrow, so it took quite a bit of time to clean the whole house. A more powerful gas powered pressure washer would likely to be quicker. On the other hand, this electric unit was very light weight, and I could easily carry it around the house with one hand (it has a handle at the top). In order to reach the peak of the house, I placed the unit on the support near the top of a step ladder, held it on with a bungee cord, then climbed an extension ladder with the gun in hand to reach the peak. I point this out only to demonstrate the portability of this unit. You could not do this with a heavy gas powered pressure washer. The unit also comes with a soap dispenser. Just place a little liquid detergent in the container, fill it with water, connect it directly to the gun (in place of the lance) and spray it on your car or truck. It lasts maybe 10-15 minutes until the soap runs out, enough time to soap up your vehicle. Then switch over to a lance and power wash it. While the unit comes with a hose reel, I find it just as easy to wind up the hose by hand, tie it with a shoe string and set on top over the handle. I do the same with the electric power cord. Make the loops small enough so they don't slide down over the unit and you have one neat package that you can pick up by the handle and carry around. This is a good, fairly powerful, relatively inexpensive, lightweight, reliable power washer that has served me well.

I used my machine for the first time today and here are my thoughts: PROS: I didn't have any of the leaks that others reviewers wrote about (at least not today). I used for 2 hours cleaning my wood fence. It wasn't that difficult to assemble it. It is light and easy to handle (I am a woman in my 50s) CONS: From the reviews, I was expecting that it would be more powerful. It did clean my fence, but wasn't that easy. I had to keep the jet very close to the surface of the wood and go back and forth a few times to get it really clean. If you have any sign of arthritis in you hands, forget about using it. There is nothing to lock the handle while spraying, and it needs to be pressed all the time to do the work. You will need some strong hands if you are planning to do a job for more than 3 minutes. After a while I had the idea of using a velcro fastener to keep it hold for me. ( see photo of the velcro fastener) All in all it is an ok tool, but I am still thinking if I am going to keep it.

Great pressure washer. I run my own small mobile auto detailing business and this was a great addition to my arsenal of cleaning tools. Along with this I purchased the AR Blue clean foam lance and it's awesome!

reviews.review_header: No leaks, worked great, and not as noisy as I thought i would be! Solid construction and very sturdy!
reviews.review_text: I received this 2 days ago and this was the first chance I had in using it. I read all the reviews about this product and with mild trepidation decided to take the plunge and buy it. I read about the leaks, the rigid hose and the plastic adapters but they were few in comparison to the good reviews. Every product will have bad and good reviews, its normal the way I see it. So, here is what I did before I actually received the AR383, I went to the AR website and ordered the metal attachment for the garden hose to the AR383 so I would not have that headache of stripping the threads or having major leaks. I also ordered the 25ft extension hose to further extend the reach of the washer hose without having to constantly move the AR383 around the garage. Both items worked perfectly but I did have the problem of the rigid hose being very uncooperative and would recoil itself into a tangle. The turbo nozzled worked very well, cleaning some of the tougher stains on the garage floor, even lifting up dried paint from older projects. The variable spray on the other wand worked great too, I love that I do not have to change tips on the wand and instead just need to twist it to get the desired spray or stream. The wheels are awesome with this washer and very easy to wheel around corners, use the handle to move the unit and don't try to drag it with the pressure hose, you're asking for trouble in the form of leaks. What I really liked about this unit is the fact that the pump stops when you release the trigger and will start up again when you squeeze it. It cuts down on the noise from the unit but I admit that it was not as noisy as a pressure washer I used from another brand that would constantly run regardless if you're spraying or not. All in all, I was very happy with this purchase, I was able to clean out the garage, wash down some chairs and even did a quick wash on my truck and it didn't take all day. Only issue I would say is that the hose is very rigid and like one of the other reviewers I just coiled it and laid in on the top of the unit, no problem for me.

I bought this at the end of a summer to help get a project done around the house. The first 5 or 6 times I used it, it worked great! It had plenty of power, good spray and really simple to use. I should have known when assembling, however, that the hard plastic parts wouldn't last. After storing it for the winter/spring, I pulled it out to wash cars with it, and the spray gun hose connection to the pressure washer was done for. Once connected, more water was getting me wet than traveling through the wand, or so I thought! The bad seal prevented any real pressure from building and was just spraying from the base of the spray gun. Well, I thought, I'll just replace the spray gun! A new gun came and I tried again, with the same result. I wish I could return it for the wasted money and effort!

The power washer did an awesome job on our concrete driveway & walkways. I hadn't even thought of powerwashing our wood pergola. While doing the concrete my wife discovered that powerwashing the wood, which was black with mold, or dark gray from sun wear, became like new again. Wow what a transformation. This machine provided plenty of power. Only complaint was that the plastic attachment which the garden hose fits onto was leaking. It just would not thread onto the hose properly. I have other attachments for the garden hose which fit tight, no leaking. So the problem was definitely with the attachment. But I called The company and they sent me a new attachment no problem. Haven't tried it out yet though. Even though with the leaking there was still plenty of pressure and power to do the job. And for the price you cannot go wrong. We Paid $140. It would have cost $80 to pay someone just to do the concrete alone. We are very glad that we decided to get this and do it ourselves.

I purchased this power washer to clean a couple of years worth of green scaly 'stuff' off some of my deck posts and decking, as well as power wash the shady side of my house (where more green 'stuff' was growing). I was concerned that any electric power washer wouldn't have enough power to do the job, but this one worked great. I've used both the turbo wand and the regular, adjustable wand and was able to quickly and easily remove 98% of all the accumulated grime on my deck, vinyl siding, and concrete. I haven't tried it on my asphalt driveway yet but I plan to soon and I'm confident it will do a great job. NOTE: my deck is "Fiberon", a composite material so I didn't have to worry about stripping paint or wood. Also, I used straight water with no chemicals or cleaning additives; I'm sure if I would have added something the results would have been even better still, but I'm very pleased with how well this works out of the box with just water. Initial setup was probably 10 minutes at most. I wanted to give this a rare 5-star review (rare for me - I only give 5 star reviews to products that I can't think of any possible way to make them better), but two things keep me from doing so. The first is that there is no way to lock the sprayer 'on' so it keeps spraying without you having to hold the trigger. The trigger is easy to pull, but after using it for 2 hours or more your arms start to get tired of having to constantly keep pressure on the trigger. There may be some legal/safety reason for not allowing you to lock it 'on', but it was an obvious need for me on the first use. The second issue I have is that every time you plug it in, you need to hit the 'reset' button on the power adapter. Sounds quick and easy, but it never seemed to work the way I thought it should. I'd plug it in, hit 'reset', and return to the washer to turn it on only to have it not work and have to go back to the power adapter and hit the 'reset' button again. Without any power indicator light on the main unit, the only way to see if it's getting power is to keep turning it on, trying it, and going back to hit 'reset' again several times in a row until it turns on. Not sure why it's designed this way and it makes no sense to me. In the grand scheme of things, the minor annoyances are just that - minor. I'm very happy with this purchase, I feel I got great value for the dollar and I'd recommend this for general deck and siding cleaning without hesitation.

reviews.review_header: hence there is a good deal of functionality delivered
reviews.review_text: I am impressed - This little device sprays the moos out of your brick patio - and over the neighbors fence when used appropriately. The connectors coming with it attach to your standard garden hose, and the (unfortunately completely useless) patio cleaner can be attached without any further tool or connector unless some of the reviews stated. You can tell that the latest devices have gone through evolution and refinement, hence there is a good deal of functionality delivered. The star less relates to the little drum - which is really a useless gimmick, as it will tip the machine over if you consider using it for the hose. If you have trapped a rattlesnake in your backyard and are looking for a fine place for storage after knocking her unconscious - this is probably a good feature. Buyers beware: The cleaner is not recommended to use on your finger or toe nails.

reviews.review_header: Great machine and super great support
reviews.review_text: I bought my Blue Clean machine from Amazon in September 2013 and immediately fell in love with it. I power washed everything that wasn’t moving. Didn’t feel it was necessary to write a positive review since there was an over abundance of them already. Something happened this past week to change my mind. I was cleaning the concrete apron around the pool in preparation for painting when the pump wouldn’t start. After trouble-shooting the problem with no success, I called the phone number given the manual. Following a fast phone pickup and some procedural steps to ensure I wasn’t an idiot, the tech asked where I purchased my unit. When I said Amazon he replied no problem and got my name and address. Four days later I received a new GFCI part. It was an easy fix, and now I am back in business. A company this good deserves all the recognition in the world.

Have now used this little marvel 6 times since it arrived last month. Did a 14 X 16 concrete patio, 40' of concrete sidewalk and the 2-car garage front apron as well as about 250 square feet of vinyl siding. The lack of onboard detergent tank/mixing is a minor inconvenience that we got around by using a pump sprayer that holds 1.5 gallons of whatever potion you choose. I'm 6'3" so the supplied wands are a tad short, just perfect for 5'5" Karen. The turbo nozzle makes delightfully short work of concrete cleaning - built up mildew and leaf tannins over the winter/spring. Makes knocking the (north side) green mildew off the vinyl siding an easy task. Relatively quiet, needs an extension handle for easier pushig/pulling around the yard. But it cleans like crazy - little effort - literally a point and shoot affair. We like it.

This is the 4th electric pressure washer I've owned over the years and it is clearly the best so far. My use is for cleaning deck, patio, sidewalk and driveway and all the units I have owned have handled those tasks reasonably well. The only real question is how well this one will hold up compared to the others, and only time will tell for that. My last one, a 1550psi Husky lasted 4 years before a seal gave out so I hope this one does as well. It definitely produces more pressure than the Husky did, although it may or may not reach 1900psi. It also has a better adjustable nozzle than my prior models (same basic design, varying from fan to jet). A dedicated power wash nozzle is included as well, although I can't tell it does any more than the adjustable nozzle on its jet setting. I don't use the cleaner dispensers that comes with these things, but they all appear to have the same idea ... fill the bottle with the cleaner solution and use the bottle in place of a nozzle to spray the cleaner on whatever surface you are working on, then put the nozzle back on and power wash. The nozzle system is the same quick connect design my old unit used, easy to put on or remove by a simple push and twist. As might be expected, the power cord has a GFCI plug, pretty much a necessity for an electrical appliance used around water. Others have complained about leaking at the supplied plastic quick connect filter, but I have had absolutely no issue there. It may be that the water pressure from my supply is low enough that it won't compromise the O-ring seal on the filter connector, and anyway, if the quick connect breaks or does begin leaking, it would be simple to replace it with a brass female-female connector as others have suggested, perhaps adding a washing machine filter. Just be sure you realize the supply hose connects to the front, not the rear. It really should be marked on the unit, not left to reading the directions. What I really like about the design of this particular model is that you can store everything on it. For all of my past units I had to retain the shipping box to store the unit and its paraphernalia. The cleaner solution bottle for this unit is even shaped to neatly fit in the bracket for holding the nozzles, trigger handle, power cord, with even a slot for the hose quick-connect filter. The reel on the top is for storing the pressure hose. That makes for pretty effective, compact storage. Incidentally, like all pressure hoses I've experienced, the one supplied is pretty stiff, but unlike the others has really good kink protection on each end. Some complain about the plastic look and feel for this unit, but that makes for something light enough to be easily moved around. For me the one real con is the trigger handle, which could use some ergonomic improvement. I found it more tiring to use than the one on my old Husky, particularly for a forward-reverse sweeping motion. For the unit to work properly, you also have to be sure you've purged any air out of your supply line (by triggering the nozzle with the power off). On releasing the nozzle trigger, I found the automatic motor cut out needed about a 1 to 2 second pause to re-engage the pump when your pressed the trigger back on, a minor annoyance. Overall, this is a solid 4-star product, especially given its price point. It does have a few minor shortfalls, but is an effective power washer for small jobs like a patio or pool deck, has a superior system for packing it up for storage, and is light enough to take where you would not take a gas-powered unit. I am quite satisfied with it. Just don't expect the kind of pressure the gas models can deliver.

reviews.review_header: Having some AR Blues at the moment
reviews.review_text: I use this with the AR Foamer Canon to produce shaving cream suds when washing cars. It does a nice job during the winter months (above freezing days) removing road grime and salt when you can't do a proper car wash. This is perfect for washing cars and doing other small power washing duties around the house. The hose reel is for winter storage, not daily storage. I just wrap the hose around the machine during the cleaning season. The hose connector/filter is plastic, so I'd suggest you purchase a backup connector, along with an o-ring kit, just in case. I ordered the parts directly from AR Blue Clean and while the parts costs are reasonable, the shipping cost is outrageous, even for small parts - hopefully that's changed now. Also, consider getting a longer hose, so that you can park the machine and walk around the vehicle without having to move it. Either that or consider the AR390, which has a 30' hose. The AR Foam Canon is similar to this unit, but sold under AR's name. You need to purchase directly from AR because of the proprietary hose connector: http://www.arblueclean.com/Products/ar-foamer-cannon-153.cfm Professional Foam Lance Adjustable with 32 oz. Bottle Update: (3-29-15) I've experience some major problems with the pressure washer, so wanted to pass along what's been happening. I have changed the star rating from 5 to 2 for the moment. I have notified AR to see how this will be handled. I will update accordingly, but as of now, I am not happy with the machine. I use the machine maybe once every 1-2 weeks since I purchased it, which is not a whole lot of use. Below are my issues: 1. I can't remove the adjustable spray nozzle from the spray gun; it just will not release from the gun. 2. The pressure washer cycles (revs) constantly every 2 seconds when idled (not being used). Similar to like squeezing the trigger and then quickly letting go. (will try and add a video later) 3. Just recently the pressure washer, while idling, revved up and ran on its own without my input (I was washing the truck at the time), but when I press the spray gun trigger to try and stop it, it continued running, but had no pressure at all; just a misty spray. I also recommended their Foamer Cannon, which is a nice attachment, however, the bottle did not last long; the bottle head ripped away from the threads as I unscrewed the bottle from the brass threads on the Foamer Cannon. The bottle that comes with the kit is very, very soft when compared to some of the higher end detail style bottles I use. I use hot water to mix with the solution and I believe the hot water made an already soft bottle even softer and thus, the bottle tear. Amazing. I'm just not a happy camper at the moment.

This is an adequate machine. I've used it for a few weeks and am generally pleased. It's much lighter than my previous electric pressure washer but nicely fills a need when I don't want to bring out my big gas machine. It naturally has some limitations and potential problems. The pressure is good, but there is an irregular surging that is annoying. I can't find the cause (no kinks in hoses, etc.) and it is not that prolonged. Still, it concerns me about longevity. It has a unique way of connecting a garden hose with two plastic snap connectors. Once attached they protrude about 3-1/2" from the body, making it vulnerable if it fell forward or was bumped while the hose is attached. Remember these are plastic connectors. I use a brass "quick connecter" for everything that goes on my hose. With that attached, the hose is 5" from the body and seems vulnerable. The other minor issue is the "convenient" pressure hose reel. It's only 7" in diameter so it takes some planning to coil the hose, especially if you--as i do--leave the one end attached to the pump. After unreeling, you will find you have to uncurl it to avoid kinks. Overall, a pretty good machine which, as with every product, required a series of compromises trying to balance size, weight, power, cost and convenience. UPDATE: I've owned and used this for more than a year, except of course during our Wisconsin winters. As I feared, the hose connection was vulnerable and broke a few weeks before the warranty expired. The GOOD NEWS is that the company now has a metal connector which they sent me under warranty which works wonderfully and seems much more durable. The other GOOD NEWS is the customer service. I've had to contact AR by phone a couple of times and each time I was treated with promptly with courtesy and helpful advice. While part of this washer are flimsy and prone to breakage, the functional part works very well and is back by excellent customer support.

reviews.review_header: Pro; It starts and stops when you pull on ...
reviews.review_text: Pro; It starts and stops when you pull on the trigger. Con: The hose between the unit and the wand is short, but it will do the job for washing the car. The nozzle fan( when spraying) is vertical, you have to hold the trigger side way to wash up and down, it is okay to wash side to side; it should be horizon fan. The hose and power cord storage are difficult to use. The hose is stiff, very hard to roll into the reel. The power cord is wrapping around the back which has very small brackets. They should make the brackets on the left and the right side of the unit for the hose and the cord. The last thing you want to do is spending 10 to 15 mins to wrap this up after used!

The power washer worked great for what it is...an electric power washer. I didn't want to deal with the hassle of a gas powered washer, but the compromise is that the lack of pressure when the stream is fanned out is very limiting for cleaning a large area such as a patio. I uploaded a pic to show the result. I'm probably going to hire someone with a gas-powered washer to redo the patio, since all the clean lines (where the narrow stream was used) stand out in high-contrast (to the rest where the fanned spray was used). For cleaning patio furniture and the like it was great. I had no problem with the hose connection leak many complained about. The key is that you need to tighten it with a tool such as a wrench; hand-tightening is not enough. No need to buy a brass connection or rubber rings.

reviews.review_header: A well-made and easy to use pressure washer for light-medium duty jobs such as washing cars and cleaning the patio
reviews.review_text: I've owned both electric and gas pressure washers over the years. This is the best electric I've ever owned; it is far better designed than the Karcher's I've used. For washing vehicles this is quite adequate which is primarily why I purchased it. I especially like the fact that everything stores neatly in one "package". Contrary to some previous reviews, I don't find it difficult to roll up the pressure hose on the reel. At temperatures of 70-90 degrees it is very flexible; maybe it gets a bit more stiff at lower temps. As lots of people have noted the plastic connector which comes with it is a piece of junk, but there's no reason to buy the metal part sold by this company. All you need is a double female garden hose coupler which you can buy at Lowes or HD. I don't bother with a quick connect but use the couple with a shutoff valve so I can connect and disconnect the hose without having to turn it off at the spigot. The electrical cords and the pressure hose are both quite long which makes it easy to wash a car without having to move the device itself very much, or at all. When you do pull on the pressure hose the device rolls nicely on its wheels without falling over. I was surprised and pleased by that; someone actually planned and executed a good design.

reviews.review_header: I would suggest you pay a bit more and get a better product.
reviews.review_text: You get what you pay for. This was very reasonably priced but did not work very well for long. I used it one day to do clean the outside of my house and it was ok. Not over the top but I knew I had not bought a top of the line product. The next day it seemed everything started going wrong. The attachment to the hose kept popping off; pressure was not consistent, I had to stop and restart the machine to get the pressure to work. I would suggest you pay a bit more and get a better product.

reviews.review_header: After owning for 3 years, still recommend it.
reviews.review_text: I bought the AR383 in March 2013. I use it sparingly but it does the job. Remember the quick connect adapter attaches to the front of the AR383.. the blue end goes on the hose and the clear part goes on the AR383. I have no leaks whatsoever with this connection and just hand tighten all connections. The high pressure hose attaches to the back and you have to hold some pressure on the hose when first attaching the threaded coupling, then it screws in nicely. No leaks here either. When removing the high pressure hose, you have to pull it strongly after releasing the threads to get the o-ring to release. I like the tips I've seen to use the hose reel to store the electrical cord and loosely wind up the high pressure hose and drap it around the handle for storage. Also, when you order this, go ahead and order a spare pack of 0-rings. Mine are badly cracked after 3 years (of mostly non-use) and the high pressure hose leaks where it fits into the handle because the o-ring there is cracked and broken. The leak is not bad so I can still use it. These are metric o-rings, but I don't know the size. I have a set inbound as I type this. Pluses: the AR383 does a good job on mildew on concrete and brick. Minuses: the AR383 with either the adjustable flat spray or the orbiting spray will clean mildew about an inch width at a time. For my sidewalk, I can do a square (expansion joint to expansion joint... about 4 ft X 4 ft) in about 15 minutes. So it will take a while to clean and is tedious work. Note: I have not used other pressure washers, especially high powered gas engine pressure washers, so I can't compare. Hopefully a higher powered pressure washer can clean more than an inch width at a time. But they are also much more expensive than the AR383 too. So I guess you get what you pay for. Regardless, for my occasional use, I am well pleased with the AR383.

reviews.review_header: It was easy to put together (mostly just adding attachments to the ...
reviews.review_text: I have read many of the older reviews on line. All the comments about leaking---the company obviously fixed that problem--are outdated. I have used mine extensively over the past month and have not had a single drop of water leak. It was easy to put together (mostly just adding attachments to the body of the cleaner), and very easy to use. The cord is long, and the limiting factor when looking at how far you can go away from the house to continue cleaning driveways, etc. But you could also add a heavy duty extension cord and thus reach as far as you reasonably wanted to go. The hose from the cleaner to the wand is also decent length, but the real hose length that matters is your own garden hose that you hook up to the cleaner. A couple of strong recommendations: if you are cleaning a large surface (patio/driveway) it is well worth it to buy and use the 10" surface cleaner...it cut the time to complete the task by 75% easily. Also, I would not waste time with using the detergent bottle or run it through the cleaner, nor even buy their special detergent. Just take some liquid dish soap and sprinkle a little on the surface before you start washing with the cleaner. Much cheaper, quicker, and no clean up required. Just saying....

A few years ago I rented a pressure washer from a tool rental place, for $65 for a day. It was gas powered and exceedingly heavy. It was so difficult to lug around that I only got around to pressure washing one or two areas before returning it. So a week ago I bought the AR383 pressure washer, and boy am I glad I did. I've used it for a few hours each day for the last few days, and I've gotten everything done that I could think of doing. The car. The concrete apron in front of the garage. The slate stairs from the driveway up to the backyard. The retaining wall at the bottom of the driveway. The stone front door stoop. The slate patio on the left side of the house and the concrete one on the right. The concrete birdbath. It did a great job. It has more than already paid for itself. And it's easy to move around. It has plenty enough power for my needs, and it's quiet. Negatives? There is more electric cord than will fit without bulging out on the plastic accessory holder, plus it takes a while to wind it all (not that I'm complaining about the long cord). I didn't even bother trying to wind the high pressure hose around the hose reel, figuring that would be just as much of a pain to deal with (as others have noted). So, as others have done, I just create one loop of electric cord and one of hose, tie each with two Velcro straps, and drape both on the handle. Easier, actually, than trying to use the accessory holder and hose reel. Also, the unit is small and light and low enough that I don't bother wheeling the unit around -- I just pick it up by the handle and carry it. So, if I was altering the design, I would nix the electric cord portion of the accessory holder and nix the hose reel (replacing both with some sort of large plastic hooks to hang the loops of cords on), and get rid of the wheels (yes, there's another model without wheels, but it's got a lower PSI than this model). If I could subtract 1/4 star for the the cord winding issue I would, but I can't, so I'm rounding up to five stars. I bought this to be a pressure washer, and pressure wash is what it does well. I didn't buy it to wind the cord and hose up in a certain way. Hanging the cord and hose from the handle is no big deal to me.

reviews.review_header: Doesn't last and poor customer service
reviews.review_text: I used the AR383 to pressure wash my deck. The next time I used it the ground fault adapter would not reset. I called tech support and was grilled about the amperage of the outlet I was using, if I was using an extension cord and a list of questions designed to place the blame on me. I had to get a non ground fault adapter at my own expense and replace the adapter myself to test the unit. Then and only then was I sent a replacement which took several months because the manufacturer had a sudden run of faulty ground fault adapters. By the time the new ground fault arrived the summer was over. The manual states that you should not use an extension cord but the person that I talked to A. R. said that you can use an extension cord if it is heavy duty. The next year the power washer worked fine. This year it worked once, I moved it to another location and it would not turn on. I waited a few days and the unit turned on and worked fine. I moved it and it stopped working again. I called tech support and had to check the water pressure, when that was fine the tech support person kept grilling me about the extension cord that I used and in the end blamed me for using an extension cord even though I was told that I could. The tech support person was rude and condescending. Don't waste you money on the AR383, all the good reviews must be fake. Buy a pressure washer where the company stands behind their product.

reviews.review_header: Great electric pressure washer, with a few quirks.
reviews.review_text: I have used this a few times now: to pressure wash house vinyl siding, our wood deck, and our car. PROS: as mentioned earlier, it's quite powerful and relatively quiet. Although the electrical cord and hose are pretty long (which makes it pretty easy to clean without actually having to move the unit), the unit itself is very light making it easy to climb up a ladder to get the higher areas of the house. It doesn't leak, provided you attach the hose adapter securely (you really have to push it in to get the "click.") The adjustable wand has a wide range of pressures and is pretty much my go-to tool. CONS: turning on the machine requires a few extra steps - making sure it is off first, and then plugging the power cord in and pressing the reset button to make sure a red indicator is present in the GFCI window, and then turning it on. Even when you do that, sometimes the machine doesn't pump when you turn the switch on, making you think you have a non-working lemon. If you press the trigger handle, however, and relieve the water pressure in the line, the pump will kick on. The other con is the cleaning solution bottle attachment does leak - luckily I choose relatively non-toxic cleaning solutions.

**UPDATE** I never did hear back from AR, but did finally find time to call them within their hours while I was with my power washer. I was able to get it restarted by keeping the unit plugged in while pushing reset, then test (until it clicks) and then reset. I haven't used it for a significant amount of time yet - but it did stay started this time. The trick was leaving it plugged in while re-setting. Also, the tech I spoke to on the phone gave me a tip that if you need to use an extension cord, you actually can as long as it is 12 or 10 gauge (heavy or extra heavy duty cord). Just thought I'd pass that tip along. I used this pressure washer once and it worked fine in August of 2014 when I purchased it. I used it again the second time in May 2015 and it came on for 2 seconds, died, and wouldn't restart. I emailed AR for Warranty Info and didn't hear back. I called and the first person I spoke to told me they had gotten over 400 emails and were extremely behind. (if that gives you any idea of how many are breaking under warranty) She then transferred me to a "trouble shooting" lady who was incredibly rude and insinuated I hadn't plugged it in or stored it correctly. (Pretty sure I know how to plug something into an outlet, and I know how to store a power washer indoors over the winter). She said I would have to call back when I was with my machine to literally plug it in while I was on the phone with her.

reviews.review_header: Great unit with some ownership advice
reviews.review_text: Got this on lightning deal and was worried about some of the bad reviews but my unit works like a champ. Strong enough to put grooves in my composite deck when focused to a narrow stream! As pointed out, don't use the built in reel to wind up the stiff hose. Instead I use it to wind up the long power cord. Just hook the halfway point of the power cord on one of the reel protrusions and you only have half the length to wind. I found it useful to mark the halfway point with duct tape. Coil the stiff hose separately and drape over the unit and you are done. Pros: Quiet, powerful and compact storage. Used 5 times so far and no problems. Plastic hose connectors are sturdy and no leaks. Cons: Does not store as described in the manual but alternate storage solution works great. Power brick on end of cord may prevent it from seating fully into an outdoor recessed electrical outlet so grounded extension cord may be needed. Read the manual fully to understand how to turn it on. For example, the line needs to be full of water or the pump may be air locked and the power brick reset button MUST be pressed every time it is plugged in. Water will flow at normal hose pressure even if the pump is off which is why some reviews say it is no better than a hose. 5 stars minus 1 star for minor inconveniences

reviews.review_header: Which is better - the product or the customer service?
reviews.review_text: This replaced a Karcher power washer that we had for >7 years and, as much as I liked that one, this is a much better home power washer. It's smaller, lighter, and yet seems to clean better with less water used. If that's not enough, the customer service is exactly what I'd read it would be - I had a couple of questions out of the gate, and the phone was answered right away, the person on the other end was knowledgeable and friendly, and resolved my initial questions in one call. Subsequently, I had a bit of difficulty threading my garden hose onto the plastic threading of the machine's adaptor. Emailed this time and, within moments, not only had a reply, but a promise to send me a replacement piece "just in case" the threading issue was theirs, not mine. And, not more than 30 minutes later, I received a second email saying they were going to upgrade that replacement piece to a metal-threaded piece, instead. So, I've now used the machine on our garage floor and tiled patio - excellent results! Great product at a great price, with great support behind it.

reviews.review_header: Customer service was excellent. Now just wishing that replacement would last longer ...
reviews.review_text: During second use of this Pressure washer, it stopped working. I tried to do some troubleshooting but no luck. I contacted AR Blue customer service and went over more troubleshooting over the phone and was determined it was defective. AR Blue sent a new unit within a week. Customer service was excellent. Now just wishing that replacement would last longer at least 10 times of use to get my money's worth.

You buy electric over gas for one or more of the following reasons: less expensive, lighter, smaller, quieter, easier to maintain and use, and safer. 2000psi is top range for an electric unit, it that is not enough, don’t criticize the unit, you should have bought gas powered. I have used the washer for about 9hrs and it has worked great. This unit has excellent price/performance. Features: 1900 PSI – at the top range for electric pressure washers 1.5 GPM - Good flow rate. (It’s not just the pressure, it’s how much water can be pushed out at that pressure. When comparing units, multiply the PSI by the GPM to get a single “cleaning value”) Triplex pump w/ stainless steel plunger – Long lasting pump design and much better than axial cam or wobble pumps. However, to keep cost down, the AR383 uses a universal motor instead of the quieter and cooler running Induction Motor. (I could not find an electric that had both Triplex pump and Induction Motor). Pump auto shuts off when wand trigger is released, so there is no worry about overheating the pump. Noise level of the unit is good. 27lbs – Light weight. So light that it was easier to carry the unit than try and pull it using the wheels 20ft stiff plastic pressure hose and 30ft power cord. Hose tends to stay coiled, so straighten it out before attaching to unit and wand. The reel is not worth using and because of the 3” stiff ends of the hose and small diameter of the reel, could eventually cause a stress break in the hose. Nice long power cord, but the location of the pressure hose fitting requires you to unwrap all 30ft of cord to get to it. The instructions say not to use an extension cord. I did use a 100ft 14 gauge cord with it and the GFI plug became extremely hot. I would suggest using no more than a 50ft 12 gauge extension cord if you need to extend the reach. I did not have the leaking problem with the plastic water hose connector; however I used my own Melnor female quick hose connector rather than the one that came with the unit. (Note: The clear plastic male connector it has a screen mesh filter to prevent debris from damaging/clogging the unit, something a replacement brass connector may not have). The connector for the water hose is located on the front of the unit, while the high pressure hose and power cord connect on the back. This makes it harder to keep the cable and 2 hoses from tangling when moving the unit The pressure hose attachment to the wand handle is very simple to use and is in front of the trigger, which gives the wand better balance. It comes with 2 spray ends that just insert and twist into the handle: A variable fan spray nozzle and a turbo nozzle (pinpoint spray that twirls around in a circle.)

reviews.review_header: Works well.. until the plastic junk factor kicks ...
reviews.review_text: I would like to update my review on this item. It is true that this is a hunk of plastic and it did break. However, I did contact the company and they immediately sent me out a new part. GREAT service! As long as this doesn't happen every year .....I should be ok. Works well.. until the plastic junk factor kicks in. Update - 1 year later and approx 4 uses. After sitting in shed all winter I was excited to bring out my power washer to clean the car and the side of the house. Well, the little part attaching the hose to the gun is plastic and a piece of junk. It broke without anything happening to it. I tried to buy a replacement part but you have to buy the gun to get it. It is almost 10$ and then they charge you another 10 for shipping. So..do I spend 20$ for another junk part which I assume will also break? I am trying to find a sturdier part and have contacted the company to find out what type of connection it is so that I can buy another one from pressure washer parts suppliers.

Product functions as well as any other electric power washer I have owned, maybe better; but with one major exception. Notice that all pictures show user cleaning something at or below his chest height. This power washer is much less effective at any height more than 10 feet above your head. So, do not plan on power washing the second or third story of your home. Even if you have a ladder and are strong enough to lift the AR Blue up the ladder, it is less effective. And, the detergent bottle is useless more than 10 feet above your head or 5 feet away from you. So with this washer, you need to apply your cleansing detergent via a power nozzle on some other device, then rise with the AR Blue washe. Also, follow the Assembly and Operating instructions closely, or the machine will not function or will shut off frequently. Just as with any electric PW I have owned, extension cords reduce its useable time, and must wait for machine and extension cord to cool down. But it is effective and priced well for cleaning below your chest height, and if you have severl extension cords to substitute rather than wait for one to cool down..

reviews.review_header: This washer works well for what it is
reviews.review_text: This washer works well for what it is - a consumer version of the more powerful commercial power washers. I have used it to clean my sidewalk, a brick mailbox and the concrete surround of my pool. I still have to do the driveway. It does clean very well, but it takes time compared to the commercial washers. If you have the time and patience to do this type of work, this is a good buy for the price. I priced renting a commercial washer and they wanted about half of the price I paid for this, and the rental was for only four hours. The estimated cost of hiring a professional to do the same job just one was well in excess of the cost of this machine. Overall, I am satisfied with this washer.

reviews.review_header: The unit itself works great for the jobs I need it to do (Car washing primarily), set your expectations properly and enjoy.
reviews.review_text: Overall this is a great product, I ranked it 5 stars but almost gave it 4/5, for the small fact that the hose and tool caddy are not that useful to me. I think the hose reel could have been done better and provided more space for extensions. Also the storage of the power cord is not that great. The wands also do not like to fit the plastic holders that well. Overall they are alright features but could definitely be reworked to be more useful. As for the pressure washer itself it is awesome. I purchased this with the intention of washing my car and for that purpose it works wonderfully. I purchased the AR blue clean foam cannon to go with this and together the two work beautifully I attached some pictures of the cannon and the unit and how my car looks foamed with the two items using meguirs deep crystal ( a very cheap shampoo that works great). I tried the cannon on cleaning cracks on the driveway and sidewalk and it was also good at that really got in there and pushed out the dirt. The only thing if any I felt kind of disappointed with would be the turbo nozzle it did not seem like it was that great at cleaning sidewalks but I honestly never gave it a proper test. Overall it did the job, but seemed to take a bit longer. If i used cleaner before it, probably would have worked better. The detergent bottle that comes with this item is referred to as a foam bottle sometimes, I do not know why. The detergent bottle is just that detergent, its meant to add strong chemicals before cleaning sidewalks, fences, and other parts of houses. It is not meant to be used to foam up your car they don't work the same way as foam cannons. I seen some reviewers mention that the bottle sucks at cleaning cars, that's cause it is not meant for that task. Now about the unit itself. It is a very small and portable unit, it is very lightweight so just about anyone including elderly people should have no problems bringing this out for pressure washing. The unit is made out of a hard plastic, and looks to be very durable. The connection on the front of the unit which is the filter that connects to a hose seems like a softer plastic so I am kind of worried about its durability in the long term that goes the same for the hose end attachment. I have used the pressure washer like 10 times so far and no issues. People complain about the front filter/hose connection leaking, I only had that issue if i improperly connected the hose. Usually just a simple reset of the hose fixed the issue every time, people who say its constantly leaking probably are not doing something right, or they damaged the threads. Luckily the parts are pretty cheap less then $15 last I checked. Best thing about this unit it is very quite, which means you can take this out at anytime of the day and not worry about neighbors giving you hell for disturbing them. I took out the unit when a neighbor was using their gas and they could not believe how easy to use and quite the pressure washer was. On top of that it felt more powerful then his 2k gas pressure washer.

This product was advertised as being a really good, dependable power washer. Well...buyer BEWARE! The first unit that was mailed to me in early June was an "out of box" failure. Well, the customer service representative for the manufacturer of this product sent me a replacement unit...this unit was not an "out of box" failure, but did work ~4-5 times before it completely shut down, with regard to the motor. My neighbor (who is a professional electrician) & I verified (by by-passing the GFCI...as recommended by the customer service rep), that there was power going from the elecvtrical outlet to the power washing nunit, but the motor would not work. The company said that they would send me a 3rd unit (which I still haven't received), but I decided to call the customer service center at Amazon.com and they were willing to give me a complete refund, so that I can now go out & buy another power washer...but, this time it will be one that works!!! I do not have any confidence in the ability of this manufacturer to produce a quality product!!!

Both the best and worst things about this pressure washer are that is is electric powered rather than gasoline. It is a good, basic pressure washer. If, though, you are looking, for example, to be able to strip paint off a deck then it will not be powerful enough and you should get a gasoline powered washer. On the other hand, if you want to clean dirt/mold off your deck, lawn furniture, house, etc. this is a light, convenient and easy to use unit. It is MUCH lighter than a gas powered washer and, rather than fighting with a pull-cord to get it started, you simply have to plug it in and pull the trigger. A lot of other reviews complain about the low pressure (garden hose) side of the connection leaking like a sieve and they are right. (I can't figure out why AR hasn't improved this simply based on the input from Amazon purchases???...) But rather than purchasing a brass hose coupling as many suggest, I found that putting in a second hose gasket on each side of the coupling stopped the leaking and, most likely, is better for your warranty since the AR supplied coupling appears to have a built in water filter in it to keep particles in the water from reaching the pump.

This power washer was great for cleaning off our house, sidewalks, and driveway. I think that it is a nice size - I was honestly expecting it to be a little larger, but it's smaller size makes storing it all that much easier. It is a little difficult to wind up and store the different cables and hoses, but I don't think that this affects the performance of the product in anyway. My husband put this together in the time it took me to run to the store and come home. I don't think that he had any difficulties assembling this. It is easy to use - my father figured out how to use it and change the settings in about a minutes or so. My only dislike so far is that it is a little bit too short to easily wheel around if you are tall. I'm 5' 6" and can roll it around semi-easily. My husband is only a few inches taller than me and has to stoop to use the wheels, so he just carries it.

Borrowed a friend's Husky 1750 psi electric machine to see how our well (3 gpm) would handle the load and then read reviews. Liked everything I read about the AR383 so I bought it about a month ago but had my first opportunity to use it this weekend. When I unpacakaged and put it together (5 mins max) I was a little skeptical. It is small compared to the HUSKY; maybe 30 inches tall and feels light- substantial but much lighter than the Husky. I bought a brass male to male adaptor after reading so many comments about leaking but I didn't use it because the plastic adaptor never leaked a drop. Did not use the turbo lance but the adjustable wand was easy. Cleaned my garage doors and a bluestone walk and I was looking for more targets! My well had no problem keeping up, the hose reel works OK and the electric cord wrap is just big enough. When I read the manual it said not to use an extension cord due to increased electrocution risk which will limit me to right around the house and keep me from cleaning the stone headwalls at both ends of our driveway culvert. The only negative so far.

reviews.review_header: Good electric washer, make sure your house water pressure is up to the task.
reviews.review_text: This is a good electric power washer. If you want the really high-pressure stuff, you need a gasoline-powered one, but I didn't want to spend money for that and maintain an engine for something I use maybe once a year. However, you need good water-pressure in your house, or the motor will start to whine a bit and the water will come out at 50% pressure, because the pump is spitting out water faster than it can take it in. If you have a very long run to your faucet, or if your plumber is a con-artist and used 3/8" soft copper to feed your outdoor faucets, you may run into problems.

Does what I expected it to do!! Purchased this item to clean my air conditioner coil and radiator, which sits outside and is exposed to the elements. It removed dirt, leaves, most older mildew, and old paint. The second job was to wash the sun shade material which I have covering two double windows, which face the west. Could not believe the dirt which was removed after two years of use. Cleaned outside windows, the patio, the garage floor, and the car. Now, I have run out of things to clean. Oh well, next year it will start over. After reading several reviews about the power, I have the feeling that the pump was never turned on. Remember you must connect the water, turn it on, connect the power plug to 110 Volts, make sure the reset button is pushed in and the power switch is turned on. I have never used directions much, but this time I had to use them to find the use of the power switch, which does not look like a power switch, because it is covered with plastic and is completely invisible. you just have to place your finger on the plastic and push on the right, then left until you feel the movement of the switch. The plastic is there to protect the switch from water exposure. The reset button has to be pushed each time you plug it into the power receptacle. In all, this is a great device and I hope it does the same job next time I use it, hopefully in about three months. Getting excited about cleaning things isn't my normal way of life. Ha!!!

The life of most AR Blue pressure washers aren't great but who's are? They are a great light weight reasonably priced electric pressure washer. Light enough for women, strong enough for men.....what more can I say???

Easy to set up, easy to use, light and portable but packs a powerful punch. It cleaned all the scum off sidewalks, walls, etc with EASE. On full strength, it stripped away paint off our trim...but that was my fault. I should have turned it down some. It comes with two wants. One that allows you to choose the width and power that is used. The other want rotates to add extra power. Took years worth of scum build up off our concrete walk. It is fairly quiet and not bothersome to those in the house while we were using it. We have had both gas powered ($460) and more expensive electric ones in the past, but this is the very best we have ever had or used.

reviews.review_header: Every homeowner should have one of these!
reviews.review_text: Great power washer! Love the spool to wrap up the hose as well as the different attachement holders in the back. Keeps everything clean and easy to put away. Will this compare to any of its gas counterparts? Don't be silly. However, for all my household needs, it's amazing! I've used it to: -Clean my front steps and walkway (took off old grime that no amount of scrubbing would remove) -Clean my composite deck (be careful not to go too close to the deck if you do this, read the board manufacturer's suggestions) -Clean slate and granite outdoor stones -Clean my vinyl siding (2nd floor harder unless you are on a scaffold or ladder) -Clean the cast iron grates on my grill (and the rest of the grill) -Clean the cast iron grates on my gas stovetop (this works great!) -Clean my driveway -Clean my toddler's toys (little tikes outdoor playhouse, bikes, etc) -Wash the car (again carefully) I think for what its intended purposes are, this thing works great! A word of caution, when I cleaned the grates for my stove outside on the driveway, I was very close with the nozzle and it actually caused small cracks in my driveway. So be warned, this thing is still powerful. Do thinks like this on the street! The only reason I could see for wanting a more powerful washer is to reach further away things (like 2nd floor siding) from the ground, etc. However, I love the fact that there's no oil/gas to deal with, it's ultra quiet compared to its gas counterparts, and its so portable that moving it is simple as carrying a suitcase! I love it!

Bought this for car detailing - particularly Plasti-Dipped cars. I also bought the MTM Hydro Foam Canon, which required a $12.00 adapter from the AR Blue website because this particular AR Blue model uses proprietary fittings thus, making it impossible to bolt on standard NPT fittings. Tightened up all parts and used Teflon tape where applicable, also installed the clear plastic male fitting on the washer unit (not on the garden hose).........all said and done NO LEAKS! The foam canon with Meticulous Matte foam concentrate from Chemical Guys puts out a LOT of foam with this pressure washer. I will probably build a custom 2-wheel roll-around cart for this thing since the tool caddy, hose real (a cartoonish joke), and power cord storage horns are not up to task and cause nothing but frustration. I give 5 stars overall because of the excellent value for the money despite the storage shortcomings.

reviews.review_header: Atrocious design. Pressure washes fine if you can put up with the design flaws.
reviews.review_text: My favorite pastime is fighting with the AR Blue Clean pressure washer. It works fine, but the hose connection leaks like a sieve. I replaced the cheap plastic fitting, and it still leaks horribly. Attaching the wand hose to the machine is a chore since there is not enough finger room around the threads to be able to screw the hose in tightly. The roller on the top is a complete joke--there for cosmetic purposes only. You'll never, I mean ever get the hose wrapped up on the roller. Just forget about it. The plastic jug connection attaches at a weird angle, forcing you to hold the wand at a 45 degree angle to keep the jug from losing its contents. If you have to set the wand down for a second (to untwist the electric cord from the pressure hose, which is something you will have to get used to) the wand with connected jug will, with all certainty, fall over and the contents of the jug will completely empty out. The design of this product is just atrocious.

Have used it a few times. Mostly straight forward. Have occasional issues with air intrusion leading to extended hiccups (yes, even with extensive initial bleeding of line upon connection of water hose). My guess is that bubbles/pockets of air occasionally form inside the unit in a way that takes a while to work their way out. Other than that, have been happy with the unit. And especially so when regarding how little water this thing consumes: I can easily use my solar/12v pump to feed it from the rain water cisterns underneath my deck.

reviews.review_header: Good for the money but some annoyances
reviews.review_text: Good for the money but some annoyances. Given the price it works really well. The issues I have are: 1. Difficult to get the hose bibs on. I had to file my hose threads so they were perfect of the fittings wouldn't go on. All other garden fittings worked fine on my hose. Once on properly they don't leak. Patience was required but it works now. 2. Hose reel is essentially useless. Only for storage and even then not exactly great to unwind given the base of the fitting sometimes catches while unwinding making it a single turn by turn affair. 3. Electric cord storage has to be the worst I've ever seen. Seems like it was designed for a cord 8 ft shorter than needed. Taxing. 4. Soap dispenser sits at about a 30 deg angle on the gun instead of hanging down straight and it isn't me just not putting it on correctly. Not a big deal but the internal fitting on the gun should be aligned properly. A detail that just makes you think the rest of it is probably equally shoddy. 5. Gun wands could all use some sort of flat section so they don't roll down your driveway while you're getting it ready and putting it away. Tiring to have to figure out where your wand went again. 6. Trigger handle did require more pressure to keep engaged than expected and I'm no wimp. Shut off a few times when I slightly relaxed my hand. Might be tiring for people with weaker hands. Other than that there wasn't anything I didn't like about the actual usage/pressure/etc. It does the job well once you're using it. It just annoys you setting it up and putting it away. It's fairly quiet and the wands work well. I really like the adjustable one. It has some serious power on the strongest single stream setting so be careful. Overall I got what I paid for. Maybe the more expensive ones have better setup/ergonomics but this one works and was cheap.

reviews.review_header: The AR383 cleans better and the spray tips have a much wider range
reviews.review_text: I just bought a Blue Clean AR383 and recently used to clean a sidewalk. The unit replaces a 10 year old Karcher 395m so I will make a direct comparison. It has slightly reduced water flow (1.7gal/min vs 1.51) than the Karcher but the AR383 higher max pressure, 1900psi vs 1600psi. The AR383 cleans better and the spray tips have a much wider range. The AR383 is significantly smaller and lighter. The high pressure hose reel is an advantage. Unfortunately you have to disconnect the high press hose from the unit to use the reel. The tool storage is better than the Karcher. I wish the Blue Clean had a rack for storing the power chord. It is cheaper than the Karcher ($150 ten years ago) and cheaper than an equivalent Karcher replacement. I found the Karcher to be unreliable after the latest failure I decided to junk it. I hope the AR is better. I did not have the same leakage problems at the inlet that other people report. I bought the brass double female hose adapter anyway.

reviews.review_header: Good for small jobs at home. NOT commercial quality at all.
reviews.review_text: OK, go enough for average home owners. There are things I don't like and some have been commented on, but nothing that would make me want to return it. The price is still a bit high, but I can tell this is a second or third generations. Pros: Light weight. Simple. multiple spay heads and wands Water proof. Relatively quite (less noise than a vacuum cleaner) Low water use (I even use a cheap 1/4 diameter hose on it at 1.5 GPM rating) Works well with the round flat surface cleaner (optional) Cons: Not interchangeable with other machines (like my $69 Husky electric that is 15 years old now) GFCI plug is understandable, but it won't fit in many outdoor outlets. (I use a heavy-duty extension cord 12-guage). On my Husky, this same GFCI thing quite working soon after I got it. I just cut it off and wired on a large 3-prog plug. PLASTIC water connections for input side (Good to have a water filter, because you need one, but all plastic is fragile and other machines still provide metal connectors. This design likes like it will break off too easily. So far, so good. I put 10 hours of cleaning on it and I like it. The sprayer hose does roll up - not sure that's very good for it, but I do it. I cleaned 500 sf of concrete porch and pea gravel decks with the option deck cleaner (a 12" round attachment that has a law sprinkler head under it, with high pressure nozzles. it spins while cleaning to minimize streaking). Plenty of pressure to keep it going, and when you let go, the motor shuts off. There is one odd quirk I noticed. When I let go the first time, the motor make a different sound and seems to go to a lower power setting. Nothing about that in the manual, not sure if it's a feature or a bug. But, the second time I squeeze, the motor goes to full power. !?!?

reviews.review_header: Don't throw away the car sponge just yet!
reviews.review_text: Bottom line first... I love it. This is my first pressure washer and was bought after a decent bit of research. I've cleaned the hot tub, got the moss off the bricks (watch out for loose mortar!), scared the cats and the ice chests look like new. I did find though that our house water pressure might be a bit close to the threshold that this unit needs. My first attempts at using the unit ended up in it acting fairly sporadic, sputtering a bit every couple of minutes. That went away when I opened up the water faucet _all_ the way, which was less than one more half turn. The car sponge reference in the title happened when I went to wash the truck today. Soap on, let sit, swap for the high pressure wand, and blast it! Hmmm... still dirty, but the dirt looks cleaner. I tried it a couple of times, using more soap and/or letting it sit longer, get _right up_ on the truck during the rinse cycle. Nada. In the end, I used the unit as an automated soap applier for my manual sponging, then a "you better best bet all the soap's gonna be gone!" rinse cycle. Now, on the upside in auto-washing, I have a "project truck" that's been in the driveway for, umm, a while. It has (had!) moss growing on it. I fired up the high pressure wand, and had a "blast" getting all the moss off of it. Way cool! A couple of other things to point out... - Like everyone else, get that bronze hose adapter that Amazon says "also bought with..." - The manual is horrible - the pictures are WAY too small. But, a couple of minutes spent sitting with the pieces and you'll figure it out. - The soap bags are bit too large to just drop into the canister, use a screwing motion and they'll go in. - DO NOT LOSE THE MAGIC CLEANING PIN! When using the soap canister, I didn't wait quite long enough for the soap bags to fully dissolve, and the remains got sucked up into the hose, and into the intake venturi. The hose was easy (but the soap tastes HORRIBLE!) but the venturi needed a jab with the cleaning pin. Even after, the venturi got clogged a couple of times in the hour I spent washing the truck. - If you find that the unit isn't providing full pressure, and the motor sounds "weird", grab the magic cleaning pin again and clean the nozzle of the wand you're using. The unit detects too much back pressure and the motor shifts into a protection mode. - If you quickly click-on/click-off, the unit will go into low pressure mode. You have to let the motor wind all the way down before clicking-on again in order to get high pressure mode. - The hose reel is useless. Just coil the power cord and the hose around the handle.

reviews.review_header: Good pressure washer with some caveats
reviews.review_text: After reading the many reviews here, I was prepared for the good and bad. First the good. The product was reasonably priced for the advertised PSI rating. The motor operated only when you pulled the trigger. This was a plus for me because it minimized excess noise and was more energy efficient overall. The pressure generated was quite robust with the turbo wand attached. It could easily washed off all the hardened tar, oil and excess mortar mix cement from my front driveway. The other wand could be adjusted to generate a wide spray pattern to wash your car or other situations requiring mild to moderate pressure cleaning. Now for the bad. Yes, even when I attached the connectors as instructed to my garden hose it leaked. Rather than buying extra parts such as brass connectors/adapters as others suggested, I did something much simpler. I stacked up two rubber washers where the fitting connects to the garden hose and viola...no more leaks. Hope this helps. Overall, I think this was a great purchase and plan to use more of it in the future... Update (4/20/15): After owning this pressure for 3+ yrs with very infrequent use (maybe once or twice a year), something broke. The o-rings from the hose to wand and wand to lancets cracked and broke at the worst time when I need to start a project going. Without an intact o-ring, the two pieces will not stay joined and you will not be able to operate the pressure washer without water leaking or splashing. These are cheap o-rings. Luckily, Amazon carries replacement o-rings kit with measurements listed. I just take note of the size and bought replacement at the local hardware stores for cheap. Would have been nice if company had thrown in a couple of these o-rings...

I just love this pressure washer! I live in Louisiana and have a large brick courtyard that gets mildew buildup quickly in the summers. Of course, this is not as powerful as a gas powered washer, but there are a lot of benefits! For one, its light and easy to get around. I can easily put it in the back of my car if I need to. It is fairly quiet (compared to the big gas ones), which to me is a big deal because my young kids are usually outside playing when I am using this, and I like to be able to hear what they are up to. It does a really good job cleaning. It gets almost everything out of the brick, stucco and concrete. However, I do spray a water and bleach mix onto the surface I plan to clean, about 30 minutes prior to cleaning. That really helps. Without that step this washer would not get everything up, but it only takes a few extra minutes. (Side note - I found that the bleach/water mix works far better than the pressure washer cleaning solutions, but you have to be careful not to get it on your plants and grass, etc) It also works really good on cleaning cars, especially the tires, and you do not have to worry about damaging anything. Bottom line, its a great buy, easy to use, easy to move around and durable. Ive had it for over two years and use it several times a month, and never had a single issue with it. It is one of the best cleaning items I have ever bought.

New UPDATE July 23, 2014 -- If you read below you will see that one week ago I had an AR Blue Clean that was shipped to me broken from Amazon. I called AR Blue Clean directly as it said on the paper inside the box and they responded within minutes. A new unit shipped later that day and I received it in two business days. They made sure I received UPS notices of its progress in shipment. The new unit was in good shape and it works fine. I have never changed a rating from a one to a five before because I have never had this level of customer service before. The customer service worker was very courteous and helpful and responded immediately. UPDATE TO MY REVIEW AT THE BOTTOM OF THIS!!! I got an email response within 10 minutes from the rep at AR Blue Clean! He says a new unit will ship to me today. Based on that extremely fast and courteous response I have already received I am changing my rating from a 1 to a 3! Even thought the unit was broken, I am impressed with their response so far. Original review -- I received the AR Blue Clean from Amazon on time. I took it out of the box today and began to put it together. I attached the accessory holder. Then I went to attach the pressure hose. Well....the connector on the main unit was bent in the shape of a "D" and there was no way it was going to connect. Not a good sign of quality control in manufacturing! I just called AR Blue Clean at the toll free number and spoke to someone for maybe a minute. I just sent them a copy of my Amazon receipt and a picture of the damaged part. Now I am waiting to see how long it will take to get the unit replaced. I really wanted to use it today too! If they respond quickly, this rating will change. We will see.

Number 1 reason for getting a pressure washer, is to wash my car. That is sole reason. So my review is only based on this. I didn't need a super powerful 3000 psi gas power pressure washer (trust me a bought one and is was too much for what I needed). I just needed something small, not too expensive, with enough power to wash my car. I also needed enough psi, as I am attaching an MTM Foam Gun (its a device that attaches to end pressure washer and filled with shampoo, foams up the car really nice). People complain about leaking...but anytime I work with a water hose, I use brass quick connects and teflon tape. That way you don't have to worry about leaks. Pro: 1. Super long power cord 2. Not heavy, easy to move around 3. On demand pump (which is great, so it only runs when you squeeze the trigger) 4. Plenty of power (1900 psi) for what I need it for Cons: 1. AR does not use universal type connections for their pressure washers. So if you are going to attached...lets say a MTM Foam gun you will need an adapter 2. The wind up wheel is ok...basic, not the greatest design, but it works. On a side note, if you plan on using an MTM Foam Gun or any other type of foam gun you will need an adapter. (the one supplied with this unit is poor). The good thing about AR is that they are now set up in North America and through their website can find any adapter or replacement part you will need. I have to say their customer service was GREAT, the office here in the states is located in Minnesota (great folks, super nice) Overall, I am very pleased with purchase, good value for the money for an electric pressure washer.

If you want a basic pressure washer, this works great. It's cheap... Real cheap. Definitely saved money wherever they could. The pressure is adequate, and it's pretty light - wish I guess is a pro. I'm giving it 3.5 stars for a few reasons. Mainly? It's cheap. Very cheap. The hose, connectors, wands and gun all feel extremely cheap. If I ere to drop this from a ladder at say 6 feet, I doubt it would survive. Which is fine, because it's what I paid for. The connectors from hose to washer are just cheap plastic.
