You can pick up brass from Home Depot for about 10 bucks. I have buyers remorse a bit and wish I got the gas from Costco, but then again, it was twice the price. I washed my walk way, drive way and front side walk with it. It did a good job. No real complaint from the functionality. I'll be doing the side molding in the backyard this weekend and expect it will get the mold on the part of the house that is in perpetual shade. I highly recommend you buy this if you're looking for a solid low end device. But upgrades will probably cost you about 60 bucks for an actual pressure hose, not a cheap plastic one and brass connectors. Also, be warned, the deck washer you can get as a an attachment does not fit - wish I knew ahead of time - but the adapter is not on Amazon, that I could see at least. Which will cost you another 15 to get it shipped.

reviews.review_header: all seems to work fine. As others noted
reviews.review_text: Did a test run, all seems to work fine. As others noted, the included hose wheel seems to be useless. No leaks noted. Only giving 4 stars because I rarely give 5 stars, which I leave for exceptional ratings. BTW - AR Blue Clean just informed me this is a "residential" washer, which are only rated at 50-100 hrs of use; but, he claimed their AR units normally last more than 100 hours. This seems very low to me, but just wanted to post this for others in case they wanted something that is rated for more hours of use, maybe consider getting a commercial unit (but I do not know how many hours commercial units are rated at).

No its not as powerfull as a gas engine machine. But for its advantage in price and portability its great. Being less power full you are less likely to damage a wood deck etc. I strongly recommend the extension hose!! It makes a world of difference. Tips.Grease the high pressure hose connector on the machine with vaseline etc. The cast threads can be difficult. Also release the pressure in the HP hose after use before trying to unscrew the hose from the machine or you will find it very difficult to unscrew.

Overall, a great power washer. The PSI is great for an electric unit, powerful enough to clean cement, cars, house exteriors, etc. I chose 4 stars instead of 5 for a few reasons: -Mobility while connected. The garden hose attaches to the front, the power cord comes out of the back, and the pressurized hose comes out of the back. When moving, any twisting motion seems like it is going to put excessive stress on the garden hose connection and possibly break it. It connects with plastic instead of copper. Despite others saying the garden hose intake leaks, mine leaked at first, but then I tightened it up (by hand) and didn't have any problems going forward. - Non universal connections. I bought this primarily for car cleaning, and wanted to use the MTM Foam Cannon. You can use it, however you need to order a special adapter that lets you connect to 1/4" connections. They sell this adapter, but you have to call and order. It isn't on the website for some reason. The part number is: "PW3084200 1/4" bayonet adaptor" -AR Blue sells a Foam Cannon that is made by the same people as the MTM Foam Cannon. I purchased this from their website, but shipping was slow and cost $18. The Foam cannon itself is reasonably priced @ ~$60. -Wish the hose was longer. 20 Ft. seems OK, but when you figure most cars are about 18' feet long, you'll need to move it around a few times to get all corners of the car. Not a big deal, and something that can be replaced/upgraded. -Aside from these few quirks, which may or not apply to your intended uses, I really like the unit. The adjustable angle end on the gun is GREAT and way better than the stupid variable angle tips that other pressure washers use. If you are cleaning something that is stubborn, you can simply twist the end of the gun and narrow the stream to make it MUCH more powerful. Careful not to cut your foot off if you focus it into a laser-geyser thin stream!!! -The unit is small, lightweight, and takes up very little space in the garage. I would suggest this for anybody that has wanted to use a powerwasher for home tasks. The price is right, customer service is decent, and the unit runs as advertised!

reviews.review_header: 900 PSI works great! I cleaned in 3 1/2 hrs what took ...
reviews.review_text: The AR Blue Clean AR383 1,900 PSI works great! I cleaned in 3 1/2 hrs what took me 4 days 2 years ago the hard way. Would have even been better if I had followed all of the instructions. I had water spraying out the front of the machine. I didn't figure it out until I talk to customer service...there are 2 pieces that hook the water hose to the machine...the clear part of the quick release goes on to the machine, the blue and black part screws on to the water hose. Even though water was spraying out the front of the machine it knocked 2 year old dirt off of the patio cover easily. Oops Pilot error... Customer service and I got a chuckle out it...read the other reviews to get more info...after looking around at the big box stores I was sure that I wanted the blue machine.... Glad to get more PSi .... It does/did what I wanted it too...

reviews.review_header: I am so happy I bought this
reviews.review_text: The AR383 has turned out to be fantastic for me. I was mainly considering it for power washing my siding to remove all the loose stain to prep for re-staining my house. I was also considering renting a more powerful gas version. So glad I went with this, and the price is not THAT much more than renting considering all the other cleaning uses I'll get out of it. Not to mention, renting you have to get as much done as you can before you have to bring it back. This machine worked great to strip off old flaking stain. You have to get pretty close to the siding, but that's okay, I have more control over it this way, so no damaged wood. I was actually really surprised as most things I read seemed to say 2300 psi or more for paint prep. In my situation, this has been enough. Maybe a bit more power would be nice, but this got the job done and for the price, it's an incredible value and I am so happy I bought this. As others have mentioned, getting the brass fitting was necessary, the factory one leaked. My brass did at first, but I think I had it too tight. So I took it off, put some Vaseline on the washers and just made it snug, and now NO LEAKS! Gilmour 7FHS7FH Double Female Swivel Brass Connector, 3/4-Inch by 3/4-Inch For power washing my siding I bought the AR brand 25' extension. That was nice. I could go all the way up the ladder and all across the back of my house without having to move the pressure washer, that was so convenient. If you are doing a job that requires you to wash a larger areas, like the length of a house, or up a high ladder I highly recommend the extension hose. AR North America 25-Feet Extension Hose So there you have it, I think this is a great value and the machine is doing a great job for me. If you have not used a power washer before, just know some things require patience while you let the pressurized water do the work. You do have to work close and in small sections, so sometimes it's slow going. I think the tradeoff would be a very expensive gas unit though, and the higher pressures can also do damage (if you are not careful). For the money, I got more than I expected and can highly recommend this unit.

reviews.review_header: Works perfectly as advertised and very simple and lightweight with plenty of power.
reviews.review_text: I bought this several months ago and waited to review it until it had several uses. Today I cleaned off our back patio slab and it had several years worth of dirt on it. Plus the surrounding grass had crept up onto the concrete by a couple of inches or so. It did a fabulous job removing the dirt built up in very little time. It is powerful enough to use on the house siding but won't take off paint unless its already flaking. Just follow the directions and stand back so the pressure isn't so high. This is a great washer for simple home owner tasks. The machine is light and sturdy. I was worried that the plastic valve that connects the hose to the washer was not going to hold up so I purchased an extra one. I have dragged this machine around many times and have not had any problems at all. It performs exactly as advertised and it is very simple to use. My 13 year old can handle it with no problems.

reviews.review_header: but based on the reviews I read before buying this product the machine does everything people liked and disliked about it and yo
reviews.review_text: Will have to wait and see about durability and longevity, but based on the reviews I read before buying this product the machine does everything people liked and disliked about it and you get a good power washer for the price. It handles "all around the house chores": cement cleaning, deck, car and house washing. Really like the adjustable sprayer by just having to turn the end until you get the spray you want. Hose is stiff and you have to plan ahead or it binds up. Going to the hardware store in the future to get a brass quick connect as the plastic one that comes with the machine does eventually leak, but all the reviews I read said that this would happen and after changing it out had no more problems with leaks. This power washer is worth and competitively priced.

I bought this pressure washer as I wanted/needed something reasonably prices, had good customer reviews and a decent warranty. This unit had it all. I was going to go with one a big box store but the PSI was lower than this one. My brother is a small engine mechanic and he works on the gas powered washers. he suggested that if I did get an electric unit get one with a PSI no less than 1800. So far I am extremely happy with the unit; I have power washed my sidewalk and driveway and didn't need any soap!? There was a noticeable layer of fungus growth and this made my area look like the cement was just installed! I did get the extended warranty as I felt that it was worth the extra coin since I don't see it breaking in the first year as it most likely will only be used an additional 3 maybe 4 more times this year? This unit doesn't take up much space in my garage-like others have stated the reel is useless but I can live with winding it up and letting it rest around the handle.

reviews.review_header: Quality pressure washer, Great customer service
reviews.review_text: My unit arrived with a small defect, but AR Blue customer support promptly shipped a replacement part AND included a free industrial foam cannon ($50 value) with 2 day shipping to make things right. I got the unit running today and it is better than advertised IMHO. Extremely powerful and perfect for washing all the mud and dirt off my 4x4 truck. For the price, this is hard to beat. It's one thing for a comapny/product to offer a warranty but it's even better when you discover they actually back it and promptly support the customer.

This works as expected and is straightforward. Very easy to hook up and use. I was able to get the entire pressure washer assembled in about 10 minutes. I have a few complaints: the tool caddy is a bit weird. It doesn't really hold the power cable adequately (the cable is too long and thick to wrap around the cable holder). When you wrap the power cable, you'll end up wrapping it on top of the soap dispenser. The hooks that hold the two pressure washer wands seem to be a bit too small. I'm already seeing some stress marks in the plastic because the wands are too thick. Overall, this pressure washer has been reliable and has been up to the task. The complaints I have are minimal and in no way affect the performance of the pressure washer itself. And for the price, I think they are minor issues that I can live with. This pressure washer is compact and hides away really easy. It fits in the back of my tiny sports coupe without any problems.

A 35' electric cord & 25' high pressure hose utilizing 1900 psi water pressure enabled me to blast away months of accumulated soil....from 2036 sq. ft. of concrete (a 48' x 9' driveway & a 92' x 16'. driveway, a 36' entry sidewalk & a 7' wide porch).This was accomplished in a combined time of approx. 12 hours. I'm 66 yrs. young and I worked on cleaning the concrete "off & on" over the course of 4 days. Two wand attachments are included.....a tight spinning circular "turbo" spray (I used this on the concrete) and an adjustable sprayer which is very powerful as well (from a wide "fan" spray, it can be adjusted to a very, very tight "pin-point" spray....capable of cutting diamonds....I exaggerate ;-) to stress the power of this adjustment point). This pressure washer and its soap dispenser, which attaches to the high pressure hose both performed excellently!! The soap is broadcast as a gentle foam spray in a "fan" shape. I like that the soap doesn't travel thru the interior of the machine, potentially "... gumming it up". I've owned a 1600 psi Karcher and an 1800 psi Husky, but this AR Blue Clean AR383 pressure washer has out-performed both, so far. Long term durability?? I can't say yet. I will inject an antifreeze/seal protectorant after each use and ahead of winter storage in southwest Ohio.

reviews.review_header: Nice pressure washer, and a good price
reviews.review_text: When I first opened the package and began assembling the power washer, I was a little nervous that things would break easily. After getting it out and using it, I don't think I' m too worried about that; at least for now. Assembly was fast and easy with the Quickstart guide, and I used the regular manual just to double-check some operational stuff. I had some funny looks from my family, but I went out and used it under my covered patio during a rain shower anyway. There are two different wands included, and they are very easy to swap out. I didn't use the soap dispenser this time, but will try it on my truck sometime when it quits raining so much here. One is like a water laser, but it is good for stuff on concrete and other surfaces that is stuck pretty badly. The other is adjustable, and was good for cleaning the concrete. I'm didn't buy the round concrete wand yet, but I have used one before on another power washer and will probably do so in the near future before tackling a larger project like the driveway. Overall it was really easy to use and easy (and compact) to store afterwards. The spindle for the hose seems OK to me, and maybe the hose was changed from some of the other reviewers as this one didn't seem to be permanently curled. It was also not too noisy, but it does take some getting used to. When you release the trigger on the wand, the unit shuts off, but if you squeeze it too quickly after releasing it, like to change hands, it seems to sputter for a second. Just let it sit for a couple of seconds and it will go again. I'm happy with it the one time I have used it so far! It was also cheaper on Amazon than at Home Depot.

I was pretty excited about this unit, but before you buy here's some things you should consider: 1. The adjustable nozzle doesn't work very well, not as strong/clean stream as the replaceable nozzles you see on other machines. 2. The instructions are good, but you might need a magnifying glass :-) 3. The turbo nozzle is ok, not sure if it's better than the equivalent pressure nozzle, but it makes an annoying sound on the pavement, like high pitched and irritating. 4. The winding thing designed to contain the hose just isn't really practical. You have to disconnect the hose, then shove it in there and wind it, once it's wound you think, ok cool, but that wasn't worth the work. However, unwinding doesn't work at all, the handle doesn't help, you just need to pull the thing yourself. 5. the wand is a little short, you find yourself bending down 6. The wands don't really 'snap' into place in the back holder, there's no leverage to push them in all the way so they stay, so you either need to get on your kneed and suport the machine while trying to shove them in (which doesn't work) or you need to put the machine on its belly and whack them, but then you could break the hose nozzle that sticks out the front. So these don't really work either. 7. Ok power cord can be wound around the back, cool right ? not really... you wind it around 75% but then you have plenty of cord left ... doesn't fit any more so you need to figure something else out. Overall lots of "want to be useful" features that aren't as practical in execution. I'm either going to get better wands or return this machine and get something more expensive that's also more practical. Pros: 1. pretty quiet machine 2. long power cord 3. the wands suck, but they're convenient :-) 4. the black pressurized rubber hose is pretty flexible and doesn't kink or tangle easily, better than other hoses I've used.

reviews.review_header: Good Entry Level, but wit caveats...
reviews.review_text: This is a pretty basic and low power pressure washer, but is also very affordable in the pressure washer market. The biggest issue I have is that the pressure hose is so rigid, it is very hard to move the unit around. There is the hose feed and the electrical line as well, and they will get tangled. The wheels are useless because of this as well. The pressure hose is also very difficult to reel back, and once you get it wound nice and tight, it will spool out a bit and become loose, due to the nature of the hose rigidity. As for the recommendations for a brass fitting, I still have the OEM fittings and they work fine. I have had to replace the gaskets that fit on each attachment, and the pressure hose as well. Even as lower pressure, it can still cause damage when used with a jet tip, so be careful. It can easily damage wood, plastic, even asphalt. There are very few uses for the jet tip, I use the adjustable fan wand usually. The soap mixer is okay pretty basic. I bought a separate foam lance and use it to wash my truck, major difference in foam thickness. I use it to foam the truck to let dirt loosen, then I switch to my garden hose to rinse. I paid $150, so at $110 on 4/11/16, this is pretty good deal. But if you think cords a problem for other things, this will drive you nuts. I am saving already for a gas powered unit, usually about $275, and I can say the ease of use alone would make those a better choice overall.

reviews.review_header: May be o.k. for occasional use but don't expect too much
reviews.review_text: After having had a Blue Clean AR 383 for several month it is time to review it. The high power at a reasonable price and mainly good reviews have been the main reasons to buy this pressure washer. Assembly was a mess. The pressure hose attaches to a recessed port. You can not hold that screw cap properly to connect the hose in that tight place so you have to have strong fingers and enough patience to tighten it. The small reel for that inflexible plastic covered pressure hose is a joke and causes the pressure hose to kink at one place which resulted in a burst pressure hose at ours. It showed, again, that you get what you pay for. If you need a pressure washer once a year and don't want to spend much money it may be o.k. Had I known this before I would have bought a different product and I would not recommend this to a friend.

reviews.review_header: ... wanted one and discovered that it is an absolute wonderful experience having
reviews.review_text: Purchased for sister in law who wanted one and discovered that it is an absolute wonderful experience having. Primarily she wanted it to clean her vinyl fence and back patio (concrete and brick). The fence started cleaning very easily, without chemicals, then she discovered its ability to clean the patio and was amazed at how dirty it was. No chemicals used at all, even though we did try and it didn't seem to help any (used the Simple Green 13421 Pro HD Heavy Duty Cleaner) but that may have been do to any number of things, so I'm not counting off for that. We had no issues with leaking from the connectors (did not put any tape on the threads), since that was the most common issue stated. We had none of the other issues commented on either. The only thing we had was an occasional stop do to air in the line. Not sure what caused that, but cleared it by pulling the hose and letting it run for a short bit before connecting it back up and turning the water on again. After about three days of use, it only happened twice.

reviews.review_header: All the cheap plastic fittings leaked Really bad. I used it once and the hose kinked ...
reviews.review_text: I should of believed the reviews before I bought it !!!! They were correct . The unit was a total piece of junk. All the cheap plastic fittings leaked Really bad . I used it once and the hose kinked in 3 places after first use. They tell you to buy a brass adapter fitting to stop the water leak. It costs only $8.00 How on earth does a company sell you a brand new pressure washer and tell you to buy a part to fix it. Why wouldn't they just give you the brass adapter in the box. That is like buying a new car and they tell you to put better spark plugs in it so it will run and not stall out. Very disappointed !!!!!

this is a solidly ok product. the pressure washer works fine, but the design of the product is off. i cant get the reel to work with the hose without pinching it. the electrical cord storage is too small for the whole cord and it must be completely undone before you gain access to pressure hose connection.

reviews.review_header: I have a well and I was worried about water pressure since my previous pressure washer did not do a good job. The last time I ha
reviews.review_text: I was going to give this a 4 star rating because I did not think the assembly instructions were that clear. I never did figure out how to get the hose to wrap around the reel but after reading the Amazon answers I followed the recommendation to skip that and just use a bungee cord to hold it. Some of the users indicated the reel caused the hose to kink and was too small anyway. After using it for the first time today it got upgraded to a 5 star rating. My back deck had not been pressure washed in several years and really should have had some cleaner in the dispenser but I decided just to use the water. I could not believe how much grime it removed. I have a well and I was worried about water pressure since my previous pressure washer did not do a good job. The last time I had everything pressure washed it was $250 and they ended up spraying a lot of gunk in my pool. If this unit only last a year it will more than make up for what it cost. Strangely enough I found it fun spraying away all the dirt so I would never pay someone to do this job again.

reviews.review_header: Great product, Well built, easy to use. Unfortunately under powered for my need
reviews.review_text: After reading the reviews I was very excited to finally own my first power washer. I have been borrowing my my neighbors every spring and wanted one of my own. I have a large deck that I power wash every spring with a Briggs and Stratton 2150 PSI gas model. It is very loud on goes through about 1 gallon of gas per washing of the deck. I thought that having an electric model would be sufficient. Shipping was lighting fast and assembly was simple. Within 5 minutes of unboxing, I had it plugged in and washing. I quickly realized that it was not a very powerful unit. We have a teak dining set and this unit struggled to spray off the winter dirt that that gas unit would blast right off. I also tried this AR383 on my driveway. It would only do very small(2-3") strips and would have taken me many hours to clean the cement. I did a side by side test of the old Briggs model I had been using and there was no comparison. While gas is loud, you can always keep the motor further away to keep down the noise. I do think the AR Blue clean is a great product for light use. It is not powerful enough to do a decent job on decks or concrete. If you are the type of person that owns many power tools and appreciate the value of using the right tool for the job, this is not the tool for you. This tool is constructed very well and is a high quality plastic.The proprietary fittings were a bit disappointing and would have like to see a standard brass quick connect included. I would recommend this for washing your car, vinyl siding, or maybe general outdoor cleaning that would need pressure more powerful than a hose. The attached soap bottle is very handy and nice that you could swap it for another attachment in the middle of a job. I also like the hose quick connect so much that I bought one for the new power washer that I eventually purchased.Since this is a 14 OR 15 amp electric model, I doubt that you will be able to find a 110V plug-in power washer with much more power. From what I have read, this unit is as powerful as the higher end consumer Karcher models. My suggestion to AR would be to make the hose reel diameter larger or get rid of it all together. The hose reel is cumbersome and would have likely not used it had I kept this tool. In short, I returned this AR Blue Clean AR383 back to Amazon and UPS shipping was free. I am unsure if this is because I am a Amazon Prime subscriber or standard policy. I ended up purchasing a gas power washer at Home Depot. It is 2200 PSI and fitted with standard attachments. It works great for my purposes and made quick work of the deck and the driveway. Although I will likely only use a power washer a few times a year, I like to have the right tool for the job when I need it. To me that is worth another $100.

reviews.review_header: Great product with a temporary achilles heel...
reviews.review_text: Great product with a temporary achilles heel - ditch the plastic garden hose attachment, and get a brass set at your local hardware store - one male to male connector (has two female openings), and a quick connect set. Though the machine works great, light and easy to handle, the plastic quick connector failed on mine - specifically the one-way valve that prevents water from coming out of the garden hose once it's detached. Once it failed (on the first usage!), it wouldn't allow enough water to flow to the pump causing constant cavitation. You can roll up the pressure hose once you're done, but you have to disconnect it from the wand and the machine - there's a special clip that the end fits into, then just straighten the hose out and reel up. Could use a bit more room to wind up the electrical cord, but now I'm nitpicking. Does an excellent job once you figure out the quirks.

reviews.review_header: Powerful unit for the money, but .....
reviews.review_text: I read the reviews on this washer and bought it based on them. Most of the reviews are right on; good pressure, long power cord, somewhat stiff pressure hose (but not really a big problem), smooth operation. Many had trouble with the plastic quick hose disconnect that comes with the unit. However they said buying a brass quick hose disconnect at a local hardware store to replace it fixed the problem. There's a real problem here. The unit I purchased came with a 14 tpi male hose inlet. That is a British or European hose spec. American garden hose is a 11.5 tpi spec. "The thread standard for garden hoses in the United States and its territories is known as GHT or "garden hose thread", which has an outer diameter of 1 1⁄16 inches (26.99 mm) and a pitch of 11.5 TPI2.2 mm; parallel thread (non-tapered). Outside the United States, the more common BSP standard is used, which is 3/4" 1.041 in or 26.44 mm OD) and 14 TPI 1.8 mm. The GHT and BSP standards are not compatible." [...] I'm not sure whether some people are getting a slightly different unit with the GHT threads and I got one with the BSP threads, or what is going on. Anyways, trying to put an American GHT connector on the unit I had resulted in massive leaking; it just wouldn't screw on very far or seal properly. I'm looking to find a BSP to GHT adaptor, but so far no luck. I'm currently using the plastic fittings that came with the unit and have no problems with them, but I'm concerned about how long they will hold up, given the problems other reviewers have had with them. Have to wait and see I guess.

I purchased this washer a little over 2 years ago, but did not use it at all last year. I took it out to clean some things this year and after 15 minutes of use it started to strain, slow down on water output and smoke. I turned it off and didn't use it for an hour. during that time I checked the wand and hose for clogs. Both were clear. I started it again and after 10 min it started to smoke and then a pop and more smoke. The motor was toast. Trying to turn it on again would trip the breaker. Note that I have followed all directions for use and have certainly not abused the washer. It was used for a total of about 2 hours when it was first purchased. It was not stored outdoors. UPDATE: I contacted AR, and even though the warranty was expired by a year, they said they would send me a scratch and dent if I paid the shipping. They ended up sending me a brand new one! I'm surprised at the quality of customer service I received. Great job AR! UPDATE 7/19/2015 - I got out the replacement and found that the pump would not shut off after releasing the trigger. I checked everything for clogs but nothing I did worked. I noticed a small drop coming from the bottom, and it wasn't from the hose connection. Ut-oh! I made a mistake and didn't blow water out of it before putting it away for the winter. It froze and cracked the plastic unloader valve/ TSS Assembly. Luckily you can purchase a new assembly here: http://www.arblueclean.com/Products/tss-assembly-117.cfm although I only need the plastic fitting and not the sensor.

Pretty expensive for a single-use, apparently disposable item. When I went to use the power washer the second time, it does not get power. I went through all of the trouble shooting procedures with customer service, but to no avail. Alas, my one year warranty was up. Their solution? Sell me a "refurbished" unit at a reduced cost with a 30 day warranty. My solution? Call my credit card and take them up on their doubled extended warranty. I will be repurchasing some other brand with the money. This model has known issues, but if you got stuck with one, the answer is "too bad, so sad". AR should willingly recall their shoddy products. Needless to say, they lost me as a customer despite multiple opportunities to properly rectify the situation. Trying to sell me another one, especially one that was returned, is just lousy in so many ways.

I am a 62 year old woman who is not mechanically inclined and not strong. I purchased this pressure washer primarily to clean my composite deck/screened in porch and patio furniture and the lower portion of the siding on my house. It was relatively simple to put together even for me. it is lightweight enough that I was able to use it for several hours with no problems. In my opinion, only the turbo attachment is of any use. The detergent bottle has less pressure than my garden hose and the spray wand would be fine for washing a car. The turbo wand was not too powerful for the composite deck and did a good job cleaning it as well as the siding. It will hurt you though and I held it too close to the door frame for too long and a small chip of paint came off.However, you have to hold the wand close to the siding to get enough power so that means it is not useful for cleaning the second story. For my purposes it is perfect and easy to maneuver. I will rent a more powerful washer to have my son remove the paint from the front porch and wash the second story of the house. I ordered from Amazon and had it in 12 hours. I did break off the blue tab where the power hose connects to the machine when I was disconnecting and have to contact customer service . That was my fault. Also you cannot wrap up the electrical cord first and then try to put on the attachments because they won't fit. First put on the attachments and then wrap the cord. Pros Inexpensive Easy to assemble Long power cord No leaks, now comes with quick connect Compact for storage Cons The electrical cord, power hose and garden hose get tangled easily Not enough power to strip paint off a full size deck I wish I could lock it in place when the trigger is on. Will update after I contact customer service

reviews.review_header: No brainer for typical patio / yard cleaning
reviews.review_text: I had a gas-powered unit. Had to work on it almost every time I used it. It weighed a ton and took up a lot of space in the storage shed. The AR washer is tiny. At least compared to what I expected--it looked like it would be vacuum-cleaner size, but it's smaller. Almost cute. It cleaned 5 years of grunge off of my brick patio quickly and has enough control that I wasn't damaging the mortar. It's pretty quiet, and doesn't seem to have thermal issues--I used it continuously for over an hour in 90+ degree heat. I recently got a patio cleaner accessory that supposidly cleans better and stops spray bouncing up and getting windows dirty, but I haven't tried it yet. A lot of thought went into the storage capabilites--everything has a place (except the paperclip-size cleanout thing) and things stay where they're put. Negatives: Only one--the odd plastic water inlet adapter fitting other reviewers have mentioned. Hasn't broken yet, but I worry about it. Highly recommended for the average homeowner. Small, light, quiet, does a great job and comes at a reasonable price.

reviews.review_header: Good Unit for the Home at a Good Price
reviews.review_text: This product works well and as expected. I had some issues initially getting the pump to prime even with standard home water pressure. Seemed like the check valve assembly was getting stuck on the inlet strainer but after a few cycles with a screw driver it loosened right up. As a tip for other users, if you release the trigger you must wait for the pump to coast all the way down and depressurize, otherwise the pump cannot restart with pressure on the unit.

reviews.review_header: good working parts, ergonomics could use some rethinking
reviews.review_text: I've only used this for a couple of hours so far, but its cleaning ability seems fine: Not as powerful as a gas-engine washer, but easier to own and maintain. I don't think that I would want an electric washer with any less power (1900 PSI, per the mfgr.), even just for around the home and yard jobs, but for cleaning patios, cars, outdoor furniture, and stuff like that this is good enough. The cord provided is a generous length, and the hose is adequate. I didn't encounter any problems with the garden hose coupler that have been reported by some users, although the plastic design probably won't prove to be robust. I'd give this at 4 stars if the ergonomics were better. The reel provided at the top of the case is too clunky to use, and if one did use it for the hose the tight coils that it would cause in the stiff hose would make the hose hard to handle until the coils relaxed. As designed, the reel is not usable for the cord, either, and no good holder for the cord is provided. The plastic caddy provided for the wands and detergent bottle is not very effective, either, since the clips that have to be used for one of the wands don't hold it very well. A better case would make this a handier tool, and complement its good cleaning functionality.

I bought this pressure washer to clean my 16 x 42 deck off the back of my house. The deck is about 4 years old and has never been stained or treated so it was starting to look pretty weathered. I was amazed at the results! By the time I finished power washing it (even with 4 yrs of crud on it, I did not need to use any chemical cleaners) it looked like new wood. I allowed it to dry, coated it with some Thompsons and it looks like new. I have since power washed a side of my house that gets moldy each spring, my pool deck, and the grates from my grill. I found this pressure washer to be more than powerful enough to handle any job I've given it. It is pretty lightweight and easy to use. I read some reviews that had concerns about leaking connections and inadequate storage space for the electrical cord, I did not have either of these issues with my pressure washer. Storing the pressure hose on the little hose real is a little time consuming but doable. Personally, after the first couple uses, I found it easier to just loop the pressure hose around the top handle for storage.I will gladly recommend this unit to anyone looking for a pressure washer to help them with those tougher cleaning jobs around the home. Very reasonably priced and nicely made.

reviews.review_header: Great washer, Definitely a good buy
reviews.review_text: I absolutely love this power washer. I wish I had bought this sooner as it helps tons in so many projects. It has enough pressure to do just about anything needed, it will not strip paint from your house, but would if the paint was peeling. Easily adjust knob. Great for cleaning concrete driveways and sidewalks. Great for cleaning wood siding. Great for cleaning brick siding. Wash cars, boat, boat carpet, engine compartments, tin roofs, etc. The only feature I dont like is the hose reel. For winter storage it is fine, but for everyday use and storage you have to remove the hose assembly, wind it all up. If you didnt have to remove the hose from the washer it would be great, but you do. It pretty much worthless and could be removed or improved. Secondly, the nozzle storage clips on the back are not secure enough for general usage. As your moving around, washing, etc, the nozzles will fall off, not a big deal, but could be improved. The cheaper model I dont think had some of these features and I could have saved a few bucks without them.

reviews.review_header: When you need to replace the GFCI...
reviews.review_text: Purchased in Jan 2014. After relatively light use -- 5 cleanings of the walls of our fairly small house -- the GFCI failed. I replaced it with Leviton 16693 15-Amp, 120-Volt, Grounded, Compact Automatic Reset Right Angle GFCI, RoHS Compliant, Black and it's working fine. The original GFCI has two security screws that I had a bit to take out, but you could just take out the 4 regular screws and then crack open the gfci to remove the wires. The gaskets fit the Leviton perfectly, it's a five minute job, and my bet is that the Leviton is of better quality.

I have a dandy almost new gasoline power washer with a 2,500 PSI capacity, but I can't get the Honda engine on it started--old gasoline screwed it up I think. I bought this AR North America AR383 electric washer hoping it would be less hassle to use and its 1,900 PSI capacity would not be all that much less powerful than the gas one. Actually, my gas washer has Zero PSI at the moment. Anyhow, the electric power washer did not disappoint. It was easily powerful enough for the tasks I had for it today. Frankly, I thought it was very similar to the power my gas machine produced the last time I had it running. The extensive research I did on these electric power washers took me to the AR383 as I passed over the yellow one, the green one and the Costco `snappy' one. I even rejected electric washers that claimed to be slightly more powerful and a couple that were cheaper. The AR383 was priced right for what it offers and had the features I thought were the most important. I got the deck cleaned off. It was not all that dirty, but had a little algae and mold on it from the winter weather. The electric washer did a good job with that. I also got the metal garden shed cleaned of lots of algae and dirt and the machine performed well with that as well. The work on the shed went a little bit slower than it did with the gas washer last year, but quickly none the less. I tried out the detergent applicator to speed things up and was not all that impressed with it. It works OK, but a squirt bottle or a pump up garden sprayer full of deck wash would probably do as well. As it turned out, I really didn't need to apply the detergent anyhow. The power washer did the job nicely without any Chemical help. The thing I like best about the new electric power washer is how the motor and pump shut down when the trigger on the wand is released. It is also relatively quiet and does not leak. The electric wire is pretty long, but I had to use a short heavy duty extension cord to get the washer close enough to the garden shed way out in the backyard, but that was no problem really. The high pressure hose is a squirmy snake like all of these things are and it tangles once in awhile, but I suppose that is a nuisance to be endured with power washers. The overall quality built into this machine is quite good. Do I like my AR North America AR383 electric washer? You bet I do.

reviews.review_header: One of my best recent purchases!
reviews.review_text: When I knew it was time to purchase a pressure washer I had a few things in mind. 1. I preferred electric. I own multiple lawn machines (mowers, weed trimmers, etc.) that have a gas engine and I honestly did not want one more piece of equipment that needs gas and has to be serviced and winterized every year. I wanted something I can pull out for use when I am ready and little to zero maintenance. 2. Lower pressure was okay. I am a homeowner and I detail cars on the side. I do not need 3000 psi like your typical gas pressure washer. I just dont. I needed something to help make detailing easier as well as something that can clean my siding and my deck. This does that with ease. 3. I didn't want to break the bank. As I said in #1, I didn't want gas. Sure a homeowner oriented unit may only cost another $100-$200 dollars, but then I need to consider the fuel use and maintenance. I have not spent a dime past purchasing this unit since getting it 6 months ago. Unlike other users, my hose hookup connector does not leak. But even if it did, and considering the price of the unit, I can suck up a couple dollars for something like that. PROS: Lightweight Great Price Easy to use Small for storage CONS: It can get frustrating with the hose and electrical cord trying to get tangled working around a car, but it isn't a deal breaker by any means.

reviews.review_header: Very good performance for an electric power washer
reviews.review_text: I wasn't really expecting too much from this power washer, since my past experiences with electric models has either been with ones that were horribly underpowered, or ones the constantly tripped circuit breakers. This was a Deal of the Day, and the price was good enough for me to take a chance. I have to say, I'm pretty happy. The overall build quality is decent for this price range -- about what you'd expect from a Black & Decker tool, for whatever that's worth to you. Getting it put together took less than five minutes, including the time it took to grab a phillips screwdriver. Everything sealed perfectly, and I was washing my siding in no time. The included gun and wands are enough for most homeowners, but the detergent bottle was a bit of a let down. I would have really appreciated a way to use detergent with the wands, or something that holds more detergent. This bottle is pretty tiny (it might hold 8 ounces or so) and you have to get really close to what you're cleaning to use it. Luckily, the company makes some reasonably-priced accessories that I think will work better for using detergent. For the price, it's nice to have around the house washing your car, patio, siding, and stuff like that. I wouldn't use it to start a business with, but I'd expect to get several years out of it for home use.

I have always wanted to own a pressure washer and after many reviews I found the right one! I didn't want a gas operated washer because I didn't want to deal with purchasing gas and maintaining the engine (spark plugs, air and oil filters, gas conditioners to maintain the carburetor, oil changes etc...) + a gas operated pressure washer leaves exhaust smoke behind. You would inhale a big deal of it while working. I tried it a couple of times and i really didn't like it. They sure have more power, but this little one does the job well... It's a little machine but powerful. I purchased this in April of 2013 for $160 even with free shipping. The price of this same product was then reduced to $150 and then back up again and back down again. I hate it when amazon changes prices like a yoyo... I don't understand the purpose of it and they change prices every single day on different items that i have saved in my cart. I used this pressure washer a few hours every day. I used it to wash my cars + engines (4 cars). You have to adjust the nozzle to reduce the pressure impact on fragile components. It is powerful enough to do damage. So be careful when washing car engines. I used it to wash the driveway and the porch (cement). I washed my electrical lawn mower specially the underneath. I also used it to wash away ant mounts :-) No leaks, no problem. (for people who complain about leaks, try to use teflon around the connections.) When I'm done with washing, I disconnect all hoses and use my air hose to push away any remaining water from inside the pump. If I want to store it for the winter, I spray some WD-40 in the pump to keep it lubricated. There are special lubricants for these pumps to extend its life, but I think, my way of lubricating it is good enough. I spray it from the front and air hose it to push the lubricant all around the pump then out... The cons? Well, when I'm washing the underneath of the car, the wand is too long and can't be bent to reach right where you want it. I guess I will have to purchase a smaller wand for that purpose. By the way, I never used the turbo wand because it didn't adjust like the other wand and it wasn't as powerful as the other one. I really love this machine and I hope it serves for the many years to come.

reviews.review_header: Not bad for it's size & price, but it ultimately failed after 3 months.
reviews.review_text: I purchased this on 3/4/14, with the intent to use it to pressure clean my sidewalk and driveway. Given its 1,900 PSI rating, it did a decent job and cleaned 90-95% of the sidewalk and driveway without treatment. Here are my impressions of the unit: PROS: 1. It's electrically powered - so you don't have to deal with gasoline. 2. It's relatively quiet, compared to the gas-powered washers. CONS: 1. It is annoying to have to run BOTH a hose line and the electrical cord to connect this machine, so if you have to move it around to get sidewalks and driveway like I did, it can be a huge hassle. 2. (Continued from above) - the placement of the hose input is on the front of the unit, while the electrical plug is on the back of the unit, so it creates more hose/wire clutter around the unit since they're in different directions. 3. The electric motor burnt out after 3 months of ownership. I will not be replacing this unit with another one. Overall - I like the idea of an electric pressure washer, but the implementation and design of this unit could have been better.

reviews.review_header: Great pressure washer, don't forget to buy the "hovercraft" flat surface cleaner with it.
reviews.review_text: First of all, buy the flat surface attachment. It should be considered standard equipment and it will pay for itself in the first hour of use. Bought the female to female brass connector as had been recommended in several reviews but did not use it. Not only did the supplied attachment not leak, the clear attachment piece the brass one would replace contains a filter that protects the pump. So if you omit it, you will increase your risk of failure. Using the "hovercraft" flat surface cleaner (see my detailed review of this product) I cleaned my pool deck in under an hour. I am actually excited to clean the driveway with this attachment, which is just as weird a feeling as it sounds. This washer has plenty of power and for those worried about the water and electricity combination, the plug end has a GFCI. I never considered getting a gas engine powered washer. Pushing a button to get this much pressure is better than yanking on a starter cord even once. This thing is compact and lite and easy to use with my bad back.

reviews.review_header: A Great Unit For My Uses!
reviews.review_text: This is the second AR Blue Clean Pressure washer that I have owned and I love it! Features I especially like include the ability to wind the electric cord and hose on the unit so that it can be easily rolled from one place to another. Also, the connection to a water hose is easier. Storage is available on the unit for the gun and wands. One of the main reasons I decided to purchase another unit from AR Blue Clean was the outstanding support I received whenever I called for assistance on my first unit. Whoever I spoke with, always took their time to lead me through the necessary steps. When my first until finally died after several years, I decided I would stay with the same company but also move up to a more powerful unit. It works great for my uses -- cleaning the pavers around our pool, the pool cage screen and our driveway -- and I heartily recommend it.

I have owned a higher-end gasoline powered pressure washer in the past. Problem was, I didn't always use it frequently and started having engine problems from lack of use. (gas going bad, fouled plug, etc.) After a good amount of research online, I chose this model AR electric pressure washer. It out performs my old gasoline model, which relied heavily on manipulation of the water stream, although the p.s.i. rating was much higher. This AR model really puts out some water. I can tell no difference between the AR pressure washer and the car wash, other than the quarters. I have used this pressure washer extensively, and although lightweight, it has held up wonderfully. It is well built with a good design. It comes with two high pressure wands, and a low pressure soap/solution dispenser. The solution dispenser is made of plastic, and is designed so whatever solution is used, does not enter the machine itself. This means that one can dispense somewhat corrosive solutions, such as chlorine, with damaging the machine. I highly recommend this machine, and consider it one of my better purchases. Just an FYI, Amazon has the cheapest price on this machine as of April 2014.

reviews.review_header: Fine for small projects but doesn't last
reviews.review_text: I purchased this about 4 years ago. As others noted, there is a horrible leak at the hose connector on the unit from day 1, which is annoying. It works fine for small projects-- patio furniture and the like-- but trying to do even a small deck or porch with it takes an excruciatingly long time. It takes less time (and water) to just scrub those things by hand than to use this. Honestly, I gave up on using this for anything but the smallest jobs after the first summer and just went back to borrowing my neighbor's gas-powered pressure washer for the big jobs (yay for awesome neighbors!!). I'll also agree with other reviewers on the hose reel and storage rack-- they are pretty much useless. After four years of light use, mine was still running ok, with the exception of the gun/wand. I had to replace the gun when the unit was about 14 months old because it was leaking like a sieve from every screw hole. It then proceeded to explode in my hands while I was using it. Replacement parts are available, so I purchased a new one. Worked fine, until the gun started leaking again when I pulled it out this spring. Just not worth having to replace parts all the time. I'd personally rather spend the money on a good gas-powered washer, deal with the maintenance, and have it last more than a few years.

I purchased this product about a month ago and have used it 3 times, it is basically a good performing washer, has plenty power and cleaning action. The sad thing about it is the design of the machine, the on and off switch is hidden in back and very hard to push, why not have a simple toggle switch right in front easy to use, secondly, the power cord bracket is placed right where you attach the pressure hose so you cant put the power hose on unless you remove all the power cord, you should put two brackets on the side of the machine to wind up the power cord. Thirdly, that accessory brackets on the power cord bracket are stupid, you cannot snap the pressure attachment into that bracket to save your soul and they won't stay there. Someone did not use their head when they designed the machine and probably did not try it out. It is a shame to sell a product like this without thought behind the design.

reviews.review_header: Died after 1 use, but company helped get it running again
reviews.review_text: I bought this in March of 2013. Used it one time to clean the ceilings over my porch and it worked fine. Stored it as I was supposed to per the instruction guide. I took it out last week (November 30th....just 8 months after I bought it) and it does not work!. The unit does not power up. The fuse in the unit's plug is not popped, and the socket(s) are fine. Initially, it made a small pumping noise when first turned it on (like it was going to run), then nothing. Now, it makes no noises at all. The plug's EFI fuse is still in too. I read the trouble shooting guide.....nothing. Amazon will not accept it back for refund (I have tried and the website will not allow me to advance beyond the 1st screen saying it is too late). TOO LATE! So, $200+ for an item that worked one time then quit for no reason. Needless to say I was unhappy. Then (while filling in my rating of the product) I read another review and the Amazon customer recommended calling the company directly at 866-235-5112. I did, and the friendly (and surprisingly knowledgeable) person on the other end of the phone listened to my issues. They walked me through a number of potential issues that COULD be keeping the motor from coming on. I did the simple repairs/maintenance that she recommended and....what do you know....it all works fine now. I'll hope for the best and that it keep working, but top marks to the company for having a good product support division. They even offered to replace it for free it kept failing to work, I just needed my AMAZON receipt as proof of purchase! AND, the consumer help people are real Americans working IN THE USA, not....someplace else.

reviews.review_header: This is the pressure washer you've been looking for!!!
reviews.review_text: Great product. Quick setup (out of the box to cleaning the pool deck in minutes). Highly effective. Arrived exactly as described. Would buy again! The unit arrives partially assembled, but goes together fast and optionally tears down for storage or cleaning just as quickly. Four screws attach two plastic attachments in the back to handle accessories and rolling up the cabling. Pressure hose from unit to trigger-handle connects quickly, and the trigger mechanism has two different wands. The adjustable wand works great for me, haven't tried the "turbo wand" that is also included... The adjustable wand allows easily moving from powerful jet (capable of drilling a hole in limestone; be careful!) to a softer fan that is useful for cleaning decks, driveways, etc. The electric pump works as described, providing an endless stream of powerful water spray, or with a double-pull of the trigger will provide a gentle spray for a temporary clean-up of your hands. No leaks whatsoever on first and second uses... ran for many hours cleaning the pool deck, stone stairs, driveway, etc. When you let go of the trigger, the water stops. No leaks at the wand, trigger, pressure hose connections, or garden hose intake. Really impressive. Not sure why some other people complained about the clear-plastic adapter and leaks; no problems experienced here. Just be careful to ensure the parts that screw together are lined up properly to keep the threads aligned, as you should do with any equipment that screws together. The electric pump is not so loud that earplugs are needed, certainly less noise than a gas-powered unit. Note - given the adjustable wand that is included, I don't see any real need to buy different tips to create alternate sprays. The adjustable wand should meet most homeowner needs.

reviews.review_header: great all around power washer. Worked as good as gas.
reviews.review_text: The power washer arrived sooner than expected. It was shipped in a cardboard box, and no damage to the unit. Assembly took a few minutes. Pretty easy. The hose reel seems like it is more trouble then it is worth. I will try again on a summer day when the hose is warm, and a little more pliable. Over all the power washer is plenty strong. Handles all my basic things I was looking to accomplish. Deck, driveway, outdoor furniture. So far so good. I would recommend this to anyone looking for a good electric power washer - plenty of power. Can't really see a need for more. Too much and you can do some serious damage. Remember, you can't undo the damage once its done.

As a starter, the only reason I purchased this pressure washer was because my OLD little 1400 PSI Karcher which I used for over 12 years got flooded with seawater from storm Sandy. Never had a problem with the Karcher which was used by myself, neighbors and family. Thought I would upgrade and purchased the AR383 and had problems straight away. The electric cord rewind was very difficult to use, jammed and finally I just wind the cord around the top handles which I still do. I used the machine very sparingly in the first year, maybe 6-8 time for minor jobs. Then the machine died. it would start for a few seconds and then just kick off. I found the GFI breaker plug was kicking off which would tell me there was a short somewhere in the machine. I called customer service and a very knowledgeable man walked me thru some trouble shooting and we determined the only thing that may be wrong was the GFI. I bypassed the GFI and the machine worked fine. The machine was just 3 or 4 weeks past the one year warranty and not covered so a new plug from the manufacturer was about $20 so I took it off permanently. Next the pressure hose connection going into the trigger assembly started to leak profusely. The two O-rings somehow can off the male connection and I had a had time finding exact replacements which are still not perfect and the connection still leaks a little but I just get wet a little when using the washer. Overall the actual pressure washing ability of the machine is fine, just too many problems for a machine that is hardly used. I need to buy another washer for a house in another state and I will not buy an AR. I will go back to Karcher and buy their 1800 PSI model and would not recommend AR.

We rented power washers before, and found them to be very effective for a variety of projects. We finally decided to research and purchase one and chose the AR383 1900psi. We chose that pressure as the rentals we had were all 2000psi, and that was more than enough for our needs. At that pressure it will effectively clean your deck, siding, grill, patio, etc. The AR was well rated, though I noted with some trepidation some of the issues it seemed to have with leakage. However, after reading the high praise for the service at AR, I decided to go ahead with the purchase. The AR383 comes in pieces, and I would recommend you sit down for 1/2 hour and put it together a couple of times. The first time I did it was rather confusing, but after the second time I no longer needed directions. When it is disassembled and stored, it consists of the main unit, a hose (which is not connected), two wands (wide pressure wash and focused pressure wash), an attachment you can use to wash your car/house that has room for a soap additive (and cuts down on the pressure a little), a clear connector that goes on the front, the 'gun', the electric cord, and a coupler to connect to your hose. All of it is well made and does not feel cheap. It is made of a heavier plastic so has some heft to it. To use it you connect you use the couple and screw one end on your garden hose. The other end is a pull back connector that goes on the unit itself on the front. You unwind the pressure washer hose (it is thinner than a regular hose to build up more pressure) and connect one end to the unit in the screwing it on in the back. The other end is a quick connect that clicks in to the 'gun'. The wands are push and turn, i.e., you line up the tabs on the wand, push it onto the gun, then push down and twist to lock it in place. You are now ready to go, just turn on your hose, plug it in, and press the 'on' button. I had absolutely no leakage issues. Every part fit securely, there were no drips or spray from any of the couplings. You will need to use a standard garden hose. DO NOT USE those popular shrink and contract hoses, as I split one in five places because the hose cannot handle the pressure. The better the hose you have, the better it will work. I have used both wands. The high pressure one is great for cleaning small areas that have heavy stains. The wider wand has enough pressure to use on a deck and the width of the spray makes it cover a wider area than the other wand. Though the wide wand lacks the higher pressure of the focused wand, it still has more than enough pressure to plow through tough concrete stains, siding dirt, etc. The electric cord is long enough to use in a normal yard without adding an extension cord, and the 20 ft. high pressure hose is adequate for the job. I have used this washer more than once and gotten great results. It did a tremendous job on the deck ( do not use the focused wand, as it can actually gouge the wood!), a great job on the concrete patio, and cleaned up our swingset and siding with ease. I have not yet used it for car washing (I get lazy sometimes), but I'm ready! Overall this is a well made, strong pressure washer that is at a fantastic price. This is a great deal for the money.

reviews.review_header: Great machine in a small package!
reviews.review_text: For the price this thing is amazing. Over two weekends I managed to pressure wash two 1,000+ sq ft roof top decks a full townhouse driveway, walkway and entryway. It has great pressure and its "NON-STOP" I was very surprised how well it worked and kept going for the price. I really like how compact the unit is as well, everything neatly rolls up in the on board storage racks that it has. The hose attachment was a little leaky at first, but after the second time using it I was able to tighten it enough so it wasn't leaking at all.

This is a really nice little power washer. It is not adjustable pressure beyond changing the nozzle from wide to narrow beam. I had a little bit of trouble setting it up initially. The "blue button" popped off and it took me a while to figure out how to pop it back on. It is really a spring which holds the power nozzle into the wand. I used the power washer on the siding, front walk and bricks of the house. It did a great job, but I could see where you would want something stronger for harder jobs. Customer service was great.

reviews.review_header: Works fine,cord & hose wrap lack organization
reviews.review_text: It has a short power hose. Handle to grab and move around is too low/short, you have to bend down stoop over and is awkward to roll around . Tool holders are a joke, just disconnect the power wand before moving. Hose reel is a,way of design, you cannot use hose reel. And trying to wrap the power cord and wash hose all onto this little machine is a joke. Very poor design to store power cord and hose. Makes it awkward and troublesome to use. All they had to do was provide a simple cord wrap area for power cord and hose. It's just silly how simple little things can make using a product a hassle. The power washer itself works fine. For a low end model, the power washing is fine,easy and I like it. But organization of cords,hose,tools is just stupid.

I don't usually give reviews of full 5 stars, but this product rally deserves it. I bought it for the purpose of powerwashing several hundred feet of wood fence. I tested chemical cleaners with some success, but the work was slow and tiring. I looked at renting a powerwasher, but rates seemed high and I would put pressure on myself to finish the job as quickly as possible in order to keep rental fees down. I actually found this machine on a home improvement store site. I checked our local store, but they did not have it in stock. I then checked Amazon and found that they had the unit for $30 less than the store site. Being Amazon Prime members, we could order it with free two-day shipping. It was too good to pass up. Once I started using it I realized what a bargain it is. It worked flawlessly. It is an electric unit, so I had to run an extension cord around the yard, but this was a small annoyance. While the work was still tedious, it was far more efficient than any other method I could have used. I would highly recommend this product to anyone who needs an around-the-house powerwasher.

reviews.review_header: This unit is easy to carry (even for a 67 year old gal) ...
reviews.review_text: I bought this unit because I wasn't able to get our bigger pressure washer up the steps to our deck. This unit is easy to carry (even for a 67 year old gal) and it works great. It has plenty of power, so much so you have to be careful when cleaning wood, it can tear into it just like the big units. I also used it on our cement driveway and it did the job. I noticed when I was using different hoses that some worked fine with no leaks but one of them I couldn't get to connect correctly at all. This might be what is happening to others who complain about the connector not working. It might be their hose, or the area where they were working and they can't get the angle right. Also, those that said it didn't work after storing for a few months probably lost the pump during a freeze. Customer service for this company is also terrific. I called because a picture on our box showed an attachment that didn't come with the unit so they just sent me one for free. Can't beat that support. I highly recommend this pressure washer. I've used it approximately 15-20 hours, over several weeks, and it never fails to work well.

reviews.review_header: Works quite well for an electric power washer
reviews.review_text: Works quite well for an electric power washer. Plenty of pressure for all household uses I came up with. Of course you're limited with range but that is expected with an electric power washer, unless you get a medium or heavy duty extension cord (recommend not light duty due to current rating). I have used this item to clean concrete, cars and my wooden fence. I wasn't sure about an electric power washer, but I am very satisfied with the purchase. I haven't had any issues up to this point and expect this product to last a long time. I also used this to clean up my exterior walls before selling my house, it performed great again. I do like the adjustable nozzle, it helped when cleaning the sidewalk and brick around my house by adjusting from a tight to wide stream. Easy to adjust on the fly. Definitely recommend for limited use, if you're looking for something to use near daily this might not be the best option as power and mobility is limited versus gas. The soap option is pretty useless because it does not operate at high pressure, unless I'm doing something wrong.

If you have prior experience with electric pressure washers of the red or yellow variety your first impression of the AR Blue is likely going to be that you got the mini-version. It is about half the size and weight of comparable models from other manufacturers. While this is no necessarily a problem it appears that this reduction was achieved by making all the visible components (case, wand, tool holder, gun, hoses etc.) down sized and constructed of lightweight materials. Probably the two most questionable design elements are the hose reel which others have noted as being not worth the trouble to use and the hose inlet. The inlet is composed of an inline water filter (clear plastic) and a plastic hose connector with a brass insert. While I did not the leakage problem noted by other reviewers these components are so exposed and fabricated of such non-robust materials that near term failure would be almost assured in any hard use situation. As far as performance goes this unit seems very comparable to other electric pressure washers in terms of power and utility. If it surprises me and holds up for a year I will update my review accordingly. Bottomline a light duty unit recommended for people who are very gentle in the use of their tools.

reviews.review_header: OK, but not the greatest experience
reviews.review_text: I purchased this product with a lot of optimism that this would be the perfect pressure washer, however, after I received the item I noticed a couple of things: 1. The quick-connect adapter that I received had a manufacturing defect causing it not to screw on correctly with the hoseline 2. The hose reel on the pressure washer isn't setup correctly in way that would make the reel very usable during actual use 3. The bottle for detergent is pretty small & none of the adapters are really made for proper car washing Altogether, the deal killer was the quick-connect adapter. Because of this, I couldn't even test the unit when I received it since it was spraying water all over the place. According to other reviews, the customer service is supposed to be pretty good here, but when I contacted them about it they treated me as if I didn't know where to connect the quick-connect adapter. After responding to try and clarify the situation with the expectation of an expedient mailing of a new adapter, no representatives have responded for three days. In the end, I gave up on receiving the response and have gone to the nearest Lowe's for their adapter which fit the hose perfectly. The hose reel should be connecting from the middle of the reel or else it can't actually be used during operation. This is a problem by design. The operation manual doesn't specify how to put on the hose to the reel because it's really just a gimmick. You could try and use the reel for storage, but the way it's made it's way easier to just put the pressure hose line in a bag. I tried washing my car with the pressure washer the other day. After using my friend's washer, I figured this would be a pretty good experience. However, the detergent bottle that comes with the unit is extremely small and none of the spray adapters are really made for the car. It's actually recommended NOT to use the turbo sprayer for the car, but the adjustable spray would be way too strong as well. Overall, this unit could be 4-5 stars, but with the experience with customer service and the gimmick of a hose reel, I can't really recommend this unit over something much cheaper.

Works great for washing our atv's after riding, cleans the windows on the house well - basically anything that needs high pressure water of course. I have owned 3000psi gas powered pressure washers in the past, and this thing cannot come close to that kind of power...but, do you really need that for cleaning some mud off a car or atv??? Also, who wants to mess with stabil and gummed up carburetors? I got tired of the gas units sitting for too long and never starting. This electric unit works great for its intended purpose and it does it at a very reasonable price. Didn't get 5 stars simply because it isn't PERFECT, but it's close. It's lightweight (wife can move it around with ease), runs pretty quite for a pressure washer, has plenty of power cord length, and has an adequate hose length. My one gripe however is targeted at the hose...it's got a somewhat cheap feel and it's pretty stiff - has a plastic feel to it as opposed to rubber - but it seems good enough for the job. Also, like I said it's only just adequate in length...would have been nice if it was about 6-8 feet longer, but it's OK as is. I can't walk all the way around the car with out running out of hose. No big deal though, just switch sides. Time will tell if this hose holds up well... I also really like the "turbo" nozzle that comes with this washer. It adds just a slight bit of "wobble" to the water stream which helps break up the mud and dirt. I like the idea that pulsating water, rather than BRUTE psi force, is what cleans off the dirt. Seems a little "nicer" to my machines. Overall, I am VERY happy with this purchase and would HIGHLY recommend this product for light-duty cleaning jobs. One last thing, others had mentioned in reviews that the hose adapter leaked water. I am happy to report that the new design is working just fine. Seals tightly against a rubber o-ring and the quick adapter side has o-rings inside as well, which results in no leaks!

reviews.review_header: Does what it is supposed to do
reviews.review_text: I had some reservations about buying this unit since there were some reviews that mentioned water leaks, etc. I did not need to be worried. The unit functions perfectly. There are no water leaks. I can help thinking that the people who experienced leaks had cross threaded their hose adapter or some such thing. Connecting the pressure hose from the unit to the sprayer head does require that one pay attention. The connection at the unit requires many more turns of the connector than one might ordinarily expect. The users manual leaves a little to be desired. It is a better than average translation but some of the things is says one should do are very obviously out of order. An example would be placing the wands in the holder _before_ wrapping the power cord around the projections that hold it in place. One would really want to put the power cord on first then put the wands in place. All in all, I am very pleased. I expect to get many years of service from this unit.

1st pressure washer purchase - overall great product for the money. I approached this from the standpoint of using this for small projects and not expecting it to last past 5 years. So far, I've probably run the machine over 8 hrs spread out over 5 different jobs. The pressure is great for cleaning my driveway; Does well on stripping wood, and makes washing the car a lot more fun (low pressure setting only). The nice features that stand out are: -it only runs when you pull the trigger / no wasted water or electricity -lightweight unit, easy to pick up and move -comes with a turbo wand which is good for cleaning small to medium size areas Cons: -casing of unit is the cheaper type of plastic, I don't expect it to last past 3-5 years -hose coil is useless: it doesn't work well and the wand hose is too stiff to wrap -unit tends to tip over easily if your at the end of the hose length

reviews.review_header: This item will leave you feeling BLUE and seeing RED...
reviews.review_text: I thought that after doing my research, this was a good product. I received it yesterday, assembled it this morning and was off to giving the sidewalk and driveway a good cleaning. The unit assembled easily, it was a little frail in its components for attachments but, I was OK with that. Upon powering it up, I was delighted with the power of and quietness of the washer. However, that's where my love affair ended. The washer was leaking water at a significant rate from the quick connect device included with the unit. I tightened first again by hand, then with the leverage of some vice grips. (Slight pressure, it's plastic). That made no difference. I attached the additional one that Amazon recommended and that made no difference as well. I am returning the unit immediately with great disappointment with the maker of the unit. (I did try to call them and got no answer. To be fair, it was on Saturday). There are many washers out there... Do yourself a favor and buy something other than the AR383.

reviews.review_header: worked for awhile -- but no longer functional
reviews.review_text: I purchased this a few years ago. initially it was ok. it worked well enough for light duty around the house. However, the hose and cord were always a mess and if conditions were too damp the unit was stop working disabling the gfci circuit until it dried out. the final straw is that the hose no longer connects to the spray gun properly -- water spews everywhere. i called the company -- they sent a pack of rubber rings -- which didn't help. since i can't sell this unit -- it is going to good will.

So far I love this! I have pressure washed the vinyl siding on my 1200 sq. ft house; Cleaned my deck and washed my car with no issues whatsoever. Just use common sense when moving the unit -- don't put any undo pressure on the water hose connection. I also purchased the 25' hose extension which lets me cover much more area without moving the washer. Make sure you prime the pump by running water through it before you turn it on. For a little over $100, I have already saved what it would have cost me to rent a washer for 3 days and don't have to hurry to get it back to the store or buy gas, etc. The washer has a 1 year "bumper to bumper" warranty so I feel like I will be ok for at least that time.

reviews.review_header: BEST deal for a 1900PSI power washer
reviews.review_text: Was very pleased at first use, how well this electric pressure washer cleaned off 7+ years of gunk from my deck. Have only had it for a week or so, but am certainly hoping to get good use of this for years to come. The improved connection at the hose coupling while it did leak some after more than an hour, I can't say for sure that it wasn't my 10+ yr old garden hose that was doing the leaking. (at any rate, it was only a cup or so over several hours) Couldn't find a place in here to post a photo of this morning's effort, but will certainly try to post my dirty deck vs cleaner deck photo.

reviews.review_header: Better than expected - sudser is junky
reviews.review_text: I have had an electric power washer for about 9 years and used it primarily for cleaning the house siding, deck cleaning (fiberon synthetic), dock cleaning (pressure treated wood), and the dreaded patio furniture. It was a brand no longer available so when it died I researched several and was about to buy at the local Channel or Lowes when I saw this one on Amazon with good ratings and a great price relative to others of similar design. It has a similar engine design to the one I had that lasted so long so gave it a shot. It works great. Be prepared to replace the hose fitting on the body with brass because it looks like a good tip over and it'll break. I buy and use quick connects for ease. There's a fair amount of stress at the hose connection because of the weight of a hose and pulling the unit along. I have had no problems but why wait? Go get brass quick connect fitting(s) at your local H/Ware store. Bring the one attached to the unit with you, and get it before it breaks and you're stuck leaving your job to go find them when you're shoes are all wet. The suds unit attachment is basically worthless and they should just forget it and reduce the price. I had hoped it would be great for the car but there are other simpler "hose only" attachments you can buy that work fantastically well and outperform this thing by a wide margin. (See Chemical Guys online). That's the main reason for 4 stars. I did not expect gas powered performance and am very happy with this unit size, weight and performance.
