The wands work very well and the fan sprayer is great for reducing pressure when you need less. It's also ALOT lighter than my last one of similar size making it easier to move around and lug back and forth in the car if needed.

reviews.review_header: The best pressure washer I have ever used
reviews.review_text: The best pressure washer I have ever used. All the problems mentioned in past reviews have been solved. Assembly was simple and straightforward. The plastic hose connection works easily with no leaks. I have had it now for a month and have used it on wood vertical surfaces around the porches and the porch and deck floors with the deck and patio flat surface tool they offer. I would not buy it without this tool which is exceptional on flat surfaces and cuts the cleaning time roughly in half. It has more than adequate pressure for most jobs. I have not cleaned brick or concrete surfaces or had to use the high pressure nozzle, but I think it would be more than adequate. The unit is light and easy to pick up and move which is important to me because I have an upstairs deck and two balconies to maintain. My wife loves to use it also. We rent a house in SC in February and March with no garage and the pollen gets in every crevice of both cars. The AR Blue Clean removed every speck of it. I recommend it very strongly!

I was in the market for a pressure washer to wash my cars and motorcycle. I had been looking at gas powered ones when I decided to give the electrics a shot first. I have a very small garage so the extra bulk of a decent gas unit would've been a problem. The price also came into question. I was looking at $700-800 for the gas units I was considering. Then I started reading around and stumbled across some glowing customer reviews about this pressure washer. I decided to give it a shot. The worst that could happen is that I'd hate it and send it back. This thing is tiny compared to a gas power washer and its light. I had my doubts after unboxing it. I assembled it and ran outside to wash something. Wow! This thing sprays just as hard as the wands at the coin-op car wash! I think the best feature of his power washer is the on demand flow control. The unit only produces pressure when you squeeze the trigger on the wand. Perfect for washing cars. That way the unit won't burn itself up. Overall I'm very pleased with my AR Blue Clean. I only have two minor gripes with it though. The inlet and outlet locations are not very user friendly and too close to the ground. The output is in the back of the unit and the input is on the front. I'm thinking a tiny bit more engineering invested could put the hook ups higher and on the front or top of this unit or at the very least put the input on the back and output on the front. The supplied quick connect for the water supply is plastic and hit hangs off the front of the unit pretty far. If it ever gets hit or kicked its toast. The AR Blue Clean website does sell a much more durable brass connector($10) that's also compatible with the brass quick connects you can buy at the hardware store. Why didn't they just sell it with that to begin with? I do love this power washer for washing cars. It gets the job done nicely. Even though hooking it up is kind of quirky its still a crapload easier to whip out when you need it than having to hoss out a big heavy gas power washer, fuel it up, hook it up and then hoss it back inside. As a matter of fact it works so well my next door neighbor ordered on the very next week.

Very powerful. I like it a lot. Went from a super expensive industrial power washer to this and it is almost as powerful! The reel on this thing is really useless unless your using it to store away. You need to disengage hose from body to use the reel. Only "slight" annoyance is you have to wait a second or two before you can continue spraying once you have stopped. Otherwise it stutters. Also wand trigger takes a bit more pressure to engage than I'm used to but I'm sure it will be fine. This is a very nice unit for the price. I hope it lasts. I use it to clean screens for screen printing.

reviews.review_header: Power washer worked great initially. It stopped working after a few uses
reviews.review_text: Power washer worked great initially. It stopped working after a few uses. I called customer service. They were very easy to get a hold of. They spent about 10 minutes on the phone trouble shooting with me. When it would not work, James( the customer service rep), asked me to email the receipt for proof of purchase and they would send me a new one. I received the replace mt in about a week. Although I'm disappointed that the first one failed, the customer service was excellent. Hopefully the new on holds up.

A workhorse of a machine. I have completely stripped pressure washed car wheels, fender wells, houses, deck, drive ways, walk ways, tool shed, tool shed roof and a complete backyard privacy fence thus far. Why hire out a job for hundreds when one big job will more than pay for this unit. I have had this for some time now and wanted to see how well it stood up before I posted a review. I am very pleased with this machine.

reviews.review_header: It was a good choice for us as it is powerful enough for ...
reviews.review_text: 1st season with it and it has been a workhorse. It was a good choice for us as it is powerful enough for the household and deck cleanings, but not so powerful as to accidentally damage the surfaces. Adjustable wand is very handy. No issues with the quick connect yet. Seems like a good home owner sized machine. We bought the flat surface cleaner attachment and it works great on out concrete pool deck. built in cord reel is pretty useless, we just wind up the hoses and drape them over the handle.

reviews.review_header: This did a great job cleaning our concrete driveway and patio
reviews.review_text: This did a great job cleaning our concrete driveway and patio. Easy to use. Takes little storage space. Very quiet and light weight compared to the gas one I rented before. You may need an electric cord and long enough garden hose. Be careful to run the water thru before turning the power on. I had to order a $24 pressure hose, because the one on this machine blew a hole, but other than that, this delivers great function and simplicity for the price...well designed. (later) AR North America read my review and notified me that their product was warranted for a year, and they sent me a new pressure hose. They are a very proactive customer oriented company, so I up-starred them to the max!

reviews.review_header: Just Okay - Doesn't Clean that well
reviews.review_text: I previously owned a 8 year old Karcher 1800 psi and sadly it finally stopped working. I planned on getting another karcher because we were very pleased with its performance over the years. We primarily use the power washer to clean our lanai in florida. It's a concrete lanai with a rough surface and dirt gets caught in the crevices. We also get a lot of mildew, mold, etc from all the humidity. The AR383 Blue Clean just didn't clean the lanai as well as the Karcher had. Yes it worked better than a hose but not as well as the Karcher especially on stubborn stains. We have flower pots on lanai and after it rains dirt water drips out and stains around the pot. Well the AR383 Blue didn't hardly remove any of the stain. It also didn't totally remove the mildew/mold area either. I stood on top of the area for several minutes and nothing. I was so disappointed because this is the main reason I use the power washer. I suppose I will have to get a bucket and mop to get the stain that my Karcher use to get up with no problems. Anyway, I suppose the AR383 would be good for car washing but not any real stubborn stains. There are a few good points I can point out: 1) it is a lightweight machine, 2) quieter than Karcher, 3) smaller footprint 4) less expensive than Karcher. I don't feel like going through the hassle of sending it back so we will keep it until it stops working and replace it with a Karcher.

It took a little bit to set up and the instructions are not clear but once it got going it worked fairly well. Despite the fact that it is under-powered as compared to its gas powered brethren it performed well. It was powerful enough to strip paint even when I didn't want it to. It was able to clean a darkened concrete driveway and managed to strip more from a deck then I wanted before I learned how to use it and control it. When I broke the detergent bottle I called the company and they were nice enough to send me a replacement free. Of course it is not as powerful as a gas model but that's not all bad. If it has one weakness is that it lacks the power or perhaps just the tools to reach the second floor with any force. Worked well using the sprayer in washing car. Overall I'm very satisfied with it and would recommend it.

reviews.review_header: I cant tell you how frustrating it is to get ready to do a cleaning project only to find out the gun won't work because of a stu
reviews.review_text: DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT. Wow. What a pain in the ass. I've only used the spray gun maybe 5 times and already I've had to replace the O-Ring for the "Hose to Pressure Washer Gun" twice. For some reason this little O-Ring either breaks off or is lost extremely frequently. I purchased the AR Blue Clean O-Ring Kit and it only comes with ONE replacement for this particular O-Ring. What a joke. I cant tell you how frustrating it is to get ready to do a cleaning project only to find out the gun won't work because of a stupid little O-Ring. Get a different pressure washer folks!

It is not 19000 psis I have access to a 1300 psi and there is no difference in cleaning power.I hooked it up and had no leaks as others have stated.and had no problem rolling hose on to reel ( temperature was 38 degrees ) and everything stored on unit as it should.I am not happy with the pressure that is why I bought it..When it comes to electric power this is as high (1900psi.) as I have seen with out going to gas powered.I could have got a 1300-1500psi for under $100.00.It did come missing wheels and one wand or lance as they call it and I notified the company and they sent them very quickly and were very helpful reminding be it had a full 1 year warranty and to notify them if any problems .I will be notifying them about the pressure.I also do not like the fact that to use soap you must install the tank and another lance to the hand and only uses low pressure then to get high pressure you remove tank and lance and reinstall the high pressure lance, it is easier to just have a hand held spray bottle and spray it that way..The 1300psi unit I have used in the past had the soap tank mounted to the main unit with a lever on the handle to pull to get soap with out all the hassle of switching everything around like this one.

reviews.review_header: Updated review. Purchased 2 yrs ago, hard to keep it running
reviews.review_text: As others have indicated, it's light weight and lots of pressure. My initial experience was troubled, and the Customer Service was great, in fact I called on a Saturday morning and the actual owner of the company answered the phone ... amazing. Well he took my issues and it was resolved. That was 2012. 2013 the machine was not used much, if at all. 2014: deck and house washing the unit works well, but like before, getting it started is a 20 minute process, each time I disconnect the machine to move it to a different level on the decks. The cheap hose to machine plastic connection will not stay attached. I get it connected, then pressurize the system, and the connect backs out leaving no water to the machine. It's very time consuming, and now it''s become irritating. NEVER, EVER, NEVER use plastic for high pressure connections ........ If they fix this I'd be grateful. Until then 2 stars ... if they fix this issue I'd give it 5 stars, but you can't wash without the pressure.

I assembled the product with no difficulty. I had a minor problem trying to put the hose onto the coupling, and called customer service. A pleasant and knowledgeable woman answered the phone - live and in-person - who quickly offered me the solution. Yeah, I had the coupling on backwards. I had absolutely no issues with leaks. I started using the power washer as soon as I had it ready to go. It was actually fun and easy to use, and I finally took care of a bench peeling paint that had been on my to-do list for so long. I did a test patch on the siding, and also on my wood fence. The fence and bench projects have become so much easier now! I'm an average sized woman with power tools. I just love this power washer.

reviews.review_header: Not Very people friendly for a 70 year old lady
reviews.review_text: I want to like this product so bad, but..it is so hard to handle and cannot keep it running. First....the plug in cord cannot be used on a regular exterior outlet...you have to buy a expensive extension cord or a pig tail, which I did and it wont stay plugged in tight!...second...every time I set it up and turn it on and then turn the gun on for the water spray ...it shuts off....so upsetting....have had many questions answered through the internet for help but it just is not very people friendly. I was hoping to save some money on power washing the house and the drive but guess I will have to go back to paying for it cause it is better then me getting upset and trying for hours to get this thing to work.

reviews.review_header: Very nice, left my driveway and outdoor furniture looking great, some small annoyances
reviews.review_text: For the price, this is a very good pressure washer. It's electric, so it's more convenient and quieter than a gas-powered model, but it also isn't as powerful, but for my purposes it has plenty of power. Our poured concrete back patio hadn't been washed/cleaned in the previous 5 years, and we have plenty of things contributing to it looking dirty - trees dropping sap and seeds, frequent gardening activities that track dirt and mud, three dogs that contribute their flotsam and jetsam, etc. I fired up this washer and after a few hours of work it was sparkling white and clean. I also used it on my Polywood outdoor furniture which, while it's relatively impervious to any permanent discoloration, had built up some surface dirt and grime and were looking dull. After a quick blast they looked like new. So, the good news is that this unit gets the jobs done that I need doing, and it does them conveniently and relatively quietly. The less good news is that it could use a few tweaks to make it better, in my estimation. First and foremost, the reel for the hose is a bit awkward. First of all, be sure you understand that you have to unwind the entire hose before use, so it's not like you can quickly pull out a couple feet of hose for a small job, you have to unwind the whole thing. Secondly, the diameter of the reel is such that the hose is wound pretty tightly given its relative stiffness, and when you unwind it the hose initially has a lot of leftover coiling that makes it inconvenient to move around the with the hose. The kinks eventually calm down, but having a kinky-curly hose is frustrating at first. Third, you also have to completely unwind the power cord before using the unit, because the designated storage winding area in the back places the cord such that it blocks access to the where the hose attaches to the body. Again, if you are doing a big job this isn't a huge deal, but it limits the ability to use the unit for quick jobs. Fourth, the unit has mounting points to hold all the provided attachments, which is good, however they do not hold them securely, such that any time the unit is moved or jostled there is a good chance of dislodging one or more attachments. However, the bottom line is that for the price this unit gets the job done. I would definitely recommend it, and have already purchased a second one as a gift. The cons listed above are more like small annoyances and I list them here just so any future buyers are aware of them.

reviews.review_header: Purchased in April, 2014 and used the PW approximately ...
reviews.review_text: Purchased in April,2014 and used the PW approximately 5 times on residential projects for a total of 10 to 15 hours max. The PW performed well up until the last project when the motor/pump would not go on. I contacted Blue Clean and went thru the troubleshooting to confirm the unit would not operate. Blue Clean was aware the unit was purchased from Amazon 15 months ago and 4 months past the warranty period. I was immediately informed to forward the invoice w/a short email and they would send a new unit. Unfortunately they were contacted two times via email past the initial phone conversation and did not respond to either request for the unit or a status of the return. Blue Clean's rep basically mis-spoke. I then contacted Amazon to explain the situation and they immediately sent it to investigation and agreed to accept the returned unit even though they were not obligated.

reviews.review_header: Good product, Great company, Excellant Customer Service
reviews.review_text: When received I opened it and began to assemble it. Directions not the best. Have used it 3 times and I'm impressed with it's power(Remember, it is electric). It is unusually quiet. No leaks at the usual places but time will tell. I've used it on my car, brick wall with mold and mildew and parts of my deck, full of mildew and it did a great job... no excellent job of cleaning it. Very impressed. So impressed I took of my clothes and sprayed myself and it took of 2 layers of skin and now I look 20 years younger but it's hard to sit down(just kidding had to put this disclaimer in case somebody really stupid would try it out that reads this!) My only criticism deals with the reel that rolls the hose up, the attachment holder and the placement of the attachment for the inlet hose but to do anything about it would call for a redesign which ain't going to happen. These are no deal breakers If you notice most electric power washers are based on this design so you will run into some of these annoyances on them, too. The thing I liked about this power washer is the company AR and it's customer service. I had a small problem with one of the wands and "boom" they took care of it immediately. There are two things to consider when buying a product, "does it work" and does the "company stand behind it and takes care of you" and this company does. They put out a great product and customer service is excellent. Kudos AR. You had me at "Way I help you" If you have any doubts about buying an AR electric pressure washer, "Don't!"

This little thing is powerful! We were skeptical to get it since we used to have a gas powered pressure washer, but this one works great. It's not as powerful as the gas powered ones, obviously, but it definitely gets the job done. We used it on our vehicles, our deck, several chairs and various things. Definitely worth the money!

reviews.review_header: Reliable washer for around the house
reviews.review_text: This is a great little power washer. Opted to go with this over a gas powered one. Although it's not nearly as powerful as a gas powered one, it starts up every time and I haven't had to spend any time fiddling with a motor. I was mostly looking for something that could do some light cleaning of the house, wash the cars, and wash the driveway and garage floor. This fits the bill for all of them. I've also used this to wash reclaimed lumber... stripping off the old gray and making the wood look newer but still aged. If you are looking for something to strip paint I would look for something in the 3000 PSI and higher range. This thing can do it but it would take you forever and you have to have the nozzle adjusted to a fine point to get it to spray hard enough.

I am an avid power-washer. I can't stand the winter grime that builds up outside, even here in NC. I power wash my deck every spring. Our old power washer died last year and I was unsure what to replace it with. Went to my favorite go-to source (Amazon) to read reviews, and as a result chose this power washer. After receiving it I had it assembled and was power washing in about 30 minutes. It's MUCH easier to use than my old model, which had to be primed and was very complicated as there was an exact order in which it had to be started in terms of when power could be turned on, when water source could be turned on, etc. I used to have to carry a cheat sheet just to remember how to correctly start it. Not so with this model. Turn on water, turn on power and away you go. The absolute best part is the quick connect for the hose. Just snap into place and you're in business. It does a great job, has the power I need, and is super easy to use. I highly recommend.

I'll try to keep this brief and cover usage and issues of concern. 1) EASY to assemble and use. 2) NO LEAKS (not even a drop from the hose connection). Okay, a tiny 3" puddle formed when I turned on the water, but none of this came from the hose connection, and no more came out during usage. 3) TOOL STORAGE fairly adequate but not perfect. Don't know what to do with the big GFCI plug, so I wrap it around the detergent bottle top. Hose reel too small diameter for the stiff hose, but works perfectly for a 40' heavy-duty extension cord. The hose hangs okay on the hose reel handle which locks into place in the upright position. 4) MY ONLY EXPERIENCE is with a commercial rental unit from several years ago, and my initial reaction to the 1900 PSI water flow was "Oh, no!" However my fears were relieved when I successfully pressure-washed my mother's entire aluminum siding (on a brick home), carport (some painted wood), porches, sidewalk, windows, and screens in one afternoon using no detergents. The house looked almost new. The turbo attachment worked best for me. Several stains on the concrete carport were resistant, but this home is 38 years old, and these stains have been sitting for a while (plus I was working fast and had no patience). Some strong detergents would probably help. Have used only once, but ran for 6 hours straight with no issues. 5) GREAT PURCHASE, and what a great tool (a small pressure washer) for around the home. Can't wait to start using it around mine. Will pay for itself in 1 or 2 uses, compared with paying somebody to do the work.

I bought this power washer after seeing my neighbor use his to power wash his stucco and sidewalk. The washer arrived quickly and in good condition. The assembly was straight forward if you read the instructions. Everything about this power washer looks to be high quality and well built. The main reason for buying a power washer was so cleaning my deck would be a little more effective than just scrubbing and using a garden hose. I will tackle that project soon, but just to test out the AR Blue pressure washer, I washed my cement sidewalk. I first mixed up some Dollar Store OxyClean and used a bucket and scrub brush to apply. I don't want to use the pressure washer to apply soap. After letting the cleaner do its thing for 10 minutes, I'm ready to use the pressure washer. WARNING: Before applying power to the washer, connect your garden hose, turn on the water all the way, then pull the trigger on the gun. You want to make sure all of the air is out of the system before turning it on. Once you see a nice flow of water coming out of the tip of the gun, THEN apply power to the unit and turn it on. This is something you have to do for all washers, gas and electric to prevent the motor and pump from getting destroyed. I used the adjustable wand and set it for the wide fan. When I pulled the trigger, this puppy roared to life. I keep the tip of the wand at least 6" from the surface of the cement and watched with delight as years of dirt were removed from my white sidewalk. The reason I keep the wand 6" away was because the water pressure at the tip is so great it will remove the top layer of cement. My neighbor let his son do his sidewalk and now instead of seeing a nice finishing layer of cement on top, you can see all of the large pebbles that were in the rough coat. I can't wait to do my deck now. I will use care when using the AR pressure washer on my wooden deck because of the amount of power at the tip. So far, I am loving the results that this pressure washer delivers. Update 8/18/2012 I decided to power wash my back patio a day after having great success washing my sidewalk. I had the surface all scrubbed with the OxyClean and I was ready to power wash the soap off. After turning on the water first, I pulled the trigger and the motor ran, but very little water came out. I tried turning the machine on and off several times. Turning off the water supply, thinking the water pressure was too much for the pump to over come. After 10 minutes of trying to get it to work like it did yesterday, I thought I would have to box it up and send it back to the factory. I then decided to take the garden hose off, then the clear filter adapter that screws into the machine. Inside the filter was grass, lots of grass. I took the clear filter apart and washed it in the sink. I also found lots of grass in the black adapter that screws on to the garden hose. After cleaning them out and putting everything back together, the machine was back to its magnificent self again. Word to the wise. Let your hose run for a minute before connecting to the power washer. I will also clean the filter after every use just in case. The patio looks like new!

The AR Blue Clean AR383 is an amazing little pressure washer. The AR383 takes about 5 minutes to assemble and you will only need a philips #2 screw driver. The quick change sprayer is very easy to use and requires no tools. When you use this for the first time do not be alarmed if you pull the trigger and nothing happens. This will happen if you don't turn it on (yes I forgot to turn it on). Ensure the water source to the unit is turned on as the washer pump will run until primed. The AR383 is very quiet. While wearing earphones I could not hear it running. So far I have washed two trucks, one motorcycle, a propane grill and a 40' RV. The pressure washer did not tip over once. This is a stable unit. It would be nice if the handle was adjustable as it is a little low for a person of 70" in height. The low handle make the wheels pointless as I find it easier to just carry the washer. The hose storage reel is just that. You cannot use the washer unless the hose is completely unrolled from the reel because the end that attaches to the sprayer goes on the reel first. This is not really a big deal as the hose is only 20' long. The soap dispenser is a bottle that replaces the sprayer head. Pretty good design. It is a low pressure attachment. Don't waste your money on the manufacturer recommended "special" soap. Any liquid car wash soap is going to work. This unit has a maximum limit of 1,900 PSI. The normal operating PSI is 1,450. That being said I am sure that other manufactures use the upper end of their products limits as well. I have no complaints about the cleaning ability of this unit. At $170 this is a great item that is easy to use and small enough that it does not take up much room. I did purchase the brass male to male coupler. With this attached you can drag the water supply hose behind you with the unit and not worry about anything breaking. I would recommend that you use a light weight hose with the unit so that it is easier to move around with. If you are going to be using an extension cord with this unit ensure that it is one intended for heavy duty use. If you use one that is to small the GFCI built into the plug of the washer will continue to trip. Would I recommend this product? I think I just did.

reviews.review_header: super happy with mine...like better than the gas-powered ones
reviews.review_text: my homeowners association sent me a letter telling me to remove the mold growing on the north face of our house. my brother-in-law has a fancy gas-powered pressure washer that i've borrowed on occasion before...powerful but noisy, sucks gas, and is tiring to use. this AR blue unit had such awesome reviews and is so reasonably-priced that i figured i'd just buy my own pressure washer. first of all, i almost ran down to home depot to buy a brass coupler based on some of the reports here of leakage but i thought i'd try it out first. i'm glad i did. i used the unit extensively over the weekend (6 hours each saturday and sunday) and experienced no leakage with the supplied couplers. set up was easy and seems very nearly as powerful as my brother-in-law's $400 pressure washer. the adjustable spray head is very, very convenient and much better than swapping tips. the cord is super long and the hose is just about right. this unit works as advertised. it's light, compact and easy to use. i only have one minor complaint: there is no trigger lock button to hold the trigger down. it takes a fair amount of pressure to hold the trigger down and it gets very tiring after the first hour, especially when you're way up on tall ladder and using the other hand to hold onto the ladder. i eventually discovered a cable tie works well here. other than that, a first-class product at a great price.

reviews.review_header: Jury is still out.....some design flaws here.
reviews.review_text: I took a chance and purchased the AR Blue Clean AR383 from Amazon because the gas powered pressure washer that I borrowed from my cousin was broken and he couldn't fix it. For starters, it's fairly lightweight, feels sturdy, and looks decent. It's made out of your typical plastic like anything else nowadays. It comes with two different wand attachments and a soap sprayer bottle attachment. They appear to be fairly sturdy as well. Now for my gripes. The hose reel is pointless. You cannot have the wand hose hooked up to the washer while it's on the reel. The reel is only there for when you want to store the hose so if you plan on using it like I did (just simply reel the amount of hose you need) then pass on this design. If they just decided to make a small 1 foot hose lead from the washer to the reel it would have been perfect. You see this on garden hose storage boxes all the time. Simple $10 fix they neglected to add. The plastic nozzle they give you for the actual garden hose to attach to is for lack of a better term, a colander. It leaks like nothing I've ever seen before. I should have taken the advice of other reviews and gotten the adapter to simply screw the garden hose into. Would have been nice had they just put that on in the first place. The spot where you hook the wand hose up on the back is bad. You have to take the entirety of the power cord off to get to it. Where you wind up the power cord is just in the way of where the hookup is. Just bad location. I've yet to run to the local hardware store to pick an adapter up. As soon as I am able to properly test this pressure washer again, I'll give an updated and hopefully better review. For now, you could probably go with the AR240 and that would probably do the same light jobs without the need of a hose reel that you wont need.

reviews.review_header: Impressive washer and outstanding customer service
reviews.review_text: I bought an AR383 from Amazon thirteen months ago and it has worked better than expected. I needed a low-cost yet powerful and compact washer primarily to clean my lawn tractor. A garden hose nozzle was inadequate to get the crud off the underside of the mower deck, but after soaking it, this AR383 peels away the crud easily. The pressure spray is also strong enough to get most bugs off my truck windshield, extending time between trips to the car wash. I haven’t lost any car paint to the pressure spray, but it did take paint off some lawn furniture. I’ve used the unit to wash three wooden decks after applying deck cleaner solution, and it does a good job as long as you keep the spray moving. It can damage wood if the spray stays in one spot too long. The wide-angle nozzle is best for 90% of my work. Yes the connections drip sometimes and no I don’t use the hose reel, but this is a great tool for the price. The AR383 worked well until a water supply hose ruptured and my slow reaction caused the pump to overheat. I called AR customer service looking for repair/replace information, but instead, AR sent me a new AR383 at no cost! The warranty was over; I inadvertently caused the failure; and, AR replaced the entire unit. Wow, I’m impressed. Yes, I recommend the AR383 to others.

I've used the washer just twice (the second time today), and it has worked great. Depending on the wand, it's effects are different. I found it easiest to actually wind the electric cord in the handle reel rather than the wand hose. I'm going to put a mark on the mid-point of the electric cord to make it easier to find it to wind it. The area that the cord is supposed to be wrapped around was too small for the whole cord. Assembly took all of ten minutes without ready the instructions. I have not had any leaks (yet). I did find that pulling the washer trigger, stopping, then quickly pulling it again sometimes doesn't provide the full pressure. Releasing and re-squeezing resolves that mild inconvenience.

reviews.review_header: AR Blue Clean Electric Pressure Washer (AR383)
reviews.review_text: I was looking for a pressure washer that did not run on gas, yet was sufficient enough to handle home projects such as cleaning sidewalks of moss, cleaning gutters, and cleaning decks. After reading several reviews, I decided on trying this unit. Here is what I liked about the unit: 1. Well made unit that works exactly as it should. 2. Storage for all of the tools on the unit. The holder for the hose can only be used for storage and requires that you disconnect the hose from the unit. 3. Easy to change wands with different spray patterns. What I was not so happy with: 1. No way to adjust the pressure from the unit. You adjust the pressure with the type of tip and the distance from the object you are trying to clean! Pay attention to this as you can do a lot of damage in a hurry if you are not careful. 2. Plastic connector for connection to your water supply hose. This connection leaks, but what the heck, it is a small amount of water and you are getting things we anyway. 3. The height of the unit is such that it is easier to just pick it up to move it than to reach down and use the handle and wheels. Overall, the good far exceeds any perceived bad and I am very happy with the performance of the unit. I would recommend that you also pick up the circular disk cleaning attachment if you are cleaning large surface areas as it cleans faster and better than just using the wand.

reviews.review_header: Very mediocre machine. Not worth it.
reviews.review_text: I tried the product twice to wash a brick walkway, driveway, and patio furniture. I found it terribly under-powered. I did not expect it to match up to our gas powered pressure washer, but based on the good reviews, I was hoping for a decent cleaner for some applications that I could do myself (a busy mom) without having my husband drag out the gas machine. Highly disappointing...it barely cleaned mold off a brick walkway and it would have taken forever to do so. So, I thought it might be ok for patio furniture at least...but nope. I was impressed by customer service at first but there was no resolution. And while I waited for replies from service, I missed the return window. Do not recommend.

This pressure washer would easily become a 5 star product if they would fix the known issues. 1) The plastic hose should be made out of rubber. 2) Ditch the wind up reel even if the hose were made of rubber winding a hose this tightly would be a problem. 3) Even with a brass inlet attachment (Purchased at Lowes) added in place of the plastic one the inlet still leaks, they MUST address this. 4) The wand feels cheaply made, I don't care for how the plastic parts fit together as they feel like they might break. The positives of why I gave this machine 4 stars are easy to sum up: Despite all of the shortcomings of this tiny 20lbs unit it cleans as well as my 2200psi gas model that finally died this last year. Bottom line: Fix the shortcomings and charge me $200.00 and I would gladly pay it, and gladly rate it 5 star.

After reading over 50+ comments from both 4-5 stars and 1-2 stars, I've decided to get one myself to try it out. The initial setup was easy. As mentioned by many other owners, this thing leaks like crazy at first from the back where the spray hose attached to the washer. I originally wanted to buy the hose fitting that many other recommended, but then decided to try going without it. I notice the connection wasn't good, and that's why it caused the leak. After examining the connection, then I realized that this maybe the problem for many others. IT WASN'T CONNECTED PROPERLY!!! You have to push the connection all the way and tighten it by turning it all the way until you can't turn it anymore. After this little fix, it works like magic charm. It is more powerful than it looks. You can feel the pressure coming out while spraying. Good light duty pressure washer for it price. Highly recommended!!!

Electric power washers don't have the pressure that gas ones do, period. You cannot strip paint off of an ocean going vessel with this. You can, however, strip the green slime off your deck every spring quite nicely. This is a solid little unit for its price point. Major flaws: The cheaply made plastic adapter that connects your garden hose to the unitl will break. Go ahead and buy a brass universal one when your order the washer. The hose reel is a joke and you will not use it. Plan on coiling up the hose and hanging it on a peg. If you can get over those annoyance factors, this is a pretty decent sprayer, especially for the price.

A great feature is the trigger controlled auto stop when pausing or not using the high pressure. In use the unit is relatively quiet and the on-board storage is handy for keeping everything together when you need the machine. It is smaller than it looks in the pictures, so if you are over 5' tall you likely will be picking it up rather than trying to roll it around, and the units relatively light weight helps in this. Found the reel too ungainly for rolling up the hose, but terrific for rolling up the power cord, and coil up the hose by hand and place it over the handle instead. Would recommend an additional extension wand if you don't want to have to stoop too much. Overall, a really good machine, and great value at Amazon.

reviews.review_header: Never worked from the start and I'm pissed
reviews.review_text: I purchased this item and assembled it according to the instructions. On the first time using it, it started to smoke. I had the water turned on prior to turning it on so that was not the issue. I have owned many gas operated pressure washers in my lifetime so I am very familiar with their operation. To make a long story short, this never worked for me and now it is past the window to return by 3 days. I will update my review if the company makes good on an exchange. Until then Avoid this machine.

**************DO NOT let the motor run without water going into the machine, it is a WET SUMP motor that needs water for lubrication. Only reason i put 4 stars is because this is my 2nd AR blue clean. I used the first one weekly for approx 1 year, and then it just completely stopped working. That being said, it works very well, and the accessories help you detail your car very well. I am very much into detailing and preventing swirls/scratches/webbing on my clear coat so this power washer helps me do that. I use the adjustable spray nozzle to blast almost all dirt and dust off car, then the soap sud shooter to get soap all over the car, and then i was from top to bottom. I love this, and I feel it is a must have for any avid home detailer. I noticed there didn't seem to be any other electric power washer on the market that had solid reviews so all in all it's a good find. ALso good for cleaning around the house. The water pressure in my neighborhood is horrible and this sucker still shoots water like you would expect and desire

reviews.review_header: Also recommend spraying silicon (not petroleum based HD40) in wand connections ...
reviews.review_text: After a year of use my only issues are having to replace several "O" rings for the unit. Be AWARE, product manual doesn't provide sizes needed. Can buy a wasteful "variety" pack on-line, but give me a break. You will need replacement "O" rings for the water wand to hose connection. Also recommend spraying silicon (not petroleum based HD40) in wand connections to prevent sticking. Otherwise I have been quite happy with the product I do recommend adding quick connect hose connector to the water inlet. If they would just tell you the O ring sizes, I would give them a 5 star rating. Using in Jackson Hole Wyoming.

reviews.review_header: Plenty of power and just the right accessories.
reviews.review_text: As it only arrived recently I've only used this once so far, so I can't comment on the longevity of the washer, but I can comment on it's operation. The washer was simple to assemble the various cables and tool caddies, I was up and running in minutes. It came with everything pictured in the product picture: - Pressure hose - Gun / Wand - Variable Nozzle - Rotary Nozzle - Soap Dispenser - Inlet Water Filter - Quick-release garden hose adapter You will need to supply the following to get up and running: a garden hose, power, and a water supply. The Inlet Water Filter contains a fine mesh to stop large particles from within the hose or water supply from entering the washer and damaging / clogging the machinery. The soap dispenser attaches to the gun and the application of any detergents will be at low pressure. The manual states that this is more optimal than application of soap at high pressure, but I've yet to try either so can't comment further. The variable nozzle lets you adjust the spray from a single very-high pressure stream, to an almost 180 degree fan of water. The single stream is very powerful, so you'd best be careful where you point it, otherwise you'll find you'll likely be damaging whatever you're pointing it at. On the wider settings it still puts out a lot of pressure and I found it much more efficient to clean larger areas of my pool deck with. The pressure from the fan also generates a strong push of water and air which I found handy to use as a broom and sweep any light dirt around my deck and out the door. The rotary nozzle seems to emit a lower pressure stream than the variable one at it's finest setting, but the stream covers a wider area due to the internal rotation. I feel this nozzle will be best for general cleaning and concentrating a larger quantity of water in a single direction over a greater distance, rather than with the variable fan which will spread the water too far to the sides and not produce enough volume in a single direction. You'll probably use this to wash your car or rinse off your windows (from a safe distance). All in all I'm happy with this purchase and looking forward to spending a bit of time finally cleaning up my deck.

Caveat: I have never owned a pressure washer, so I have no point of comparison. I purchased this because I wanted my walkways to be as clean as I could get them. A little research taught me that gas pressure washers are way more powerful than electric ones. Because of my heartbreaking experience with a finicky gas lawnmower that prompted me to buy an electric version, I decided to buy an electric pressure washer right out of the gate. Yes, the connector between my garden hose and this machine leaks! I bought a replacement brass version of the coupling at the Home Depot. Didn't fit; returned it. Oh well, what's a little leak? This is easy to use, very intuitive. I read the manual, but really, there was no need. I understood quickly how this thing worked. Is it powerful? Yes, since I hit my toes with a direct blast from the wand. Ouch! This cleaned my cement walkway with relative ease, and cleaned my house's algae covered stucco. One issue: this machine did not make a dent on some spilled paint on concrete. Sigh. I wish it was strong enough, but I have to get out my soy based paint remover and dab that on the paint spills... I had a blast using this machine, but I was soaking wet from the experience. I intend to stay drier as I learn to better use this machine. So, AR North America, please fix this leaking problem! Makes no sense that everybody loves the machine and hates the leak. Still, overall, a great buy.

reviews.review_header: I love the power swirl attachment
reviews.review_text: I've had this pressure washer over a year, and can find no faults. The water supply connect is simple and tight. I never use the on/off switch on the pressure washer. Leave the switch on. Plug the machine in. Turn on the water supply. Hit the reset button on the plug in unit, the pump should come on for a second or so, then shut off. You can be otherwise occupied for an hour, and the machine will sit quietly waiting, until you press the trigger and the pump comes back on. I love the power swirl attachment. It squirts a powerful narrow stream in a circular pattern that cleans a wide area. The hose and cord lengths are good, it's conveniently maneuverable.

Bought this unit about a year ago for our summer place in the mountains. I have a 6.5hp Craftsman gas washer, but it's a hassle to transport. Fast forward a year, and the pump on the Craftsman has given up the ghost. I brought home the Blue to do a few jobs over the weekend. This thing kicked butt over the past 4 days. I have done no less than 25 hours of washing over the past 4 days, including a 40'x12 redwood arbor, 3 smaller arbors, a 50x12 redwood deck, 20 teak patio chairs, 8 ottomans, pads for all, and the entire outside of the house. The big arbor was probably the worst job. A couple years after having it built, we decided to have it stained. Big mistake. For whatever reason, the stain turned black (I mean BLACK) and looked terrible. My wife called a few painters to get bids to paint it white, and they came in between $1600 and $3300. Just for fun, on the day before the painters were supposed to start, I hit one of the worst spots on the arbor with the washer-the results blew us both away. I power washed the entire thing, a 1-1/2" swath at a time. Took me 2 solid days, but it looks like new AND I saved some cash. I've even pulled the thing up onto the roof to clean skylights-something that would be impossible with the Craftsman. Yeah...I really like this machine. (and yes-it did do the annoying leak thing out of the box, but a little Ace Hardware MacGuyvering fixed it up fine). If it breaks tomorrow, I'll order another one. [UPDATE} Literally the day after I wrote the review above, the pressure hose blew out on my washer. When the pump is on, the hose stays pretty straight, but when you turn it off, it kinks up. The blowout occurred on a kink. Sucks, but with a hose that small, there's not much that can be done. Went to ACE to try and find parts to adapt the hose on my old Craftsman to the Blue, and lo and behold, there was a complete replacement kit from Blue sitting on the shelf! $40 for a new hose, trigger assembly, 2 lances, and chemical injector. Sweet deal, and I was back in business in less than a half hour. Nice to know the local stocks the washers and parts.

This thing worked great the first year ... washed the car, cleaned the adirondack chairs, cleaned the walk, etc. After about 10 months, the washers that hold the hoses together all dried out and cracked, causing leaks -- not a big deal... you can buy replacement rings on Amazon or at Home Depot for about $5. Then the gun receptor for the hose broke and that was a bit more expensive, to replace the gun itself (again on Amazon). And now, in the early spring of it's third year, on it's first use, the entire machine starting sputtering after 10 minutes, and, then, as other reviewers have described, it started smoking and stinking of burnt plastic. The engine shifted down and the pressure was cut by 2/3 and the smoke continued. I finally turned it off for fear of a fire. A day later, no improvement, more smoke and weak pressure. We are tossing the unit out, very much feeling we didn't get our money's worth. I will not be buying another one from this company.

reviews.review_header: Got this shipped to my house for $115 on Amazon ...
reviews.review_text: Got this shipped to my house for $115 on Amazon Deal of the Day. This is made in China and the instructions might as well be in chinese. Your garden hose is connected to the back and the pressure hose to the front. This replaced a Karcher 1750 PSI cleaner, my third in ten years. Karcher quality has gone down the toilet. The quality of this AR appears to be inferior to Karcher at first glance. The garden hose inlet is recessed making the use of teflon tape difficult, the pressure hose outlet is a clear plastic "quick connect" which appears flimsy... but time will tell. I did not have any leaks and pressure appears to be as advertised in the 1,900 PSI range. This is 4 stars @ $115, 3 stars at $158 and 2 stars at $199. Price is the key on this item. Hope this helps.

When I bought this house in Florida the cement pool deck, driveway and front walk had been severely neglected. I could see in old pictures that they were suppose to be white but they were quite black from mold and mildew. I used the turbo spray, it took me 6 hours to do the pool deck and the cement plant pots which now look wonderful. The hose and power cord reach quite far, I was pushing it to get to the other side of my pool but I managed without an extension cord. The 2nd day I did my front walk and driveway. They both look SO much better. There are old stains from the neglect that I'm guessing will never come out but the black is gone. It was very easy to assemble, if the cheap plastic parts don't last I don't mind, it's the power cord, hose and wand I need. When you first turn it on there was a quick 'start up noise' which shut off just as fast. Don't be alarmed, I guess it's just charging up because it blasted away as soon as I began to work. Great little machine and for this sale price can you beat it?

reviews.review_header: The "1" reviews gave me pause but ...
reviews.review_text: My wife campaigned hard for this one. QVC was selling a similar model. I have a much more expensive and powerful Honda washer that's a pain in the neck to use...hard to start these days and leaks like crazy. The "1" reviews gave me pause but to keep the peace at home I bought one. Surprise...it works fine. Easy to assemble and doesn't leak at all. I read the instructions for a change so that probably helped. It's plastic so I hope it holds up. I used it for about 6 hours today with no problems.

I bought this last September 2011 and was a little apprehensive given as one reviewer mentioned in September that most of the bad reviews were in the past 6 months I have used this to wash my sidewalks, cars, garage floor but most impressive to me was the back patio. It not only removed the mold on the pavers but removed all of the weeds in between. I could not be happier with it I read the instructions before putting this together and would encourage everyone to do that. Also after the first hour the water was coming out more as a trickle, I read the troubleshooting guide and fixed the problem. The only downside is that is uses "soap pacs" that I was unable to find at Home Depot Bottom line is that after several months of using this I remain very impressed. Having read a lot of the reviews before buying it I would say you have to follow the instructions to start it. There is a sequence of steps to take otherwise for safety, you know water and electricity, it won't turn on

reviews.review_header: Doesn't work well in my application.
reviews.review_text: Where I use this I have low water pressure because of a well water system and a long length of pipe and hose between the well water pressure source tank and the pressure washer. That may be the reason it doesn't work well for me. After about 2 years of ownership it started to be unable to continuously spray at pressure. After about second of pressurized spraying the stream slowed to a trickle and there was audible evidence that the pump was spinning at a higher than normal rpm. If I release the trigger it will continue to pump at this increased rpm unless i shake the unit. If i shake the unit it pressures up and is ready for another 1 second of usage. This makes the unit useless. Maybe it would work fine with city water pressure. Maybe my unit is defective, I don't know. Its kind of a tangled mess to work with but I guess that comes with the territory of electric pressure washers. I don't like the way the garden hose attachment point protrudes out of the front of it. I feel its only a matter of time until that breaks. It has got more difficult to use the twist-lock system to attache different nozzles over time to the point now that its a pain. I hate to criticize a product for being to powerful but know that it can take the paint of car wheels.

This is lightweight, easy to use, powerful enough to clean Seattle algae off the roof and siding, and is sturdier than I'd imagined for the price. My 6-year-old left it in the On position with the water turned off and 'shot' the deck for about 10 minutes before I figured out what he was doing. The unit was making a funny (not ha ha) noise when I shut it off and I thought he'd for sure burned it out. Hooked water up and turned it back on, it was like it never happened. I had no idea how big of a difference owning a pressure washer would make as a homeowner, and my only regret is not buying this sooner. Excellent product at an excellent price.

reviews.review_header: Durable machine minus it's water hose attachment you can replace easily
reviews.review_text: I at first bought the sun joe SPX3000, but it smoked up the first time I used it, returned it for my money back, and used that to buy this one. I did not like the design of this one as much but it held up unlike the Sun Joe, so ultimately that's what matters. I never use the reel for the hose and the area for the power cord was not aesthetically designed and you have to do more work to unwrap the cord since you can't just take the whole spool off at once. At first I didn't like the different kind of nozzle, partially because it didn't work with any of my nozzles I had and you have to buy a new wand attachment just for the blaster. I learned to really like the adjustable width nozzle that comes with it though. It's really nice to be able to change it right there without having to even stop the water flow. You can rinse a window right after you shot some dirt on it, and go right back to using a harsher jet a second later. I used this machine for almost 12 straight hours and it performed great with no sign of giving up or getting too hot.

I purchased this pressure washer to replace one that apparently froze in my garage during the past brutal winter causing leaks. When looking at the picture of the Blue Clean AR383 it looked identical to my old one except for the color. When I received it, I discovered that it was approximately 30% smaller than the one it was replacing. I was initially disappointed as I felt that it would probably not be capable of easily cleaning my deck and brick driveway. I was pleasantly surprised that it performed well & handled my jobs. Although smaller and lighter in weight, it did the required work. As noted in other reviews, the hose reel is more decorative than functional. It is much too difficult and cumbersome to attempt to roll the hose onto the small reel. I simply looped the hose a few times and placed a clamp around the looped hose to keep it in place during storage.

If you need to pressure wash driveways, you probably want to look at gas powered units. After renting the high powered washers and seeing the damage that they can do, I opted for the electric. A bonus feature is practically no maintenance required. When I got my new "toy", I washed our deck, patio furniture, back of the house, front walk, and car! I do have some issues with it, might be my own fault: the high pressure hose storage reel is awkward to use so I end up coiling up the hose and draping it over the unit. Also, I had trouble getting the nozzles to stay attached. I read and reread the directions, attached the nozzle by pressing in and twisting, then it pops right off when I start the pressure spray. Not every time, but somehow I haven't gotten the hang of it yet. I like that it is so quiet. I can hear somebody's contractor pressure washing a house five doors down, but I bet my next door neighbors don't hear this unit at all. This is quite a compact unit, so it's easy to store. I hope it holds up, because it works well and I'd like to get my money's worth out of it. Next job is prepping a house for paint- single story house, this isn't up to a two story.

I needed a pressure washer mainly to clean out the cartridge filters for my pool. I borrowed my buddy's 1500 psi washer and loved the results but felt it needed a bit more power. After checking allot of the reviews for the different brands I was intrigued by the AR Blue reviews. They had ALOT of reviews, most were great, but some were bad. A few complaints of the washer smoking and dying during the first use. I decided to call AR blue to see what the heck was up. After a few rings a rep (living) answered and we had a good short chat. He explained that a few years ago they had some defective pumps that made it past QC, but the problem was fixed quick, fast, and in a hurry. He ALSO went on to explain why there were some complaints about the leaking hose connection, guess what, operator error guys. Since I had all my concerns resolved during that short but effective phone call, I decided to buy the AR383. Of course it came wicked fast (thanks amazon), and after about 15-20 min of assembly started using it to clean my patio. I have used it multiple times this last week for various tasks, No leaks, and it works great! I love the single tip that adjusts your spray pattern, and the alternate pulse wand packs a wallop. For those who are looking at this washer but are concerned about the few bad reviews, don't worry, AR Blue has got their bugs worked out.

reviews.review_header: Read the operating manual first and you'll be fine.
reviews.review_text: I've read so many of the negative reviews on this product and still decided to go with it. Some folks complain that it leaks but that wasn't my experience. Unlike many of the commentators, I didn't purchase additional connection parts. Instead, I went with the suggestions of a few who recommended Teflon tape on the protruding pipe parts and I've had no issues. I read the operating manual thoroughly before attempting to operate the unit and I believe that helped me to avoid a lot of the issues others have had. The unit itself is very compact and everything stores quite easily on-board, even the water hose. I have used it on a couple occasions so far and haven't had any issues. The pressure is quite strong for the average household need and in all honestly, if someone needs more pressure than what this unit supplies, maybe a gas powered unit would be a better choice. My only gripe is with the capacity of the detergent bottle. Its on the smaller side and I may purchase a larger bottle in the future.

reviews.review_header: Fantastic customer service from AR North America!
reviews.review_text: When my relatively new AR383 stopped working, I figured I was out of luck: "You get what you pay for," I thought, and since this was an inexpensive machine compared to the $500 pressure washers at Lowe's or The Home Depot, I figured there was no chance the company would help. In fact, when I emailed AR North America, I got a response right away from Susie in the customer service department. Before I knew it, I was on the phone with Tom, who specializes in the internal operations of the machines. He listened to my description of the problem, identified the malfunction and assured me the company would make it right. A few days later I had a new unit on my front porch. The company had made good on the warranty. Tom explained that having "happy customers" is AR North America's top priority. Count me as a happy customer!

After reading a few reviews about people having issues getting it put together I have determined those people were trying to use the instructions in a foreign language. It was very easy to put together and very few pieces at that. I spent about 5 hours washing the concrete in my back yard when I got it and it went off without a hitch. Holding the nozzle about a foot away from the ground, it cleaned the surface wonderfully. I had to get closer to the ground to get the green mildew/algae (after winter time rain) off and it did come off too. I also felt the cost was very reasonable for the product. I went to Home Depot to look at their equipment and they had lower PSI washers for the same and higher prices. Pros: It is pretty powerful. I like that if you let go of the handle and then squeeze it real fast, you get a less powerful stream out of it. Its not a big unit so its easy to transport and lift. I have back issues and i found no issue lifting it. The machine is also fairly quiet. I was expecting something much louder. After 5 hours of use, I didn't have a headache and my ears didn't ring. My gas leaf blower is much louder than this washer. Cons: I wish the wand was longer. I'm not sure if that has to do with the pressure and what not, but because of my back issues, I was hunched over a lot because the wand was pretty short. I'd like to see an extension part for it so it can be used short (if you are cleaning the side of your house or something), but can be make longer for the ground or high up places. I would definitely recommend this product to my family/friends.

reviews.review_header: Great for the price! Not the best for big jobs
reviews.review_text: So I decided on this model for the price to psi ratio. It is primarily used with a foam canon for the cars, and to clean off the front porch. I noticed, as with most electric washers, that they can not compare against gas washers in psi and overall stream strength. But for light duty cleaning, it works great since it is quiet, only runs when you press the trigger, and is light and easy to move around. As some others have said, the hose that comes with this model is not the best. I will be buying a better, more maneuverable hose some time soon. But I am happy with this product after a month for what I need it for. So, if you need a pressure washer that is light, easy to use, and priced right, get this one. If you need high levels of pressure for tough oil stains and such, you may want to consider a gas operated one.

And my sidewalk. This thing is powerful enough to clean wood and concrete. The handle vibrates something awful, though. My fingers were numb for three days. I did end up bungee-ing the trigger to alleviate pressure of the pinky and ring finger, which took the brunt of the vibrations on the trigger. EASY set up. Having a cord can be bothersome, though.

It has taken me awhile to write this review because I just got around to using it. However, this product is wonderful. If you are female and are looking for a pressure washer that is easy to use this is it! There are not mixing of products to use, just hook up to water and electric and you are ready to go! Great for cleaning off patios, decks and concrete birdbaths. I also used it on a plastic storage container that I store my outdoor cushions in and it worked great. This is easy enough to pull out any time and use. I am so glad I bought it!

Great seller. No problems. Very happy with the product. Works well. Light weight and easy to move around. Nice that the sprayer handle also powers the unit on and off at the same time. No need to walk back to the unit and turn the power switch off while in idle or when not spraying. More importantly, I am impressed at great level of customer service offered by the manufacturer AR Blue Clean where they offer the ability to be reached in 3 ways: 1) A toll free 800 number; 2) standard email; 3) Online contact form. I left a message over the holiday weekend promptly received a call the next business day. I understand their mission statement is 2 words - Happy Customer. They earned it with me. Note: Please read the assembly instructions thoroughly. I wasted time by not doing this.

reviews.review_header: Not as powerful as I expected.
reviews.review_text: 1900 PSI sure does sound like a lot. But in practice, this thing is not all that powerful. Honestly, my garden hose with a tapered "pressure" nozzle has a more powerful stream and will reach out much, much further than this device will. The reel that is used to store the pressure hose, which is simply plastic tubing, puts a crease in the hose when you insert the hose into the reel's retainer clips. So I have stopped using the storage reel in order to stop damaging the hose. It comes with a pretty long electric cord. However, the three cord retaining clips are not wide enough and deep enough to completely wrap the entire cord. The clips run out of space when there is still about 6 feet of cord that needs to be wound up. The unit comes with two 'push-in" nozzles that fit into the washer handle. One of these has some sort of spinning jet nozzle inside of it, and this is the one that can do some major cleaning. But it must be only inches away from the surface, or else it does nothing much. The nozzle retainer caddy on the washer has two clips, one for each nozzle. These are not sized correctly, so the nozzles barely fit into them and will fall out when you try to wheel the washer around the garage driveway or yard. This product is made in China.

I researched pressure washers and found the AR 383 to be top of the class for both price, as well as ratings from consumers. At 1900 psi, this washer was up there as far as both a powerful electric washer and still it retained a great value within the pressure washers I researched. The main purpose I got the washer was to rehab a deck. My deck is approx. 5 years old and gets very little sun each day. The grime and green mildew was crazy. So, I bought the AR 383 and put it to the test. ****Beware**** the first boards I cleaned literally drove a 1/8" mark into the boards. However, when I figured out how to use the AR 383 and took some time, the dirt just disappeared from my deck. This is a very strong washer that can take on most if not all home tasks. I have had only for a few weeks, but as of now, daddy has a new toy!

Best pressure washer I've ever owned. After having several electric PW's this compact AR383 packs a punch. Don't let its size fool you. This 383 model is as close to a commercial electric PW as you can get without spending several hundred dollars more. This little guy cleaned 13 years of crud, grime and mildew off our 1,600 sq ft cement patio effortlessly. Then went on to power wash the brick & siding on the house & did a fantastic job on these materials as well. No leaks, quiet operation & POWERFUL. FIVE stars all the way on this AR383 from me. Update 6/15/13 I did end up purchasing the turbo patio cleaner accessory from AR Blue for $19.95 Along with an extra extension wand. Being 6'2" the extra extension wand allowed me to stand straight up with no bending over. I would suggest to anyone who's tall to spend a few extra dollars for an additional extension wand. BTW the $19.95 Turbo Patio Cleaner did an amazing job of removing even more crud off the cement. The patio cleaner unit has stiff bristles brushes the surround the underside of the unit and scrub the surface and work in conjunction with the powerful rotating spray arms on the unit. The patio cleaner accessory is a must have for large surface area cleaning.

I followed all the advice from other reviewers on Amazon. This product works exceptionally well. The manufacturer made improvements to the water hose attachment and there are no leaks. The product has been used to clean the patio, driveway outside bar and remove dirt from several vehicles. Using an additional high pressure hose, we were able to efficiently clean a wood cabin and prepare for staining. The product has paid for itself by not having to rent a pressure washer.

I would like to say that this company is the best on customer service that I have ever delt with. My power washer all of a sudden stopped so, after I had tried all the trouble shooting info, I decided to call customer service. Tom, answered my call very quickly and friendly. He had me do a few trials to diagnose any problems. Then he said, " We are going to send you a new washer." And the company didn't even have me return the broken one. Wow! A company that answers their own phone and values customer service more than so many other companies. By the way my new power washer works great for my uses.

reviews.review_header: this product works great. If you have a larger area or want ...
reviews.review_text: For the price, this product does a decent job. I've used it to clean my driveway--though the small coverage from the sprayer means it takes awhile to do. Due to the length of the cords, I found using the product to clear the siding of my house a little difficult. If you have a small area to take care of (a little drive way or sidewalk), this product works great. If you have a larger area or want to clean siding on your home, I suggest spending a bit more for a more powerful device.

reviews.review_header: Excellent tool for cleaning patios, garage floors, sidewalks and siding.
reviews.review_text: I bought this having used commercial grade pressure washers for a number of years from my local rental center. Those washers were all heavy, and too powerful for the types of applications I needed to clean. The AR Blue Clean is easy to use and light weight so it is easy to move around the house to the various surfaces. We have several large paver patios and it did a great job cleaning the surface and removing the moss and dirt that had accumulated in the spaces between them. I tested it on the siding of my house, cedar which seems to breed mildew, knowing that I needed to clean it before staining and the result of that test was great. The ARBC has just the right amount of pressure and got rid of the mildew without damaging the siding. I will use it to clean all of the siding before I start to re-stain the cedar. The only negatives if you want to call them that is the hose storage reel is a bit challenging to use and I found that storing the hose off the reel works better for me. I would have appreciated a bit longer electrical cord. The length of the electrical cord while adequate for most of my applications was a bit short for my large lot. Overall, I would strongly recommend it.

reviews.review_header: It works if you use it
reviews.review_text: For a little more than a full day rental from Home Depot (professional machine) you can have your own. Easy to set up and use unless you're reviewing for a competitors behalf or ate a little to much lead paint chips as a kid. This is a no brainier because I'm brain dead with tools. Very little assembly but easy. Only con is you have to take it outside, hook it up to water source and USE it. It's won't do anything without you 😆😆

Does the job at a reasonable price. After two years or so, the hose leaked at the attachment to the wand. Turns out it was a missing small O ring. I called the company and although out of warranty they sent me a replacement and now it is working perfectly. That is customer service!

reviews.review_header: Someone actually thought out the design of this machine, and it shows.
reviews.review_text: Having gone through a couple other electric pressure washers, this one is easily the best. It's a solid workhorse for residential use and, in comparison to the other washers I've used, has places for all of it's attachments. That might sound like an odd thing to be happy about, but when you don't have a place to put 25+ feet of electrical cable you'd be amazed at how nice this AR383 washer is when you are done using it. It has good, constant pressure. The 'gun' portion itself also has a toggle safety switch button (instead of the hold-down kind), the gun's hose as a free-rotating connection, meaning you can spin the gun on the end of it's hose freely. The connector to your garden hose itself is two parts which makes connecting/disconnecting the hose (while water is flowing) easy and quick. Mine doesn't leak at all as well. This is a solid, fairly quiet and solid machine. It was designed by people who actually thought about things and you can tell when you use it.

reviews.review_header: This company's customer service is excellent. I've called several times with questions and they ...
reviews.review_text: I bought this last year and have had success with using it on my deck and stonework. This company's customer service is excellent. I've called several times with questions and they have always been courteous and helpful. It does leak a bit but that has not been a problem for me. A good buy!

Living in the SE requires power washing the home & porch/deck after the spring pollens and we typically paid folks to come do this. For the price of the AR Blue I'll break even this year! I read all the reviews, positive and negative and agree with all except some of the negative. This thing has plenty of power for most jobs - granted, for concrete/bricks you have to have a lot of time on your hands given it only has 1900 psi and you have to make very small swipes to get it clean. But I love how quiet it is vs a gas powered unit I'd have to maintain year to year and wear ear protection when using. I have not yet replaced the water hose adapter, but I had no problems with it leaking at all - used a little plumbers teflon tape on all threads and it seals with no leakage. Yeah, the hose reel isn't really usable - I recommend removing it and instead velcro-ing in your pressure hose in the slot. Pros: Fast Setup/Breakdown Powerful enough for most jobs (it can still remove old paint so be careful on your painted surfaces) Quiet (compared to gas powered equivalents) Relatively Inexpensive Cons: Plastic water hose connector won't last Really cleaning concrete/bricks/stone takes a lot of patience

I've never had or used a pressure washer before. Reading the many comments here on Amazon.com I learned of the many potential uses it would have at my home. I am not disappointed. It works great. The AR383 arrived yesterday. I used it on a Trex deck on the side of our house today. We've had the deck for three and a half years and only washed it with a hose from time to time. It is subject to dust blowing from nearby farm fields, from residue dropping from airplanes landing at two local airports, and a lot of wind carried debris. I knew if I ever tried to tackle cleaning the Trex with a scrub brush it would not produce good results. From the first few inches of cleaning I knew I had made a good purchase. A dark layer of dirt came off exposing a long lost clean color of the deck. The deck has 6 stairs on each end, is about 6' wide and about 30' long. It took me about two hours to do the whole thing. I also used the pressure washer to wash the dirt off the white painted wooden fence along the side of the deck which came out really nice. AR North America must have gotten the message about the leaking hose fitting. They didn't ship the fitting in the manual. I had already purchased the brass fitting replacement but didn't need to use it. The new hose fitting is a two part quick release connection that didn't leak a drop. I found I could wrap the hose around the hose reel as designed. I read where several people thought it wouldn't work but it worked fine for me. The power cord wraps around the back side but it was just a bit too much cord for the way the AR383 is designed and the last few turns were outside the holding bracket. This isn't a tool that I would grab and use for a small job without knowing that the time to set it up and put it away is at least 5 to 10 minutes on each end of the job. But my imagination was running wild with all the jobs I could do with it. The machine doesn't make too much noise, and the cord and high pressure hose are long enough for all applications around my house. I appreciate that the pump shuts off quickly after releasing the handle. I do wish the handle had a lock to keep it on so I wouldn't have to hold it on all the time. My hand is tired after cleaning the deck. I have nothing to compare this with but I like it a lot and highly recommend it. Time will tell about reliability.

I had read the reviews before purchasing and this product seemed to have the best PSI for the price. I am a 48 yr. old female and have never pressure washed before. I had no problem setting up the machine and it worked better than I expected. It did a great job around the pool and on our stamped concrete driveway. Now I'm pressure cleaning our landscape rocks, fencing and anything else in my path. Once you start and see how clean things become...you look for new things to spray. My husband was afraid it wouldn't be strong enough, but it's done the job. It barely leaked from the hose connection, but who cares...that's like complaining about getting splashed when your in the pool! The hardest part was putting it away and figuring out where everything neatly gets stored at. I would definitely recommend this. We've used it 3 times so far and it worked as promised and the price was right.

I used this before i got my gas powered pressure washer. It has strong pressure and is over all a good pressure washer to start with. My only complaint is the coupling where the hose meets the pressure washer is made of plastic. This has caused it to leak over time. I have read where you can change out this thread for a metal one and that should stop the leaking problem.

Power full light duty pressure washer! I am impressed with it's usefulness. Easy to set up. I used it on my vinyl fence, brick patio, concrete driveway, vinyl shed & wood deck. It handled the job amazingly. I used ammonia in the spray bottle that comes with it to pre treat the surface's. I would give it 5 stars , but the only thing I wasnt crazy about is the hose reel. Its hard to figure out & there are no instructions on how to wind it up.

reviews.review_header: This is the way to spray..
reviews.review_text: Bought this to replace an old gas powered washer. This is easy to assemble and only takes a little bit of time to begin washing. Pros - easy to assemble, great spray, nice accessories, good for decks, walks, driveways, cars, BBQ grillsv - packs into a nice package for storage - plenty of electrical cord - moves easily from one location to another. CONS - had difficulty getting it to work the first time as the plug has a GFI built in and it didn't work the first few times I tried it. would recommend you just plug it in, reset the GFI and turn the machine on. it sounds like the GFI clicks off again but it is the way the valving works. Also, make sure you connect the want prior to hooking up the water or you get a wet mess. It cleaned my composite deck, deck carpet, driveway, and BBQ grill in one day.
