Now I have to get rid of a 20 Y.O. gas washer.

reviews.review_header: Motor died after 3 months, and four uses
reviews.review_text: Arrived on April 11, 2016. I have used it about four times around the house. Pressure washed deck, stairs and patio. It was not super powerful, but I just wanted it for moderate routine clean-ups, so it was OK for me. Today, July 13, the motor died. It lasted a couple of days over three months. I see a lot of good review, so I guess I it's most likely a good product -- but the machine I got was a dud. UPDATE: Called the manufacturer today, and they walked me through trouble shooting. Nothing worked. BUT, after a few steps, the manufacturer was quick of offer a replacement -- with NO hassles. Thank you.

reviews.review_header: So, so disappointed. It leaks badly even with suggested brass attachment. Motor stops working after a few seconds.
reviews.review_text: So disappointed. It leaks badly and the motor just stops working after a few seconds. I even bought the attachment suggested to avoid leaks but the way this is made makes leaks nearly imposible. I think you can reduce the leaks quite a bit with the attachment but it still leaks.

reviews.review_header: Works great...have only had it a few days
reviews.review_text: Had an electric pressure washer several years ago (Karcher). It worked well for about 4 years and then started leaking so was basically useless. You have to just expect that with these plastic models. Bought this one to clean the deck and teak patio furniture. It worked great right out of the box. Absolutely no leaks anywhere. Easy to assemble. I called AR customer service to ask a question during the assembly, and they answered on the first ring and could not have been nicer. FYI, when you first turn on the power button, the machine will make noise only for a second while it pressurizes. Then it goes silent, until you pull the trigger on the gun. It ONLY runs when you pull the trigger, which is nice. (at first, I thought it was broken because there was no noise) I had to turn down the pressure (very easy to adjust it by turning the nozzle of the gun) to not damage the wood furniture. Once I found the right pressure, it was great. Did not use any detergent - just water. Nobody can believe the difference in the furniture. Totally worth the price for what I plan to use it for.

Had this for a year, light duty. Did the siding on house, very black driveway and pool lanai, very green. Wash truck couple times and after a year just did lanai again. All has gone very well and is great for my needs. Electric is a little more work effort with the cord but you work it out. No regrets with the purchase.

I only use the sprayer once per summer to clean the mold off my vinyl siding, the rest of the time it is kept in a storage shed. The first summer it worked fine. The second summer it needed washers replaced so I ordered the O ring kit and replaced them then it worked fine. This summer I again had to replace the O rings, they fall out easily into the grass and since they are small I cannot see them. But now the pump won't work. I have read the manual and checked everything and just no pressure. This should not happen after no more than 4 hours of usage and of course the warranty time is over. I can order parts for it but why should I have to pay for and repair something myself especially after only 4 hours of use. Besides I'm not mechanically inclined and may not be able to do it anyway. Very unsatisfied with this product.

reviews.review_header: Pretty powerful but not the best design
reviews.review_text: I purchased this washer to keep my mower, tractor, and truck clean. The AR383 has plenty of power for these jobs. It comes with a bottle for wash to be added and it works well but does use a lot of wash when used. The main thing I noticed that I didn't like is how the water hose hooks up to the washer. It has a quick connect plastic piece that screws on the hose end and then plugs into the washer. The only problem is the plastic piece will not screw onto any of the hoses I have tried. It won't tighten enough to not have leaks. I also fear the this plastic will crack after several uses and then I won't be able to attach a hose at all. The washer has storage places on the back for the extra pole and wash bottle. This is convenient but the poles don't stay secure and often fall out. For the money it is a good unit but it could use a few improvements.

I was hesitant at first to purchase this with all the negative reviews but i must say im impressed with this powerwash. I immediately put it to use removing green mold on my vinyl fence. At first it didnt seem to get it off easily but then a few adjustments to the nozzle this puppy washed the the fence with ease. Not to mention it is light and easy to move around. The plastic hose adapter leaked water when i used it but i later realized i didnt have it tight all the way. I will try it again later and update my rating if i find it as an issue. I did however struggled to put the hose in the reel it wasnt a deal breaker to me.

With mildew an annual problem on the clapboard siding on one side of my house, using a ladder and a sponge was getting too difficult and tiresome for this senior citizen. I felt it was time for me to buy a pressure washer which I could use on other things as well. Friends have always told me that when buying outdoor powered tools those powered by gasoline engines are always more efficient and powerful. However, I have had bad luck over the years with anything that requires me to pull a rope to start it up so I had to consider an electric pressure washer in spite of my awareness that gas is better. I spent a lot of time reading reviews on the internet and the AR Blue Clean model AR383 was highly regarded in every review I read. So 4 days after ordering the unit from Amazon I was using it to remove the mildew on my siding. It was easy to use and did a superb job. Next was the resin outdoor furniture I was going to trash after 10 years of use; it almost looked like new when I finished washing it with this unit. The AR383 is well made, compact and was a pleasure to use. I would highly recommend it to anyone

reviews.review_header: You get what you pay fit
reviews.review_text: Use it and works well for my car and house but I wouldn't count on it for heavy duty use. Best feature is that the motor only runs during use which is good instead of constantly cycling like others. Saves wear & tear. Quiet in function. Others complain about it leaking but I put some Teflon tape and a smudge of plumbers putty on all thread fittings as you should do and no leak. I also advise lubing the rubber seals with an appropriate lube as to not damage and makes an easy connection at the fittings. The only cons are that the pressure hose is too stiff and that it's so stiff don't even try to put it on the reel as shown the product photo. You'll see what I mean. I suggest wrapping it at the handle. Lastly the plastic quick connect to the garden hose is cheap and easily cracks. I have a heavy duty garden hose and the sheer weight of it when pulling the machine around caused it to crack. I accidentally and lightly brushed my rubber shoe against the new one and it cracked again. I advise a light weight garden hose and be very cautious of that fitting

Today was the first chance I had to try it out and if it had not done such a good job as a pressure washer, I probably would have given it a 1. So yes, it is a light weight and powerful for pressure washing. However, today when i opened the box, I found a quick start guidd, but no manual. The directions tell you to screw on some storage pieces, but there were no screws. The hose that goes to the wand had kinks in it and i am a bit worried the hose may give out at those kinks with continued use. Finally, i have no idea what it wants me to do to store the electrical cord and hose. I have spent over an hour trying ti figure out how tge plastic attachments that I did not have screws for are supposed to work. It is probably something easy that I am missing, but since I have no maual, I will probably never know.

The leak problem is not fixed as suggested in the longer review. I have replaced the quick disconnect and still have a problem. Second there are thread issues both with the filter that is over tolerance and difficult to use with standard hoses. This was remedied by purchasing the brass quick disconnect. The more serious issue is the wand threading. The plastic threads are not deep enough or strong enough to hold the nozzle. Mine stripped out and now the unit is unusable again. This is not from stripping etc. The unit shot off and the threads went with it. When it worked it was great but with a total of about 1.5 hours it was useless. Now I have to locate another wand. I purchased this because it appeared to be a great value compared to my last electric from Koersher (SP sorry)

reviews.review_header: AR limits what you can do by having manufacture specific fittings unlike every other pressure washer on the market....
reviews.review_text: Works great if you only have to use the supplied hose, but don't bother buying the AR North America extension wand as it does not have compatible fitting and cannot find any combination of hoses or fittings to make it work. Multiple trips to multiple Lowe's and Home Depots across town. Just a waste of time and money if you need to reach anything over 10-12 feet, like my 35' tall side of the house... Edit: Oh and terrible customer service.

reviews.review_header: Good, but could use a little improvment
reviews.review_text: I bought this after retiring an 1800 psi Karcher power washer that served me well, right up to the day it dies. While this only has 100 psi more then my Karcher did, it seemed to be a bit more powerful. It actually removed some stuff that the Karcher missed. I've had this about a month, but this weekend was its first major workout. I bought this with the Deck, Patio & Flat Surface Cleaner, which was a big time save. I have about 2000 sq feet of concrete and textured concrete, in south Florida. It requires power washing every 3-4 months. the Deck, Patio & Flat Surface Cleaner was a big time saver. I did not experience many of the issue that other have covered in their reviews, but then I have different issues of my own. Mine does not leak where the hose connects, though I did buy the female to female connector that every one mentioned. Also, I have found that the plastic tube/hose that goes to the gun rolls quite nicely onto the integrated reel. My complaints are the location of the connector for the plastic tube/hose that goes to the gun. Whomever thought that was a good place to put the metal connector on the body of the power washer needs to actually use it. Because it is buried amongst the plastic that hold the cord and accessories, it is very difficult to undo. The second is a complaint is one I have about most all power washers. Include a trigger lock. When you are power washing for 6-8 hours, depressing a trigger ends up being a very sore experience. You will hurt while you are doing it and for hours after you are done. Please, please, please, give me a trigger lock.

reviews.review_header: Great Customer Service Bumps up the Rating
reviews.review_text: Cleans siding, rock walls, cars, wood furniture, PVC decking and other typical tasks well. I bought several extensions direct from the manufacturer($6 each, much less than here) to try the gutters. There are lots of attachments available... bought a floor cleaner as well, but haven't used it yet. But the gutters - with all those attachments (~5 of them for my raised ranch), when you pull the trigger, it flexes and blasts the wand backward, out of the gutter. You simply cannot control it. This was the reason I purchased the unit. Unless your gutters are almost within reach, you probably cannot clean them with this. However, on all the other tasks I've listed above, it performed very well. This may be the best electric pressure washer there is, but you still might want to go with gas. I've been thinking of giving this one to my dad and going with a gas unit. Yes, more maintenance, noisy, smelly, but saving $100-$200 a year on gutter cleaning might make me do it. I just don't do ladders. On a side note, I backed my truck into the unit and cracked the connection between the unit and the hose (the blue piece that clips on the plastic piece that threads onto the unit - the quick connect coupling). I called AR and they shipped me a new one, plus the additional clear piece I didn't even need, free of charge. And as I said before, buying accessories direct from them is quite affordable, possibly beating everyone else, depending on the piece. I can't do 5 stars due to the lack of gutter cleaning, but it is a 4 for the product, 4.5 with the great customer service and good manufacturer standing behind the unit.

reviews.review_header: Makes you want to pressure wash everything in sight
reviews.review_text: This is my first pressure washer so I can't really compare it to much but this thing rocks. I almost rented one from Home Depot right before i got this but the equipment rental dude was a jerk and acted like I was a complete moron for wanting to use an electric washer for my wood deck. It might not have the power of a gas one but honestly I wouldn't want much more power than this thing has for fear of damaging the surface. I also used it on my concrete patio and it worked like a charm.

reviews.review_header: Works as promised and excellent customer service
reviews.review_text: I purchased this pressure washer to clean my fence and the kid's play set. The pressure washer was strong enough to clean both and I was very happy with my purchase. After 6 months however the unit would not pressurize anymore. The pump would turn on, water would come out, but no pressure. After troubleshooting the issue via the phone with customer care they offered to send me a new unit. The new unit arrived promptly and I have been happy with this unit ever since. Great customer service from AR North America!

This unit gives great power at a sensible price, I previously owned a Karcher and this beats it hands down. The unit was easy to assemble on arrival but whilst the storage reel is a nice feature I do find it did awkward to use and therefore resort to coiling the gun hose into one of my buckets. When I do use the reel it does hold everything nice and tidy. I do imagine that someone might find connecting the gun hose a little tricky due to its location on the back at the bottom but since it does not need to be too tight it shouldn't be too big an issue. All in all I am pleased I bought this unit and expect many seasons of use from it.

reviews.review_header: Cleans just about everything. Love it.
reviews.review_text: Does the job. I have cleaned my patio furniture, truck, car, porches. Pay attention to what you are doing while operating the washer. It is a powerful stream of water coming out of this so be careful just how close you get to whatever you're washing. Makes no noise until the trigger is pulled. The instructions state to not use regular outdoor extension cords. If you absolutely need an extension cord, buy a heavy duty one. Pricey but washer will not run with regular cords. I recommend this product.

I was in the market for a pressure washer to do some general clean up around the house in preparation for putting it on the market. The house has vinyl siding, concrete walks and is heavily shaded, meaning that everything gets a greenish-black layer of moss/mildew from lack of sun. I also own a boat, a fifth wheel camper and a couple of cars which are always in need of spruce up, so there's no lack of work for a good pressure washer. Previously, I owned a Honda-powered Karcher washer that did a great job, but was bulky, heavy, noisy and a hassle in general. I decided that I wanted an electric and the AR383 seemed to fit the bill with fairly high pressure and being self-contained. The unboxing experience was outstanding. The actual product package was outer-boxed in a plain cardboard container, which doesn't need to be removed in order to open the inner package. Next, the packaging and product components were "stacked" inside the box. This is nice because the parts can be removed individually and set aside without worrying everything falling apart as you pull stuff out of the box. Bubble wrap was at a minimum and there is almost no tape (often, everything is taped together and then slipped into the box, which makes for a frustrating assembly process). Assembly is easy and simply enough to be shown (with actual photos and very good drawings) on just a couple of pages. The descriptions are decent with good English (the manual is multi-language, but I can't comment on any of the others). The plastic is of decent quality and only a phillips screwdriver is needed (there's a total of five screws that attach the tool holders). It was getting late, but I wanted to try the beast out, anyway. Being an electric, I assumed the unit would be fairly quiet and I wasn't disappointed. The unit only runs when the trigger is pulled, excluding a brief period when you first flip the switch to pressurize the wand line (A word to the wise, turn your water on before you turn the pump on and squeeze the trigger to purge any air in your hoses or pump. This ensures that the pump does not run "dry" as most of the pumps use the water for cooling and lubrication during operation). I cleaned a section of my deck, a concrete slab of about 100 square feet (10x10), a section of siding and a short length of mildew-infested gutter. The jet nozzle has a very tight pattern and works well in expansion joints and really tough dirt (probably good for paint removal, etc, also). The rotary nozzle is a spinning flat jet that works wonders on normal dirt and my ever-present mildew and moss. For most of what I worked on, holding the spray tip about six to eight inches from the surface produced a three or four inch wide pattern that is strong enough to clear everything down to the underlying surface. I did not work with the detergent bottle at all. All in all, I'm happy with the performance. Longevity is yet to be seen, but based on the visible quality, I'm confident that this machine will provide good non-commercial service.

reviews.review_header: Good pressure washer with decent attachments
reviews.review_text: Good pressure washer with decent attachments. Wish they were not plastic - I worry when they will snap and break. The washer works well most, but with some occassional hiccups. For example, if you press the trigger and immediately release, so on-off-on (obviously by accident not on purpose) the washer pump would not turn on-off-on. You have to let go of the trigger wait for 10 secs and turn on again. Similarly, sometimes you wouldnt get much pressure. You just have to stop everything, wait a min, and then try again and everything works. Not sure why, but seems to be design issue. But still, for the price, great overall pressure washer.I used it on my deck to strip out the old layer

reviews.review_header: THIS machine is awesome. It is amazing what it meas to pull ...
reviews.review_text: I tell you what; after 12 years of pulling the cord to crank the pw after it runs out of gas, which it does over and over....THIS machine is awesome. It is amazing what it meas to pull the trigger and have it on, let it go and do something, like move a chair, squeeze and back on. WHY did I wait so long!! I have already PW'd 3 big houses, and wow. There are some things I do not like: the trigger is too hard to squeeze, and it is so sensitive, if you slack it goes off. The roll up wheel is a pia. I just wind it around the lower thing. The hose adapter, quick couple, is well you must be too careful as it will snap!! I wish I had a dozen of them, OR one in brass, hey that's an idea.... Anyway worth the money, sell all gas pw's, and clean on! Katie

I have owned and used a 5 HP gas powerwasher for over 12 years, which has worked fine. It got to be too much of a problem transporting it between 2 homes. I read the reviews of owners of the AR Blue Clean AR383 1,900 PSI unit offered by Amazon.com, and decided to purchase it. First, the leakage problem refered to by one owner, is no longer a problem, as the manufacturer has changed the design and now includes a quick connect coupler,(garden hose to the unit) which includes a see through conector that contains a water filter. (neat idea) Other nice features: the high pressure hose has a quick disconnect from the Gun (handle), which makes dealing with the stiff high pressure hose easier to coil and store. The adjustable spray nozzle is a must when considering a pressure washer purchase, as some units offer 3 or 4 different nozzle tips, that you must stop to change, when you encounter different cleaning procedures. With this adjustable nozzle you can go from a pencil point spray, (which by the way is great for knocking down wasps nests) to a fan spray, by simply rotating the end nozzle. The biggest surprise, however, is the "Turbo nozzle" This nozzle seems to add so much cleaning power to the unit. What is easily noticeable is the area it covers while cleaning. With a fan spray you can only clean, by moving the fan forward and back, which cleans the width of the fan spray. The turbo nozzle, works more like a flashlight beam. It cleans a circular area, and therefore you can go back and forth, side to side, or even in a circular motion. The unit includes a nice accessory holder to store all the components. It has a built in hose reel for the high pressure hose, but because the hose has a ridged connector at each end, it is difficult to wind it on to the built in reel. I just coil it and loop it around the handle. I received this unit in 3 business days, with no shipping cost. This unit is a great bargain!

I got my AR383, unboxed it, and immediately put it to the test cleaning my much neglected paver patio driveway that was being over run with weeds. I tried cleaning with the adjustable nozzle at first, and, while it did a good job cleaning the pavers, it struggled with removing the weeds. Not impressed, I decided to switch to the turbo nozzle. The turbo nozzle tore through those weeds like a hot knife through butter! And, it did a good job with cleaning the pavers. Lesson learned -- use the proper nozzle for the job. Some other thoughts -- the power was adequate for home use -- not overpowered or underpowered. Between the length of the electric cord and hose, the range was more than adequate. I read a lot of bad feedback on the plastic quick release. Personally, I loved that feature. Very easy to connect and not a drop of leakage. Either AR Blue fixed the problem, or I just haven't had the unit long enough to experience any problems. I can see the potential to damage the quick release, since it's made of plastic, if you're not careful when moving the unit with the hose connected. If the hose comes in at an angle, it could put pressure on the quick release and cause problems. The only minor criticism that I have of the product is the design of the hose reel. My previous pressure washer's hose was connected directly through the reel, so when you weren't using it, you simply wind the reel and you're done. With the AR Blue, the hose doesn't connect directly to the reel. When you store it, you disconnect the hose from the machine, connect the front of the hose (the end that connects to the gun) to the reel and wind it up. Not a major headache, but from a design point of view, it isn't as seamless. Since I've only used this product once, I can't comment on its durability. So far, though, I am happy with the purchase and would recommend. ** Just an update after using this item 3 times over the past 3 months. Everything still holds true in my original post. I washed my pavers again today, and, again, it did a great job. One thing that I found that I really don't like about the design of the product is where the hose connects to the back of the machine. The connection is a little too close to the area where you wrap the cord. It's hard to get a firm grip to twist the hose on. And, for some reason, I couldn't thread the hose connector on for the life of me. I ultimately sprayed some WD-40 on the connector and it helped a lot. I've always been very careful not to mis-thread the connector, so that wasn't the problem. By no means is this a deal breaker. It's still an excellent product. It just needs some slight design tweaking to give it 5 stars.

reviews.review_header: Just a GREAT Little Pressure Washer!
reviews.review_text: This pressure washer exceeded my expectations. As a previous owner of a gas-powered 2700 PSI unit I expected performance just a bit above a hose with a pressure nozzle. My primary need was to clean sidewalks in my retirement community. On-line reviews lead me to believe this was a good unit but it has performed much better than anticipated. The attachments all proved useful and the included wands provided a good range of cleaning patterns and pressure for everything from cleaning grimy plastic light fixtures (back off if you don't want them to appear sand-blasted) to screens -- and those sidewalks. I have read advice to replace the plastic hose coupler with a brass unit and I'm sure that might be better for heavier or more frequent use. But over two different periods of use, exceeding 3-4 hours each, I have not had any issues with leaks. The wind-up hose storage and place to wrap the cord make for a compact storage footprint. Comment from neighbors wife (hubby had used a lower-powered electric) "what did you put on your sidewalk - it came out a lot whiter?" I had just used water. Hopefully I will be this happy with the unit a year from now but considering local HD wants about $100 to rent a unit for a few hours and a contractor wanted $150 to do what I have done in about 4-5 hours it will pay for itself if it lasts a year -- and then some --- sweet!

reviews.review_header: Probably the best you'll find in a cheap washer
reviews.review_text: I've tried several different electric washers (Karcher, Lowes and Harbor Freight) and they were all junk and ceased working within a very short period of time. I bought this unit about six months ago, have used it extensively and so far, no issues. A couple of minor problem mentioned by others: Lack of a quick disconnect - they simply are not available in this size (15mm) for the pressure side of the unit. The supply side takes a standard quick connect garden hose fitting. The pressure hose reel - worthless. I would have much rather they turned it into a cord reel which might actually serve a purpose. Far easier to just wrap everything around the machine. Pressure. Every washer I've used is overrated as to PSI and this one is no exception. I think they measure these with the wand set on pinpoint, which you would never use. Once you open it up to a fan pattern, it probably has dropped off to about 1000psi (or less). However, it did get somewhat more powerful as it got broken in. It's satisfactory for light washing, any heavy duty and you will want a gas washer anyway. Detergent system. Frankly, it's a pain to have to fill and install a separate bottle for the cleaner. Other systems manage to use either a siphon or have an onboard tank that is connected to the wand so that you just change the wand setting to dispense detergent. If the manufacturer can correct these relatively minor annoyances, it will become a five star product. UPDATE: 07/15/2013. Well, the unloader valve finally gave up the ghost on this machine, much like it has on every inexpensive electric pressure washer I've ever owned. It starts but pulsing on and off when you've released the trigger and eventually progresses to the point where it won't shut off at all. Still, two years of fairly heavy use is about all that can really be expected unless you spend a lot more than this or stick with a gas powered pressure washer from someone like Honda (my Honda 3000 psi is now thirteen years old and still works flawlessly but it was over $1500). I suspect if you only use this a few times a year, store it properly (drained and not in freezing temps), it will last a long time. I used mine almost weekly to powerwash cars, driveways, siding etc.. Still left it at 4 stars because it's about the best electric in this price range.

reviews.review_header: Does what it said it would do
reviews.review_text: When my Karcher died I did my couple of hrs of my usual research comparing online and in the stores. I did not want the hassle of maintaining a gas washer so I went electric again. I was going through my book with all my old manuals and found the Karcher receipt- ~15 ½ years ago I paid $179+ and this unit I paid $149 and got 200PSI more. I have had no issues others have mentioned. I was going to buy the brass coupler based on others reviews about leaking but decided to wait and see. The product was delivered in about 3 days and the shipping was free. I used it to wash my siding and pavers. I used this for three consecutive days about 6hrs each day with maybe a 15 min break each day. No motor overheating or burning up and no leaks. Wand hose attachment instead of at the butt end is forward of the trigger which helps with the balance and lessened wrist and arm fatigue. Wand is much lighter than my old Karcher 330M unit which died a couple of hrs into my work. I would have power washed more around the house but it's getting too cold here. I agree about the hose reel, too tight just drape it over the handle in a loose coil. It's like those garden hose reels people buy and then wonder why they bought them, it never works right and not worth the time and effort to coil it up. No idea why the wheels, way too low to wheel by the handle unless it's a child pulling it along. Make the handle extendable and now you're talking. Light enough to pick it up walk. Over all a good product which performed great. I would recommend to a fried to buy. I hope it lasts as long as my old one.

reviews.review_header: Jury Is Still Out; Jury Now In (See UPDATE)
reviews.review_text: Purchased item to pressure wash old stain off our deck. The jury is still out. Cleaned some areas well, others not so well. Only used for a couple of hours, so need to try at different angles, wand nozzle adjustments, and distance from wood for a more thorough testing of effectiveness. The unit is very quiet, the hose connectors easy to use and leak free, and did not have to move the unit thanks to the 20 foot hose. UPDATE: Pressure washer worked very well once I got the correct spray fan and distance to the surface. Made the wood look like new! I highly recommend it!

reviews.review_header: you get what you pay for.
reviews.review_text: Have used only a couple of times since purchasing the pressure washer. The assembly was easy enough. As noted in other reviews I read prior to purchasing, the hose reel in trouble to use probably due to the stiffness of the hose itself. The plastic connector is just plain cheap and I worried about it snapping off during use. The company was to send me another replacement after I purchased the $10 metric brass hose connector from them, but so far I haven't received that replacement part. The pressure washer did fine on the few small jobs I have tried so far. I have used it more than 45 minutes at a time however. It motor cycles quietly. I would have given it at least a 4 if the connectors were not made of plastic. I tried to find brass connectors to replace the cheap plastic one, but so far have not had any luck.

I just bought this and have only used it one weekend, so I can't vouch for any longevity yet. But so far I am very pleased with it. I used it for a full weekend pressure cleaning my fences, and it did an excellent job - the fence looks brand new. I had it going steadily for about 12 hours total and it had no problems keeping up. The one thing I will say is that the 'special' turbo wand that is supposed to be good at stripping didn't work nearly as well as the regular blade-shape sprayer. It did have a problem with my deck - I guess the combination of a horizontal surface with years of neglect are too much for 1900 psi. I'll have to rent a gas unit for that I think. I guess there's a limitation to what these electric washers can do, but I'd buy a 3000 psi from AR Blue in a flash if they had one.

Ordered this as an xmas gift. Received in an outer plain cardboard box which I removed and wrapped the retail box in xmas paper. there was no damage to either box. delivered the gift but didn't open the factory box until May. Found that the 2 piece handle was broken. Found out, several months too late, that Amazon has a 30 day return policy. Contacted the company and received a replacement with no questions asked, other than the order receipt. Lesson learned: check your order in case you don't get a responsive business, amazon doesn't care after 30 d.ays. the washer itself seems to work well but is cumbersome with the hose and power cord coming from the front and back respectively. can't really roll the machine around and things tend to get tangled. it does seem to have good pressure/ the spray bottle for cleaners is small in my opinion depending on the size of what youre using it for. had to refill 4 times for the metal house roof, guess that's not so bad. synopsis: open the box and check for damage. thanks AR Blue for the replacement, no thanks to amazon

Read all reviews before buying and decide majority was positive so thought I'd give it a try. Glad I did. The product is light weight, easy for a small woman to handle, it is on wheels and the attachments fit nicely on the unit itself. It comes with two different spray handles each with adjustable ends which I would think could handle any type of spraying that is needed. Also has spray bottle attachment.It stands upright so it fits nicely against the wall. The pressure is excellent and what is really nice is that by releasing the trigger the water pressure will automatically decrease to a softer spray. In our old machine we had to adjust the spray heads each time. The increase and decrease is easily done by engaging the trigger. We cleaned a two story deck and gazebo and the machine handled very well. Easy to set up, easy to put away. As homeowners we feel this machine can certainly handle our deck, concrete, fencing and all jobs in cleaning that are necessary to use a pressure washer. We like the machine, the electrical cord is long, the hose is also long and sufficient to the jobs as needed. Cons: As stated by others we will not take the time to roll up the hose unless storing for sometime. It's kind of awkward to roll and the space to roll into is tight. The hose is a stiff rubber I would not call it plastic as someone stated an it does tangle but has not been a concern since we straighten it out before we started.The more we used the unit the more flexible the hose became and less stiff. We can see the more we use it the stiffness is disappearing. The plastic adapter at first I just snapped it in the blue piece an attached it and it did leak slightly. However I noticed on the blue plastic that there were arrows so I pulled back the blue piece, then attached the cone shape and snapped it in and the unit has not leaked. Bottom line even if we were to have any issues with this plastic adapter we would have no problem replacing it because everything else handles so well. We would recommend it. It's a nice machine for the price.

We purchased this particular pressure washer based on internet reviews and, in particular, good comments about AR North America's (ARNA) customer service. The comments concerning leakage at the inlet hose connector were bothering, but later reviewers indicated that that problem had been mitigated. The unit we received came with an instruction manual referencing both the old-style "barrel" connector and the now-shipping quick-disconnect adapter. Upon assembly with the QD connector, we did get a fair amount of leakage. An email to ARNA's customer support was answered quickly with both instructions (essentially make sure it is tightened properly) and an offer to send a replacement if the leakage continued. As others have noted, the inlet port on the unit is slightly recessed, making it a bit difficult to tighten things. In addition, the QD connector is plastic, so there is the fear of breaking it with excessive tightening. A metal QD adapter would be a nice upgrade for ARNA to consider. Our solution was to purchase a package of rubber hose replacement washers (plastic may work also) and put one in each piece of the QD connector (these in addition to the washers already there). The end result is that there are now essentially no leaks. The additional washers make it easier to tighten both the connector to the unit and the hose to the connector. In the relatively brief time we have had the unit (a few weeks now), it has performed very well. The motor shut-off when the wand trigger is released is nice, though one should be sure to purge the water supply hose of air since that may cause the unit to cycle (and, air in the line is probably not good for the pump). Cleaning performance is good for the size unit and is certainly well within our expectations. Storage for the pressure hose and power cord is not the unit's strong point (also as noted by others). The solution we implemented involves a ratcheted plastic "cord clamp" which is large enough in diameter to go around both the coiled pressure hose and power cord and secure them to the unit's handle. This also makes them very easy to deploy when using the unit. These clamps are generally available at big-box home stores. Overall, we are quite pleased with the unit so far.

reviews.review_header: Just what they said...GREAT little machine...Update
reviews.review_text: UPDATE 6/6/13: AFTER USING THIS MACHINE FOR A COUPLE WEEKS, PRETTY HEAVY USE, THE MACHINE CYCLES AFTER RELEASING THE TRIGGER. RUNS FOR A SECOND, STOPS FOR 3 TO 5 SECONDS, RUNS FOR A SECOND...ETC. LIKE IT HAS THE HICCUPS. WHILE PRESSURE WASHING IT STILL WORKS AS IT SHOULD, WITH GOOD PRESSURE. AR CUSTOMER SERVICE WAS GREAT. ONE RING AND A HUMAN ANSWERS...AND HE TALKS ENGLISH. QUICKLY IDENTIFIED THE PROBLEM AND ADVISES THE UNIT BE RETURNED. APPARENT INTERNAL LEAK...VERY RARE. AMAZON RETURN PROCEDURE IS AMAZINGLY SIMPLE AND STRAIGHT FORWARD. THEY HAVE A REPLACEMENT ON THE WAY ALREADY. FREE SHIPPING ON THE RETURN, AND ALSO THE REPLACEMENT. COULDN'T BE BETTER. Easy set up. Good quick start guide. All that is needed is 15 minutes and a #2 Phillips. A tip...when first setting it up, spread a small film of petroleum jelly on all the "O" rings. Makes it much easier to connect/disconnect lances, detergent bottle and HP hose to gun. And helps keep "O" rings from leaking and in good shape. After buying and returning a Campbell Hausfield 1835 (died after 2 hours), I purchased this AR 383. It is smaller, quieter, more powerful, $20 more expensive. But most importantly this one stays working. Leak free...No leaks what-so-ever. The plastic quick connect works great. The two wands work well and are easy to attach to the gun. All attachments mount on board. The roller will work for electrical cord or the high pressure hose. Although it is easier just to coil them up and place over the handle on the machine. I actually like the separate detergent bottle attachment. You can fill it with any kind of solution and not worry about clogging the pump. And make the solution as strong as you want...with no worries. The machines dilution rate is 10:1. So it sprays 10 parts water to one part bottle solution. So you want to dilute the bottle detergent to avoid using too much detergent. Great for car, motorcycle, dirt bike washes, Siding, driveway, concrete, paint removal, lawnmower decks, charcoal grills. Yesterday I washed our 38 foot RV in about an hour. Without this machine it takes a lot longer. Machine is just the right amount of power. Not too much as to cause damage...like a gas job...but strong enough to do what you need it for. Not many things I would recommend as highly.

reviews.review_header: I was very disappointed in the quality and function of this product
reviews.review_text: I was very disappointed in the quality and function of this product. After reading previous reviews I felt it would meet my expectations for use by me or my wife. I am fairly competent in home repairs but after looking at the plastic she'll and struggling for over forty-five minutes trying to attach the sprayer hose to the plastic storage compartment I realized that this washer probably was going to be a liability. I spent about $20 more and purchased a heavier gauge metal machine which is much easier to use and much better quality. I would not recommend this product to anyone.

I've been renting pressure washers for years, primarily to clean a large parking cement slab in front of my house. Given that my last rental experience was lousy, I decided to go online to find out if there was a washer that I afford. Just when I thought I had exhausted the possibilities, Amazon popped up with an ad for AR Blue. Given the $150 price, I immediately thought it would not last very long, nor would it be able to do the jobs I needed done. However, because of the number of positive ratings, I decided to take a chance and buy it. To date I've used it to clean the parking slab as well as the public street area around my house. In each case, it readily handled the jobs, some taking 3-4 continuous hours of cleaning. It did far better than I expected, and as good as I had hoped for. It took a little bit to get used to the lengthy cords, and I do have a concern about the wear-ability of the plastic nozzles...I'll just have to wait and see if my concern is warranted...I doubt it, however. I would definitely recommend the AR Blue Pressure Washer.

I was torn on whether I was going to give this four stars or five. The pressure isn't fantastic (four stars), but it's good, and for the price it's great. Since I believe the rating should take into account overall value, I'm going to go with five stars. I orginally bought an Earthwise PWO2200 2,000 psi 1.6 gpm Electric Pressure Washer and it was a miserable experience. It worked but was wonky and then eventually just blew itself apart (somewhat literally, but mostly figuratively). I decided to give this Blue Clean washer a try instead and am very happy with it. The pressure isn't as high as the Earthwise was, but it's close and this one has been working reliably for me for quite a while now (I've had it for about a year now). This one is lighter and a little smaller than the Earthwise so it's easier for me to move around. Cleaning my entire driveway, walkway and patio area takes an afternoon. I wish it cleaned faster than that, but for the price and ease of maintenance I just can't complain. My one real complaint is with the cord and wand storage. The holder that's included just doesn't do the job of holding everything very well. It's not a huge problem, but it does suck to have things falling out of their holders when I move it and they get jostled around. Still, I think it's a great value for the price and convenience. Update May 2014: Several years on we're still using this washer and it's still working as well as it did at the start. We routinely wash our patio and sidewalks with it and once or twice a year we clean the driveway and wooden outdoor furniture. It's been great for getting winter gunk off the hammock in the spring, and we've even used the jet setting to shoot down some hornets nests way up high. Excellent value!

The instructions are in need of a do-over! But I did manage to put it together. The caddy for the attachments is great except for one thing, the cord! Things over lap, so you have to figure out the best way to wrap up the cord. The washer itself works well. The trigger handle (part that is blue in picture of the wand) is sort of touchy. Once your hand gets tired, you want to relax your grip a bit, thus shutting off the stray. At that point you must release all pressure on the handle and start over again. The unit is light weight and easy to move around with enough pressure to do most jobs. I personally think it could use more power when using the soup unit, which is under-sized for me. I have high hopes that this power washer will last for more than one season. I have used other brands that haven't made it through ONE season, so with the rating that the Internet gave this unit, I purchased the AR Blue Clean unit. If this does not hold up through the rest of the season, I will let you know.

reviews.review_header: Another complaint is that the pressure washer hose attach to the gun does not wind up in the cradle like it shows in the photo
reviews.review_text: This pressure washer comes with many complaints and annoyances. First off, the connection nozzle leading from the pressure washer to the hose leaks badly. I've done a lot of research on it and yes it is connected correctly. The connection just doesn't have a strong seal. Another complaint is that the pressure washer hose attach to the gun does not wind up in the cradle like it shows in the photo. The tubing is so thick/hard that it does not bend and the plastic winder is so cheap that it cannot force the tubing to wrap around it. This pressure washer also does not have a lock on the handle. If you're pressure washing a long sidewalk or a large deck, your hand begins to cramp holding the handle down for long periods of time. It would be more convenient to have a locking mechanism in place so you didn't have to clamp the handle down for long jobs.

reviews.review_header: Surprisingly great quality and works well
reviews.review_text: Surprisingly great quality and works well. I have used it to clean a car as well as caked on mud from a concrete patio and it has worked very well. The hoses and nozzles are easy to put together and interchange. The Soap canister that it has is just for spaying the solution onto whatever you are going to clean, it comes out like spray foam. It does not come out with any significant force. The only downside to this use is the amount that the adapter for the hose sticks out from the unit. I have NOT had any part of this unit break or leak, but I feel that this is the most vulnerable part of the unit as you are pulling on the hose and the machine is stationary. It is easy to tip over and bump or bang the adapter. So far I am not having any trouble with mine.

reviews.review_header: Finally, a power washer that I can use!
reviews.review_text: After struggling with gasoline engine power washers for the past dozen years, I finally gave up and bought an electric one. Many people advised me that I would not like it because it wouldn't have enough power to clean my decks and outdoor furniture. They were wrong! I LOVE this little machine, and it's so easy to use that I am cleaning everything around the house and yard. It starts with a flip of a switch, it has plenty of power, and it's no noisier than my vacuum cleaner....all in all, it's a great purchase! The only glitch that I had with the power washer was a leak where the garden hose hooks to the machine. The plastic part that was in the box was cheap and unusable. I happened to have a short F/F hose (I think from an old washing machine), so I use that instead and now I have no more leaks! The instructions say not to use an extension cord with it, because it will cause the motor to overheat and burn out. This limitation would limit its usefulness, so I did a little online research and found that I can use a heavy duty (12-3) extension cord, as long as it's not over 50' in length. I ordered one from Amazon and used it today. It worked fine!

reviews.review_header: High quality machine saves a lot of time
reviews.review_text: I've used the AR383 for a couple of months now, and so far it's been great! I haven't had an issue with overloading the circuits that others have discussed. I used it to blast the oxidized varnish off my front porch, which I then stained, and it now looks great. Then I went nuts with it: cleaned my outside sheds, my back deck, and our plastic kiddie pool. Then I used the fan sprayer to wash our cars. What a difference! Didn't use any soap - just the water, then a towel and a chamois. What used to take about 50 minutes got reduced to 25 minutes, including the time it takes to get the unit, assemble it, disassemble it, and put it away. My neighbor was so impressed, he went out and bought one too. I'd actually like to give this 4 1/2 stars. The only quibbles I have are that the wands don't snap in to the holder securely and the hose is a little challenging to get on and off the reel. Overall, I'm sorry I waited so long to get one.

reviews.review_header: it is NOT easy to handle and it does NOT produce enough pressure ...
reviews.review_text: After reading the reviews Amazon provided I thought this would be an ideal product to clean my deck.....it is NOT easy to handle and it does NOT produce enough pressure to clean even an easy job like my deck which was recently painted so it was not very dirty. Unfortunately I waited to long to open the box and use it so now I can NOT return it which I definitely would if I was in the right time frame. So I will probably give it away to someone who does not want a very good product. I definitely will NOT buy this type of product on Amazon ever again!!

reviews.review_header: Find a better option than this one
reviews.review_text: I bought this in 2012. From the start it made a loud screechy noise every time it started up. I contacted customer service and they told me that I had a 90 day warranty, so just to use it and if it died I could return it. Of course it didn't die in the 90 days. So, yes it did last 3 years. When I got it out for this season the gun is leaking. It has always been stored in a heated area. Have had issues with it building enough pressure. In short, I would call it junk. I had another electric pressure washer prior to this that lasted about 7 years with no issues. Keep looking.

reviews.review_header: It Packs a Punch and Gets it Clean
reviews.review_text: Just power washed my entire house. I have brick in many areas and I could get right up against it in a fine jet. It cleaned everything up with great pressure. It is also light enough to just be used as a source to blow grass and leaves away. Finally, I used it to totally clean interlocking floor pads. Some use these in garages. My teaching partner and I use them in our classrooms. They get very dirty, and since they have ridges you can not just scrub them. The AR Blue Clean just took care of all that dirt. I did not even need much soap; just the power of the water. Cool. Thanks AR. I hope this helps someone. It's not expensive, and you DON'T need a gas power that has more power. This will do it all.

Being my first pressure washer I really can't compare it to any other but even so I love this little beast. I was skeptical at first because as I removed it from the box water started draining from the pressure hose... Not sure if I was given a used or refurbished washer. So far it has cleaned my concrete walkways and removed paint from my concrete porch, in preparations to repaint it. I did notice that if I release the handle, either due to moving over an area quickly that I don't want to wash or to switch hands, that it makes a revving up and down noise with pressure loss. I just have to release again and it's back to normal. PROS: The turbo nozzle makes quick work of just about anything. 25FT hose is nice. Long Power Cord. Super quite compared to my neighbors gas powered washer. Strong power to be 1900PSI. CONS: Pressure hose is stiff. Hose roller is confusing at first and hard but does work.

reviews.review_header: I've had two of these. They are indeed lite ...
reviews.review_text: I've had two of these. They are indeed lite weight and put out as much pressure as could be expected from an electrical washer. Two quibbles are that they have a limited durability, even for homeowner use, and the optional attachments from an earlier production model may not fit on a later purchase.. Trying a new brand.

reviews.review_header: AR is as good as you can buy
reviews.review_text: Ive had this pressure washer for about 18 months and I would not take for it (Texas analogy). After using the big box store electric washers about 6 of them I purchased this unit and it always performs perfectly. Don't be hesitant to buy this pressure washer.

When the person that was to pressure wash our flagstone patio backed out, I decided to do it myself. I did not want to get involved with a gasoline unit but I wanted the best power in an electric model. The only problem that I had with assembly was threading the hose reel. The instructions on this point were not helpful, so I did what other reviewers have done and just wraped the hose to the wand around the top of the unit. Don't worry about the plastic water hose connector; it works fine. There are two wands that you can use. One with a narrow pencil point spray for maximum power and one with a stripe spray for best coverage. I found the latter the most useful because the pencil point spray covers such a small area that it would take forever to clean a large area. Some other brands come with changeable nozzles which would be nice. Nevertheless, the wide wand removed about 90% of the mold on the patio which had not been cleaned for 5 years. The difference was amazing! I then used it on my aluminum siding which had dirt and algae on it. Again, it worked great on the first floor sections. The second floor sections did not have much algae so I was satisfied with what it did, but others may want a more powerful sprayer for two stories. I then washed my car without having to bend over. It worked as well as any car wash in that it took off the dirt and bird spots but left tar. Again, I was satisfied. The unit had already paid for itself.

This is a decent unit for the price. I was able to use my Gardenia quick-connect on the provided adapter without any leaking . There were no leaks anywhere. It is a pain to disconnect the detergent bottle and attach the turbo wand every so often but I think I knew that. Just did not give that a second thought before the purchase. A built in bottle with an adjustable wand (between soap and turbo) would have been great. The unit also needs a higher handle for us tall people but this is not that big of a deal. The hose is rather unflexible when trying to put back on the reel. The machine did a nice job of cleaning dirt and moss up from sidewalks and driveways but oil and rust stains are still visible. After looking at all the reviews for hours on other machines, this was the best machine for the money. Now that the job is complete and all this has been said, Yes, I would recommend and purchase this again because the unit did what it was suppose to without any major errors. Now, time to watch a ballgame.

reviews.review_header: Excellent product for light household cleaning
reviews.review_text: My wife had me order and assemble this item for her use. She didn't want to deal with the weight and operational challenges of our gasoline powered 2700 psi pressure washer. The AR383 was a good compromise and she is, "Thrilled with it." after using it for cleaning rubber mats, wood walls, and concrete floors in her stable. I assembled and set it up, ready to run in about 20 minutes. The plastic wands seem a bit light duty to me, but they worked well and installed in the pressure handle with minimal leakage. Like other users, I don't think much of the plastic, quick-lock fitting for the water hose connection, but it does contain a filter which would help prevent clogs in the nozzle. After working with the connection for a while, we were able to get it to stop leaking. It is indeed nice not to have to add gasoline, start and stop a noisy gas motor....it is very easy to plug it in, hook up water, turn it on and go...just don't expect it to do the job of an industrial pressure washer. Cannot address the durability since it has been used only about 10 hours. On the other hand, many household chores are overdone with a high pressure washer: vinyl siding is easily scarred, wood decks are ruined, window screens are bent and concrete actually eroded by high pressure sprayers when the operator is not careful. This unit works great on everything you can reach from arm's length and washes it very well. Easy to use, easy to set up, does the job of a light/medium duty washer...reasonable price.

I am absolutely thrilled with this little gem. Due to my husband's major back surgery it is now up to me to do the normal maintenance jobs around the house. Since I am unable to handle the large gas powered pressure washer that we have (and we won't talk about the maintenance they require that I know absolutely nothing about) I went looking for a unit that I am able to handle. After reading the reviews I decided to give this a try. Was I ever pleased. The AR383 is perfect for me. It goes together so easily and it gets the job done. I no longer have green siding on the house in some spots, it's white again! Not as powerful as the gas pressure washer but I am truly pleased with my purchase.

Works pretty well but takes a long time to do a driveway or sidewalk. It struggles to hold pressure right after you start working with it, I think because of the air from the water hose, but when it gets going, it does a good job. I've got about 24 hours on it so far, cleaning siding, fences and concrete, but it's not made too sturdy, so I expect it to quit any time. Works well with the plastic hose connector or the aftermarker brass one. Best bang for your buck.

Unfortunately due to some serious medical issues with a couple of family members I didn't get a chance to test this out until just after a month of receiving it. It will not power up, no matter what I do..reset, change outlets, etc. etc. So I am stuck with a machine that without power gives only a light spray of water that is far less than if I just use the regular sprayer on the hose, which is seriously sad and a total waste of money. Make sure you test this out right away, and use it often to make sure it doesn't have any defects.

I am not very good at putting things together and I only like things that work easily like they are supposed to - and this fits the bill! I used this to power wash my house and it worked great - not as much power as my old gas driven model, but pretty darn good. Light weight and blanced so it was easy for me to maneuver it. Cleaned all the caked on grease off my grill so it now looks brand new - this was a great purchase! It feels well bit and based on other reviews I ordered a brass fitting (unfortunately I ordered the one that was linked on this page (Nelson Industrial Brass Pipe and Hose Fitting with Dual Swivel for Male Hose to Male Hose, Double Female 50574 ) and it didn't fit but so far no problems with the fitting that comes with the washer. I have used it three different times now and each time I like it better than the last because it is so easy to pull out and set up...

I thought I would notice more of a difference between this and my 1300 psi Husky (Home Depot) blaster. It wasn't very noticeable at all. The little reel shown in the picture for rolling up the (stiff) high pressure hose? Ha! It would have to be about 140 degrees outside before the hose would wind up that tight.

reviews.review_header: GOOD: *Reasonable Price - Overall great product for the ...
reviews.review_text: GOOD: *Reasonable Price - Overall great product for the price *Powerful - Lives up to the 1900 PSI claim. I accidentally carved a line in some soft stone on my wall! Easily stripped a layer off my wood fence so I could refinish it. *Light-weight BAD: *Storage management - It does come with a clip to store the attachments, but they always seem to fall off, and the clip itself pops off occasionally. The hose reel doesn't quite work very well. I ended up not using the reel at all. SUMMARY: Overall very happy with this. The storage management is a little messier than I'd hope, but not horrible.

I bought this washer mainly to clean my Trex deck, and to clean out cracks in my driveway before filling them. It did both these jobs quite well, and I expect to use it soon to clean cars and boats, too. There is plenty of power. My deck had years of mold and an ugly drip line that I was unable to clean with detergents and a stiff brush, but this washer blasted off all the dirt and easily brought the Trex back to a new look. I never even needed to use the highest pressure wand. In my driveway, I had to be careful to use lower power (wider spray) because the power is so much more than I needed. It might be too small in volume of flow to do, for example, the siding of a house in a reasonable amount of time. However, for jobs the size of a deck, a sidewalk, driveway, car, or boat it's just fine. No need for a bigger washer. It does leak a little bit where the garden hose is attached, but I'm getting everything wet, anyhow. I bought the extra coupling some people suggested, but so far it hasn't been necessary to stop the small leak at the attachment. The instructions have pretty clear pictures of setup, and if you follow them the parts go together ok, with only that one small leak. It's hard to read the written instructions, but the pictures convey the necessary information adequately. Once set up, the washer is simple and easy to use. Bottom line: If you try it, I think you'll like it.

reviews.review_header: Power Washer Did A Great Job!
reviews.review_text: This did a great job for me. I have a huge amount of pavers --a large pool deck, lanai, front driveway and front porch area. This washer has enough pressure to take care of the mess our oak trees make on them. I did need to go to hardware store for a new connector because the one provided did leak. That was the only problem. The only assembly I had to do was attach the holder for the different attachments. Very simple. Yes, it gave me a lot more power than the water hose I used previously to do the job.

I've had this pressure washer for a couple of weeks and have barely given it a rest. I bought it to see if pressure washing my house would alleviate what I thought was the need to have it painted. It did! Is so light, and so powerful. I had a 2000 PSI gas powered washer that died, and wanted to rid myself of the hassles of gas, oil, engine maintenance, etc. This washer has been a dream to work with so far. I've power washed my stucco, soffits, gutters and downspouts, and just today, I did my porch furniture. I've always had to use a bucket of water with soap and bleach, and tons of water from the hose. Today it took 1/4 the time, without the need for any of those. My furniture looks like new. I'm am so pleased. The only hassle is that when you're using it, the three hoses want to get all tied up together...a small price for such a great little machine. I went ahead and bought the the brass hose connector that everyone suggested, and installed it right away without even trying the plastic one that came with the washer. I also bought (at lowes) a connector with a turn off valve so that I didn't have to go to the hose outlet to turn off the water so that I could change wands. It works great too. So far I'm loving it, and searching out more things to clean. It's so easy to use...on, off, done. I'm not using the accessory piece since it looks like more hassle than it's worth. Just looping both the electric cord and the pressure cord and laying them over the top of the machine. I highly recommend this machine for anyone who hates the hassle of gas powered equipment. It's every bit as powerful as my previous gas powered one.

This is what I call a throw away model pressure washer....when I first got it, it worked fine. It's only 2 years old, I have used it maybe 3 times... today it smelled like something burning...stopped, let it cool off, made sure to check the reset at the plug...I think it's burned the motor..... not like I was constantly using it, I stopped every 10 minutes (for me LOL) no motor replacements I noticed...sigh live and learn..you get what you pay for....I could have hired someone to pressure wash 3 times for the cost and trouble of this machine....

I purchased the AR Blue Clean AR383 6 months ago. It worked decently the first time we used it. We went to use it for the seconf time yesterday and the power went out on it. It will not power up at all. Amazon will not let me return it. Very disappointed.

reviews.review_header: Easy to use, hard to store
reviews.review_text: This is my first pressure washer. It's doing a lovely job getting the dirt-pollen-sludge off my deck, even though i've let it build up every winter and bake in every summer for a few years now. It's easy to set up, easy to use, easy to disassemble. The problem is that it's hard to store. The power cord is far longer than the storage on the back allows for, plus you'll take the skin off your knuckles bashing into the hose attachment every time you loop the cord, and it would take some sort of mutant power to get the very rigid hose to actually sit nicely on the reel as shown in the picture. It looks very pretty and stowed in the picture, but in my garage, the cord is looped neatly behind it, and the hose is slung over the handle.

reviews.review_header: Surprising performance - No issues with any of the pieces after 18+ months
reviews.review_text: I've had this for over a year now - and it's a great tool to have when you need it. I use it for sidewalks covered with slimey Pacific Northwest sludge, and it's plenty powerful to work through our entire sidewalk and driveway (4k sq ft?). It seems to be about 10% slower than using the professional (gas) one my neighbor let me borrow before I owned this. The newer host attachment has never leaked - that initial problem is definitely fixed. The pressurized hose attachment is in a horrible spot and I have to patiently use slip-grip pliers to get that on and off. I do wish it came with a taller wand - personal preference, no stars need be deducted for me being extra tall.

1) It is very difficult to get the high pressure hose on and off due to interference from another bracket. I skinned up my knuckles on two occasions trying to thread on the collar. 2) The sprayer wand is in sections. The sections are difficult to join and disassemble. I thought I had the sections joined (I didn't), pulled the trigger and a piece of the wand shot out across my yard. 3) The unit did not put out high pressure spray and would sometimes pulse 4) the instructions are poorly written and the print is sooooo small.

reviews.review_header: AR Blue Clean AR383 Pressure Washer
reviews.review_text: I am happy to report that I have not experienced any leaks after using it twice as some other reviewers have mentioned. This is probably because the connector is different in the new models. There are two things that I really like about this unit. First, it is very easy to purchase accessories such as a new hose or hose connector. Second, I like the fact that the hose disconnects from the unit so that it can be stored during the winter months or easily replaced if needed. Prior to purchasing this unit, I purchased a CleanForce pressure washer from home depot. The pressure washer worked fine but after the winter was over, the hose had burst. This unit has an internal storage area for the hose. Although this is very convenient and stores nicely, the entire unit must be disassembled just to change the hose. The AR Blue Clean worked well and with over a thousand reviews, it appears to be a well tested machine.

reviews.review_header: I think this pressure washer works great, but you should be aware that this is ...
reviews.review_text: I think this pressure washer works great, but you should be aware that this is not an industrial grade pressure washer, like the ones you can rent. I got all the cleaning that I wanted done, but having used other pressure washer in the past, I could see the difference. It took me a little bit longer than usual, so be prepare to spend a little more time than you are used to. If you are like me and power wash around your house every summer, this power washer will do the job. If you are looking a deep cleaning/powerful wash, I am not sure if it will do the job.

reviews.review_header: Powerful enough for an ordinary household use.
reviews.review_text: I own this unit for a couple of years now. It's been on work may be around 25 times. I use it to clean deck, patio, wooden siding, gutter etc. etc. It's powerful enough for my work, and light enough to carry up and down. I once used it continuously for 4 hours, but this unit was still going strong without any problem. I did not notice any pressure drop or unusual motor-heat. The only problem I have with it is on its connecting joint where the plastic filter unit is attached. I feel this unit very weak, however, it has not broken yet. I once tried it to wash car, and I felt that it is too powerful for car wash if you do not set the nozzle right. It is easy to modify nozzle pressure. If your kids are around and point the gun on your car with fully concentrated nozzle, it may damage paint on your car.

I know this is the age of injection mould plastic, but I was expecting a little more out of the AR Blue Clean AR383 1,900 PSI 1.5 GPM 14 Amp Electric Pressure Washer. I don't know how the light-weight construction will hold out because you know with a pressure washer you have to continually move it around. Also, the hose reel is a bit too lightweight to take on the task of always having to wind the hose back up into it. I really can't notice the difference in pressure from my old pressure washer (not the same make or model) for it was 1,500 psi. The product doesn't seem it will out last my old pressure washer but time will tell. On a positive note, customer service was good; there were female water hose adapters include with the product, I called and they sent me two male adapters ASAP. Overall, a good lightweight product for the small jobs around the house.

reviews.review_header: Great Machine for the money! NO LEAKS
reviews.review_text: After reading all the reviews on this unit I decided to try it out and I rate it 5 stars hands down. This is my first unit and I got just what I paid for. I was concerned about all the reviews regarding the leaking so I called AR directly to ask them about it and they shared that they upgraded the connector with a new quick release coupling that solved the problem. Once I got the unit I called AR back just to make sure I assembled the connectors correctly since the instructions still reference the old connector piece that had leaking problems. Angie walked me through the simple setup and I was off and running. The first time I connected the quick release coupling I had a little leaking at the connection point but I found later that it was because I did not have the hose connected tightly enough to the connector. Once I hand tightened the hose to the connector I did not have any more leaking. This product does not leak if you connect the pieces correctly! As far as performance, it was great. Good power, worked well on a 5 year old deck, made it look like new. I did have a lull in power on two occassions during about 4 hours of continuous use but it did not seem to happen again. I found that the cord and the pressure washing cable were quite long enough to reach my second story deck. The machine is also well constructed. The utility of the cord holders are questionable but again that is something that I expected as many reviews detailed this issue. The shipping only took 3 days instead of the estimated 7! I was able to knock out this project over the weekend.

After owning a gas high powered Pressure Washer that leaked oil, was difficult to start and hard to move around, I sold that Pressure Washer and was looking for something more manageable, cleaner with good power. I researched with Consumers Report and Amazon and decided to purchase this model. AR Blue Clean is everything we hoped to have in a Pressure Washer. It cleaned up our mossy, moldy flagstone patio easily. Works great on the vinyl siding and I'm sure will work fine on washing the cars. It is easy to manipulate and plenty of pressure for household projects like cleaning outdoor furniture, garden pots, etc. Instead of having to change out couplings for different pressures which is a pain, this Washer uses a turn adjustment to regulate the PSI. It is female friendly but my husband also likes it because there is little hassle in using it and storing it. We do have two minor cons, it does take a few minutes to get it ready for use each time which really is no big deal and there is a plastic coupling that should be made out of metal. It is curious that Blue Clean would us this cheap fitting. Otherwise, we are very satisfied

reviews.review_header: Cleaned the pool walls after draining the boggy pond scum.
reviews.review_text: I bought this pressure washer because I needed to drain and clean a pool that looked more like a swamp than a swimming pool. It comes with a couple of different attachments and I used both wands. It is amazingly easy to use and I had no trouble controlling where I sprayed. I was very pleased with the actual pressure and how well it cleaned the deck as well as the walls of the pool. One thing to note, the place on the front for attaching the hose comes with a cheap plastic part to make the connection and it looked like something very easily broken if the washer fell over. I didn't even attempt to use it and replaced it with a metal connector for a few dollars.

The only reason for four instead of five stars is that the hose connector is still a bit of a problem. In my case, I was able to get the leaking at the hose connection to a minimum with a two plier grip. I'll probably just get another hose and dedicate the one with the now fused connector to the Blue Clean. Otherwise, I found this to be a great tool. So far it's done a great job cleaning city grime from our Austin-brick sided home, various iron outdoor furniture, and our 10x20 cement patio. The pressure has been perfect for removing grime with a minimum of brick removal. I did follow previous review recommendations and got the "Gilmour 3/4-Inch Brass Female Double Swivel Hose Connector 7FHS7FH". THIS IS A MISTAKE. The brass connector immediately and constantly sprayed water in all directions from the swivel center, it's a waste of good brass.

Had this for a few months before it broke. Brought it to a local motor repair shop who indicated the water pump was no good and that it would cost more to repair than the thing was worth. I only used the thing 10 times, tops, and always took great care of it. I kept it clean, wasn't rough with it, didn't use it for anything but minor cleaning (washed deck, siding, etc) for a few hours, total. Buyer beware, won't last.

Electric pressure washers can be finicky. I did a lot of research but it was hit and miss. I returned two pressure washers that had similar traits. They stopped working and the pressure advertised was questionable. I decided to give the AR Blue Clean a shot and I was pleasantly surprised. Well worth the extra $50 that it cost over the two I returned. A solid sounding motor that featurs a shut off when you release the trigger on the gun. I think an important feature. Concerning the leakage at the dual female connections: Some reviews suggested purchasing a brass double connector but I was able to get a good seal by just adding an extra soft washer in each end and it worked perfectly. No leaks. Why AR doesn't address the problem with the leaks that so many reviews mention is beyond me. This is a big time company in the pump business and I believe they have a good product here. The only thing that disappointed me was that they don't tell you that the soap dispenser is not pressurized. I thought it would be similar to the coin operated do it yourself car wash but it only serves as an applicator with little pressure. The unit is good enough to accomplish any household job and I would highly recommend it as a solid performer.

reviews.review_header: Not for low water pressure or complete paint removal
reviews.review_text: I saw a pressure washer being used to remove paint from a house next door. Their paint looked in good condition, so I figured it would be no problem removing flaking paint from our deck with a pressure washer. Unfortunately it only takes off the loosest paint chips. Even an inch from the wood, this pressure washer will just cause splintering and not remove paint/primer that's still got a good hold. The turbo nozzle actually removes the most paint and causes the least damage but it still leaves a lot of paint. I've since done more research and looked at videos and apparently 3000 psi is the recommended pressure for paint removal, but that's mostly so you can cover a wider area at lower pressure, not because you want the full 3000 psi to hit your wood from an inch away and splinter it. It seems most sites don't recommend hitting wood with over 1200 psi, and apparently pressure washing is typically used just to remove the loose paint and then you paint over what remains. So this pressure washer will do the job for that usage, but only in maybe 4-6 inch strips (guessing). Unfortunately I want to get off ALL the paint and stain the deck. I could have sworn the neighbours were getting off all the paint with a pressure washer, but maybe they were using a chemical stripper as well or maybe the siding was aluminium or sheet rock that could withstand higher pressure. Not wanting to use chemicals, I tried an orbital sander, an IR heating device, and later switched to using a Paint Shaver Pro which I'm loving. See my review of The Silent Paint Remover for details. The blue quick release nozzle that bridges from the house water hose to the washer does not work correctly with lower water pressure. Although my water pressure doesn't really seem very low, so maybe my quick release is just defective. Either way, with the blue quick release, the washer will work for a few seconds but then the pitch of the motor changes and the spray becomes much lighter as if it's half air. I replaced the blue quick release nozzle with a grey one that happened to be on another hose I had laying around and it works fine with that with the water spigot barely turned on. The only difference is the blue one has a sliding pin in it that is pushed open when connected to the washer but when disconnected it is held closed by pressure in the hose to keep the hose from spraying water when disconnected. I think the amount of water that can get past the pin may be too low. Since a lot of old customers complained about water leaking from the quick release because they turned their spigot on too high, this new quick release may have overcompensated by keeping the pressure too low. It looks like you could remove the pin by taking the quick release apart, but you would need to pry about a dozen tabs of plastic up to allow the housing to slide apart. The blue tabs are arranged in a ring holding onto a lip around a black pipe. Or you could just drill the pin out but then you couldn't return it. When I first used the washer it was dribbling enormously out the bottom of the machine and I thought I had a defective, leaking unit.
