It turned out that the water was coming out of the seal between the machine and the clear nozzle that connects to the quick release. The manual says to only hand tighten this nozzle to the machine, but even when I hand tightened it as firmly as I could it still leaked water copiously (the water dribbles down the machine and then appears to be coming out of the bottom of the machine). I had to get a rubber pad used to open jar lids to get a better grip on the clear nozzle to tighten it further. After that it hasn't leaked. I noticed today that after about five minutes of use, the power brick that connects to the wall plug was almost too hot to touch. This was after the machine had been turned off for at least five minutes. I hope that won't end up being a problem with longer usage.

It seems to work well, but mine has a loud squeak. It's a little distracting as it sounds as if the pump is not working properly. If it gets any worse, I'll have to contact CS. The water inlet does leak water, but I knew this before my purchase, by reading other reviews. Otherwise, the machine does a good job and has plenty of power to do most chores. I just hope that nothing happens with that squeak. UPDATE: In March 2016 my AR383 got worse. Contacted Customer Service for AR North America. They were incredible. Very concerned and wanted to make everything right. Sent me a new machine. Turns out that the warranty is good for 12 full months (mine lasted 11). These people care!!! Thanks to Jon and James.

I've never owned a pressure washer before so I can't compare this one to anything else. I bought it to clean the copping and deck around my pool after a pool renovation. I couldn't afford to replace my pool copping or deck so I opted to pressure wash these areas and bring them back to life. I have to say that this machine is pretty powerful. My pool copping and deck sparkled by the time I was done. But I was so excited about how clean they got I cleaned just about everything else with the pressure washer too... My BBQ grill got a good cleaning, the exterior walls of my house where my dogs brush up against is now clean, and the covered patio was rinsed down and now looks like the color it was meant to be. I think next weekend I'll wash the garage door and driveway. This was definitely a good investment. I hope it lasts. Oh, one thing to note is that the thing that reels up the hose sucks big time! I couldn't figure out how to reel it up, attach it and unreel it to use the hose. The instructions for this also suck. I just roll up the hose and wrap it around the handle. UPDATE: June 2016 - this thing still works well. Please click YES if my review have been helpful to you, it will encourage me to continue writing and updating my reviews, and leave a comment if you have any questions, I will be more than happy to answer if I can be of help.

reviews.review_header: Great product with a few design flaws
reviews.review_text: First, does a great job and I am very happy with my purchase. I found the previous reviews very helpful. I did as others recommended and replaced the plastic hose connector with a brass one and red washers. Its pressure compares favorably to the much larger, more powerful, MUCH heavier models. I would consider it very portable. It has an extra long electric cord and nice long high pressure hose. The design flaw have to do with storage. The area where the electric cord is to be stored needs to be bigger - it barely fits. Also the plug is BIG and doesn't fit well were it is intended to -between the wound up cord and the unit. The input valve where you connect the high pressure hose so too close to the tool caddy, making it difficult to connect and, especially to disconnect, the hose for storage. Another issue with the tool caddy - it is very difficult to get the wands to snap into the tool caddy. I'm concerned the small brackets for the wands will break if I force the wands to fit. Finally, the detergent bottle is a joke...a big joke! My prior washer had an internal tank which was great! This is a great unit and would recommend it. It seems everything you buy there are always going to be design flaws. And, they may not appear that way to everyone.

reviews.review_header: This is so powerful and easy to use
reviews.review_text: Bought for my husband's birthday. This is so powerful and easy to use, He has washed the cars, sprayed the vinyl siding, used for our windows and screens, and washed the driveway. He had some plastic burn into our brick and it came right off with this product. We love it!!!! My husband said its the best "toy" he received. Its so compact and easy to use, its awesome. The other reviews helped my decide on which pressure washer to buy, so I if you are not sure, I WOULD AT LEAST GIVE THIS A TRY

I have had this little pressure washer for about 7-months and I have enjoyed using it. It is compact and lightweight so it can be stored and moved about easily. It has been handy for washing my cars and motorcycle and for cleaning the algae off of my house. However, the pump broke today. (It sounded like the impeller became detached from the motor.) That is just too short of a lifespan considering the price. It is cute but not sturdy enough - so I don't recommend it. I will purchase another pressure washer, but not this brand.

Compared to my old pressure washer this one is light weight and delivers pressurized water immediately. Have used unit only 3 weeks but have not experienced leaking water from coupling that others have reported. 10" deck cleaning attachment works well. It is much faster than wand but lacks power of wand so does not do tough areas as well. For storage I wrap electrical cord around wind-up reel (getting plug thru opening in reel takes a little effort) and hose around 3 guides on back (still not easy). A great unit for the price.

I originally bought a unit from Costco that was in the same price range and it started leaking from inside the unit after 2 weeks so I returned it. I noticed this one had much better ratings on Amazon so I bought it and have been very happy with it. It has a little more pressure and I like the adjustable wand better than the assortment of fixed nozzles the Costco unit had. Plus it seems like the motor is not laboring as hard. I've only had this for a month or two but I've been using it a lot during that time and there have been no leaks or any other problems. I thought there was a leak once but it was easily fixed by removing the quick disconnect and giving it a good hand-tighten and popping it back in. Since than I attach the quick disconnect to the garden hose first where it's easier to have a good grip, then pop it into the unit and there are no drips.

I've had this pressure washer for 2 months & am very pleased. Absolutely no leaking @ the hose connection as some have reported. They either fixed that problem or users were not hooking things up correctly. I've used it to clean the mold off vinyl siding and to clean the patio and deck around our pool. It worked great. It's very easy to change the attachments - just release the on / off trigger & make your change. No need to turn off water or unplug from the AC outlet. I used a zip-tie to create a lock for the handle tripper - no need to wear yourself out holding down the trigger. The only negative issue I've encountered is the soap dispenser. As others have reported the soap is not dispensed at high pressure / will not spray very far / is quickly emptied out. No problem - just use your hose & a Krud Cutter or similar dispenser for that part of the job. Highly recommended!

This is my first experience with a pressure washer. It's light weight so it's easy to carry around the yard and the long electrical cord makes it convenient to work in most any corner of the yard. It is relatively easy to connect the the garden hose and quick disconnect fitting to the pressure washer, and it took only a modest effort to line up the connection on the high pressure side. I bought it to wash the aluminum siding on the house and it has done a very good job using only water, no detergents. In fact, I like it so much that I'm walking around the neighborhood looking for more siding to wash ;-) I've also used it to pressure wash a split rail fence, and a brick patio, again using only water, and I've been quite pleased with the results. I definitely recommend this pressure washer for home use.

reviews.review_header: Good power washer for the money.
reviews.review_text: This product does the job. I only gave it 4 stars because of the hose. It does tangle quite easy. On some items you have to get pretty close for it to work, but for the price, and ease of not borrowing or renting, it does the job.

I purchased this because I was looking for an affordable and convenient pressure washer to clean our patios, furniture, cars, and other things around the house. I was pleasantly surprised by this little machine. In Florida, we constantly deal with mold on patios and this blasts it right off! Our concrete looks good as new every time we use this. Is it as strong as an industrial pressure washer? Of course not. But it is great at what it does do! It is very easy to store, is convenient because it is electric powered, and does a great job at every day type cleaning. The only problem I have had is a loose fit where the hose connects resulting in leaking of water from around the fitting. It doesn't affect the performance or anything, but is the only negative I can find to say about it. Otherwise, it has worked well for almost 2 years and I would certainly buy again.

reviews.review_header: Works great. Powerful. Nice and small. Price is right.
reviews.review_text: I've had this about a month and really like it so far. It is much more powerful than other electric power washers I have used before. The size is nice and small which makes it easy to move around. The hose reel is a joke, but storing the hose on the unit just coiled up works really well. I highly recommend getting the extension hose (http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B0047AE98I/ref=cm_cr_ryp_prd_ttl_sol_3). An extra 25' makes covering a larger area so much easier.

reviews.review_header: Rolling everything up nice and clean is a bit more work than you ...
reviews.review_text: This power washer works well. I primarily use it to clean mold of my deck and house. I also use it for cleaning cars, mowers, and other outdoor tools. I did light drop the gun part of the power washer and the little section where the tube connects broke and I had to buy a whole new gun. Looking at it closely, I am not shocked at all that it broke. Its all plastic and fairly thin. My other issue with this is the hoses and cords. Rolling everything up nice and clean is a bit more work than you would hope.

reviews.review_header: This washer works pretty good for the DIY person
reviews.review_text: This washer works pretty good for the DIY person. It's not as powerful as a gas operated power washer. However it is a lot quieter and does not stink up the whole neighborhood with exhaust fumes either. Besides I have no desire to mess up my aggregate cement driveway by applying to much pressure to it. At least I can take this little machine out whenever I think the cement is starting to look rummy without totally annoying my neighbors. **Oh I also had no water leakage operating this machine. I would not buy the recommend "Male Nose Connector" with your purchase. You do not want to spend money on something that is not necessary. Order the connector after you have evidence that there is a leakage from the power washer.

As has been previously reported, the unit works well. The hose connection indeed leaks under most conditions. Finding the exact brass connections has proven to be difficult. There is a filter attached to one of the connections, so the replacement of that part will result in unfiltered water being introduced into the unit. Operation is easy, however the unit must have the GFP reset each time it is used. This is a safety precaution. The connections on the wand part of the unit are not quite 'standard.' If a circular concrete washer were desired, it would require an adapter to make it fit and care to match the operating pressure of the washer to pressure of the AR383.

reviews.review_header: this is a good pressure washer in terms of power and ease of ...
reviews.review_text: Just a quick review, this is a good pressure washer in terms of power and ease of use. However, the hose developed a leak this week, about 1 year and a half after we bought it. I probably have only used it 10 times since we received it, so it has had limited use. I would have expected the hose would have lasted longer. The hose seems to be the weak link on this product. Fortunately, a replacement hose is only about $30.

I read the reviews and noticed that this was by far the most popular home power washer purchase. There were all kinds of comments about various problems. WE HAD NO PROBLEMS OF ANY KIND! It is light, It is easy to use and it is powerful. Our old all steel power washer produced 1500 psi pressure. This one is 1900 psi and it makes a difference. We do not use the hose reel. We had no problems with the fittings. Being able to turn the whole unit off and on with the trigger is a huge improvement over our old gas-powered washer. It is so easy to get out, set up, and start that I would not hesitate to get it our for a small job. We only used the old washer for once-a-year cleaning of the cement and paver surfaces around the house. I highly recommend this new one.

originally bought this unit to wash my car but due to the new local regulations washing cars in the driveway is now prohibited. So I just kept the unit I moved. I then used this unit to clean the garage floor in preparation to lay down a few layers of epoxy. this worked very well. I ended up using this unit for my girlfriend's garage epoxy as well and both garages turned out wonderful. This is a pressure washer however and not a garden hose so handle with care. when I was blasting the garage floor my mother wanted to try this unit and she ended up losing control of it and blasted a softball sized hole in the drywall.

I've been using the AR383 for several seasons and am very glad I did not buy anything bigger or smaller. It does everything you could think of around a private residence. This is NOT a tool for people who do not like to read and follow directions. It's best to store it in a place where there is no freezing temperatures over the winter. If you are going to store it under freezing conditions, certain precautions MUST be observed. For sure, a big gas engine power washer works faster, but they cost several times more than what this costs, and require much more maintenance. A gas engine is only a good choice for equipment that is run often.

reviews.review_header: AR Blue Clean AR 383 Pressure Washer
reviews.review_text: I ordered this and put it together and took it out to wash the car, yesterday July 24th, 2012. I was not impressed with it at first. It kept kicking off every few seconds after using for several minutes. I called the 800# for help with the AR Blue Clean company. They were very helpful and walked me through different trouble shooting things to try. After several different tries, the gentleman I talked to the last time said that it was a piece/circuit (I don't remember the exact thing he called it) under the cover that could be replaced if I wanted to try to take the plastic off of the front of the washer, or I could return for refund or exchange. I was not too sure about taking the pressure washer apart, he said that he would grab the exact model and take it apart and see how complex it was. He called back and said to go ahead and return the pressure washer. It happened to be more complex than he thought. So I had NO troubles Returning it. I went online and did the UPS pickup and I repacked the Pressure washer. The UPS came today NO TROUBLES with returning the product and UPS brought the label and took it for me. IT was very easy to return. I was very impressed with the help I got from the AR company. I know in any manufacturing plant, they sometimes have bad parts that get into the products. I have yet to reorder the pressure washer. They said this is the top selling model. There were no leaks and it did work pretty good for the first few minutes and then it would cut off. The piece would have fixed it and it would have worked fine the gentleman reasurred me... So I liked their time in explaining and listening to the product while I was on the phone with them. Very good customer service. I just happened to get a defective one. That happens. I gave 3 stars because they were great with service and I think it would have worked great if that piece inside the motor area would have been good, but it was defective so hard to give it higher star without actually trying one that works properly. I will have to let you know later about the pressure washer when we decide to get one. The power cord was a bit irritating to try to wind on the machine after use. The washer hose was in the way so I had to do some extra work in winding it up going around the water hose for each loop around the holder part. The manual could have been a little more instructive about the reel, but maybe it was good enough. The reel is just for storing when not in use. I did get it put together tho and there were no leaks in the plastic piece where the hose connected to the pressure washer. The plastic water piece on the front was sturdy and I didn't have any leaking at all. I didn't need any other pieces to make it not leak. Thing mentioned by others in reviews that I read previously.

reviews.review_header: Great Power Washer for the Home Owner
reviews.review_text: Works fantastic. Cedar Fence, large Deck, house siding and roof were all done with ease. Well, not real easy. Lots of work, but the Power Washer did a great job. Very pleased with its capabilities. Had no issues with its performance. Very happy with this unit. Wish I had bought it sooner!

I purchased the AR383 after reading numerous positive reviews. This little machine surprised me! I cleaned a large amount of concrete( I live in the snowbelt) and it did a great job with the turbo wand. I also used the adjustable spray wand on other stuff and it worked well, too. Some reviewers complained of water leaks- make sure you grease the o rings and this should not be a problem. Also, do not leave it out in freezing temps or you could have pump failure. On the negative side, the pressure hose is cheaply made. This was also the case with the low and midrange units at the big box stores. If the hose fails, I'll just replace it with a good one. Over all, I am very pleased with this machine. For light to moderate use, I didn't find another pressure washer with as much psi and gpm as this one along with so many positive reviews. How long the unit will last is now the only question. I am very hopeful at this point. Good unit with good power at a good price. I would purchace again!

I gave this machine to myself as a Christmas present. Here in Puerto Rico, where I winter, every hard surface grows some kind of mold or gunk. I started with the swirling nozzle on my cement driveway two hours later, all the black slime was gone, replaced with bright cement. Switching to the adjustable nozzle, I tackled my wooden deck, outdoor shower and even the old paint on my steel gate. Finally, I washed the entire exterior of the house in preparation for painting. Just a couple of idiosyncrasies: The connection where the filter attaches to the body of the machine leaked when I pulled on my garden hose. I unscrewed the connection, applied teflon tape and no more leaks. The wheels are too small to be of any use, so I wind up carrying it to move it. As other people have mentioned, the hose connecting the wand to the machine is stiff, unlike, say, a rubber garden hose. Otherwise, no problems. And what a great price!

I turned to this washer after reading generally average reviews on many others in the $150-$200 range, while those reviewing Blue Clean raved about AR North America attention to any problems the consumer might have. I bought an underbody wand that I did not realize wouldn't fit....AR got me straightened out quickly with the proper Part Number and a source, PW Mall, from which to buy. Have used the washer a couple of times and found it easy to connect up, realiable in function, and it has a feature I have not had on previous washers which is the motor shuts off when you release the gun trigger....great!! Also found out from AR North America that those of us who live in the cold winter can benefit from a product they sell which is a can of pressuried lubricant to flush the pump after completion of use which evacuates residual water and leaves an small amount of anti freeze in the pump so you don't have to worry quite so much about a freeze up and crack situation during storage.

I am surprised a the great reviews his machine has received. It is very flimsy, virtually all plastic. The hose reel is pretty much useless, it cannot be used while the unit is being used..like coil the hose and move the washer. You have t disconnect the hose to reel it in. The plug has a built in GFI breaker but it makes the plug so large that it cannot be used in a typical putside outlet due to the outlet cover, you have to use an extension cord. And speaking of cords, the electric cord storage is terrible. Power-wise it is probably the rated psi. Since this is not powerful enough for much more than cleaning your siding or washing the car, you migt as well get one slightly less powerful and save $50. This is not a less powerful version of a $300 gas washer, it is an expensive (at $170) cheaply made garden hose substitute. A pretty powerful substitute but not paint-stripping powerful.

reviews.review_header: Does the job but has some annoyances
reviews.review_text: I just purchased the AR pressure washer this week and have used it twice now. Assembly of the unit is pretty simple and straight forward. As advertised it comes with two wands and a soap bottle. Both the electrical cord and water hose are fairly long, making so you don't have to lug the washer around too often. I did have some issues at first getting the unit running. The power plug kept tripping (has a built in breaker) for some reason. Switching to a different outlet seemed to fix it. After connecting everything and turning the water on, I did encounter leaking at the connector where the hose connects to the unit. It wasn't a terrible leak, but drips none the less. I'll probably buy a better brass connector as others have recommended. As far as pressure washer goes, the unit did a good job. It cleaned off 6+ years of gunk from my deck with little effort. It also cleaned the brake dust and grime from my car rims quite easily as well. As with all pressure washers, this guy does have enough power to cut into wood and other soft surfaces if using the fine point sprayer. The unit was powerful enough to even clean some surface stains on my concrete patio, but not strong enough for some of the deeper ones. One drawback with the trigger gun is no locking mechanism on the trigger. There is a safety switch so it can't be depressed, but you must hold the trigger down while spraying. Proabably a safety thing, but when holding the trigger for long periods it does make your hand a little tired. My main complaints are with the storage features of the unit. It has a built in hose roller and a plastic holder on the back to hold the nozzles and soap dispenser. The nozzles don't fit in the plastic holder very well at all and fall out. The hose roller also did not work very well. It kept hanging up on the hose, was hard to turn and kinked the hose in places. I opted to loosely roll the hose and just hang it over the unit. The height of the unit is a little weird too. It has a top handle and wheels to roll with, but the height of the unit is short. If you're 5'5" or taller you have to hunch over a little to pull it by the handle. Overall, for the price, not a bad unit and it does work well for it's purpose of pressure washing.

I investigated several electric pressure washers both online and in stores and settled on this one. It arrived when promised and undamaged. The instructions to assemble it were not the clearest in the world, but I put it together without too much problem. All the parts and acessories fit together as one unit and it is lightweight and easy to manouver. When it was finally warm enough to try it out I was very happily surprised with the way it performed. The combination of the long electric cord and the long hose made it so that I could wash a 60 foot long wall without having to stop and reconnect to a different electrical outlet. Its a little cumbersome with the three lines - tap hose, electrical line and pressure washer hose, but I will preplan my procedure more carefully next time to keep from getting tangled up. I was washing the painted cinder block wall to prepare it for painting and the pressure washer had sufficient force to stip loose paint and morter. The washer did everything I asked it to. I have used a gasoline motor pressure washer before, and although it had more pressure than this electric model it was way too cumbersome and heavy. This electric washer had more than enough pressure for my needs and was much easier to move and transport. I read some of the reviews about the problem fitting, so I also purchased the additional fitting on the same page on Amazon, but didn't need it. In fact, I don't know where it could be used. The manufacturer must have solved the problem because all fittings were fine and didn't leak. I would recommend this to anyone who wants a reasonably powerful, easy to move pressure washer.

reviews.review_header: It's powerful enough yet without regular maintenance of a gas ...
reviews.review_text: It's powerful enough yet without regular maintenance of a gas engine. I purchased a "Outlet end hose connector with water stop" made by Melnor for 1.19 to replace their garden hose adaptor. The one included in the package does not come with a washer and the thread is too shallow for leak-proof connection with a garden hose. And, yes, don't forget to hit the reset button to generate pressure. Use a velcro loop with a hook to organize the power cord and high pressure tubing.

I read all of the reviews before purchasing this pressure washer. All of the positive comments were a great help. Yes, it does leak just as one reviewer stated, but it isn't a big thing and it hasn't affected performance at all. I bought the brass connector at another reviewer's suggestion and while I haven't used it yet, it gives me peace of mind that it is there when I am ready for it. I used the AR Blue Clean to remove clay residue from the sidewalk and my parking space following some major plumbing work. I am so pleased with the performance and I didn't have to use a soap or added cleaner. It was relatively easy to put this thing together and get to work immediately. I was having so much fun, I did my steps and both my neighbor's sidewalk. I took off one star for the leak which I feel the company should have resolved by now.

Works well. I have used this a lot! I used it to clean engine parts on a rebuild, clean the back patio, and (in pieces) clean my driveway that has been neglected for years (house is old! 1976 old and I don't know if it has ever been cleaned) You wouldn't want this for you first choice to clean a driveway because it's high pressure nozzle cleans about 1 square inch (takes a while to clean the driveway :p) but it really isn't meant to do that so I am not rating it down for that. This is a great little unit to clean the car with as well. I have used it for long periods of time and thus far no problems. Replace the cheap plastic fittings with some brass.

After using a different brand of electric power washer for the past 6 years (4 in 6 years), I had decided not to get another electric washer. Then I saw the reviews for the AF Blue Clean AR383, 1900 PSI and liked what I was reading. Almost all of the reviews were positive. The only problems listed were ones with the connection from the hose to the power washer. I bought a quick connect metal attachment to solve this problem. Thanks reviewers for this tip. I am 65+ and disabled so I like the ease of electric equipment. I needed something that was fairly light weight, but would get the job done. I love the long wand and the long power cord. Since I got this power washer I have finished my house, 2 decks (these look like new), 2 sidewalks and 3 barns !! Oh... and a 32' travel trailer ! I will now winterize the machine and see if it works as great in the spring. The only thing I really don't use is the hose reel as it is more trouble than I want to deal with. I just wrap the hose up and put it over the handle.

reviews.review_header: Good enough for an electric washer
reviews.review_text: I don't know if other people experiences the two problems I have or not... but here they are: 1. It takes a few minutes before I can get a steady, strong water stream. Maybe the motor is trying to heat up first or something after storage? It's just weird. After that initial few minutes, however, it works pretty good. 2. You can't press the trigger twice in a row rapidly. The second time you do that, the pressure washer will start humming without providing pressure at all. But if you let it stop for 2 seconds, you can press it again and get the pressure you expect (after the initial waiting period I described above). 3. The hose is rigid, inflexible, and feel cheap, which makes it harder to roll for storage. Pro: One of the best pressure you can get from electric pressure washer. Cons: See the three items I mentioned above.

Today was the first day that I used this, so if it doesn't hold up, I will come back and modify this. I have used gas power washers before and was hesitant to buy electric, however, being newly single decided to try it as I don't want the hassle of oil, gas, winterizing, etc. I was quite pleasantly surprised at how well it works! It works just as well as the last gas powered one I used! Compared to the typical residential gas power washer: 1) Lighter, easier to move around. Can easily pick up and carry. 2) Quieter...much quieter! 3) Attachments are much easier to switch. 4) Easier to use overall...trigger is easier to handle, etc. I just purchased a new construction home and cleaning mud and cement dust that had been rained on and stuck to the cement was a breeze. Dirt all over siding, paint on garage floor... all of it was a snap. Cons: It does leak at the filtered water inlet. I will just replace with brass connector and it should be fine. The gas powered one I was used to using always leaked at the water inlet too so I guess it didn't bother me as much as other people who have written reviews. Overall, very good power washer for the money!

Used to power wash an unfinished basement in a newly constructed house. It took about 4 hours and worked well. Fast-forward several months later and I'm looking to power wash the deck after winter and it wouldn't work. No noise, no startup, nothing, dead. Checked breakers, GFI, different outlets. Called AR North America and got an RMA. They sent me a new unit and told me to do whatever I wanted with the old one. All things considered it was a fast and easy process.

reviews.review_header: Great product - especially for the price!
reviews.review_text: I am extremely happy with this purchase. Plenty of power, lightweight, easy to use, and a great price! I use this a couple of times a year to clean my wood deck and stone retaining wall, and it is perfect. This unit is extremely powerful for an inexpensive electric model. I had no problem cleaning stubborn grime on stones and concrete. In addition, the adjustable nozzle lets me dial down the pressure so I don't strip the paint off my deck when I'm cleaning it. The only negative thing I can say about this unit is that it is a little flimsy. I can see why some other reviewers have replaced the hose fitting. Mine doesn't leak, but it does seem a little weak, so it wouldn't surprise me if it starts to leak at some point in the future. Also, as the other reviewers have said, the hose / cord reels are kind of a joke, it's easier to just wrap them around the handle. However, considering this is a few hundred dollars cheaper than a professional gas unit, these minor inconveniences are definitely worth the price savings in my opinion. Again, if you are using this a few times a year as a homeowner, it's perfect!

The order for the AR383 went well. Delivery was right on time. Packaging of product was excellent. The unit assembled easily and quickly. Performance was as good as advertised. However, the two dealing I've had with their customer service department have been disappointing. I registered the product online. One of the items on the form was the product serial number, which I was unable to locate. I wrote customer service about this seeking clarification. After a week I received a reply asking why I needed a serial number, and that all I needed for warranty service was a receipt. I replied with a copy of their product registration form with a notation regarding the serial number. I have also contacted customer support about 2-weeks ago regarding the used of extension cords with the product. To date, I've received no reply.

This is my first experience with an electric pressure washer. This particular one was recommended on a few web sites I checked and so I gave it a try. I was extremely satisfied with the performance of the unit. It did exactly what I bought it for which was to clean my powder coated aluminum patio furniture. Do no order the recommended Quick Connect Hose Adapter as one comes with the unit. So now I have two of them. Pay the shipping and I'll be glad to send the extra one back to you. The included instructions were not very clear on how to roll up the washer hose on the integrated reel so I just rolled the washer hose up in several loops like an electric cord and zip tied it then hung it over the top handle for storage. Everything else seems to store rather well on the rear of the unit after installing the rear storage tray as noted in the instructions.

reviews.review_header: Look else where or spend little more for better
reviews.review_text: Vary cumbersome moving around. with hose attachments having to change different attachments some times frustrating cannot just hook garden hose up to machine have to have special attachment. all around it gets what I needed done I use the hose roller for cord not even worth fighting the hose to roll up but wishing I got something little better

reviews.review_header: The cap breaks almost immediately, otherwise solid
reviews.review_text: We bought the AR Blue Clean and were able to do one day of cleaning before the cap broke. We bought a new cap, but fear it will break again. We also bought the recommended metal cap, but that is not working for us. The machine was great while it worked, but without the cap, it doesn't work.

This was reviewed well by Consumer Reports, and I purchased it expecting more. It does work well, but I question how much better it works than any other equivalent brand/model electric pressure washer. Almost everything is plastic and the quality and design feels the same as the cheap pressure washer it was replacing. This is not a U.S.-made product. It's the same, inexpensive, off-shored manufacturing that you will find in most modern consumer products. They are made to be disposable and replaced every couple of years, same as all of the competing models. It does have a couple convenience features that make it easier to store, but they don't add to the functionality. If you want better, you'll have to get a bigger, heavier, more expensive model, simple as that.

Didn't want to spend a ton of money on a pressure washer as we wont use a lot, but was worried about the reviews stating it leaked . Either we got lucky or company has listened to reviews and improved product - I had NO issues with leaking (some stretches it was on for a good 1-2 hours also) and it is pretty light and easy to move around (only has about 5 hours of use on it though). Used it to spray off paint on the floor of a covered porch (took right off) and a large wooden deck to prep for water sealer and it took that black slick mold right off that grows so well on wood in Florida (chemical treatments have been unable to touch in getting off for us) - great pressure. We have never owned another pressure washer so can't compare, but for the price and quality we received plus coming right to our door vs renting something - glad we chose this - we might have paid a bit more buying, but happy we can use again.

I first purchased an 1800 psi Power Washer from Harbor Freight but returned it after the first use; it was only a little more powerful than my garden hose! I read allot of reviews after this mistake and decided to purchase the AR Blue Clean AR383, I am sure glad I did! This power washer lifted off stains and marks on my walkway that the Harbor Freight Power Washer left behind, it took almost no effort on my part sans for moving the wand back and forth. It really is a very powerful pressure washer for the price, I couldn't be happier with it. Very easy to use and set up, the wand spray adjusts from very fine to a very wide stream, great for removing stains from cement to washing the car, really get's the brake dust off the wheels! The only negative I would give it is that the hose reel is to small and compact, you have to spend way too much time carefully winding it up after use because if you don't it kink's the hose as in my case and I was being very gentle winding it up. I contacted AR and they sent me a new hose in less than a week. Very good Customer Service! I now just loop the hose over the handle, doesn't look as nice but it's much easier to store this way.

reviews.review_header: A Great Small Sized PowerWasher - Just Right For Medium Jobs
reviews.review_text: This electric powerwasher does just what I hoped, it cleans off the wood deck before reapplication of waterproofing, cleans the concrete patio and gets the siding on the house washed down. It has plenty of power, and it's not too heavy or noisy to use single-handedly. It doesn't make too much noise, and only runs while in use, not constantly, which keeps the noise down also. It's easy to assemble and disassemble, and is small enough to store easily without taking up too much space. All in all a good investment that has already seen a lot of use and will be used more in the future also.

This was a great unit that I bought in Aug 2013, When I started up in March and ran for 3 days of washing my cars and trucks. Then the washer would not cut off and would only blow on Low pressure. I would cut the switch off then it would start out on high then stop spraying the high pressure. It had a yr warranty and Amazon did give me credit after I sent it back.Amazon is great about this. AR unit are great products but I must have gotten a bad one.The real is useless unless you want to fight the hose then try to get the hose to straighten out after the hose has been on it a few days. I have to give it a 3 star because it was great while it lasted.

Let me say first that we really like the pressure washer. It is powerful and easy to operate. We did have an operational problem after we had it for about 6 months. I called their customer service and was immediately put through to a technician. He was patient with walking me through the trouble shooting process. When we could not resolve the problem and with a copy of my purchase receipt sent to them, they sent a new machine the next day. I don't know about you but we have always felt that Customer Service is vital to a purchase we make but especially now as we are purchasing more items online. It is rare to get this kind of service and we are absolutely 100% satisfied.

reviews.review_header: This product was easy to assemble and does a great job on my ...
reviews.review_text: I couldn't decide if I should go gas or electric. I was advised to get at least 2000 PSI. This product was easy to assemble and does a great job on my trex deck and outdoor furniture (with the patio attachment). I also used it on my vinyl siding around my entry way and even my stone pavers. If I break it tomorrow it was still cheaper than hiring a company to clean my deck/patio. It's also light weight. I'm having trouble getting the cords to store nicely but otherwise it's great.

I bought this in trepidation because I was used to a very powerful gas powered pressure washer. But, I spent an afternoon cleaning paths, decking and house siding with absolutely no problems, alrhough I made sure I took breaks to allow the motor to cool before I began blasting the dirt away. I particularly appreciate that it takes up very little space in my garage, whereas my larger gas powered washer took up 4 times the floor space.

reviews.review_header: AR Blue Clean AR383 1,900 PSI 1.5 GPM 14 Amp Electric Pressure Washer with Hose Reel
reviews.review_text: Really impressed with the cleaning power of this little machine. Used it to wash cars, clean stained wooden porch and walls and brick walk covered with heavy mold. It absolutely cleaned off each surface to my wife's complete satisfaction--using Krud Kutter cleaning solvent labeled for each specific task (Universal, Wood, Brick/Concrete). Used both the wand attachment for cars and wood and the turbo for brick. Surprising how fast each cleaned the respective surfaces. Have to be careful with the force of the spray, however, as it can peel loose paint. No problem with the new plastic hose quick connect leaking. I liked the soap container as an attachment to the hose. This avoids clogging up the pump and water lines with soap residue---a drawback I discovered on another brand of washer. There are some drawbacks. The unit is too low to easily roll around on the wheels. The water hose is not very flexible and a little cumbersome to drag around while cleaning. Also the hose is difficult to roll on the reel. Took off one star for these minor cons. All in all, though, the AR Blue 1900 PSI is just what the doctor ordered for a Harry Homeowner to keep things clean around the outside, reasonably painlessly--especially if on sale below $150.

reviews.review_header: A lightweight washer with heavyweight power
reviews.review_text: I placed my order and recieved the power washer in two days. The packaging is very good and the washer arrived in perfect condition. After reading other reviews I decided, out of character, to read the manuel. The unit went together easily and, after dinner, I couldn't help but wash two cars. There were no leaks. The washer worked as advertised. I still haven't found the detergent bottle but will search again in the morning. I agree with other reviews that the hose reel is useless and the power cord might as well be coiled. The washer is light but with the hose attachment and electric entering on opposite sides it can't be easily pulled around, a minor fault. It's too soon to determine durability but I am encouraged. I have no prior experience with power washers but this seems like a well designed unit.

reviews.review_header: Where have you been my whole life?
reviews.review_text: Phenomenal. I cannot believe we lived with the dirt, mildew, mold, moss, etc., on our sidewalks, patios, brick and driveway for so long. This thing is addicting. I bought it for my husband for father's day because he is painting the house this summer and he likes to wash the cars himself. He wasn't sold on it. He was scraping the paint off the front door yesterday and I suggested he bust it out.. He finally did and he didn't stop at the front door, he moved on to the front porch and sidewalk. After seeing the results, I wanted to try it. We easily moved it to the back patio, which faces north, so lots of muck to work on. Well, this thing is amazing, literally erases the grime. So rewarding to instantly see the browns and greens disappear before your eyes! My husband had to unplug it to get me to stop because it was getting too dark out. I can't wait to get back to it. We had no problems at all running it for four hours straight and although I didn't read the directions, it was very easy to operate. Husband assembled easily. I warned him about the amazon complaints on the plastic connector, but we had no problems. Love the angle adjustments right on the nozzle. Widespread was kickbutt, and you can narrow the stream for heavy, heavy duty like paint and grease on the cement. It is powerful, I was adjusting the stream flow while cleaning a wooden swing and I did tear through the wood with that sharp line of spray, so don't think that since it is not gas powered that it will be weak, because it can still do some damage! So glad I gifted this to my husband and so glad I didn't go with a gas powered one. If we have problems with longevity, I will edit review, but for the first initial run of four hours, I am hooked and in love!

reviews.review_header: Good pressure washer for the price, Not as powerfull as I thought it would be
reviews.review_text: I got this pressure washer because I wanted to do some cleaning and it works great for what I use it for. Washing poop off the cement, cleaning my porch, windows, walls and fence but its not as strong as I wanted it to be. next time I would go for a washer with more PSI. One of the attachments is stronger than the other which does a better job of cleaing poop, algae off the cement and bricks, you can even remove grass and other greens in between cracks. The only thing I don't like is that it looses its strength at about 1 foot, anyhthing farther and all it dies is blow leaves. But for my purpose its ok. The attachment for the hose does leak which gets everything wet, wish they would send a better one.

Washer did not work on arrival. Customer service diagnosed as a faulty CFGI plug and sent a new one. I ask if this was a common or known issue and was told yes. The replacement part worked for about 30 seconds and died. Why they would use such a cheap part on what seems like a decent machine is beyond my understanding. Returning the unit for a refund. I don't have the time or patience to keep replacing a part that should just work out of the box. Sort it out please. It's not difficult.

I received this product two days after ordering it! I was so anxious to see what it could do because my deck and porch were in bad shape. As soon as Saturday came, I excitedly got dressed and begin putting the washer together. It was really simple, just followed the instruction booklet. After connecting everything properly, I begin with the front porch. I was blown away at how it was blasting the dirt and build up away!! I saw the color of my wood that I'd never seen before!! It got every bit of dirt, mold, grime and everything else that wasn't supposed to be there away. I laid my porch mat on my driveway to clean and mistakenly went around the edges too. Well now I have a square cleaned on my driveway because right around the edge of the mat, it cleaned the driveway also. It's really awesome and I can't wait to do my entire driveway. I also used it to wash away those stubborn spider webs that were everywhere, clean the siding on the house and the outside of the windows. I LOVE my power washer!!

I have used this washer several times since ordering and it really is great for most home uses... I was surprised how much I have used it once I had it... you might think you will just use it for one or two projects but I found myself using it to clean the patio, drive way, patio furniture, brick on the house, windows, car, garage...etc...etc.. etc... you get the idea. It works great on all of these projects... The leak that has been mentioned in other reviews is minimum on my unit. It does leak a little, but very little... besides everything else is wet anyway so to me it is a non issue...

reviews.review_header: Works well but requires a pressure regulator on the hose bib if mains pressure exceeds 60psi
reviews.review_text: Our mains pressure is 90psi, and the power washer would sometimes take several false starts before it began to pump smoothly. The manufacturer recommends a pressure regulator if mains pressure is above 60psi. The washer now pumps smoothly after we installed a pressure regulator on our hose bib. A decent regulator costs around $60 -- the inexpensive ones around $15 are designed to shut the flow off completely when pressure exceeds the max.

reviews.review_header: This item is junk. Bought back in april 2014 ...
reviews.review_text: This item is junk. Bought back in april 2014 and finally used it today. work for 20 secound and died. Obviously, its out of warranty and i'm unable to return/contact support. It went in the trash. DO NOT BUY unless you want to throw money way. It cheaply made out of plastic. Due to my busy, couldn't test it sooner and I was worry the entire time that it may not work as advisetise. I guess I was correct. Again, STAY WAY, buy another if you need a power washer.

OK for the money, it's top heavy, easily tipped over. Cheap plastic hose connector broke after 3 months ( I thought it would ) . I bought the metal hose connector and it worked Perfectly. I don't think the company recommends it because it's not metric, or they want to sell another plastic connector that will break the first time it's tipped over.

reviews.review_header: This thing is awesome and love how it performs
reviews.review_text: I have used this water pressure for a few months now. I only use it to detail wash my vehicles and wash my drive way. This thing is awesome and love how it performs. I bought a MTM Hydro (made for my AR383) to compliment my AR383 and the suds that it puts out is amazing. I really recommend this product and I have no leaks, no issue with the stock input adapter, and any signs of the motor going out. Seriously though, this thing keeps all nasties I pick up on my jeep wrangler when I offroad and this thing cleans them off the jeep and off the driveway. Best investment ever.

Bought this last week after doing a lot of research. As most of the reviews said the hose connection supplied with the washer leaks, will get a brass one as soon as I go to town. I had no trouble winding the hose up on the reel as long as there are no kinks in the hose(at least the first time). I spent several hours cleaning the deck and stairs it did a great job with lots of power. I had a gas power washer before it was big, clunky, and noisy. The AR383 was easy to move around and fairly quiet. The only negatives are the leaky hose connection and the hose could be made with rubber instead of plastic. Will be doing the driveway soon.

I researched for a new pressure washer for hours and went to numerous stores and finally decided on this product. It is fantastic. Other reviews mentioned the plastic hose connect but just be careful and it works fine. Don't be rough with it and take your time. Do not try to connect the hose to the washer while there is pressure in the hose line. Connect it and then turn on the water and shut off the water before disconnecting. I SUGGEST YOU READ THE ENTIRE MANUAL before using it and just take care of the product and it will work fine for you. I've used it for about 40 hours now, did a superb job on my picket fence and brought it back to life. My driveway and walkway look brand new and I am currently doing the house in preparation of painting it. Bought it on Amazon, cheapest price I found and it was delivered as scheduled. No complaints here, in fact I'm getting ready to go use it NOW. I have a picnic table and benches that need to be restored. I WOULD DEFINETLY RECOMEND THIS PRODUCT TO ANYONE! Have a safe day, Dennis

reviews.review_header: AR Blue Clean AR 383 Electric Pressure Washer
reviews.review_text: I replaced a 1500 PSI motor pressure water cleaner with the AR Blue Clean AR 383 1900 PSI Electric Pressure Washer. The AR 383 was delivered on time, well packed, easy to assemble and use. It does a good job, my only concern is that the spray nozzles are a bit too short, would work much better with a short 3" to 6" extension. The pressure cable roll up wheel does not function well, I find it easier to just roll up the pressure hose and hang it over the handle of the unit. Other than that I find the AR 383 good value for money, so far I used it for 12 hours, it cleaned well, but I did suffer shoulder pain because of the shortTurbo Nozzle.

reviews.review_header: A great power washer - but definitely spend the extra and ...
reviews.review_text: A great power washer - but definitely spend the extra and get the brass fittings. The plastic fittings break easily and leak profusely. Once the brass fittings are on, it doesn't leak.

reviews.review_header: Have tried two units, both were junk!!
reviews.review_text: purchased unit in June, used twice and it broke. Item was replaced by Amazon in July. Just opened new unit as this was the first time I needed the unit. The second unit didn't work out of the box. Missed deadline to return it to Amazon so now will have to deal with dealer. I do not want another one and would not recommend this unit! Update...Still giving pressure washer a 1 star rating but Amazon made it right as always. Thanks Amazon!!

reviews.review_header: It worked fine first two times I used it
reviews.review_text: Bought the unit on July 30. It worked fine first two times I used it. When I started on driveway it quit. As of August 13th it is not working. Pumps runs because when you release the trigger it will pump up and shut off. Blast of pressure when you pull trigger which quickly drops to trickle even though it sounds like it is running. Customer service wanted me to do a half an hour of things I had already tried. Will try one more unit then get a refund.

I just received my AR Blue Clean AR383 pressure washer and have used it for about an hour cleaning my RV camper. I had a 3000 psi gas pressure washer that died some time ago. This electric washer is pretty impressive for its size and price. It is not a heavy duty unit - as a result it takes a lot longer to effectively clean a large area. It does leak at the hose and gun hose connections but I may have not tightened those enough - The effective spray area in only about an inch or two so it takes time to clean a larger area and the gun does not have a constant "On" button so after a while your hand gets sore from squeezing the trigger. I think I'll pick up a Velcro strap to keep the trigger depressed while using. This unit is great for things like washing a car, cleaning a few steps etc. but for a larger area I'd suggest renting a more heavy duty unit. Overall I like it but only time will tell if it will be dependable and not fall apart ( all parts are plastic).

This is a good machine and worth the reasonable price. I read numerous reviews about this unit before I purchased and have not had any of the small issues many people complain about. The water hose connection on the unit works fine, does not leak. The unit is powerful yet not too bulky or heavy. I love the adjustable nozzle so you can change the spray pattern instantly, I would never buy a power washer without one! I have used both types of washers over the years and cant understand why some manufacturers dont offer the adjustable spray nozzle. Having to stop and change nozzle tips is just stupid and time consuming. I wanted a unit with a soap dispenser tank built into the unit but the number of units out there is very limited with this feature, so I went with this unit due to the good ratings and decent price. The only reason I did not give 5 stars is the hose reel feature; it is worthless to use and not practical, I did like everyone else does and just coil the hose up around the machine. They could have easily added tabs so you could just wrap the hose up on the machine like a vacuum cleaner cord but what ever. This is a great, powerfull unit worth the price and I recommend highly.

I was paranoid about mixing electric with water, but thought that an American company would not subject itself to lawsuit city were this thing actually dangerous. All I needed was a portable pressure washer to clean my house area, especially the concrete patio and fence. For my needs, this machine performed very well on its first run of about a 4-hour use. I even bought one of the used versions as a first-time experiment, and found it was actually brand new but perhaps had been returned (packaging only was defective). Another plus is that, while a gas-powered pressure washer I used chipped my privacy fence, this 1900 PSI cleaned the privacy fence perfectly without damaging it. I would recommend at this stage and will report back if something goes wrong in future. By the way, I deducted a single star since it is plastic and doe snot seem so durable, but will upgrade it later if it exceeds my durability expectations. For the $135 PRIME Amazon deal, I am satisfied

Received washer today. After lots of research, ordered AR 383 primarily due to positive reviews on Amazon. Manual instructions are better than average. Clear instructions, decent pictures. All parts were shipped and easy to find. I did order a brass hose fitting but that has not arrived yet. Installed with plastic fitting supplied with machine and it functioned fine. No leaks. I agree with others that leaking problems are likely due to owner error. While I would have liked AR to supply a brass fitting, most or all of the washers in this price class use plastic so I did not knock down the rating for this. Just finished doing about an hour's cleaning on some VERY dirty/moldy sidewalk in the rear of my house. No, it's not a 3000 psi machine, but it did a good job. I'm looking forward to using this on more sidewalks, driveway and bricks. I also bought it to do some high windows that are beyond my climbing comfort. Almost forgot. I had a question about leaving the pressure hose connected between jobs. (The manual says to disconnect and put it on the reel.) I emailed the manufacturer and had an answer in under two hours! (It's OK to leave it hooked up, but it's recommended to disconnect it when storing for the winter.) There was even a name and phone number on the email! When you go to their web site, you can find email addresses for the entire management team. I like that. I'm very pleased with this early experience. Will update if my opinion changes. Update: Have a few more hours of use and still very satisfied. Called AR customer support to see if they offered a brass hose connector. They said they recently replaced the plastic single piece connector with a two piece quick-connect. Because I had a nearly new unit, they are sending the new connector to me UPS at no charge. As others have found, their service is really exceptional.

Can run continuously. Which many of these smaller units can't. So, for it's class it's very good The only cons - Stiff hose means it's not really easy to store. It's great for small jobs but I wish had more psi. When doing a patio for example, the tough spots require a pretty tight fan/ spray - like 2-4 inches. So that took a long time. But for the money etc. it is great.

I am giving 4 stars because it was very frustrating for me to put this thing together and it took me a while to understand how to use this machine. OK, I have to admit that I did not read all the instructions before assembling the washer :) It would be nice to include a DVD instructions for people like me who never put together a pressure washer before. I am a girl and it was not easy for me to put this thing together by myself. Written instructions in the box are terrible. I think my neighbors heart me cursing, thats how mad I was trying to make this thing work :) But after I've got it, it was very easy. This pressure washer is very nice and easy to use after you understand how to use it. Be careful because it's very powerful. I made a hall in the sidewalk, I am not kidding !!! Use the Turbo lance first it cleans sidewalks better and not as dangerous as a Adjustable spray lance. The Ajustable spray lance is good for making halls in the pathways, peeling paint from the walls of your house and shooting off wasp nests of the walls ;) Once again, this is good product. I like it.

I bought an electric power washer because I won't be using it enough to maintain a gas model. This thing was just what I wanted. An easy to use, low maintenance washer that I can drag out to clean off my tractor, hose down the animal cages from time to time, clean the moss, etc off the shaded porch, etc. This unit fits my needs. It worked almost out of the box (assembly is minimal). The adjustable nozze wand works great so I am able to go from mild to wild without changing orifices. The only criticism is that the detergent application must be made with the low-pressure bottle, you cannot siphon-mix the detergent into the high pressure stream. It's a mild complaint, over all, I'm happy with the unit. Oh, it does occasionally stop spraying--just "playing" with the trigger to pulse the stream usually gets it back working. This may be more related to my water supply than with the unit. I should also mention that I like the way the pump shuts off when you release the trigger.

I bought this product because it met my budget. I used it on a brick patio and found it was not powerful enough. I wanted a washer that would clean bricks, cement, and wood quickly. The only con is that the manual could be clearer on two points: (1) push in the quick disconnect very tightly, otherwise, it won't work and (2) Don't use an extension cord unless it is 10 or 12 gauge. And oh, always remember to press the reset button before use.

reviews.review_header: Good quiet compact set for the price
reviews.review_text: Good quiet compact set for the price. 1800 psi just doesn't blast away cement unless you are 1-2 inches away from your target.Otherwise, great on cleaning wood and great on siding unless you has molded or loose paint on the siding. This unit will blast that paint off, so you will have to come back with a new coat of paint where the paint came off.

The AR388 Blue Clean Power Washer arrived last weekend. After attaching the external holders, I cleaned our driveway. The unit performs as well as washers costing much more. As a handyman type I was glad to see info on replacement parts (if needed), etc. For those that have had problems with the "quick connect" connections coming off; I think that this is a failure to understand how these work. The correct way to fasten them is clearly stated in the instruction manual. The manufacturer, realizing that most people don't read manuals, included a "Quick Start Guide" which was not very specific when it came to explaining how to (and how NOT to) attach the various hose pieces. All these fitting are pretty standard across major brands. One other note: As this is not meant as an industrial unit, it will overheat (and "pop" the circuit breaker) if used continuously. I gave it ... and me ... a rest every 1/2 hour which seemed about right.

Bought this in late May, and - of the three power washers I've owned over the years - immediately thought it was the best I've used. Compact, easy to use, great to put away. (You know what I mean by this: rather than having a hose and a power cord that sort of "hang off" the thing when it's being stored, the AR has cleverly designed this one to have places to secure both of those items, along with the wands and the attachments. Bravo.) It gets a fair amount of use, from our patio deck to the pool filters...that alone pays for one of these...and it's held up just fine over the summer, without any of the engine problems or leaks that I've encountered with other brands. The reason I'm writing now, though, is because they just impressed the heck out of me with their customer service. Using the washer, I accidentally tipped it over, and the coupling for the garden hose cracked. Even though the damage was my fault, when I emailed AR to order a replacement piece, they responded almost immediately that they'd happily replace the part for free. Can't remember the last time I came away from a customer service interaction quite so satisfied. Thank you, AR: you make a solid product, and you stand behind it.

We used our AR Blue Clean AR383 today to clean grime off the cement on our car port and the mildew off of our siding. This little machine worked better than the gas operated unit we just put out on the curb for trash night. We put some detergent in the provided container and sprayed it on the siding. Waited a few minutes and then used the adjustable wand to easily wash away the mildew. We used the turbo wand to easily cut through the grime on the cement pad of the car port. My wife loved using it too. We found cleaning with this unit to be addictive because it cleans so good. I think maybe my pressure washing days are over because she loves using it and seeing the great results. It's great not dealing with gas and fumes. We have exterior power oulets on all 4 sides of our house so the length of the power cord was not an issue. I believe extension cords do not work with this unit. We experienced no leaking from the unit. It's quick and easy to set up and put away. We didn't bother trying to reel up the washer hose or loop up the power cord on the holder. We just looped them up and hung them on the handle. We are so happy we made this purchase. Would rate more than 5 stars if it were permitted.

reviews.review_header: The machine is a 3 but customer service is a 5
reviews.review_text: Well I very reluctantly purchased this after so many mixed reviews due to the fact that I didn't want to mess with heavy over powered, maintenance intense gas/oil machines.so here it is. I used it for about 45 minutes and I started smelling an electric burning smell very quickly the smoke started rolling. Very disappointed I turned it off and emailed customer service ( it was after hours of course) I explained the situation to the representative and he requested a copy of my original purchase receipt and a new one was sent to me in 1week no questions no arguments. The representative was very courteous and friendly made a bad situation somewhat pleasant. Although I did not have a lot of time with the machine it did seem to have ample power to do your everyday cleaning I'm not sure it has the power to tackle the very difficult jobs. I am using my new one today I am hopeful it will make proud!!!!!

reviews.review_header: Its a good for the price.
reviews.review_text: The product is a great product but I would have developed the accessory features a bit better. If use the hose reel you have to unhook it from both the machine and gun. It doesn't just wind up after use. Its for storage only. A longer hose would be nice. The handle is a bit short for me and I'm only 5'7 so a collapsible handle would be a smart change it only comes up to my knee. Lastly the quick connect water hose leaks. Not the quick connect itself but the adapter to the garder hose. For a quick fix just use plumper's thread tape and its good. Now for the good part. The machine has a great fit and finish. Feels solid not like a cheap machine at all. The pump operation is quiet compared to others I have used. The pressure is higher than most by 400 psi. The gun attachments are also solid. The soap sprayer is a great to for spraying soap over a large area. Its not a pressurized soap sprayer it sprays softly. All attachments except the soap dispenser store on the back of the machine with specially designed holders including a holder for the spray gun with the wand attached when your using. Over all the mechanical and fit and finish are top notch just needs to work on some design. I'm very happy with this machine for the price.

reviews.review_header: It performed as advertised but don't expect much to get ...
reviews.review_text: It performed as advertised but don't expect much to get many hours of use from it. I only used it a handfull of times before the TSS module needed replacing and the compressor began leaking.

reviews.review_header: Great power washer for the money
reviews.review_text: This washer is great. I have a deck several stone walks, a patio and a stone wall that I wanted to clean. It is perfect for the job. Fortunately, I have a large gauge extension cord to get to the outlying areas - distance from an outlet is a disadvantage with an electrical unit. The water and hose connections are not that convenient and you have to bend down and wiggle or play with the connections on the pump to hook-up the unit when you use it but, otherwise it is convenient - lighter than I expected. The electrical cord has a place to wrap but that is more trouble than it is worth - just rolling the cord up ad draping it over the handle is handier. The pressure seems just right for a wooden deck cleanup. Not to heavy to tear the wood up but strong enough to clean it very well. I used a liquid cleaner first with the applicator that came with the pump - that's handy. Has done a great job on the pavers and stone.

I ordered and received the AR Clean PW in a timely manner. When I used the PW, it did great for about 10minutes, then stopped. After reviewing all possible options for problem, couldn't find a fix. I called the Customer service people for help. What a pleasant surprise, the gal on the phone went through all possible scenarios with me. Still couldn't get the PW to turn on again. Then she said, "we'll send you another new machine and you don't have to return the 'unfixable' one; just use it for spare parts". The new PW arrived, I set it up as directed and used it for 3 days, 2--3hours/day without a problem. Worked great on cleaning my driveway, the brick walkway and the cars. My sister has the same PW and hadn't had a problem in over a year. So I got a lemon, but was sent a replacement without question - great machine, great company!

Every year we borrowed gas presser washer from neighbors for 2 days to clean deck, siding on house, concrete driveway, sidewalk. Now we bought this Washer, and weren't disappointed . It does the same job as gas one , and does very good. Yes, it's not so powerful. But it cleans concrete driveway, and wooden patio for same amount of time as gas one with same quality. Strongly recommend to buy 10" Surface cleaner. It saves a lot of time when using on siding. As was recommended in some reviews , we bought brass connection, rather then use included one for water hose attachment. So far 2 years it works.

reviews.review_header: Nice while it works, but ours is already in the trash bin.
reviews.review_text: Bought this a couple of years back, and it's served us OK until recently. One day, it sprung an internal leak, and was unusable. We opened it up and found that a plastic pressure sensor device had cracked. Ordered the replacement part, but the old cracked one was fused to the metal housing and would not come out - the plastic nut bent out of shape instead of turning. Unfortunately, it comes with only a 1-year warranty and the whole thing is now trash.

I looked for a Gas Powered pressure washer for weeks researching, reading reviews, price checking, engines, etc. and it was not fun. Ultimately, I decided that I do not want another engine to take care of and maintain. This Power Washer is simple and add water, power, and ready to clean. I used it on an Epoxy Garage Floor preparation and could not be happier. It did an amazing job of getting rid of years of stains, dirt, and muratic acid. PLenty powerful. What a joy - quiet, powerful, easy to use, easy to store, light weight. I would recommend getting the 25' AR Extension Cord as the included 25' cord is way to short for any project. Never heard of AR brand but very impressed and thanks to everyone for the 5-Star reviews - this thing deserves the high rating.

My sentiments exactly. Really pleased with the performance of this unit. Told my son that if you ever look for a pressure washer this is one you should consider. AR customer service - is there a word beyond "outstanding." Excellent pressure washer. See my video. Wow. Plenty of Power. Nice and quiet. Addictive. ALSO, Phenomenal customer service. As in, I HAVE ONLY ONCE BEFORE encountered a company with this level of customer service. Even if you are not sure the pressure washer will handle your residential job (but it can handle it, don't worry), buy it just because if you ever need customer service, you will feel you have entered heaven. No, actually seriously, almost. I just googled their website and they have their contact info all right there; I emailed and explained the issue. The response was nearly immediate -- they are sending out a replacement part to me. They definitely have my recommendation!

I was skeptical to buy an electric power washer, but this was a lightening deal so I thought I would try it out. I have only ever used gas/oil power washers which are hard to start with the pull cord. Orifinally I was looking for one with not so much power as a gas powered one. WELL let me tell you that this little baby cleans every bit as good as a gas one! it can handle cleaning concrete driveways, houses, cars etc. I got mine on a lightening deal for 109.00, but even at it's listed price it's worth the money. It has a nice long electrical cord too, so no need to worry about water being too close to the end.

reviews.review_header: A+ recommendation for an electric pressure washer.
reviews.review_text: I use my AR Blue Clean 1900 only once every two years. From patio, sidewalk along house, driveway, then street sidewalk. I always have the best looking cement in our gated park of over 100 homes. I use a clamp to hold the trigger down, and an old dining chair with wheels to scoot along. It is an easy job that way. At 1900 psi this washer is really plenty powerful enough for jobs around the home. I love mine and recommend it with an easy ★★★★★s.

reviews.review_header: Lightweight and quiet general-purpose pressure washer
reviews.review_text: I received this unit in late March of 2013 but didn’t get to use it until late April. I have now used it twice and I could not be more impressed. I have always used gas-powered pressure washers in the past (rented or borrowed, never owned) and what a pleasant surprise to use this electric unit. It is relatively light weight (I can easily move it around) and is remarkably quiet. As others have pointed out, this will not do the heavy duty jobs, such as large areas of heavily stained or moldy concrete, but for the vast majority of jobs I do around the house, this is perfect and I can still rent a gas powered unit if I need to. Others have said they had problems with the connection to the garden hose but I followed the included directions and everything went very smoothly. No issues. If you don’t need the high cleaning units (psi x gpm) of a gas powered system, do yourself (especially your back and ears) a favor and try one of these electric unit. Outstanding!

reviews.review_header: and this is a great unit. I use it for everything you read ...
reviews.review_text: I read ALL the reviews of ALL the gas and electric water Pressure Washers before I bought this. I even went to Lowes and got the metal connectors in case I had a problem with leaking water. But, not leaks so far, and this is a great unit. I use it for everything you read online, and I use it to clean the "Multi-Year" really good air filters we have in the ceiling. It works well at everything. I am also planning on using it to clean our solar sun screens on our windows. Should work just fine. IT is a really good unit. Enjoy!

reviews.review_header: A little cheap looking but powerful.
reviews.review_text: The build quality and sturdiness are a bit suspect by looking at this. Knowing that however I can be extra careful in my care of it to make it last. The detergent reservoir attachment is mostly useless because its only low pressure and is very small so you're required to refill it often. Despite those two cons this comes with a huge pro which is the high pressure rating for its size. This is the highest pressure rating I could find in a small electric power washer and it does the trick. I was able to clean my outdoor benches, fence, hammock, and siding with this. On the dirtiest parts I did have to get very close and move slowly but it worked. If you're looking for something powerful but small this is a good choice.

I have used the pressure washer about 8-10 times so far. I can not be more pleased! I like in Hawaii and everything is more expensive out here to begin with and a lot of times shipping on items like this are super expensive. This one came with the Free super saver shipping, had great reviews, and were about $40 cheaper than any of the other electric ones at Home Depot. If you are looking to strip paint off your house then go with gas, but the 1900 PSI that this one offers is great for general cleaning. I have used it to pressure wash the entire house and garage. On this side of Oahu its very dry and everything gets covered in a red dust and this pressure washer had no problem knocking it off. I found cleaning is a lot easier using the solution attachment first, I use the Zep all purpose pressure washer cleaner (Zep is always nice and cheap and really gets the job done). I pretreated with the solution then changed wands and sprayed the house down and all the dust and grime came off real quick. Also used it to wash my truck, and it made it quick and easy work with the same process pre-treating with the solution, quick sponging then spraying it down with the pressure washer and it worked great. I haven't had any problems with any of the attachments, hoses, or connectors. I have no leaks and it is super easy to get the unit into operation. I am very very pleased with this purchase and I was rather nervous about buying something like this online without being able to see it in person but if you are looking for a decent pressure washer at a great price for general cleaning this will do everything you need and at the price its great.

reviews.review_header: Easy to use. An indispensable tool for the home.
reviews.review_text: Works great, however treat with care. This is not one of those tough as nails gas powered pressure washers that your dad used to have. You know the ones I'm talking about, right? The ones where you fight with the starter just like an old gas lawnmower. And noisy as an old chainsaw. The slick little unit is extremely quiet and easy-to-use. Just plug it in and off you go. I really don't know how I got along without it now that I'm used to using it. But it as others have said it's made of plastic and probably won't hold up to much abuse so treat with care.

I bought this pressure washer for my son as a housewarming gift. It was actually the second one I had bought him. I had originally purchased the "Green Machine" at Lowes. Well we went through 2 of those and I finally had my money refunded. I decided to buy the AR Blue Clean based on the reviews on Amazon.com and I watched a video that one of the reviewers had posted. Looked easy to assemble. Well, Let me tell you. I received this machine and decided to use it on my patios before I gave it to my son in case there was a problem.
