Just like the reviews, easy to assemble and NO LEAKS!!! Love it !! The sprayer has a mechanism to widen the spray pattern or shorten it. That's great.. No losing tips. I did my self a favor and used bleach on the patios before I used the pressure cleaner. It made very short work of the process. It's a great little pressure washer and it worked as promised. My son now has it and loves it. Glad I bought the AR Blue Clean.
Not sure how I lived without one. We have used it to clean just about everything possible.

Should man really have this much power in his hand? The power to lift stains and dirt from years past with a single stroke? Sounds a little God-like to me... These questions and many more await you as you pressure wash your first drive way at 10:00 pm because the stupid UPS guy came late and then you have to eat dinner and put kids in bed... After they are asleep though...then questions like am I living life to the fullest, because it could all be gone just like this dirt on this driveway?!? Then you attach the turbo nozzle and think yes...yes I am living life to the fullest.

reviews.review_header: It does a great job, the only restriction being on the part ...
reviews.review_text: I am a 78 year old woman and live in a 3000 sq. ft. free standing house with all the associated driveways, walks, etc. I was able to assemble this pressure washer with no help by reading the instructions, looking at the pictures, and remembering to press the reset button each time the unit was unplugged to move it around. It does a great job, the only restriction being on the part of the operator who gets tired after a few hours and needs a break.

Bought this pressure washer to replace AR blue 112 1600 PSI, very happy with this unit. The added 300 PSI made spring cleaning a snap. Great for washing siding and driveways. Not bad for the price. I didn't want a large gas powered pressure washer, this is nice and light and very powerful. Great for medium duty jobs.

I read the reviews before ordering and this product works as advertised. Of course, I was warned about the plastic coupler and sure enough, I had a lot of difficulty even connecting my garden hose to it. The brass coupler that I had bought with the unit works fine, although there is a slight leakage if turned a certain way. The instructions are a bit vague and not detailed enough, but intuition saves the day. I bought the product to get rid of the algae on my concrete steps, patio floor, and driveway, and this product works exceptionally well for that. First I used the high-pressure nozzle to loosen the algae, then switched to the "regular" nozzle for cleanup and washing away the debris. The regular nozzle is safe enough to use on my hanging chandelier porch lite and even rinsing off my car. The 1900 psi high-pressure nozzle is great for special jobs like algae removal. I was concerned about using any chemicals near my landscaping vegetation, so am happy that this unit works fine without any additives. Make sure you wear appropriate attire, this unit works great, but the process can be pretty messy! This item would have gotten five stars except for the plastic coupler and sketchy instructions. All in all, a great product, and definitely I would do it all over again!

I just got done using the AR383 electric power washer for the first time. I am extremely impressed with its performance! Two weeks ago I used a gasoline powered washer to remove dead moss off a porch and sidewalk at my sisters house. It was rated at 3000 psi and worked quite well. Today I used the AR383 on my sidewalks which had dead moss buildup for the last several years. This washer removed the moss just as good as the more powerful washer did and was much quieter. Plus I didn't have to stop and fill a tank with smelly gasoline half way through the job. So far I am very happy I purchased this pressure washer. Oh yes, I almost forgot, I have one minor quibble. You need to insert a washer in the water hose connector before hooking up the hose. If you don't it will leak badly. I think they should include that washer. Luckily I had an extra washer to insert and it stopped the leak.

Unfortunately, I assembled this item after the return date as I had to wait for the weather to change to have use it. It is terrible, you'd have more water pressure putting your finger over a hose. And places where it attaches to hoses are plastic, and weak-looking plastic at that. Feel completely ripped off. There should not be a cut-off return date for faulty items such as this.

reviews.review_header: You will be better served by loosely coiling it and hanging it around ...
reviews.review_text: Since buying this pressure washer (based on reviews) I've used it about 6 times. The fittings all work well and don't leak - I did proactively replace the fitting on the front with a brass double female connector based on comments in the reviews. The hose is quite stiff. You will be better served by loosely coiling it and hanging it around the top handle vs. wrapping it into the spindle. My only complaint - the storage notches for the 2 main nozzles are poorly engineered and don't fit the nozzles well. One of the "teeth" on a storage notch has already broken when I tried to get a nozzle to securely seat for storage. Other than that - right price, right tools, very good pressure.

reviews.review_header: Wand is easy to hold and operate
reviews.review_text: Powerful product. Does what it says it should do. Wand is easy to hold and operate. Cord is long enough to attach to your garden hose/water supply as is the electrical cord. Leaks a tiny bit but who cares, my patio stones have never looked better and cleaner and no detergent is really needed. Price was great too when it was a deal of the day.

We have a high end white resin wicker set and a 100 % plastic deck. Both are low maintenance but we could never get them really clean, especially the woven wicker. We just used the AR383 on both and they look brand new. Machine is easy to set up and use. My wife won't let me near it. If it doesn't move it looks like it's going to get power washed so I guess I better get moving. By the way you don't need to buy the brass male adapter Amazon suggests, it comes with one.

Worked the first time I used it. Doesn't work now. Now I'm going to have to call the company, get one of those damn RMA's, send it back, probably at my own expense. I'll let you know if things change. Update: Called AR Customer service. Very friendly. Willing to help me troubleshoot (yeah, I'm a bit bummed we're having to troubleshoot it's second use) and promised they'd send a new unit if we don't get it working. More updates later.

reviews.review_header: It works so great and it's very easy to move around
reviews.review_text: I bought this in 2013 and it's still going strong. I use it at my daycare and just pressure washed my chairs from the classrooms last weekend. It took the dirt right off, and they were filthy. I had been scrubbing the chairs and could not get the dirt off, but that little pressure washer did the trick and they looked brand new. It works so great and it's very easy to move around. I can throw it in my truck and move it around while I am pressure washing because it is so light. I like that it's electric and I don't have to mess with the gas. For the price, it has been absolutely wonderful.

Since this was my first pressure washer, I wasn't sure what to expect. The AR Blue Clean AR383 was received quickly and well packaged. Assembly was pretty easy. The new added clear plastic connecter for attaching the garden hose seems to work fine. There was some leaking, but that is to be expected. The unit fired up on the first try and I was up and running right away. The pressure was pretty good - I'm not stripping any wood or anything hardcore with it, but it was effective for home use overall. I hit the rims on my car with the pressure nozzle and it took the winter grime right off! Effortless! We also have an oil spot on the driveway. We sprayed at it for a while and got a decent amount off. Then I rand to Menards and got some degreaser cleaning solution and put that in the bottle that came with the unit - that seemed to help quite a bit. The spot is still there (as expected), but it's nowhere near as bad as it was. Overall, pretty happy with the unit and looking forward to using it more!

This was pretty easy to setup. The instructions are very clear, and assembly takes just 5 minutes. It has enough pressure for basic jobs around the house, and giving your cars a nice clean. I used it on 20 year old lawn mower, to clean out its deck, and this thing worked like a charm. Happy with it so far.

For the occasional yearly house cleaning/driveway/screen/windows job, this is great. The cords are quite annoying, the pressure side is all plastic, so it's rather inflexible and has a memory to it. The cord holder/nozzle holders seem cheap and impractical. The reel for the hose is absolutely worthless. As other reviewers suggested, don't bother with it. However: It sprays excellent, it's reasonably small/low weight, and it's low cost. If I power washed driveways and homes as a side job, I would not buy this unit. But for the occasional home job, it delivers.

This AR replaced a small Generac suitcase pressure washer that I've owned for years and "worked to death". I liked the Generac but it was not economical to repair, even with me providing labor. The first thing I did was remove the cheesy reel from this AR. Other reviewers are correct in cautioning not to knock it over while the plastic inlet filter fitting is connected. I also purchased a wand hose extension which along with the longer power cord gives me good reach around my house. I like the flow switch function that starts and stops the pump when the gun trigger is activated or released. The real beauty of these homeowner style pressure washers is the low use of water versus the cleaning effectiveness. If you are still using the garden hose thumb over the end method it's time to upgrade!

I bought this to replace on old electric pressure washer that failed on me after 10+ years. This one in comparison is cheap feeling, but it does the job. Personally I do not regret buying it (yet) but if I needed a more sturdy pressure washer I would look elsewhere

I purchased this item with the intent on cleaning my deck, which had become weathered over the past few years. I was a little skeptical that an item this inexpensive would do the job. However, I was pleasantly surprised at the power of the unit and the ease at which it removed years of grime. I also used it to clean my grill and plan on pressure washing my driveway in the next couple of weeks. Functionally you couldn't ask for a better electric pressure washer at any price. I do agree with other users, however, that the hose reel seem like an afterthought and that having to remove all the accessories to wind the power cord is a little inconvenient. Otherwise, this is a very solid unit.

This is our 2nd one of this model that we've ordered. We live on a big farm (lots of pressure washing opportunities!), but I didn't want to haul around a clunky pressure washer, so we got this one about 5-6 years ago. My husband (big tool and equipment guy) was hugely skeptical of an electric pressure washer...but we both LOVED it. The thing is awesome. Unfortunately, we forgot that it was on our back porch during a deep freeze this winter and some water expanded and cracked the interior. Our bad. We just replaced it with the exact same model, that's how much we love this thing.

Well, let me say the 2 times it worked I absolutely loved it. It was the perfect strength for what I needed around the house. On the 3rd time after camping I got it out to wash kayaks, coolers, etc. and after about 5 minutes it stopped and has not worked again. By the time I used it the 1st time it had been several months and now over a year so now I guess I'm just out of luck and a bunch of money.

reviews.review_header: Works great, not noisy, light weight, no leaking as other have mentioned.
reviews.review_text: Finally had a chance to use this pressure washer thought its late in the year. I used it to clean the algae growth off the brick and on the concrete patio in the back. I was skeptical since reading about others that had leaking spraying at the hose connection. First time, it sprayed leaking water all over. I disconnected it and looked at it, loosen the adaptor off the hose and reconnected. This time I made sure it was all the way screwed into the adaptor. Put it back on and no leaks at all. So make sure you have tighten it all the way down. Just hand tighten it down! After that, it worked beautifully, no high pitch noise at all, pump motor kicked in when ever I pressed down on the trigger and turned off when I released the trigger. It works great removing the dark black algae and dirt build up on the concrete and the green to dark green algae on the brick. I used the adjustable nozzle head. Was at it for at least an hour, turning it on and off as I was finishing and working my way around the outside of the hose. THe only minor inconvenience was that the pressure line felt a bit rigid when moving about but still totally workable. Would recommend to others. Lightweight, no high pitch sound when running, no leaking at the hose adaptor (as long as you have actually handtighten the adaptor to the hose, then popping it back onto the unit!) Its easier that way.

This thing is pleasantly surprising and I have used it more than I originally had thought. It works great for siding, brick, concrete, and washing vehicles. It has plenty of power for those jobs and zero maintenance. There are a couple of issues that are purely design flaws. 1. The hose reel is a joke. I used it for awhile until I noticed it was kinking the hose. 2. The electrical cord holder is a completely unnecessary pain. Vacuums have been using the rotating 'hook' for decades so you can quickly pull the entire spool off, why not this thing?! I didn't buy a swivel adapter like a lot of users suggested and haven't ever felt like I needed to. If you are looking for something to use periodically and don't need the power (or maintenance) of a gas one, you'll be happy with this.

I used this to wash a deck before staining it. It is OK especially considering the cost. The fittings and attachments seem solid and I am happy I purchased it. A pricier, electric pressure washer that I have borrowed from a friend a few times is much more powerful. This translates to time savings since it can cover more area faster with more consistent results. If you don't mind spending a little more time taking care of your project and you want a nice, compact system at a good value, this is a solid choice. Just don't expect a great amount of power at this price point. It would be ideal for car washing and other projects that do not require much power.

reviews.review_header: Great Product (once you get it connected)
reviews.review_text: I must echo the other reviewers who decry the connectors to get the garden hose into the unit. The problem is that the actual washer has a MHT (male hose thread) connector that is slightly recessed. So when you try to screw on the plastic connector that comes with the unit, it is difficult to get it seated well. Next, the filter piece that is supposed to attach to your garden hose has a FPT (female pipe thread) connector. Yes, different sized threads. Once I went to Home Depot and bought good brass connectors, the unit works great. It is quiet, light, easy to control and no more gasoline and pulling the starter thread. If AR just upgraded the connectors to all brass and all HT (hose thread), this would be a 5-star product hands down!

reviews.review_header: So far I love my pressure washer
reviews.review_text: So far I love my pressure washer. It comes with two wands, one is like a pin thin though. I can't really figure out what you would use it for except for getting really detailed. PS...Dont stick your hand in front of it. I did and it put a small hole in the tip of one of my fingers....It's pretty strong....

reviews.review_header: Nice pressure washer for the price
reviews.review_text: I borrowed a friend's Karcher unit a few weeks ago and decided I needed a pressure washer. He told me he got it at Amazon and paid around $200. I looked on Amazon and this unit came up as a best seller and was right around $150. I purchased it and used it for a good 4 hours the first day cleaning off our cement patio. The unit worked great and I thought it performed as well as my friend's Karcher that was $50 more. As others have mentioned, it is plastic and if you don't take care of it, I'm sure some pieces may break off, etc., but I generally take good care of things. Also, the hose to the gun is no that easy to spool, but I figured out how to do it rather quickly. I would recommend this unit.

I initially loved this little power washer. When it worked, it worked great. It was quiet, and did not leak. Switching out the wands was a bit of a pain, but not bad. Of course, when the warranty expired, then began the problems. First, the twist lock mechanism came apart. I could live with that, and everything worked ok. Now, it is dead. It doesn't power up at all. I've reset the breaker in the plug and used it in different outlets. Nothing. I am very disappointed, as I have only used it a half dozen times or so in the last year.

We purchased this with the desire to have an electric pressure washer instead of gasoline and we were pleased. Gasoline is more powerful but this met our needs and will be able to be used again and again. The rotating nozzle was fantastic and cleaned the gunk (mold?, years of pollution, off the driveway. Being careful kept it from damaging the concrete but, if the nozzle is too close, it starts to eat away at the concrete. It will clean wood but it isn't as fast as the gas models I have rented before. Both will splinter the wood if it's old or if you get in too close. A few cons: Ensure that the nozzle wand is securely in place and locked. The bottle attachment could use a little handle to make it easier to use. It takes a little longer than gasoline powered models and the spray width isn't as broad. Then again it's 1900PSI and not 3500PSI! The unit does not kick on unless water is flowing; it can be a surprise the first time when it doesn't appear to work. The plastic coupling unit feels cheap; while convenient, I expect it will break after a few uses.

This is the second unit I bought. The hose burst in several places on the first one after three uses. The second one was used a couple of times then sat unused for several months. We just used it yesterday for about two hours and then today for another hour. Hose just burst again. Clearly this is a defective product as many people have had this issue and now I have had it twice with VERY limited use. So disappointing.

reviews.review_header: A bit cumbersome but does a great job
reviews.review_text: Definately as promised, the piece that hold the hose broke but its easy to pull too hard, so probably my fault. I ordered two as a replacement and back up. For a home use system, it works really well, just have to get familiar with the pulling and clamping on of the hoses. I haven't had success winding up the cord on the wheel, but I certainly have been using it for all types of washing jobs! Can't live without (one) !

I have used this pressure washer several times and it works well. I have cleaned my picnic table and sidewalks of built up mold, and it has done a jod job of cleaning. I have used an environmentally safe cleaning solution beforehand to lightly scrub the sidewalk, then the pressure washer finishes the job. Sidewalk is very clean now. TIPS: The hose connection to the unit leaked when I first connected it finger-tight. I used plumber tape on all the male threads (can be bought at Home Depot) and tightened all connections with a pair of vise grips. CAUTION - do not attempt to overtighten any platic fitting, only snug tight (can't loosen with fingers) will be just fine. Also, I use a 3/4-inch garden hose,and only turn water spigot on about 1/2 turn (we have strong water pressure from the city). Leaks stopped after doing this. I also use a no. 14 outdoor rated 50-foot extension cord. Wand connection requires a little muscle to get it disconnected, but if you use the same tip all the time, you do not need to do this. I really like the fact that the motot and pump shuts off when you release the trigger. I would recommend purchase of this product. John F, Concord, NC

reviews.review_header: We unboxed this bad boy and put it to work immediately
reviews.review_text: We unboxed this bad boy and put it to work immediately. It did an awesome job on our 25 year old fence, I cannot believe the difference. I haven't had a chance to use it on the deck or concrete patio. (being in a drought we have to be careful and space these projects out) Not one leak on any of the fittings and it performed perfectly. Not nearly as loud and high pitched as our old power washer either. Very very happy with our purchase.

I've had this for a year. Works better than my old one (can't remember the brand). I like the way it shuts off when you let off the trigger. I wish there was a trigger lock, the hand can get fatigued after a while. Rolling the hose up every time is inconvenient so I just coil it and hang it on a hook. I'm satisfied with its performance.

reviews.review_header: Great, but handle-hose interface breaks waaaay too easily
reviews.review_text: I've owned this now for a couple of years. In that time it's been used maybe 20 times or so. I've nothing but good thing to say about it in general, but there is a significant weak spot - where the high-pressure hose joins to the handle. I've been through 3 new handles now, and it's particularly annoying when you put it away working, take it out to work on a deadline, and the darn high-pressure hose starts popping off the handle at the drop of a hat making it unusable. My advice is to keep a handle (replacement part costs $20) spare with the unit, so you're ahead of the game when it breaks on you. Apart from that it's a great little power-washer.

reviews.review_header: First impression. Compares favorably against Karcher
reviews.review_text: Just used this unit for the first time. Like the lightweight/portability factor. In anticipation of the possible leak that some others reported, I placed some Teflon tape (readily available at any good hardware store) on the threads, NO leakage at all. Seems like a better engineered product than the Karcher brand. BTW, I have had 3 Karcher electric units previous to this purchase. Each one lasted about a year or so- stopped working properly due to internal leaks or pump malfunction. Sick of wasting my money on Karcher.

reviews.review_header: Excellent customer service from AR Blue
reviews.review_text: I bought this item from Amazon on July 20th, 2011. It worked great. I used it regularly and it met all expectations. Beginning of July 2012, while using it to clean my deck, I smelled something burning and saw a little smoke coming out from one of the vents. I immediately switched it off, and let it cool down. But since then I was not able to start it. The machine was dead. I called AR Blue and explained the issue. One person from the company scheduled a troubleshooting session over the phone with me, but found the machine is dead (burnt out). Since there was still some days left on the warranty, AR Blue immediately processed the warranty and send me an exactly same new replacement washer. It arrived on time, and it works great as my old one (before it burnt out). I really appreciate the way AR Blue customer service handled the issue, including processing the warranty.

reviews.review_header: Great washer for the price and my needs!
reviews.review_text: The washer arrived quickly, even faster than the seller originally indicated, well packed and with all its pieces. I was able to assemble it easily and attach the hose with no problems or leaks. I initially used it to clean my dirty stained wooden deck and my painted gazebo. It was strong enough to easily do the deck and bring back a clean finish and it even took off the peeling paint from the gazebo and avoided my having to scrap for hours. I then took it to my friends house and cleaned the mold from her siding, cleaned the concrete walk and steps and the concrete foundation on the house, It worked like a charm. Of course you need to hold the nozzle at a close proximity to the surface and move in smooth sweeps to get a clean pattern. You get splatters of water on you, but that's expected. I love this washer and can hardly wait to use it again. It is easy to store and has plenty of cord length for the electrical plug.

reviews.review_header: Tip for connecting garden hose and note about customer service experience
reviews.review_text: The manual and assembly instructions are not printed to the highest quality or sized for my aging eyes so I downloaded the manual in PDF from AR and enlarged. Assembly easy except I naturally assumed the clear plastic male connector (the name in the instructions is "Garden Hose Adapter (clear plastic) PW3082130") was for the garden hose. It's not. It won't thread onto the garden hose at all. I contacted the company via email since it was Sunday. I could have called Mon during business hrs but I wanted to get a task out of the way while I was thinking of it. I had a response in my Inbox Mon morning. I didn't read it well enough and I made a snarky-to-possibly-neutral tone reply and 10 min later, called them. I was told the clear plastic connector was metric and needed to be attached to the machine. The black and green connector attaches to the hose. Easy fix. Here's the important part. I was impressed by their customer service! I got a timely reply and they didn't point out that I was an idiot (I told them I was when I thanked them and apologized for not carefully reading their answer) but instead, were kind. Wow, what a big difference from some companies (like Roku, who fought me tooth-and-nail when they overcharged me $20 on my 4th device purchase. I had to return the purchase since they weren't going to honor their email offer, duplicated and posted online, or their many customer service verbal promises. Sorry, still burning over that. Just saying, you never know who's has good customer service until you need it)

Based on reviews I thought this would be a good around the house pressure washer. I assembled the unit easily enough. Thefirst time using this I was cleaning a cement walk way. Literally within 3 minutes of use the motor started smoking. I shut it off, boxed it up, and sent it back. The hose reel on this is completely useless and takes more effort to wind up than just looping the hose over the handle. The power cord does not fit on the cord storage area because it hits the output hose. The water hose connection is made of plastic and I can see this getting broken very easily. Overall this is a poor design and not convenient for storage of the hose and cord.

reviews.review_header: Not 5 stars but good bang for the buck
reviews.review_text: Out of the box, this thing feels kindof cheap. Very fraggile . The plastic fitting that your inlet hose connects to is junk just like everyone said, ii couldnt even get the threads started. I used a washer machine hose as a coupling. But ill be buying a brass connector soon. So I put this thing to the test today, my reason for purchasing this unit was to clean my brick paver patio. And it did the job, without any chemicals this thing blasted off the moss, the weeds and dirt from the seams and did a over all great job. I hope it holds up for a few more years of use . This machine was worth the money for me as a homeowner. I'm glad I didnt spend the extra $ on a gas machine, this has plenty of power.

I bought the ar 383 approximately four weeks ago. After doing alot of research looking at many blogs! I decided on a ar 383 because no gas fumes to smell or gas too buy or mess. Also pretty quiet compared to gas. That being said one must realize it won't do the same job a gas pressure washer will, but for home use it does just fine! Weather broke last week so I decided to give a try, has quick connect for house water side leaks alittle but bought female/female to solve that problem, but for now it does just fine. took the advise of another blog and use either vasoline or white multi purpose lube on fittings ( every other time). I've used the ar 383 for a total of about five hours, with few rest stops and works great! Not as fast as gas, but be patient gets the job done no scrubbing! Also the reel a good idea, but it's much easier to just wrap both electrical cord and hose by hand and use twist tied then hang over handle, stores just great that way! cons: Unit is alittle light so when pushing on/off button hold on to machine or might flip over. If this unit holds up for a couple of years or more it will be worth the money! A little common sense will go along way!

Purchased this unit after many frustrating years operating and repairing a gasoline powered Craftsman pressure washer. This unit is lightweight, easily mobile, cleaned cement and brick more thoroughly with actually less power than our old unit. The AR is not bulky, and adapts to different usages and is slated for many more powerful cleanups around our home and garage. Telephone support is excellent should you need any info. It is gratifying that this unit delivers fine performance at an affordable price...so much so that another member of our family purchased one as well after trying ours!

I was originally looking at gas models, as I would have never considered an electric model. I didn't think electric models could put out sufficient pressure. However, after reading the reviews and considering that the price was 1/2 of the cheapest gas models, I decided to go with it. Long story short, this pressure washer has more than enough power. I wouldn't need the additional power of a gas model. A nice feature is that the motor shuts off when when you release the trigger; unlike a gas model which would continue to run. That makes it easy to stop for other tasks without worrying about the gas motor running. Note, one common complaint I saw was with the leaky water hose connection. As of my first use, I did not see any leaks. Another complaint was the stiff pressure hose. I did find that to be correct. I'll wait to see if it relaxes after more uses.

reviews.review_header: Best cleaner for the money out there (I've had three ...
reviews.review_text: Best cleaner for the money out there (I've had three other brands) with one nick-picking flaw. The clear plastic hose adapter that is screwed onto the unit needs to be beefed up somehow where the females threads narrows to accept the adapter that is screwed onto the hose. I tried moving the unit with its handle while dragging the water hose with it …. which was at a cockeyed angle… and the clear adapter cracked. Yes, it was my fault, but I noticed the thickness of the plastic was relatively thin. No big deal. Just be aware of the potential breakage, position the hose, THEN move the unit. OR come up with some way to strengthen the adapter.

Very powerful for a little washer. Just got this last weekend and i think its perfect for washing vehicles and the frames or under the wheel wells. Any larger of a power washer and you would probably take off clear coat. Only thing i dont like is the power cord roll up and the washer hose reel.

reviews.review_header: this pressure washer does the job!
reviews.review_text: I am very pleased with the AR Blue Clean pressure washer. After reading all of the specs and reviews (both of which are very helpful) i Decided that this piece of equipment would do the job I needed and it does. Its very helpful to have a lot of information available to help in making a decision. Even reading the reviews sometimes it is clear that people have expected the equipment to perform at a level that was not intended for this specific unit. Buying the right equipment for the job and being realistic about what to expect makes for a successful purchase. Amazom makes those choices easier! Packaging was great, delivered on time, performs as expected …what more could one ask!

I received this power washer yesterday and spent about 2 hours cleaning off a section of our extremely long driveway. I had zero problems with this unit. Set up was extremely easy. I didn't need any kind of adapter for the hose, except what was included in the box. Absolutely no leaks. I love the adjustable pressure sprayer. It's light weight, easy to maneuver. QUIET! It's so quiet. The kids can be napping inside and I can be power washing away, which would not happen with a gas powered washer! We had rented a gas power washer from Home Depot last year and for 24 hours it cost almost $120. I would much rather get one that I can KEEP forever for only $30 more. You will not regret this purchase!

I love this little unit! Have used it several times and has great pressure and it is a breeze to swap out 'wands'. Takes less than five minutes to set up and put away. The design could be a bit better, the cord does not stow easily and the reel for the pressure hose is hard to use, so I use the reel for the cord now and just hang the hard plastic pressure hose on a hook. No leaks from the plastic hose filter adapters on my unit either. Very happy so far!

reviews.review_header: Works fine for what I use it for
reviews.review_text: Not sure it actually puts out 1900 psi because it cleaned the same as my old 1700 psi Husky that went missing from my garage. Put it together in a few minutes and all parts and accessories work and fit well. There is a small leak where the water connects but I can fix that with an all metal quick connect if I want. Light weight and the cord reel wound up the sprayer hose with no problem for me. If it lasts as long as my old Husky did I will be satisfied. P.S. be careful when attaching the sprayer to the back of the unit because it is easy to tear up the threads.

I purchased this pressure washer with some hesitation as I thought that a gas powered machine may be the better choice. I was wrong as it has done an excellent job on sidewalks, siding, concrete walls, my charcoal grill, wood and composite decking. I do not understand the reviews that complain about the stiffness of the hose, leaking of the connections and hose reel. I have not experienced any of these issues and the deck, patio and flat surface cleaning head is a must buy -- saves a ton of time. The compact design makes it easy to keep all of the components together and it stores neatly in the corner of my garage. One of my best home purchases!

reviews.review_header: AR Blue Clean AR383 Pressure Washer
reviews.review_text: For the price of this unit you cannot, I repeat, cannot, go wrong. I had my reservations when I ordered it but they were soon erased. I have only had this washer about a month and have washed all the awnings (fabric) on the house, all the decks, all the cars, the motorcycle and the tractor. I have to tell you, I am impressed. I have a gasoline powered 3400psi washer that will etch concrete and is just too powerfull for most home applications whereas this washer is just the ticket, you can use it with out destroying things. One drawback is the supply water hose connection in the front of the unit. It is a quick disconnect made of plastic and I wouldn't want to put too much force on it. As far as the reel for the pressure hose, I don't even bother with it, it's easier and faster to coil it up and hang it on the machine. When all's said and done, you cannot go wrong with this washer. As to it's survivability down the road, that remains to be seen, but I am more than satisfied with this purchase so far. I would recommend it to anyone who's looking.

reviews.review_header: works great except for the completely worthless hose reel
reviews.review_text: works great except for the completely worthless hose reel. if you try the wind up the hose it kinks the hose and never looks like the picture. I thought it had a swivel so the hose would stay attached and just roll out but its just a reel for storage that's way to small for the hose supplied. just coil up the hose and lay it over the machine. other than the reel it works very well.

I originally saw this on QVC and decided to check Amazon, whose price is lower and whereas QVC had a model with 1,800 PSI I found this one with 1,900 PSI. It's lightweight and I did my driveway with no problems. I have yet to use on my car as have to practice more before using on paint. I did have to re-set the switch at first and do occasionally as it does shut off, but it's not a problem. My only complaint is that the handle doesn't lock in on mode, and if it does? then it is something I haven't discovered as did read the manual. Awesome Product, can't complain.

reviews.review_header: Received 2 units and both had bad motors
reviews.review_text: I am the guy who spends hours researching products prior to purchasing. So much so, most of my family asks me to look into items they are considering for Christmas, b-days, etc. Knowing that electric pressure washers have progressed considerably in the recent past, I thought I would give one a shot. I had no expectations that an electric unit would provide as much power as an equivalent gas unit. However, I was only needing it for light duty house stuff (i.e. small patio and deck, a little vinyl siding, and some window cleaning). The reviews for the AR383 appeared to be pretty solid so I gave it a shot and purchased it in March. Upon receiving the unit I got it all hooked up appropriately and began to clean some windows. I was generally happy with the initial pressure and operation of the unit. After about 8-10 mins of use, the motor began to rumble and overheat along with a noticeable loss of pressure. I stopped and let it cool down. I returned about an hour later and began again. The motor overheated again and smoke began to rise out of the unit. The highly identifiable smell of smoldering electronics/motors was present as well. The unit was done for. Thinking I got a bad motor, I contacted Deerso and the manufacturer. Both customer service reps offered to send a second unit at no charge and stated I could keep the first one for parts if I wanted. 2nd unit arrives in short time and I fire it up again. Exact same result as the first unit. In both cases I made it a point to ensure that a constant cold water source was fed to the unit, so at this point I am fairly confident that the motor unit is poorly engineered and/or constructed as the cooling system is obviously faulty. Deerso, AR North America, and Amazon all handled the issue incredibly timely and professionally. A full refund was issued including the shipping costs. With the number of great reviews for this product, I can't say that it is a poor product. However, I can say that the 2 units I received were complete lemons. If you want to give it a shot and don't mind the minor inconveniences associated with the refund/return process then go for it. I can attest that Deerso and AR North America will assist if you have problems. Hopefully you will receive a better unit then I did.

Overall this is a great power washer. The adjustable tip to change from a fan to stream was very handy. One complaint that I have is the quick connect. The piece that I had to attach to the garden hose leaked constantly. I eventually had to get pliers out to tighten it enough to stop. I think in the process of getting it back off I may have damaged the coupler. I will be buying a metal coupler instead of using the plastic one they have.

reviews.review_header: Works great. Well organized and light
reviews.review_text: Did lots of research on pressure washers. This seemed like one of the highest PSI ratings and other good reviews led me to purchase this. Pretty quiet in comparison to my old Karcher unit and the extra pressure makes jobs go quicker. Cleaned a 75 ft x 12 foot deck and the same length of concrete with some staining on it. Definitely purchase the Nelson Industrial Brass Pipe and Hose Fitting with Dual Swivel for Male Hose to Male Hose, Double Female 50574 mentioned in other reviews. That makes connecting your hose easy and doesn't damage the connector on the unit. The host reel and the cord storage make this easy to store and it's probably a good 15 lbs lighter than the Karcher unit was, so storage is a breeze. Used it twice so far, once for heavy duty cleanup and the second time was a quick cleanup. Worked great both times.

AR North America AR383 1,900 PSI 1.5 GPM 11 Amp Electric Pressure Washer With Hose Reel I have always used a gas powered pressure washer, but this was equal and much quieter. With 1900 psi, it was effective - not as quick as a more powerful gas unit but did a good job in a reasonable time. I would like to have a longer hose, but found the unit light and easy to move around. The only thing I had a little difficulty with was the lower bracket in back used to wind the power cord around. It is situated very close to the pressure hose connection, and I had to remove the bracket to get a firm grip on the hose to screw it in place. Then I replaced the bracket and will leave the hose connected between uses. I was very pleased and am looking forward to more jobs with it. Nice unit and easy to assemble.

I used the ar383 pressure washer today and was very happy with the product. It did not leak out of any of the fittings and did a very good job of removing the tree pollen stains and pitch from my car. My wife and I also cleaned all the windows around the house and my backyard deck. Once she used it I could not get it back. She wants to do all the cleaning with it now and I am very happy to let her do so. My Deck is concrete and it took off all the built up dirt and stains on the deck. In my opinion this pressure washer is great for your around the house projects and I highly recommend it. The only con is you cannot hook up the pressure hose while the power cord is wrapped around its holder.

reviews.review_header: Attachments are not easy to change out with my washer either
reviews.review_text: Bought it March 2012. Just recently the fitting from the wand to the hose rusted through and just broke off squirting water. The fittings are not NPT - the male connection is not tapered. So you can't just run to the hardware store and buy a 1/4" coupling or union. Attachments are not easy to change out with my washer either. Just info. Other than that it's worked good. Since this was my first ever power washer, I'll probably try something else next time though.

The first one received only worked for 2 hours. It took the companies' customer service over a week to get a replacement in my hands.( I was told that their dept. is a week behind- - not a good sign), BUT, the replacement has worked perfectly. I like the engineering of the design, compact, self-contained, does not "walk" around during use, and takes up very little storage space. It works very well for small jobs, patios, driveways, siding etc. Even with the slow(er) "customer service", I would still recommend.

This is my first powerwasher that I've owned. After reading other reviews I was worried about needing to purchase brass fittings. But I've used the powerwasher numerous times now and have had no issues with hoses leaking (particularly where you connect the garden hose to the washer). The washer is suprisingly light weight & has plenty of power. The wands really have to be pushed into to be connected securely, but easy once you get the hang of it. I agree with other reviews that the hose reel and how you wind the power cord is annoying when storing the unit. But overall I would definitely recommend this washer if you are looking for an electric washer.

This pressure washer works great for light and medium duty tasks, although after about 6 hours of use the second day I had it, whenever the trigger is released, the motor makes a small whining sound which it had not made when I used it the second day. I haven't noticed any loss in power or leaking of any kind though, but it does get slightly annoying if you're using it for a while.

reviews.review_header: Nice size power washer cleans my sidewalks
reviews.review_text: Nice size power washer cleans my sidewalks, patio and pavilion, and also vinyl siding. Delivers plenty of PSI power for my needs around the yard and garden. Highly recommend upgrading the hose coupling to solid brass. I did this after reading the reviews and have had no problems with leaking water. Especially like the upright feature of this power washer as it's not in the way as much as my old one which was a Karcher (that died after the 3rd use). Have used it all summer; about 4-5 times now, for several hours each time. Highly recommend!

Issues with this order. 1. The plastic adapter to fit a hose end was cross-threaded making it impossible to get a tight connection. 2. WORST is that the deadline to return this product was the exact same day it arrived. Summary: So now I have a machine that arrived with a defective fitting but it cannot be returned because the deadline to do so expired the same day the machine was delivered.

reviews.review_header: How did I live without this?
reviews.review_text: Love this product; so useful. Every spring its a big job to scrub the dirt and pollen off the wooden porch and decks of our old house, including white railings. This washer makes the task much easier and does a far better job on the railings, easily getting into the corners and details. It still takes time to get tough areas clean, but it is not as labor intensive as hand scrubbing and way better on complex surfaces. Also cleaned all our teak furniture. What I thought was a grey patina was really a lot of dirt and algae; seven years out in the weather and it looks like new now. I would highly recommend this product. I did buy the adaptor for the hose inlet that was recommended in many reviews. I tightened it with pliers as much as I dared and it still leaks. Annoying but I don't find it to be a big issue as your are pressure washing and everything is wet anyways.

I have had the unit for two months now. It takes about a half hour to assemble it. Used it three times now, one session went for about 3 hours. Worked very well, no leaks as some reviews have posted. Easily took the loose paint off an old deck in preparation for painting. Used both wands and found the power wand worked best on stripping the old paint. Did not try winding the power hose yet since it is pretty stiff. It easily sits on the unit. This unit could probably get the full 5 stars, however, holding to 4 only because I want to judge it's reliability over time. Bottom line, this unit is well worth the money. Note Amazon delivery was great. Ordered it on a Monday night and had it Thursday afternoon with regular shipping. Not saying it will happen this quick all the time, but it can.

This product is very poor in its construction & quality. YES - it does leak constantly from the time you plug in the water pipe, the water wastage is more at the connection than while doing the actual job . The Plastic Accessory holder in the rear is useless. I thought the power cord can be winded just below the handle as shown in product photo - BUT that's for the Hose only . I called the Customer service they said this product was meant for Europe & they changed a few parts ( Increasing the power cord & the hose length) You can never use rotating wheel because of the small diameter & the hose provided is extremely rigid & not user friendly. Making the whole deign useless. Customer Service asked me to wind the power cord and the hose around the washer since they will not fit in anywhere else . I am truly surprised that this is the BEST SELLER , I have no idea why my fellow buyers have rated it 5 Star . The quality of construction is flimsy & cheap. The pressure gun is poorly designed & causes fatigue compared to other brands - this is also because of the rigid hose . Strongly recommend – NOT TO BUY , I used it once & it’s a big waste of time & money .

Make sure you hook the clear to the machine and then the blue- had them reversed and that does work well... The roller for the wand hose is a waste in my opinion- hose is too stiff- hence a 4 star.......Works well for cleaning my patio furniture and cushions.. Will be using it for other things- Having owned and used other small power washers as well as well as larger ones- this perfect for all the smaller jobs- pressure is good and it is easy to hook up and get going- job done in no time...

Excellent, compact, lightweight and with all the accessories you need to work . Buy this unit to replace a damaged KARCHER K3 and no regrets. I use fresh out of the box for 4 hrs followed without any problem cleaning the mildew of my roof Things to consider: USE teflon to the unit threads for both hoses, have had no leaking because of this. - Whether you use an extension cord, I recommend using an extension minimum 14 AWG; this beauty needs 14 Ampers with 120 VAC to work and that can heat or burn cheap extensions 16 or 18 AWG wire.

Have only used the unit once for about 2 hours continuously - it worked jut fine!. I do not use the reel for the hose storage, as I feel the radius is too small and could place stress on the connection. Instead, I fold the power cord in 2 and place the loop into the space on the reel and wind it up, leaving the connector stored on top of the blue housing. I coil the pressure hose and store it where the power cord was supposed to go

AR Blue clean must listen to their customers. I read the reviews and ordered this plus the female/female hose coupling to replace the leaky part that everyone complains about. Well, I don't need it. AR now ships this with a quick connect, swivel connector with a check valve. What this means is that you can easily connect the hose (female part) to the sprayer body (male part). It doesn't leak, and when you need to disconnect the hose, just do it. The check valve keeps the hose from spraying everywhere. I used the sprayer for about an hour solid to clean a fence before staining. It works perfectly. Can't wait to use it for more household applications.

Summary: A small, compact pressure washer that is fine for occasional use. Two heads allow either a rapid spinning needle spray, or a variable wide to needle pattern. Pros: Compact, easy to use, good quality. The handle is comfortable, and the pressure is perfect for the casual exterior cleaning I do. If I need to do a deep cleaning, I'd rent a 3,000+ pound sprayer, as this is not designed for hard to clean jobs. The power cord is long (25 feet, I think) and the hose is about 10 feet long. So it reaches around the house from the power outlets fairly well. Cons: The hook-up for the water is plastic. This can be changed out for Brass, which I did. I'd buy it again. After three months of use, I remain pleased with the purchase. The one star deduction is for the cheap plastic ready-connect.

Pretty awesome so far. I have used it a good amount and it is definitely pretty powerful. The ONLY thing I do not like is that it pretty much is impossible to properly wrap the water hose to make it so it can be rolled in and out. I just leave it to the side. If there is a way to do it, PLEASE AR Company, PLEASE provide a link to properly set it up. I have spent hours and to no avail and there are no videos anywhere to show you how to do it. Other then that little downfall, like I said, pretty good stuff
works great as specified. I've used gas motor pumps and they usually are a little stronger but this one gets the job done and at 1/3 the price and way lighter.

reviews.review_header: Great little powerwasher and a great price
reviews.review_text: I've got a big power washer with a gas engine, but half the time it won't start, tons of bother, gas goes bad, etc. Enter this new little acquisition, just hook up the hose, plug it in and go. Plenty of power for any normal job, but not quite enough to remove the clear coat from your car by accident (personal experience). I've read about it "leaking", but have experienced none of that. Power cord is nice and long, wash hose is a reasonable length though I wish it was a bit more flexible as other reviewers have said. I'm not over fond of plastic connectors and such, but these are of good quality, very convenient, and so far no leaks at all. Comes nicely equipped out of the box, though I do wish it had a fan-spray pattern nozzle as well. Probably will get the optional one.

This pressure washer performed fine. I used it to clean my deck before staining. I really appreciated the wheels on it. My previous washer didn't have wheels and was heavy for me to lift and move around. I had a question and called the customer service line which was answered immediately and provided great service. I was impressed! I have some elderly neighbors whose back and front porches really needed cleaning of cobwebs, etc and the extra long electric cord was great when the outside outlet there did not work. There was enough length to plug it in in the garage The only drawback, which is probably true of all of the washers, is the hose reel. I really found it useless. Also, the attachment spaces on the back were pretty lame and I finally gave up and just tied everything to the washer.

reviews.review_header: What leaks ? This is a great unit
reviews.review_text: Obviously the product has been improved since some of the reviews about leaky fittings. Mine does not leak at all, Then there is the complaint about cheap plastic, well it is plastic but compared to the one I am replacing ( Home Depot) store brand it is leaps ahead in material quality. I expect many years out of this unit of light to occasional medium duty. HINT about the hose reel yes it would be a pain to wrap up that stiff hose into that small circumference reel every time your finished, However you can wedge the GFI plug into the opening sideways and use the reel to store the electrical cord and there is enough room to wrap up the whole cord.

This being my pressure washer, I did a lot of research. I finally decided to purchase this and it was delivered very fast! Only 4 days! I never realized how much stuff I needed to wash until I used it. I am giving it a 3 because there are a bunch of problems I noticed. Some good things about it first; my connection from the hose to the washer didn't leak like a lot of other people had, easy to hook up and install, easy on the eyes. Ok here are the problems! The handle should have had an option to stay help down for the long jobs such as cleaning the driveway. There is a reel for the hose to the handle which is pointless. It is such a PITA to use. It's a lot easier to just wrap the hose up and throw it on top. Sometimes the unit stalls and you have to let go and then re-squeeze a few times to get the pressure. To me this is a great first time washer, next time I will get a gas powered washer with at least 2500psi. I thought 1900 was a lot but realized I needed more.

Poorly made with low cost materials. I suppose you get what you pay for, but I was lured in by all the positive reviewed on Amazon claiming it was a great product. The washer is constructed from softer plastic which is cheaper to mold, but is less durable and does not hold its shape well. The hose storage was inconvenient and the soap dispenser was also poorly designed. I was replacing a Greenworks washer which to me was much better constructed and well worth the additional expense. No point to having tools that don't work.

reviews.review_header: 50 cent part ruined the entire product (and this was a brand new one bought in 2013)
reviews.review_text: I really wanted to like this power washer. The washer was packaged well and looked sturdy with the exception of one part. There is a small metal clip that locks the hose into the gun. For some reason, the clip popped off as I was putting the washer together. I then spent an hour trying to get the clip back on. Unfortunately, the hose would not connect to the washer. Epic fail and waste of 3 precious hours on a Sunday. I hope AR changes the lock mechanism on the gun. It looks like it could be a decent unit. I am going to Lowes to buy another brand.

reviews.review_header: Works well. Wish it had a little more oomph.
reviews.review_text: I am a tad of a clean freak and a friend recommended this to me. Overall, the thing works well. I have however not run into the leak problem people have talked about. I am cleaning things faster and more thoroughly with less water. I should have had one of these years ago. If I was to nit pick, I wish the nozzle for the added liquid container would pack a little more power. It seems just to spit the formula and water out. Also, the dials on the nozzles really do not give you a lot of choices. At least mine does not. It goes from powerful to nice for cleanup to a spray that looks like it would be good to mist plants at thats about it. Still, for the money, its a handy thing to have around the house.

This is the first electric pressure washer that I've used. It is definitely less powerful than the gas powered ones I've used in the past, but it's also considerably less expensive. It does 95% of what I want and 100% of what I need it to do. The hose reel and attachment caddy on the back are just about worthless. However, I would buy it again just because it does so well for the price.

I have had this washer for more than six months and I have had no problems. I have used it often, pressure washing decks, driveway and concrete floors. It is a very good household washer. Other reviews address hose and cord storage and I agree that the hose and cord storage is not the best . I wrap the cord around the reel and coil the hose when stored. I cannot think of any real negatives, so five stars for this fine product.

Great buy at the price due to the ease of use and effectiveness. I worked for a power washing company for one summer and used gas commercial units the whole time. YES they are more powerful, faster, and of course more fun but for most average users this is an awesome tool to have around the house. We did concrete, patio stones, random items like garbage cans and the bbq grill, the car. What was funny was that I didnt even have the propper soap (except for the car). I know some folks have issues with leaking and i did too. To fix this I stepped back. Took a deep breath. And tried to attach the pieces again. In haste I hadnt put them on perfect. THEY MUST BE PUT ON PERFECT. IF the thread is even a bit off it will leak like a race horse pees. Once PROPERLY assembled it is a pretty sweet toy.

Brought this product a few years back; the first time we used it -- it leaked where our water hose connected with the pressure washer but over all it worked. Within a few months it also started leaking where the pressure washer pipe connects to the handle. Now the leakage is so strong that the pressure from the unit is so low it is worthless! Would like the manufacture to contact me to repair the unit!

Great product, performed as advertised. Was worried it would not have enough power, but it did the job. I used it to power wash my fences and concrete patio floors and it worked great. Lots of uses around the house. It is small, compact, and was easy to store away in the garage. Storage wheel for tubing and power cable could be improve but not a deal breaker. Great accessories ( rotating power nozzle or head very nice extra). If you want a inexpensive, easy to use, sturdy unit, this is the one for you. Remember this unit is for home use, not heavy duty commercial use. I would highly recommend it for the homer owner.

First day I got it I used it to wash my car using the detergent bottle that came with , and my dad decided to clean to driveway after 20 years and you can see the big difference. The driveway job took hours because of the focused blast which tells me how reliable the pressure washer is after being constantly ran for hours. Overall great product and easy to understand instructions.

reviews.review_header: I'd say this PW can handle pretty much any chore around the standard house
reviews.review_text: My first experience with a pressure washer and I was pleasantly surprised how well it did. I'd say this PW can handle pretty much any chore around the standard house. I've used to wash the garage door, the front porch, and a few patios around the house. So far so good!

after have 2 Karcher power washer and finding that they worked well but didn't seem to last very long, we decided to try this AR Blue Clean power washer. the first time we used it, we washed the car the gulf cart, the tractor and lawn mower and truck. It seems to do a very good job, but was not crazy about how when you let go of the nozzle button, it will hesitate before it starts back up. This is a little aggravating, but time will tell as to how well it will work out and how long it last..

Have only used it once. Unit was relativel easy and simple to assemble and operating instructions were clear and straight forward. System operated with no leaks and pressure appeared to meet specs. On negative side, water hose, electrical cord, and miscellaneous fixtures could be better stored on body of unit. And, the water hose is somewhat difficult to manage when unit is being operated because it insists on kinking and twistind. Overall, I rated the unit as 8 on a 10 scale.

I received this washer yesterday and immediately went outside and did some sidewalk cleaning. I will say it does the job. The only negative that I have is the stiff plastic pressure hose. The unit did not leak a drop when I used it. Also the fitting for the pressure hose is now metal, not plastic. When I first squeezed the handle to spray, the pressure was not good and the unit was making a pulsing sound. Needless to say, a disappointment! I let up on the handle so I could check if my faucet was turned on all the way. When I squeezed the handle again, what a difference. I don't know why it didn't work well on the first try but it has worked great since. If I have any problems I'll update this, but for now I highly recommend this AR383 pressure washer.

This product has mostly excellent reviews so I won't add to that. Just want to clear up one issue. The negative reports have to do with the hose attachment leaking. That was a concern of mine. However, I read somewhere deep in one of the reports that this was user error rather than product problem. When I first put these pieces together I had the same problem. However, I realized that I had not mated the parts correctly. It took a little bit of doing but I finally snapped the connections in place fully and then nothing leaks. Over all, excellent value for the money and much easier to use then the gas versions.

reviews.review_header: great value in an electric washer
reviews.review_text: Just got the package and opened it right away. Simple to assemble. Other reviews I read here on Amazon suggested the hose connector leaked. Mine didn't at all. Just a few precautions ensure good operation: 1)make sure the water to the garden hose connected to the washer is turned on--not doing so will damage the pump; 2)make sure the power is turned on--use a large enough extension cord (correct gauge); 3)select the right extension wand for the job. The oscillating one is perfect for washing cars and doing light work. The smaller tip is great for more stubborn stains, but takes longer since the pattern is more concentrated. As usual, the shipping (free super saver) was timely and didn't take but a couple of days. All the parts seemed durable (many plastic.) The high pressure hose is a durable rubber, smaller in diameter. The only thing I didn't think was overly great was the hose reel, which is only for storing the hose, not for use during washing. All in all, very satisfied with the quality and features right out of the box.

reviews.review_header: Great Power for such a small unit
reviews.review_text: Other reviews are spot-on. No problems at all with leaking garden hose connection, connector now shipped with product must have been upgraded. This is not a gas unit and as such will not have the associated power. That said, the unit has no issue removing dirt, algae, mold, etc. from concrete and wood. Used almost non-stop for 2 days without any issue cleaning pool cover, wood deck and concrete with years of build-up. Did not use the accompanying cleaner container as the water pressure alone was enough. The cost of the unit was effectively 2 day rental for gas unit so already paid for itself. Granted the time it takes to do the same job is marginally longer due to water force but much lower noise and operation ease. Good construction, hose to wand doesn't easily kink, garden hose connection is solid. The small hose reel is a bit cumbersome, good for longer term storage but easier to just drape the hose over the handle if going to use frequently.

reviews.review_header: I can't say enough good things about this cleaner and the company
reviews.review_text: I can't say enough good things about this cleaner and the company. I purchased this washer late last year so just had a chance to really use it this spring. My vinyl deck and pergola use to take me hours to clean but this power washer cut that time in half. And it was actually fun to do. It is the perfect size for this 64 year old woman to tote around and once I figured out the connections, very easy to use. I had a couple of questions so I called the company. They were wonderful! Very helpful. Their aim is to please the customer!

reviews.review_header: very good unit, needs cord storage hooks
reviews.review_text: I was a little cautious as I started to use the pressure washer after reading some of the previous reviews. I was very careful as I attached the plastic hose connectors, and they worked great - no leaks, no problems. It has plenty of power to wash vinyl siding, wooden decking and an aluminum canoe. As far as design, I was leery of the wheel at the top as it seems small for the hose. I would prefer hooks on the sides for the power cord and for the high-pressure hose. It would be easier to store the machine that way.

Had a cheap Lowe's brand that died after one year of minimal use. Bought this one and literally used it for hours without stop and its still going. Love the attachment holders and wheels. Don't really use reel at all, more of a pain unless you use 1-2 times a year...which I use it more around the house. Easy to plugin and keep started. Will see how long it lasts, but super strong so far.

This little electric pressure washer really works. In contrary to some of the postings I have seen against it ("fittings are not tight", "there is water leaking all over", etc), I would like to declare that mine did not leak a drop of water. I used it continuously to wash my pool patio which took about 3 hours and later to wash my driveway. It took about 4 hours and it just worked and cleaned nicely. I used both nozzle extension (circular pattern & straight) and had similar performances (one does not necessarily wash faster than the other one by the way). I can't wait to use the detergent dispenser that came with it to wash my cars. I recommend this product for not so bid pressure washing jobs needed around the house.

reviews.review_header: I REALLY liked it so I purchased another one thru Amazon for ...
reviews.review_text: I originally purchased an AR Blue Clean electric pressure washer at a hardware store where we winter in Florida. I REALLY liked it so I purchased another one thru Amazon for our summer home. I have washed vinyl siding, stucco, our wood patio (in preparation for staining) and our pool deck, concrete, our vehicles - anything and everything that needs pressure washed. I have never had ANY problem with either of these power washers. It is lightweight and so easy to use. I HIGHLY recommend it.

reviews.review_header: Dead. Blue smoke after using it a few times
reviews.review_text: Dead - Used less than a dozen times. Excellent while it lasted...Finally drop in pressure and slower engine noise followed by blue smoke and some seriously bad smell. Search for "smoke" across the Amazon reviews. Seems like a rather common issue. Of course outside warranty now.

We purchased this as an Amazon Daily Deal, and it was a good buy for us. We'd been looking out for a power washer, because our vinyl siding is starting to look grungy. This really did the trick! The first time we used it, we used just plain water, and it got all of the dirt off easily. It is of course even easier to clean when you add detergent to the included bottle. I've never used another power washer before, so I really can't compare this to anything else, but I do really like this power washer. I use it on everything – wood, vinyl siding, brick, blacktop. I didn't have any trouble wrapping everything back up and storing all the attachments, as I've seen some other reviewers say. The cord is really long, which is convenient. I also like having two different nozzles for different stream strengths.

This washer was purchased to clean a concrete patio that was very dirty and had quite a bit of algae and moss growing in some places. I did need something strong enough to get the dirt, but I needed something easy to handle as well. After a quick spot check, I believe this washer will fit those requirements once I get some pressure washer detergent. I also believe that I will be able to do the first floor windows (careful with that pressure...) and the vinyl siding and car. That was the good news. The bad news is the instruction sheets are really rather poor, repetitive and confusing. Many thanks to the reviewer that subitted a photo with a comment since there is no way I would have been able to figure out the hose attachment without a phone call to the manufacturer otherwise. The power cord and the pressure hose are also a little awkward, but not so bad that I would take off more than one star. Bottom line is that this is not a bad purchase for lighter cleaning jobs and it will take additional time and effort for heavier dirt. This is after all an electric, residential type washer.

The carry handle was shattered. I had to tape it together. If you thought this washer would dispense detergent at high pressure guess again. There is an attachment bottle for detergent but it only works at very low pressure. The garden hose fittings are mickey mouse. You will get a bath when the water is turned on so you'll end up at a hardware store to get brass hose fittings. Forget the hose reel just wind the hose up on the handle. Aside from the above mentioned dislikes, it works well and has good pressure.

This works very well. Previously I have only used gas powered Power Washers and was skeptical. This did a great job cleaning my concrete patio and the wood gates. You do have to take time to let it recharge pressure but not a major issue and no fuel to worry about.

The machine works well and is a step above the entry level machines. I have only used it for an hour or so, but I am not sure how long it will last. I bought this model specifically because it is described as being made in USA. I don't want to replace all my tools every year. My last pressure washer lasted 15 years and it was made in America. I must say I was extremely disappointed when my AR383 arrived and I unpacked it. It is made in China. Amazon usually does better than this and I have found their descriptions to generally be accurate. I paid a premium for this model based on its country of origin and feel I was delivered an inferior quality substitution. I will update this review when the machine pukes. It shouldn't be long.

reviews.review_header: Perfect for around the house and to wash a PVC fence
reviews.review_text: I've only used it once on my PVC fence, but so far it seems perfect for my needs. Not too heavy, the power cord and hose are ample in length. Didn't know I could purchase soap from AR to use in the soap dispenser attachment. I will be ordering some and trying it out later. \\\\ Based on my one-time use and compared with another power washer I have borrowed, I would recommend.

After researching extensively I wanted a a inexpensive. .capable ..pressure washer and chose this one ..I musta got a good one unlike some because it works awesome ..I like the fact that it only runs when the trigger is pulled..it's small and lightweight. .the instructions are written pretty small and the washer hose could be longer but it does have a Long power cord..happy with product

If you're reading this, then I was in your shoes in 2011. I was looking for a maintenance free washer to use around my house. I decided to go with the AR Blue Clean 383. It worked great for about 12-15 uses over the span of 1.5 years. Since I didn't use my washer that much, I was satisfied with the way it operated when I did use it. Then in the spring of 2013, I decided to wash off the siding of my house; during the first 10 minutes of use, it suddenly started pumping only at 50% and the pump started smoking. Now, every time I use the machine, it does the exact same thing. I now have a ~900 psi pressure washer that smells horrible. The warranty is only 1-year, so I'm out of schlitz for a replacement. If I could go back to 2011, I would have bought a gas-powered washer instead.

reviews.review_header: Great Product with one minor complaint
reviews.review_text: Awesome product. I can't brag about how much use I have gotten out of this thing. I have cleaned my fence, tractor deck, porch, house, roof, siding, everything!! It is such a great tool to have and so easy to setup and use. My BIGGEST gripe with it and its quite annoying actually is the location of the hose adapter for the pressure gun in the back. I'm not talking about where the water hose plugs in the front. Its the back connection for the washer gun. It is so hard to fit your hands around it to unscrew it, especially with the hose holder right next to it. And after building up a lot of pressure, its actually harder than you think to unscrew it, even more so when you can't fit your hands around it.

reviews.review_header: I would not recommend this pressure washer...
reviews.review_text: Only used the pressure washer for a few minutes, and started having issues with the pressure from the nozzle. You have to press it several times before the pressure kicks in. Now the unit has completely quit spraying. I've used this on two small household projects...spraying off the patio and the porch. I've contacted the company...hopefully, they're able to replace the unit.

reviews.review_header: the quick connector hose adapter on the front of the unit broke easily. Found a replacement one at the building supply ...
reviews.review_text: Worked well and removed more dirt/grime from the patio than I expected. Erased 6 years of weather and build-up and made the blocks look brand new in very little time. The manual could have offered more detail on the use of the wands--more specificity would have been helpful. Also, the quick connector hose adapter on the front of the unit broke easily. Found a replacement one at the building supply store for $ 3 that was built better. Otherwise, am somewhat pleased with this purchase.

Had to return this after not getting a full one time use out of it. Leaked terrible, had NO pressure and all around was just poor quality. We ended up going to a big box store and buying one at a comparable price, and we've had that one over a year with zero issues.

reviews.review_header: Good for odd cleaning jobs around the house
reviews.review_text: Good tool for small jobs. I wouldn't recommend this as a whole house cleaner due to size and pressure limitations (compared to gas pressure washers), however I used this to clean the side of my shed, portions of the vinyl siding on the house and garage and for cleaning some trim boards on the deck and it worked great. There are some small tricks to using this, but after a couple of minutes with it and working on fine tuning the nozzles, found that it works awesome for cleaning around the house.

So far everything works exactly as described and worth the money. Pros: -Good PSI for deck, fence, driveway etc. -Runs only when the trigger is pulled -pretty compact and stores accessories nicely -No leaking at the gun, at the hose disconnect or at the pressure line disconnect. -Simple instructions Cons: -I'm not crazy about the plastic quick disconnect nipple. I can see this getting broken soon. -Could maybe use a longer hose. Overall I am very pleased and really impressed considering how relatively inexpensive it is. It's obviously not made for professionals but a good buy.

This is a fine product. I needed one to blast the pressure treated deck down clean to accept a acrylic stain. I was hovering between a more powerful gas model and this highly rated electric. If you are looking to wash the old wood deck, this is all you need. It's rated PSI was more than adequate to do the job. It was able to blast off the scum and strip off old loose stain without etching the wood. For homeowner jobs it's fine. Do not be tempted into buying more power than you really need. Others were rite about the reel winder and implement holders. They are a waste. But no big deal the washer does it's job. And for this price, It's all I asked for.

I gave this as a present to my daughter and son-in-law for their wedding anniversary and they love it! They have vinyl siding in most of the exterior of their home and had been wanting to have it power washed. They actually only used water with no chemicals and they were so happy to see how great it cleaned. They power washed their home's exterior, their shutters, their driveway, and their back patio slab and couldn't be happier. They also love it's light weight and it's portability. As always, shipping was fast and it came in a larger carton with interior cushioning around all sides and the vac in it's factory box within.

reviews.review_header: Easy to assemble, use, and store, paid for itself
reviews.review_text: Works well, lots of versatility. Well built, not too big or heavy. Easy to assemble and store. Paid for itself, I was quoted $250 to pressure wash my drive and patio. With this pressure washer I can use it for other projects, like cleaning the car, esp brake dust off the wheels. The GPC protected plug is a super bonus, water and electricity can be dangerous. Naturally it's not as powerful as a gasoline power washer, but it's still plenty powerful. I used the turbo wand to clean the driveway and the old mold off the house bricks. Like others have mentioned it can leak water on the water hose connection, even with the recommended brass adapter. Just make sure the hose is tight and doesn't move around. I'd have given it 5 stars but for this problem. 2015 update Still working. I need to order replacements o rings. The wands tend to get stuck, recommend taking them out before storage. Also get a pump storage lubricant, esp. if you have hard water.

reviews.review_header: I wont' recommend this unit to anyone
reviews.review_text: it only worked once since I bought it. NOw on the 2nd try all it does is blow fuses. Tried to find out how to replace it with one that works told sorry you out of the time allowed to replace it. sorry 37 days gets you nothing but a piece of junk.
