I wont' recommend this unit to anyone. if their warranty policy is 30 days they know there is something wrong with their product

reviews.review_header: I've turned into a washing madman!
reviews.review_text: The AR383 works awesome. I was concerned about leakage after reading the other reviews, however, the product now comes with a revised hose attachment. No leakage at all after 4 hours of use. The new part is not shown in the manual at this point so I called customer service. They said it is so new they have not updated the manual yet. The hose reel is good, the cord is long and no problems wrapping it for storage. The 383 out performs a Taskmaster 1.5 gal I borrowed from a friend. I am impressed how quiet the 383 runs. I love this machine so much I am washing everything possible. I stripped paint off garage exterior very easily and didn't need to do much sanding. It is very powerful so watch how narrow you set the nozzle.

The product is high quality. I have used it on my concrete sidewalk and it cleaned it very well and I am very satisfied. I also tried it on stucco (near my windows where there was buildup of dirt) and it cleaned it well. The only drawback I see is in the way the cables are designed for storage. The unit wire for AC plug and the hose is a bit cumbersome as there is no place for it to be wound back (on the unit) after use for storage (the photo on box is deceiving in this regard). This is the only negative. My view is it can be enhanced (like a vacuum cleaner cord) to have an easy cord/hose storage reel built in. Yes, I would recommend this to a friend and I have already done so!

I was very excited to have clean sidewalks again, and this washer seems like a very good value for what it is. Assembly was pretty easy and took about 5 minutes to put together with just a Phillips screwdriver. Its cleaning power is pretty good for the price, although I had to take it pretty slow on my sidewalk and use about a 2-inch wide spray to get everything off of it. It's much better on cars and wood decks. Just for perspective, it's about the same amount of power as a self-service car wash hose.

reviews.review_header: This model is a great bang for the buck
reviews.review_text: This model is a great bang for the buck, and I've used a number of these. I almost gave it 3 Stars because the fitting for the garden hose connection failed after 5-6 uses. But I gave it 5 Stars, because the manufacturer has a phone # and a real person will take your call and assist with troubleshooting. They sent a replacement part free of charge and it's worked great after many uses!

I own a lot of concrete slab around my house. I usually just clean it 2x per year so having a gas powered washer is more trouble than it's worth. This electric one did the trick just fine. You need to have outlets every 50' apart around your house so you can keep plugging the power washer in. So far I've used it once in the hot sun for about 4-hours straight. It did a great job of removing debris with the adjustable "stream to fan" spray wand. CAUTION: If it's on stream don't spray a stucko or painted surface. I did and it ripped the stucko right off of the house. Do get the brass fittings as these won't leak and will last the life of the washer. I didn't even bother with the plastic ones after hearing the negative reviews.

reviews.review_header: Can't beat it for reliability and price
reviews.review_text: The AR383 is by far the best electric pressure washer I've owned. The only complaints I had was the built in reel really doesn't work well, and the front quick connect hose adapter is rather flimsy. I swapped out that adapter with the brass fitting from my old pressure washer. Other than that, it's a great piece of equipment. I've done my driveways, walkways and entire pool area several times now, and no problems. Really simple to use and does the job well.

reviews.review_header: Great pressure washer, cheap hose attachment.
reviews.review_text: This thing is great! Really light, small, easy to manage. Able to scrub clean a patio, vehicle, or stone pathway pretty easily. Very long power cable, which I find convenient. Easy to store. I took one star off because the adapter to hook up the hose is garbage. I bought a metal attachment (https://www.amazon.com/dp/B0015AUSTC/) and it works much better.

Constantly had trouble with the connections. Now a year later the wand connection is totally perished and the unit is unusable. Never had any issues with a Honda gas powered unit for 8 years, now after 1 year this one is junk. Completely dissatisfied

reviews.review_header: It also worked great blasting pollen and other stains off the side of ...
reviews.review_text: I've been using this for over a year now, with an MTM foam cannon attachment. I haven't had any problems with it. In the warmer months, I wash my car at least once/week and do part-time detailing on the side. It also worked great blasting pollen and other stains off the side of the house. Not as powerful as gas units I have used, but still effective and after a year with it still holding up I will say it is sturdy.
I believe I am on my 2nd or 3rd summer with this machine. Works on my home and patios.

reviews.review_header: Was skeptical, but can not be more happy!!
reviews.review_text: One of my first reviews on Amazon and this product is worth every penny! For such a small portable machine it packs a lot of pressure. I cleaned my balcony, driveway, car and front porch with this and it holds up and washes anything away with ease!!

I turned it on, and the motor was starting and then immediately cut off. It also knocked out my house circuit breaker, but after I reset it and tried several outlets, it would not come on again. I am returning for a refund and will not try this one again.

reviews.review_header: for under $200, its a good buy
reviews.review_text: Pros: 1) Light weight 2) Easy to put together 3) easy to use tip Cons: 1) It would be nice if the tips were universal. i.e. I could go to the hardware store and buy different tips for different applications. In reality this pressure washer is really intended for small jobs, if you plan on pressure washing a 800 square foot, dirty, grimy driveway this will do it, but it will take you a long time. Since its only a 1.5GPM unit and 1900 max psi, you have to have a pretty narrow band and be close to your work to make a big impact. So if your doing little jobs around the house, or don't mind spending an afternoon and a 6 pack cleaning your driveway then this will work just fine. I personally think pressure washing your driveway and watching it go from horrid to awesome is extremely gratifying, even if it took a six pack and a whole afternoon. :)

I have used my AR 383 for three years now. When it first arrived I had an immediate problem with the motor burning out. I called customer service and they were great. A new unit arrived in a few days. If you investigate pressure washers you can find that Annovi Reverberi Triplex pumps are found in the best pressure washers as well as this unit. The hose could be a little more flexible, but the unit works as well as one could expect.

I have always used gasoline powered pressure washers, with my latest being a Karcher 2,600 PSI that did the job, but was loud and at times difficult to move around. I spotted this electric machine that gave you 1,900 PSI, read the reviews, and decided to buy it. What a pleasant surprise ! It took no time to assemble and start using. This AR Blue Clean gives a powerful adjustable spray that would rival the larger machines. It is quiet, shuts off when releasing the trigger (unlike gas powered ones) is easy to move around, and a pleasure to use. For the price, this is a fantastic product that I would give 6 stars to if I could !

reviews.review_header: Solid quality, better than expected pressure
reviews.review_text: way better than expected. solid pressure stripped paint on my garage floor and easily removed stains on my patio.

it's okay the main reason i bought this was for my car, for the foam suds and wash. if you are going to use it for cars don't. the motor unit is fine but the gun and extras are bad. everything is plastic you cannot buy other parts connect them. you would have to buy a different hose, gun, extender, and lance foam. again the unit itself is fine but the extras are awful. would not recommend for auto wash usage.

To be fair, this is my first pressure washer, but I used to clean a meat room on a daily basis, so I am familiar with the power available from a powerful pressure washer. I purchased this unit because I moved into a new home with an inground pool and a fair amount of patio/landscaping stones. The pressure washer cleaned the edging around the pool wonderfully. The instant gratification of watching the dirt, grime, and moss come off to reveal beautiful clean stone was actually quite fun. My wife came out to see what I was doing and was begging me to use it. In fact when I went back out the next day to wash more of the stone, she basically demanded she do it because she enjoyed using the washer so much. I highly recommend this washer for the home owner.

reviews.review_header: To remedy this purchase a metal connector (HomeDepot 5 bucks) Also the company was great in replacing
reviews.review_text: I would give this 5 + stars but the hose connector fitting is made of plastic. The threads will become stripped in time. To remedy this purchase a metal connector (HomeDepot 5 bucks) Also the company was great in replacing quickly

I bought this to spray our back patio and I am impressed with the power. I used it on stained concrete and it worked so well, it blasted the stain off. The 2 nozzles easily handle anything I have thrown at it (concrete, siding, my cars) and it performs like a champ. The only reason I gave it 4 stars is that it is a pain to set up and break down. The holders in the back dont grip the wands very well, so they are always falling off. Everything is tedious to set up and break down. Other than that minor issue, the pressure washer performs quite well. I am happy I ordered it and I have (and do) recommend it to my buddies looking for one for themselves.

reviews.review_header: Did tons of research before I settled...
reviews.review_text: I'm one who researches and relies heavily on reviews before I make online purchases. Most of what I read was good so I did further research to see if this was the best price out there and it was. I'm very happy with my purchase. I have used it so far to pressure wash my concrete before I sealed it. I also used it to wash my house windows and screens. I also used it on my carpet car mats and it brought it back to looking like new; before I used a regular garden hose and a scrub brush and still was not as good as the AR. I was very satisfied with the results with what this can do. I look forward to using it in the future. Unlike other reviewers I have not had any signficant water leaks that would require me to buy additional parts.

I tested this out on my vehicle, and I must say it did a pretty decent job. Was it the best pressure washer I've used? Far from it. I'm used to using industrial electric and gas pressure washers in the detail business so it's hard to compare. For what it is though, it really gets the job done and it is a very reasonable price. My only real complaint with this product is the hose is a little short and is extremely thin. It works, but a little extra length would have been nice.

reviews.review_header: Does not clean by synthetic wood deck.
reviews.review_text: I have to admit, the first problem is my deck. Although I spent twice as much for a "forever" deck as a wood deck, it is impossible to keep clean (so much for maintenance free). However, having said that, the Air Blue Clean, does not clean it. Yes, I bought the recommended detergent to use first and followed all the instructions - but it does not clean the deck, Once dried off, it does not look significantly different than the part of the deck not cleaned. Perhaps, it will be fine for cleaning my car, etc, but it is NOT good for a synthetic wood deck.

I read all of the reviews and checked out other pressure washers and by far this was the best. The only problem with it is when you connect the water hose to the machine, it sometime leaks. I purchased a female to female hose connection, that was a waste of time it leaked all over the place. So I went to home depot and purchased a washing machine hose which is female on both ends that did the trick.

reviews.review_header: Once I stopped the leaking it worked great
reviews.review_text: I love the features: wheeled body, powerful pressure pump, hose reel, holders for implements and elec cord and it worked great cleaning my wood deck, BUT... the included plastic connector to my garden hose was a piece of garbage. It leaked profusely at both the hose end and where the connector attached to the threaded male pipe protruding at the base of the unit (water inlet). Until the manufacturer corrects this problem I wouldn't order this unit unless you also order a brass double female swivel hose connector and some extra rubber hose washers (I had to use two rubber hose washers inserted into the female swivel hose connector that goes onto the machine's threaded male pipe (water inlet) before all leaking stopped).

I've never taken the time to write an Amazon review but I like this power washer so much I had to do it. It's light enough to carry up and down the stairs, it takes dirt off like crazy, and it's cheap. All around a good value and it does what it's supposed to do. I don't use the hose roller, I just gather it up and drape it over the top handle, pretty easy. And the same goes for the power cord, I just skip the storage for that and wind it up myself. You do have to be careful about the deceptive power of this little unit, I took out a bit of grout when I got too close with the nozzle while not paying attention. Though that's an indication of how powerful it is. This thing is just great.

reviews.review_header: GFCI does not fit modern outdoor outlets; no problem with quick-connect
reviews.review_text: As with all electric pressure washers the last several years, the attached GFCI plug will not fit into current Code outdoor outlet covers (the sort with a bulbous clear plastic cover). You need to use a load-matched extension cord, a particularly long 3-prong to 2-prong "cheater", or, as I did since my outdoor circuits are GFCI protected already, cut the thing off and replace with a 15 amp plug from the hardware store (which also saves having to reset it each time) -- do this ONLY IF your circuits are GFCI protected. ...incompatible safety mandates... [The manual says 11 amps, the faceplate says 14 amps.] I use quick-connects on my hoses and had no difficulty with leakage with the supplied set, including the filter portion.

Works very well for the price. I have a gas 6hp 3500 psi washer as well as a 4500 psi hotsy for heavy duty jobs but for driveway cleaning, decks, cars, trailers that have normal dirt buildup the AR does a fine job and is much easier to use. No need for gas or kerosene for the heater and it's extremely light. I strongly suggest getting the extension hose since the hose that comes wit hit isn't very long, the deck cleaner is extremely usefule and fast if you have large flat spaces to clean such as decks.

reviews.review_header: Great power washer and even better customer service!
reviews.review_text: I had tons of trouble with leaking from every single connection. That's when I learned that AR North America has one of the best customer service departments I've ever dealt with. If you have a problem, CALL THEM. It turns out my problems were totally user error and all that was easily resolved on the phone. They took me step by step through all the connections and even had me turn it on so they could tell by the sound whether it was working correctly or not. Love these guys.

reviews.review_header: Overheated and broke after 20 minutes of use
reviews.review_text: Bought this 8/2012 and have used it sparingly for approximately 10-15 brief uses over this time, mainly car washes. Went to use it today to wash my siding. Worked fine for about 20 minutes then started to slow down and smoke out of the vents. The problem is not my water pressure, it's getting full pressure from the hose, an no it's not connected improperly. I feel like i've been robbed of $165. Thanks AR this will be my first and last experience with your products.

Got this for the fiance for his bday, and he seemed to really like it. He will be power washing the house and his parents camper awning soon, and is so excited to have one for his own and not have to borrow my dads anymore. This had great ratings, and seems to be great quality. If anything changes with steady use we will let you know...

reviews.review_header: This thing is amazing. I always wanted some sort of pressure washer ...
reviews.review_text: This thing is amazing. I always wanted some sort of pressure washer for the small jobs around the house. I borrowed one like this from a friend and it did an amazing job on my lanai! I just bought one for myself and did a few other jobs around the house. The nice thing is it's easy to use, so I can just do a little at a time. It doesn't have to be a grand production, since it's so easy to hook up, use, and put away.

reviews.review_header: Not A Good Choice for Washing Houses
reviews.review_text: Based on numerous glowing reviews, I took a chance on an electric pressure washer even though I doubted it could do the job. My suspicions were correct. The only way this unit can meet your needs for washing a home is if you are cleaning a one story house with a hipped roof. If you have gabled roof ends then you should pass on this unit. After my first use of this machine, I found myself disappointed in many ways. There is not enough power for cleaning at heights above ten feet. The soap container is a joke. Be sure to have a funnel handy for loading cleaner because the opening is tiny. Most disappointing is the pathetic distance that soap is propelled from the unit. My unit did not leak at all which is an issue many buyers report in their reviews. I did experience the common poor hose storage reel. One seriously surprising disappointment is that you can not use an extension cord with this unit. I am surprised this issue does not show up in more reviews. You will need at least one exterior outlet on each side of your house to reach all four side on an average sized house. Evidently the GFCI will fail if an extension cord is used which could result in electric shock for the operator causing serious injury and possible death according to the manual. I have one exterior outlet so I was limited to cleaning 25% of my home. This issue alone made the machine a total failure for my intended use. If you are considering this unit for washing a car or general household use then it may be a good choice for you but if washing the exterior of your home is your goal then I would pass on this unit.

reviews.review_header: Powerful compact machine and amazing customer service from AR North America
reviews.review_text: This pressure washer is so powerful but compact. I can't believe how nice this machine is. It is lightweight but packs quite a punch. It has several settings so it's good for windows or fabric as well as our moldy sidewalk. We had a minor issue with the first one we received but got a replacement within a week. We contacted AR North America customer service and a real person answered the phone and helped us diagnose the problem. He even called to follow up. That is an amazing company. We got another one for our business since we like it so much. I highly recommend this machine.

I purchased this pressure washer to clean the roof of my home prior to coating it with an elastomeric coating. It worked flawlessly. It's light weight makes it very easy to carry up a ladder. The power cord is extra long, I did not need an extension cord. It was powerful enough to clean the roof without damaging it. I like that it shuts off when you release the trigger. Some reviewers have complained about the hose being a little stiff. I did not have that problem but then again it was sunny and 80 degrees. The hose is thin but it gets the job done and helps to keep the weight down. Plus it stores on the built in reel. The whole unit is very compact and takes up no more space than an upright vacuum cleaner. Is it a heavy duty tough machine that you would use everyday? No. But for periodic use around the house it can't be beat.

reviews.review_header: Excellent product, easy assembly and very easy to use
reviews.review_text: The wife and I have a huge deck in the back of the house and I was looking for an electric power washer. This product fits the bill -- and then some. Easy assembly and clear instructions. .Within 10 minutes I was power-washing everything in sight. The first time out of the box, I used it for 2 hours straight and the unit never quit. It also is pretty quiet during operation. Comes with adjustable and fixed nozzles and does exactly what is advertised. Excellent value for the money.

reviews.review_header: Here's a quicker easier way to store this super machine
reviews.review_text: Just used it for the first time. Clean my concrete patio thoroughly. Happy to discover I can clean my stucco wall from 15 feet away - great for hard to reach spots! Smaller and lighter unit than I expected, but easier to maneuve and store. I used the hose reel for the electrical cord not the pressure hose. Grab the cord at the middle point, feed it into the opening in the reel and spin it up. Then just drape the hose over the handle - way easier that trying to coil the stiff hose onto the reel.

Nice machine, seems to work well and do the intended job. For the slight cost increase I wish they would make the water in take and discharge out of machined brass instead of molded plastic and die cast zinc. Would we buy another one? Don't know, would have to do more research. Overall for the price it is OK.

This pressure washer works like I would expect. The adjustable spray pattern and 90 degree swivel on the spray wand is great for washing cars and gutters. The motor shuts off when you you are not spraying which is a great feature. Hose and cord were long enough to allow me to spray my gutters from atop a ladder. Very disappointing is the soap dispensing bottle attachment that is included. It does not dispense soap with any kind of pressure, just sort of splashes out. I could accomplish more with a bucket and sponge. And it empties out very quickly. I bought some Karcher self-dissolving soap packets with this washer which do not physically fit in the top of the dispenser bottle so had to pour them in by hand. I never used a pressure washer soap delivery system before but this was not what I was expecting. Overall, I am pleased with the quality and performance of this product.

I bought this washer because I liked the reviews, and it looked small enough for myself, as well as my husband, to use. My husband always likes to get "heavy duty" tools, which end up too unhandy and are rarely used much. I bought this AR Blue Clean without mentioning it. When it arrived, he put it together (very easily I might add). He had no problem with water leaking from any of the connectors as some previous reviewers had mentioned. He was so surprised at the power! He enjoyed doing all the outside pressure washing that had needed doing for a long time. I believe this is one of the smartest purchases I have made in a long time. Everything he pressure washed looks like new! I know I will be able to use it as easily as he did. I am so happy!
Works as advertised. If you need power, for heavy duty grime don't get this unit.

reviews.review_header: AR Blue Clean AR383 1900 PSI meets my needs for a general purpose power washer.
reviews.review_text: Good power washer for general needs. However connections are funny at times. If you are not careful you can cross thread and it will leak. Also an extra rubber washer will help keep it from leaking. A big plus is that the threaded connections on the machine for the water supply and washer hose are metal and this is much better than the plastic you see on so many other brands. In spite of the occasional leaks I would still get this brand because it's cleaning performance is everything I wanted from a washer at a reasonable price. I recommend it.
working great

I don't know how much pressure I actually got because it leaked. The shape of the connector has flat edges and does not fit the hose adapter properly. I tried to use it, got really frustrated and sent it back to amazon.

reviews.review_header: initially worked well. used it a total of 3 ...
reviews.review_text: initially worked well. used it a total of 3 times all within a month's time. tried again and it would not turn on. reset and tried again. did not turn on. reset and tried on another outlet. started and then quit. reset and tried again. did not turn on. let it sit for 1 day and tried again, still will not turn on. can i expect a replacement?

Purchased this unit after reading some good reviews. The first issue is the hose reel. Who every heard of needng to totally disconnect BOTH ends of the hose to use the reel? So it has a reel but is it worth using? The water inlet connection leaks really bad. It is also self tighting. I put it on the hose with my hand and it requires wrench's to take off. Even if I tighten with wrench's, leaks water real bad. Then the electrical cord holder at the back, unless you are perfect at wrapping the wire, it won't stay in the holder. At least they left some space behind it you can use. Would be nice to have a place for the GFCI end so it does not drag the ground when moving it around.

reviews.review_header: After one use it appears to function well. The ...
reviews.review_text: After one use it appears to function well. The broad spray could have a slightly stronger spray at about 2" wide. The total spray has about 4" in width with the center "power clean" at about 2". I had an electric with 1300psi where the real cleaning power was about 2". This one seems to be only about 1" wide when you want max power. I'm referring to cleaning black mold and dirt on stone patio and walkways

This washer has been fun to use. While realizing that it is not as powerful as a gasoline engine powered washer, it has done everything that I've wanted it to do. I've power-washed lawn furniture and stone flooring around my house, and washed two cars. Coiling up the power cord and washer hose for storage is tedious, but it comes together in an easy to store unit.

reviews.review_header: Good washer for household cleanup jobs
reviews.review_text: Very pleased with the performance of this pressure washer. It is fairly easy to use, stores compactly, and does a good job on a variety of things (boat, vehicle, deck) when appropriate settings and attachments are used. I thought it worked as well as a gasoline powered washer and it is less expensive and smaller.

I was a little apprehensive about getting this pressure washer because of some of the negative comments I read on line. It was very easy to put together. It only took me about 5 minutes. I first used it to wash my house in Big Bear. It took me about 2 1/2 hrs to complete the job and the pressure washer kept up with me. The only negative thing had nothing to do with the pressure washer - at one point on the north side of the house the pressure washer couldn't reach an electrical outlet. I didn't know what would happen if I used an extension cord so I left that part of the house untouched. Overall, the pressure washer looks to do the job it says it can do. I hope it's as durable as it says it is.

So far no problems with pressure washer, when I bought this item some of the reviews said that they had problems with it. I'm not sure why they had some of these problems( you can look at some of the reviews) but I just plugged it in and it worked just great. Maybe the problem is with the person trying to use it.

I used this pressure washer approximately 7 times within the first year of purchase and it worked fine. Shortly after, the washer started malfunctioning and never recovered. I'm not sure if this malfunctioning purchase was a fluke or not, but I cannot recommend this product.

Bought this little guy to clean sidewalks, patio, and other outside area which require a cleaning. I have done my patio--20x18 in just over an hour--the patio has not been cleaned in 10years. The AR 383 cleaned the patio pavers to like new. Cleaned out the brick spacings of grass and other debris that had collected over time. The only Quark is when you pull your hand off the trigger, before you press the trigger to restart, you must wait for the pump to quit--this is not an issue--maybe 3 second delay. The assembly is easy--read the instructions and follow the pictures. Handy little package with the electrical cord and hose wind onto the unit and areas to hold the wands when not in use. The spray is very powerful for a little unit - I had another brand--threw away after one summer of use. Sorry repressed memory--can not recall the mfg. of that product

Big mistake - I bought a Blue Clean 383 because I thought the hose reel would be helpful - it isn't, doesn't work right, and you have to end up winding the hose around the whole pressure washer. Also, the parts are extremely cheap and the hose connection to the nozzle handle is very cheap, and likely to break. Worst of all, it only pressurizes for about 5 seconds, then the pressure drops to zero. I'm sorry I bought this one - buyer beware!

This unit works very well for the price. The water fittings seem a bit fragile, but should hold up if reasonable care is taken. Pleased to see a long, heavy-duty power cable with GFCI protection. Easy to use, good pressure.

So let's set expectations here: this is not a high-powered gas pressure washer. It's not. You're getting what you pay for, and it's a good electric pressure washer which is easy to move from place to place without much maintenance. Having said that, know the limitations of its usage. Great for pressure washing concrete and siding and lighter jobs. Surprisingly great in fact. Not very great at something like wood decks. Get a gas powered pressure washer for those. There are a ton of small pieces and parts that go along with it, which can get somewhat confusing, but there are a lot of configuration options which makes it very useful. It's sufficiently easy to use that I was able to enlist my six-year old to help out in attempting to power wash my deck. You won't have much difficulty in getting stuff done, just as long as you're using it for the right thing.

I previously owned a 3000 psi, gas powered pressure washer, but it was stolen. Instead of paying another $400+ for replacement, I just bought this one and it's been working great! I actually prefer it being electric rather than having to purchase gas. We have a sunken living area around our pool, and our sump pump wasn't working so when it rained, all the dirty rain water was stored there for some time. The water was pumped out a week later, but it left all these hard stains on the ground that were really tough to get out. Ordered this pressure washer and I cleaned it up in a few hours! I highly recommend it, and it's a great price for what you get!

reviews.review_header: This machine is great. We had a much larger much more expensive ...
reviews.review_text: This machine is great. We had a much larger much more expensive one for a few years and it stopped working. The part we needed would cost more than this AR Blue Clean, so we decided to try it. You can just plug it in, no worry about gas or mixing gas products. Light weight and will fit into my closet for storing with no problem. We cleaned the entire outside of the house very and easily and it did a great job. Glad we got it and will happily recommend to others.

reviews.review_header: Works just like I hoped it would
reviews.review_text: Needed a pressure washer for some routine cleaning around he house - driveway, patios, lawn furniture, bbq grill. Didn't need one of the big high-powered, expensive, gas powered units. This model worked perfectly for me and made cleaning the areas mentioned a snap. Would definately recommend this for someone who wants a pressure washer but doesn't need an industrial strength unit.

reviews.review_header: AR Blue Clean AR383 1,900 PSI 1.5 GPM 14 Amp Electric Pressure Washer with Hose Reel
reviews.review_text: This pressure washer - my first ever - has been great. Living in the Pacific Northwest I bought this pressure washer primarily to remove the moss that has accumulated on my property (roof, house, deck, sidewalk, driveway). It's awesome. I love it. Works great and is easy to use. And it's a heckuva lot more powerful that I imagined. I want to give it a try on the truck, but it's been a little wet out yet to try it. Otherwise, I'm very happy with it. The only thing that's a little weird is the roller at the top when you roll-up the hose that connects to the nozzle. It's hard to describe, but the design is odd, and I have to work at it to roll the hose up. But that's a slight hassle in the overall picture.

So, its much less powerful then I thought it would be. My brother has a pressure washer, and I thought I was buying the same one. His is MUCH more powerful. This one, though slightly wimpy, will do the job, but takes much longer to clean our pool deck. The thing I did like about this, however, is because it isn't as powerful, I can clean the screens in the pool enclosure without worrying that it is going to rip a hole in it! So, take some and leave some, I guess.

reviews.review_header: AR Blue Clean AR383 Pressure Washer Met Expectations
reviews.review_text: A professional painter wanted $950 to pressure wash and apply two coats of stain to my deck. I decided to do the job myself. The AR Blue Clean Pressure Washer arrived two days after ordering it from Amazon.com. The cost was $175. A gallon of deck cleaning solution and two gallons of Behr deck stain cost $75 at Home Depot. Total cost of this do-it-yourself project, $250. The AR Blue Clean did a great job removing dirt from the deck flooring and railings. Besides saving $750, I received some badly needed exercise and now have a pressure washer in my power tool collection..

I have a much more powerful gas powered pressure washer....but I can't get it started an it was always too noisy. The AR Blue works well and is powerful enough for the things I need it for. The first time I used it I was just going to spray the cleaner off my wooden deck, but spending a little more time with it really made my deck look great. The parts are all plastic but seem to perform just fine. Money well spent.

After reading alot of reviews about this product, and weight how often will I used the pressure washer. I went ahead and purchased this product. Like most had said the machine was well construct, the issued with leaking had been corrected. Instruction was a little less details but easily figure out. I bought it to just washed off the dirt and stuff from our exterior wall of the house, for the up cominng paint job (NO it will not take the old paint out.....etc...you will need a higher performance machine to do that). Machine hold up well, plenty of cord and hose for moving around .........overall I happy with it PS: After done I just hange the power cord and hose on top of the handle ...don't even bother to roll it .

i have a driveway that needed this powerwashing (7yrs worth) and this worked great! I had a Yellow powerwasher and it lasted about 4yrs.. it took the some of the dirt off but had to be done again to completely removed all the dirt.. i bought the deck, patio and flat surface cleaner and OMG it worked great...you have to use it like a buffer which is just above the surface but i LOVED IT!.. so any Girly Girl can do this, it worked better than i would have thought possible.. I will have to come back in about 3-4yrs to let you know if this is still working but I do think it will be as it seems to be made very well.

Unit will not work with any other standard hose or wand. You will be stuck with not being able to upgrade the spraying wand to accept any attachments. The wand is a cheep plastic adjustable and a rotating soap wand. The company does not offer an attachment to be able to utilize different nozzles, wand extensions or gutter cleaning extension. Waste of money spend another 40.00 and get a unit that you can get to do it all.

reviews.review_header: Hose and cord need place to wrap better. Pump stalls then spays
reviews.review_text: Hose and cord need place to wrap better. Pump stalls then spays ,nozel sucks buy one with changeable tips. My work force was better but cord trip burtout could not find repair parts. Would not buy this again!

I have a slate slab patio and it was getting a little green in the corners and on the stairs. The outdoor rugs I love to use had left marks on the patio as well. The slate countertops around my BBQ had some grease stains. I used the power washer with great success! I had way too much fun cleaning, which is a positive. It worked wonderfully and was very simple. The nozzle can easily be adjusted as you are cleaning to be a needle point or a fan and clean with great force or more gentle spray. I was able to clean the BBQ and fire pit covers and the slate counter. I used a hand brush to apply some dish soap to the greasy marks and then power washed it all away. I'd highly recommend this washer!

If you've been shopping around for a home pressure washer, stop your search and buy the AR383. It's a great prdouct for home use, I've had the washer for about a month and have been very happy. I've used it for several jobs around the house, including an hour straight deck cleaning. I bought this washer to replace my 10 year old 1300 PSI unit. The AR383 comes with a long cord, and plenty of hose for most jobs. I do agree I wish the placstic quick-connect was brass, but until it breaks I see no problems with it. I have not tried it with an extension cord since the directions tell you not to, which is the case for most electric washers, however I used an extension cord everytime on my older unit (which is actually still working). When I find the need to use an extension, I will use a 12 gauge cord no longer than 25 feet to avoid burning-up the pump. Make sure read all the directions, and use the pressure washer properly and you'll be glad you bought it.

reviews.review_header: this is an excellent pressure washer for the money
reviews.review_text: I've only used it for a few hours but so far, this is an excellent pressure washer for the money. It's powerful enough to really get stains off the driveway but gentle enough to clean siding on the house without tearing it up. it's pretty quiet too. I recommend that you get a quick disconnect hose connector at your local hardware store - it will leak a lot less and hooking/unhooking the hose will be MUCH easier.

Just received this power washer & used it for the 1st time. No issues & it has all the power I'll need for general use around the yard. I see a lot of reviewers complain about the hose reel, but I really like that feature. As per the instructions, you do need to detach the hose from the washer & gun to use the reel storage, but that only take a few seconds. I suppose if I used the power washer every day I might skip doing that step but I like the fact that there's accommodations for power cord, hose & accessory storage. Nice power washer for the price!

You can tell a lot of design went into this washer, best part is the swivel pressure connection to the wand, it goes left or right, and it's never in your way. As far as pressure, it's certainly powerful enough to where you need to be careful what you clean! I found that a 1 gal hand pump sprayer with cleaner in it pre-treated hard to clean areas very well.​ I had the mis-fortune to need replacement parts and found them just an internet order away. I mis-applied one of the parts and Jon called and wrote me to get things going again.

reviews.review_header: Just did not have the cleaning power I expected it to have
reviews.review_text: I have a 15-20 year old 1300 PSI electric pressure washer and wanted something stronger so a 1900 PSI had me excited. Assembly went fine and I liked the idea of a hose reel. When I tried both of the wands out the first time on concrete it just did not seem to dig out the dirt and grime as easily as I expected so I pulled out the 1300 unit and did a side by side comparison on a new area. After going over very slowly with the most powerful streams possible I could not tell the difference between the side done with the 1900 PSI unit and the 1300 PSI unit. Since I could not see any benefit in performance to the new 1900 unit I returned it.

reviews.review_header: Not a bad machine. Used it right after it arrived to ...
reviews.review_text: Not a bad machine. Used it right after it arrived to clean my composite deck. Did a pretty good job. Probably not the strongest pressure washer around but seems to be more than adequate for medium to light jobs. Only real annoyance is that it has so much heavy power cord that its hard to wrap it all on the attached bracket. But that's a minor flaw.

reviews.review_header: Overall very pleased with this unit
reviews.review_text: Overall very pleased with this unit...I used it on my vehicles and the siding of my mobile home. In conjunction with good chemicals this unit will eliminate 95 percent of any scrubbing you may have to do otherwise. I didnt care for the soap dispensing unit on this machine. I was hoping for a little bit longer wand but maybe they sell an extension. This is a decent unit but remember this isnt a heavy duty industrial unit. It still hurts though if you get sprayed by this pressure washer!

reviews.review_header: Worked great until a year and two weeks old
reviews.review_text: Bought this unit from Amazon in early January 2012 after reading reviews here and on other sites. I had no issues with leaking parts, or weak plastic. Pretty much just worked, though the reel is more gimmick than useful. Literally two weeks out of the one year warranty I am using the unit for maybe the 5th time, 10 minutes into the job the sound from the unit changes though pressure is still strong, I check it but all looks ok, start using it again and very shortly the smell of burning motor is apparent. I have two other pressure washers, a 6yr old 1200psi electric homestore brand and 2400psi gas one. Both have held up longer with far more use than the AR383, which I got as I needed and electric unit with more pressure.

I saw that this unit had the best reviews for an electric power washer. I didn't want the hassle of a gas unit and didn't need the power of one. It went together right out of the box with no issues and has been used pretty heavily in a two week time period by me and my son. Works very well for us and every time so far. I did buy some liquid cleaner and tried it but that didn't seem to do any better job than not. The one thing I did learn is that to change nozzles you have to let all the water out of the wand or you can't depress the nozzle to twist it to get it out. Took me awhile to figure that out. Overall I'm very happy with the unit and have already recommended it to people.

I went with electric instead of gas because of the price and because I did not want to call my husband to turn on the pressure washer for me every time I had a "I should clean outside moment". It just arrived and set up was a breeze. I did buy the brass amazon suggested as did other reviews for the connection however I did not use it. The item it came with works fine with no leaks. Obviously its only 1900 so to get the drive- way really clean you have to be fairly close to have high pressure. but all in all great machine. I already did my windows and the drive-way and it just arrived. =) Even my 9 year old likes it. =) helped clean the drive way. Good product.. made in china so not great.

Plenty of power for normal-duty residential use. I have pressurewashed my 20 year old deck, gotten moss/algae off 30 year old concrete to make it look new again, and washed cars. Plenty of power for what most people are looking for The reason I bought this unit, was it is light (27lbs) to carry around in my car, and quiet. The gas ones have more power than I need and those are way too heavy/bulky to ship around in my car. Zero issues so far, only annoying thing is the water hose being a little stiff. No big deal

reviews.review_header: Great Alternative to a gas pressure washer.
reviews.review_text: Great pressure washer. I have used it for cleaning my deck, concrete, outdoor furniture and house siding and am very impressed with how it cleans. The hose connection adapter started leaking after the first use and it had to be replaced. As this is a common complaint from others, it would seem the manufacturer would take notice and change this item. I did not even attempt using the hose storage reel and simply hang the hose on the machine.

I was unsure about electronic powerwasher for it power, but was pleasantly surprised. The machine was easy to set up, the water power is very strong. I used the spray noozle to wash 2nd floor windows with no problem, just use the jet setting. Even without the pressure noozle the stream is powerful enough to strip paint and dent wood in close range, so be careful. There is a leak at the connection of garden hose to the machine, as mentioned by many reviews. But that did not affect water supply or power, so I can live with it. Next will try powerwash concrete slab.

This replaced a Karcher which failed after a few years. Many complained about the leaky hose connection—mine came with a convenient quick connector—so the company does listen. Unlike some, I do like the hose reel. I do not like the power-cord storage. I find it much easier to hang the coiled power cord from the hose reel handle. Also, the lower power cord bracket gets in the way of connecting/disconnecting the power washer hose. This machine does pack a punch and makes quick work of car washing. Haven't tried it on the house yet.

I bought this washer with some skepticism as I was not sure it would have enough power to clean my vinyl siding and sidewalks but I was proven wrong. The unit is light and easy to move around and packs enough punch to clean everything I've tried it on including wood, vinyl siding, concrete sidewalks and it also works really well to wash off the stubborn Love Bugs off the front of my vehicles. Considering this is less than half the price of a gas washer I think it works well and would recommend it to anyone.

reviews.review_header: Giving up on Electric Pressure Washers
reviews.review_text: I purchased this pressure washer about a year ago. Last season it worked fine. I started using it this past weekend for the first time, and after about 5 minutes, the pressure dropped. I turned it off and noticed some smoke coming from the motor area. I let the unit cool down for about 20 minutes. After just a few more minutes of use, I could see more smoke coming from the motor. Since I'm outside the warranty period, I will probably just trash it. I think the gas powered route might be the way to go.

Picked this up a month ago or so. Used it twice since. Just the right amount of PSI and a very convenient package, but the port from the garden hose into pressure washer sprays gallons of water over a 10-minute usage. I've tried replacing the cheap plastic male/female quick connections provided with the machine with something a bit more heavy-duty. But the problem lay in the seal between the entry port at the interior of the machine. Yes, it works. But it's extremely wasteful and messy. I'm going to see if I can't get it replace.

I borrowed my neighbors pressure washer and I didn't want to give it back! I had so much fun washing everything I could find! I didn't want to give it back and when I finally did, I wanted to borrow it again. I researched for a while before purchasing this. It is a terrific machine. I have now used it a number of times and I am very excited to use it in my backyard. I have trees that overhang and produce yellow flowers each fall that the bees absolutely love. They are filled with pollen and that sticky - dark pollen covers my patio each year with the flowers that fall down. Normally I have to wait until the rainy season to get any of this grime off. Now, I am able to wash it off quickly!! The machine is strong and the tools work well.

reviews.review_header: This is a great pressure washer for home use and well worth the ...
reviews.review_text: This is a great pressure washer for home use and well worth the price. It's well designed, compact and works perfectly for cleaning walls, walkways and decks. I have at least 100 hours of use. If I ever wear this one out, I will buy another.

reviews.review_header: Gear head car guy very happy with this!
reviews.review_text: I use this mostly to give my car a wash weekly in the summers! It works very well if you know what your doing and carefully and efficiently detailing your car! I bought the higher quality soap dispenser bottle from this same company (on their website) which was like half the price of this washer alone.. to me that accessory is worth the price to ensure a super quality sud and soap dispensing on your vehicle. Additionally, I have used this to totally clean bricks and a patios overgrown with moss. An electric power washer like this is a most excellent investment! Would buy this again!

reviews.review_header: it's pretty impossible to get a tight seal
reviews.review_text: Completely junk. First, the fittings are all plastic. Second, the fitting that attaches to the hose does not fit a standard hose properly. And being that it's plastic, it's pretty impossible to get a tight seal. Third, it only worked for about 5 minutes. And there's no way it was pushing anywhere near 1,900 psi. It's the worst pressure washer I've ever used.

reviews.review_header: Easy to operate, does excellent job, stores compactly
reviews.review_text: It exceeded my expectaion.I also bought the 10" rotary attachment and cleaning my driveway and sidewalk was a breeze. Has nice storage for hose and power cord. I would like for the spray hose to have a quick connect coupling. I highly recommend this washer, even for my 78 year old mother.

reviews.review_header: The product leaked terribly. It leaked so much from where the garden ...
reviews.review_text: I researched several pressure washers and this AR Blue was my choice. As I was hesitant to purchase this item due to reports of leakage. Well I should have followed my instinct. The product leaked terribly. It leaked so much from where the garden hose is attached that it did not have any pressure. My garden hose had more pressure. This is truly a design flaw that should be addressed by the manufacturer.

have only used once but seems to be doing the jobs we need with only water. great having 2 nozzles and it is compact and easily stores everything with it. We are replacing a gas pre washer. We are in Florida and have mildew on the house, patio & sheds and need something that you can just use when it needs cleaning. The gas one had to be worked on just about every time, they don't do well sitting for months at a time. By the time you pay someone you can get this.. had great reviews.. time will tell how it does..

used it twice. Worked great but seemed to have pressure problems and I had to work with the trigger to keep a constant spray. Seems the motor had problem keeping pressure. We had 100-1050 feet of hose. Sprayer choked a couple times and then the motor died. I couldn't get it to turn on. Ordered a replacement. haven't tried it out.

Bought this about a month ago. Just had a chance to use it today and it worked great. I cleaned my back patio, lower area of vinyl siding, front porch, and part of my driveway. I haven't replaced the fittings to brass yet, but I didn't have any leaks. It's small, lightweight, and powerful. Great buy!!

reviews.review_header: Worked well, for a VERY short time
reviews.review_text: Unfortunately I had to return this washer after only a few hours of use because the switch failed. It worked very well, but on one occasion when the pump stopped in response to releasing the trigger, it just never came back on. Nothing I tried worked. Reset, cooling the motor, made sure all the waterways were clear. I never ran the motor without water pressure, and made certain the hose was of sufficient diameter. We have city water so the pressure should have been more than adequate. Reading other reviews I am convinced this switch has a design or manufacturing flaw. Amazon's returns department was most gracious and helpful.

This pressure washer works great! Sprayed a portion of my fence with the turbo nozzle and it made it look like new! Still have yet to wash my car with it but I'm sure it will work great, just keep the pressure away so not to peel paint cause this thing packs a punch!

bought this because of the amount of positive reviews. The water connections leaked from the beginnig. the adaptor you put on the garden hose would have to be removed with pliers every time.. then about the 4th time I used it the connector broke completely! They offer you an upgrade to a brass fitting for 25 bucks , thank you NO! I returned this disappointment and returned to Karsher! while both models have plastic fitiings, karsher's are quality fittings that leak zero amount and are easy to put on and take off.avoid this brand at all costs!!!.

reviews.review_header: Smoking Motor Before Finished First Car Wash
reviews.review_text: I had some high hopes based on the reviews here but the electric motor in the unit I received began smoking the first time I used it before I could finish washing my car. I've since packed it up and sent it back to Amazon. I suppose I could exchange it but I was a little underwhelmed by the amount of pressure provided by the machine so I'll be buying something a little more industrial next time around. Pressure washers just seem to be one of those things that you get what you pay for.

Pressure hose is too short. Wanted to use it to wash the eaves on my house while keeping unit sufficiently far away so water does not fall on unit. Subsequently purchased extension hose. Pressure hose too stiff and curls making it difficult to fully extend hose. Felt water hose connection too flimsy and may break if I couldn't keep the water hose strictly in-line with the unit, which in practical use is difficult coupled with the short pressure hose. Subsequently bought a brass fitting for hose. Pressure not strong enough to wash dirt stains off of concrete. Might need a gas powered unit to get more pressure.

I bought this for a variety of reasons. Washing the house, sidewalks, patio, cars, it does them all with relative ease! Not to mention that you use LESS water when doing all these things. The only knock on this is the cheap foam bottle the include with the package. It didn't work at all for me. Fortunately I had already purchased a quality foam cannon from a detailing company. Unfortunately it required and adapter that cost an extra $22 after shipping. For the bottom line price though this is a sensible buy that you'll find plenty of uses for!

A nifty little marvel for the price. Strips paint like a champ. More powerful than you'd expect. East to use and clean and comes with great attachments. Haven't had any leaking on the hose intake but I bought the recommended female to female plug just in case. Seems very durable but I would not bang it around. Remember to house indoors in the winter. Great buy - so many used around the house.

This washer has ample power for most home use. A turbo nozzle (my favorite) is included, along with the more typical fan nozzle. All parts can be rolled up on or snapped onto the main unit, so relatively little space is required for storage or transportation. This unit is quieter than other electric washers I've used, and it's much quieter than a gasoline-powered washer. Also, the motor and pump only run when the trigger is squeezed.

reviews.review_header: Rather good - doesnt leak if backfliw connector is attached properly
reviews.review_text: Works well but only used for a couple of hours so far. As far as leaking and no flow- CHECK the manual. I and like others found the issue was the backfliw connector should get attached backwards than what it appears. Good pressure, unit can tip with cable rolled up, but I'm not the type to worry about getting the cord being perfectly rolled up and hung. Updated - works well for what it was intended: infrequently used low cost, lost psi. Does tend to tip, works well but you can see it is mostly plastic, but that's why its inexpensive. Again, good for what its intended.

reviews.review_header: AR Blue Clean lives up to its reputation
reviews.review_text: The AR Blue Clean was easy to assemble and intuitive to operate. It generates less force than a pro power washer but enough to strip paint, if that's what you want to do. It was surprisingly quiet when operating and shut off its motor automatically when not in use. It's relatively light and small, making storage easy. In summary, this is as good as most of the other reviewers have indicated.

reviews.review_header: Don't listen to the negative reviews
reviews.review_text: This is an excellent product. Those people complaining about the swivel connector leaking water and coming apart are the ones at fault. The pressure washer only pumps 1.5 GPM, but your garden faucet pushes out around 9-23 GPM, so it is unnecessary to open the faucet more than a small amount. I barely crack my faucet open while using the pressure washer and haven't had a single problem with the connector leaking or blowing apart. By using some elementary reasoning and a little common sense, you should have a satisfactory experience with this product. I love mine. It hasn't given me a single problem of any kind since I bough it several months ago.

After a lot of research, electric, gas, PSI's, etc, etc.. I decided on this pressure washer. The gas washer I had previously was constantly in the shop getting repaired, until, the cost of repair this year was to exceed the cost of a new model. This is when I decided to start checking on an electric model. I have no regrets. We have used the AR Blue a few times already (just bought it) and have been very happy with the results. This model is easy to set up, easy to move around, easy to store. The end results made me stand back and admire the look of the siding, deck, walk way. The only area that I have not been able to clean is the oil from a vehicle that is on my asphalt driveway, but could be I need a better cleaner. Small, but is doing the job!!

reviews.review_header: Good power Washer, Poor storage for Accesories
reviews.review_text: I recently had a Campbell Hausfeld washer for about 5 yrs. It decided to spring a leak in the pump section. After reviewing all makes, I decide on the AR Blue because of the reviews and it offers the 10" deck cleaner and an extension hose, plus it's 1900psi versus the 1450 I had previously. I have NO problems with leaks using the supplied connectors. I ran it for about 5 hrs. yesterday cleaning my barrel tile roof. The extension hose is great for doing roofs. The reason I did not give it 5 stars, because the storage for the accessories is poorly designed. Also the handle is very low making you stoop to pull it. Have not received the 10" deck cleaner yet. Looking forward to using this on my concrete driveway .

This product is well made, well designed, and has the best price/performance on the market. The 1900 psi rating is at the very top end for electric units and at the low end for gas. For my purposes, cleaning a wood deck, it was perfect. I was not looking for a unit that has high enough pressure to destroy my deck, even though you can remove a dime-sized piece of wood in seconds with this unit at close range. I carefully attached the garden hose adapter that comes with the unit, and it did not leak at all in use. The instructions provided specifically state that the hose reel is only for storage, so I did not have any issues with the unit falling in use since the sprayer hose is attached at the bottom of the unit. I would recommend it highly.

This pressure washer replaces my 1300 PSI Karcher as well as a very powerful Sears professional gas powered machine. Although I was very pleased with the Karcher for general use, this one has enough power for more applications and yet Not so much so that you are afraid of taking the shigles off the house like the more powerful Sears washer. I use it for more than just cleaning. I found it's great for blowing leaves off my pool deck in the fall, around trees and sidewalks and porches. Overall as a women that likes to work outside and can't handle gas powered tools without help, this machine is great.

My husband absolutely LOVES his new "toy". As soon as it arrived the day after it was ordered (paid for next day shipping), he assembled it (pretty quickly) and started putting it to good use. He kept remarking at what a terrific job it was doing and how quickly it was removing the greenish-grey mildew on the side of our house, which now looks like it has just been repainted! Wish all the products we order would be this great.

I waited until we used this for a year before writing a review. After cleaning our deck, cars, rugs, plastic lawn furniture, and more I must say I do not regret this purchase! Do not expect this to clean your vehicle like the high pressure commercial wash, but it speeds up a hand wash as well as great for under body. I bought a kink free expanding 1/2 garden hose for water supply and just loop it loosely over the handle when I put it away. I agree with the other reviews about storing the electrical cord and wand hose- much easier to drape it over the handle also.

reviews.review_header: I have used another electric power washer in previous years and this one performed better. My old power washer needed more time
reviews.review_text: I used this to power wash a deck and it met my expectations. I have used another electric power washer in previous years and this one performed better. My old power washer needed more time to create pressure compared to this one. I also like that all of the attachments/accessories can fit on to the unit. This makes storage easier.

Purchased this machine to clean the stone walls and deck around our pool. Very powerful and easy to use. Others have complained about the plastic hose attachments, but I've had no problems. Keep in mind... If you follow the advice of others and replace the quick connect hose inlets, you should know that the one that comes with the machine has a water filter in it - a very essential part to keeping debris out of the pump.

reviews.review_header: A lot of bang for the buck
reviews.review_text: This unit replaces one I bought from Home Depot, a red one, don't remember the brand. It was marginal from day one and finally gave out after a year of light use. It was junk. I've used the AR, quite heavily, for several months now and it has been great. Definitely has higher pressure than the other one, the hose reels up handily for storage, there's storage for the power cord and the power wand has adjustable spray pattern that is very useful getting off a stubborn paint stain and then widening out for general washing. I teamed it with the AR deck cleaner and that was been a very good combination.

reviews.review_header: Great pressure washer for the price
reviews.review_text: I was concerned about the connections on this pressure washer after reading many reviews here. So far, I am glad I took the chance and bought the AR Blue Clean AR383 in spite of some of the poor reviews. It has performed perfectly, even on fairly tough jobs. I was able to clean two rather neglected wood decks with ease using only the regular wand and not the turbo. It is also great that this unit is so small and lightweight. It was easy to put it in a car and take it to a rental property I own and clean the deck there as well. I hope it continues to perform as well as it has so far and that the plastic connections hold up.

I was very happy with the quality and power of this pressure washer. It is lightweight, easy to use and surprisingly powerful for being so small and electric. Unless you are doing some heavy duty jobs this is more than adequate. I have noticed this same brand advertised at home improvement stores for less money but upon further investigation realized those were not the same model and, in fact, were less powerful. Just be sure to check the model if you choose to buy what looks like the same product somewhere else.
Pressure washer stopped working after 3 months. Poor customer service. They do not respond back. Look for other washers I'm out money now....

reviews.review_header: We are very happy with this washer
reviews.review_text: We are very happy with this washer. We've had no leaks. We blasted paint off from our deck rails and managed to roughen up the wood a bit. After some very light sanding and two coats of paint, those rails are beautiful and smooth. We didn't take all of the paint off--about 50%. The rest is really stuck on well. I can't imagine needing a washer with more power.

This little thing is a light weight trooper! I love it. I'm pretty fanatical about keeping my porch clean. The big gas one I borrowed was just "too much" to use often. This pressure washer I can store in my basement carrying it up and down the stairs easily. And it does a great job. Don't expect the same super high power wash as the big gas washers, because this is not what you're getting. Just expect a good, light weight machine, for a good price that will do a great job and you'll be as thrilled as I am.

This little pressure washer does a great job of keeping my driveway, sidewalks, porch, and decks clean. I love it even more since purchasing the 25 foot extension hose. That eliminated the need to be pulling it around here and there. It is much lighter and easier to set up than the gas pressure washer thus making it that much more handy.

Broke after two uses. The power will simply not turn on. Pretty disappointed. Update: My father, who is an electrician checked out the powerwasher and diagnosed the problem as probably being a faulty built in surge protector that is a part of the cord.

Purchased this 9 months ago and have enjoyed using it every since. Much more powerful than I expected and very easy to carry/wheel around. Only complaint would be the hose that comes with it. The supplied hose is very stiff and hard to manage. I would purchase a better quality hose to go along with this pressure washer.

This was a great choice! Have used it on our deck that hadn't been washed for 3 years. My deck now looks almost like the day it was installed! Have used it on my outside fish tank (wooden wine barrels) and it cleaned them up fast and easily. The same for my brick walk way. So far I have not had any problems with connections leaking, as many reviews mentioned. It is easy to move around and use. Very convenient. I recommend it highly! .

Poor quality in my opinion purchase in 2012 used 2-4 hours maximum motor quit this year unit well cared for clean, company will not respond to request for technical assistance nor recommend repair center I suppose because it's out of warranty. I purchased due to good reviews but turned out poorly for me.

reviews.review_header: Not enough GPM to do much reflective of the PSI rating.
reviews.review_text: Doesn't do much for wood, cars, or painted surfaces...just not enough power and especially not enough GPM For the PSI. It does a fairly good job on stone / concrete, etc. I was truly hoping this would be the way to avoid a gasoline equipment purchase, but it cannot replace a gas model with comparable PSI.

This washer was exactly what I was wanting. i had a Karcher prior to this one. It was very loud and awkward to move around. The 1900 psi spray is perfect. The quite motor is great. It was easy to assemble. Its very lightweight. Only complaint I have is the pipe where you attach the spray hose to the body of the machine is not long enough to extend past the tool holder parts which makes in difficult to attach. This is something I can work around. The first thing I cleaned were pool chairs. It was amazing, they look brand new. Next was the concrete around the pool where moss had grown under the trees. The concrete look like new. I now have a list two pages log which this machine will be great on. I would highly reccommend this product over many on the market.

reviews.review_header: I am baffled by the good reviews. No problem with leaks but the machine ...
reviews.review_text: I am baffled by the good reviews. No problem with leaks but the machine is so weak as to be useless and not worth the trouble of hauling it out. Tried cleaning my stone and brick and I'm better off with a brush and bucket. Also there is no way to mix detergent with the so-called pressure wands. The detergent attachment just sprinkles it around without pressure. Not that there's any pressure to begin with. Will return this at great hassle.

reviews.review_header: ... 3 days in a row and I am extremely pleased with the results
reviews.review_text: Have used the product for 3 days in a row and I am extremely pleased with the results. Lots of power. I have experienced some difficulty with the soap bottle which has leaked. Not a big deal though. I am happy that I purchased this pressure washer. I had done a lot of research on which product was the best for the money and I have not made a mistake.

We are now in our second season of use with this power washer, and still wonder about the reviews that talk about leaks, which we have not experienced. It seems that these may be due to improper connections rather than the unit itself. Our only problem has been with cord management. The reel is pretty useless for the sprayer cord, and it's a pain to wrap the power cord, so everything is always tangled. Also, be careful about moving the unit with the hose attached, as much twisting strain on the coupling will crack it.

Nicely featured product. Plenty powerful for jobs around the house. Used it to clean moss off of rocks on pond and waterfall, a task I'd been delaying for several years. The AR383 made it a snap. The washer has a slight leak at the inlet hose connection, but no big deal. The handle and wands go together securely and provide a variety of spray patterns. Happy with this purchase so far. Hope it has reasonable reliability

I bought this unit to do small jobs - car wheels, porch stoops, and the like. Works great! Please note: I store this unit indoors in the winter to keep ice formation from breaking the seals! I winterize my standard higher pressure washer & keep it in my shed.

reviews.review_header: Better than a gas powered pressure washer with better specs
reviews.review_text: Fantastic powerwasher. I originally bought a 2850 PSI gas powered pressure washer with a higher GPM and the Blue Clean was way more effective at getting the job down. It is very powerful. I can't speak to the long-term durability because I have only used it 3 times, but that is also why I wanted an electric pressure washer. The gas powered ones would have issues with the cylinders rusting, gasoline going bad, and stuff since I would never use it often enough.

reviews.review_header: The pressure washer did a great job for me
reviews.review_text: The pressure washer did a great job for me. Light weight and easy to handle. Plenty of pressure to clean the siding on the house. I didn't try winding the hose on the reel but it works great for the power cord.

I must confess that this is my first power washer so I have no comparison. That said, this little baby rocks! I've had no problem so far - 3 extended uses. I've not had problems with the hose reel or the hose adapter mentioned in other reviews. Very minor improvements - extend the handle so I don't have to bend over to pull it along and increase the size of the accessories/cord wind attachment. If this were slightly larger everything would fit better. Don't get me wrong - this is a must buy in my book (assuming it lasts). It has cleaned every household task I've attacked so far with ease. I am very pleased.

I purchased the AR blue clean for home use. This doesn't leak at connection point, and the hose reel makes it easy to store. It's powerful nozzle was great for my most dreaded job - cleaning dried, stubborn bird poop off my slate patio. The gentle nozzle is fine for washing more sensitive things, like a door screen. I used to borrow my neighbors Black and Decker power washer and it leaked at the hose connection so much, I feared electrocution. This is ideal for a homeowner, compact storage, powerful and easy to use.

I have had three electric power washers over the past two years and this is by far the best, and best value. Extremely powerful for a residential electric power washer and is very easy to use. You can't use the wind up feature unless you plan to disassemble the unit and store it, but who cares? Only thing you need to do is order a brass hose fitting, the plastic one is complete junk. I use this one http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B0015AUSTC/ref=oss_product and it works perfectly with no water drippage and makes the unit look better too.

reviews.review_header: AR Blue Clean AR383 1900 PSI 1.5GPM 14 Amp Electric Pressure Washer
reviews.review_text: Pressure washer is exactly as described. We are very pleased with the performance of our new pressure washer. It has plenty of power and pressure to get that hard job of cleaning done. Very easy to set up and use. I love having every thing in one place. If you are looking for a high performance electric pressure washer this is the one. We use a pressure washer almost daily around here. And this one has gotten quite a work out since it came last week. Our old one bit the dust and we were just waiting on this one to get to our house. I have no problem using this power washer it is so easy to handle and roll around.

Love, Love, Love!! This is the first time I have ever purchased or used a pressure cleaner. It arrived yesterday and was extremely easy to assemble and use. I was so excited to use it that I tested it on a piece of our patio. It worked very well. It is compact and therefore easy to store as well. A friend of ours has had the same one for a while and it is still going strong. We are very happy with our purchase and highly recommend it!!

I bought this for my parents to have at their place in florida and since they are still here in wv currently this has yet to come out of it's box. My father was excited as he read that it is 1900 PSI stating to me "that's really good for an electric pressure washer"lol. I think it will work out well! I paid full price for this item without any promo's.
Super easy to set up. Plugs into a regular 110v outlet and has its own fuse reset / test buttons right on the plug. Used this today to clean off my wooden pergola and it performed beautifully.

reviews.review_header: I would expect to receive a unit with an adapter ...
reviews.review_text: I would expect to receive a unit with an adapter that allows water to flow into the unit. Quality of unit is inferior to other units I have used in the past for the same cost. When I am able to purchase an adapter that does allow water flow, I will then be able to determine the true value of the unit. Currently not impressed.!!

This unit is small, quiet, powerful and it stores well. What's not to like? My last electric power washer was a Husky 1550 PSI. It was okay. But this little guy is terrific. It made quick work of my 3 car driveway and sidewalk. This unit is an "on demand" unit. This unit's motor only runs when you depress the trigger versus my old unit whose motor was always running. So this unit is quiet and delivers power only when you need it. It is barely 3 feet tall and stores well. I highly recommend you try it. Oh by the way. It does NOT LEAK. If you tighten all of the connections correctly! Enjoy.

We've had the opportunity to use this several times and we're very happy with it! Has worked well to clean the cement in our driveway and also power wash our house! I'm sure that the gas powered cleaners are stronger, but consideration should be given to what your needs are before you make a purchase.

Good power washer for the money. Easy to operate. Cords are long, which makes it easy to do projects without a lot of unplugging or tangling. Only drawback is that the plastic piece that holds the cleaning solution busted the first time using it so there's no way to spray on cleaner using the power washer. I had to purchase an external sprayer and do it separately.

reviews.review_header: Product quit working the second time I used it!!
reviews.review_text: This quit working the second time I used it. Power would not cut on. Tried all the suggestions in the Troubleshooting section and called the 1-866-235-5112 and no help on the weekends. Left my contact number and HOPEFULLY, they'll call. Advice at this time is....do NOT purchase this product.

I bought this to replace one from Costco that only lasted a couple of years and never worked well. This one worked better for cleaning sidewalks and wood, but only lasted a few months. The "pistol" part broke and would not accept the nozzles. Clearly I need to spend more for a more powerful gas powered one. Live and learn.

The unit stopped working after the first use. I logged into my account to attempt to return it, only to find out the 30 day return policy had just expired. Hopefully Amazon or the manufacturer will do what's right and issue a replacement or a refund. I will update this review throughout the process.

reviews.review_header: Just purchased this power washer and only tested it out ...
reviews.review_text: Just purchased this power washer and only tested it out. Have not put it through it's paces yet but the test went very well. For a compact unit I think it has all the power I will need

This was a replacement for another AR North America power washer after about 10 years of usage. I figured I had such good luck with the last one, I would give this one a try. Like other reviewers, I also had a problem with it leaking until I bought a metal coupler. Just be sure to wrap the threads with some teflon tape to help prevent leaking. Unit has plenty of power for cleaning decks and patios. Only thing I really don't like is the HUGE plug at the end. It has a built in GFIC which makes it hard to plug into an outlet that has a protective cover on it. Not the best design IMHO. Other than that (and the leaking that can be stopped with a metal coupler), I am happy with the purchase. Would recommend it to others looking for a medium power electric power washer.

Using the turbo wand I was able to clean deeply embedded dirt and grime from a very large concrete patio that virtually surrounds the house. It did little to remove paint splatters at first but after application of concrete paint remover it got rid of 90% of them, saving a lot of elbow grease.
