I like the automatic shut-off when the trigger is released. There is only one negative in my opinion and that is the garden hose connection. A pet peeve of mine is plastic on metal connections. Sooner or later the plastic threads are likely to strip. Like others that have commented here I simply replaced the default hose connection with a $6.00 brass garden hose "swivel" brass fitting(female to female) from Home Depot. It greatly simplified the hookup and minimized leakage. All in all this electric pressure washer is a winner.

reviews.review_header: Good product, and great customer service!
reviews.review_text: I bought AR Blue Clean AR383 as used from third party at Amazon. One month after I received the package, I used AR383, and liked the amazing effect in cleaning the driveway and the brick walls. However after less than 30 minutes usage, the engine was dead with some smoke coming out from the vent. I called AR North America customer service directly. Angela Braun told me that in rare case the engine would burn, and she sent UPS to pick up the broken one from our front door, and mailed us a new tested one shotly. Today I used it for about 4 hours without stop to clean all the walls. I loved it, for its tremendous pressure generated, small size, and long hose/power line. Higly recommended!

I didn't want to have to deal with gas cans, oil, etc. so went with this item for pressure cleaning around the house. Very simple to set up and to operate. Be sure to read the instructions, especially about how the unit primes itself when you first turn it on. Also, do not get too close to a painted service such as a garage door. You may damage the paint. The hose and cord are a bit awkward to deal with but not a big deal at all. The hose connector to the unit is plastic and may have to be replaced some day. But that is a simple fix, just order new quick connectors for Amazon or go to Lowes or Home Depot.

I am happy with the machine overall but I am not happy with the design of changing out the wands and soap dispenser. Once you install one of them its impossible to get it back out to put in one of the other ones. I have posted a question about it and other people are having the same problem. I would have given the machine 5 stars had it not been for this poor design. Also every once in a while when you pull the trigger the machine does not kick on and you have to let go and pull it again for it to kick on.
First one quit while under warranty. Customer service was great and sent replacement. Replacement unit quit after first use.
I love the power washer. Having a choice of two power wands is great. In no time I power washed my patio and laerge edging bricks and adirondack chairs. Would recomment this highly.

reviews.review_header: Affordable pressure washer for personal use.
reviews.review_text: Best affordable pressure washer for personal use. The attachments are real handy for washing the house and car. Do note to use the cone attachment for car and not the cylinder attachment. I have yet to experience the common leak that a lot of people are experiencing but the replacement seems easy (just a brass fitting).

reviews.review_header: I did a lot of research on electric pressure washers.
reviews.review_text: This one seemed to meet my specifications and price. It is hard to make a purchase like this without ever seeing it in person or being able to use one. After a couple of months and medium use...once or so a week...I like this product so far. The changing from soap to pressure washer is a little problem, a very little problem, but not enough to break the 5 stars in my rating. I'd buy another one! 'Nuff said. Yes, I have recommended this to my friends...and they were able to try it out!!

reviews.review_header: AR Blue Clean power washer did a good job.
reviews.review_text: Have only used it once so far but liked the results. I think with more use I will really be able to get a lot more done on my house, sidewalk & driveway. It did a real good job cleaning mold & mildew from front porch. I found it would also clean mold off wooden porch railing, then tried it on my porch swing & was very happy with how well it cleaned dirt & mold with very little effort.

My daughter has used this a lot. Me? None yet. She always has it going on decks or porches or siding or cars. Our water bill went up but she had fun getting things clean. Even used it on some plastic chairs to clean them for a party. We're happy.

My husband and I used this pressure washer for the first time today after a quick assembly (do change the garden hose adapter to a metal one) and it is fantastic! I am not a "read the instructions" kind of girl, but after having a hard time getting the dang thing to turn on after hitting the power switch, I pulled out the manual and saw there was a bit of a "trick" to it. You need to plug it in, HIT THE RESET BUTTON (on the power adapter), then switch the power washer on. We were able to clean our wooden fences, patio furniture, concrete patio, driveway, windows, walls and take moss off the north side of our roof. Love how we were able to get so much done in just one day!

reviews.review_header: Worked great for removing deck mildew
reviews.review_text: Great washer for the price! Cleaned all the mildew off my average-sized deck in one afternoon! Had plenty of pressure to easily remove the green mildew coating off my vinyl house siding and deck, no problem at all, and we have well water which doesn't provide much power of it's own. Keep in mind, it's a small plastic unit meant for smaller home cleaning projects.

reviews.review_header: good washer but bad connector (probably just my luck!!)
reviews.review_text: only tried once so far, works fine. Only one issue - main inlet where I need to plug hose if not fitting properly with the water hose. I am thinking that connector that came with washer is probably defective. I am hoping to get replacement connector from company.

I dislike the product. It was the second one that I had due to the first one did not run eather. This one gave me the same problem as the first. It ran for about a second then shut off. I never could get it to run. I would not recommend that pressure washer to anyone. I gave it away.

Cheaply made. Handle broke during assembly. Ordered a new one. Used it on our driveway and worked well. Tried to use it a second time and the adapter to the hose broke. Ordered a new one. During operation this time it has sprung a leak from within and I have no idea why.

It arrived dbl boxed for extra safety of the product I presume. It was easy to put the few pieces together. It worked like a dream. My husband cleaned entire driveway within a cpl hrs and it looks brand new again! He proceeded to our walkway to front door. They are pavers that had weeds growing and mold on them. In an hr they looked new again. He pressure washed our entrance way, walls ceiling and the glass door, looked awesome. Easy to move around, not top heavy. It comes with 2 nozzles. Turbo works best on cement. It was well worth every penny. Price is great too. Great appliance!!!

reviews.review_header: Didn't even last one summer of minimal use. Not ...
reviews.review_text: Didn't even last one summer of minimal use. Not really much else to say. This is the third brand, electric pressure washer, that I've tried. None of them last for more than a summer. I'm not sure what else to conclude but that they're all pieces of junk; but your mileage may vary. You're really just buying an expensive lottery ticket when you buy these things.

I bought this power washer from Amazon last spring. It was great for cleaning off the lawn furniture, grill, etc. Unfortunately, when I pulled it out this spring...it no longer works. I took it to PW Mall (AR North America's recommended parts and repair provider) and it was minimally $69 to look at it plus parts and labor. They thought it was the switch but a replacement switch is $58. Mmmmm...$69 & $58...might as well buy a new power washer. Do wish it would have lasted a bit longer!

reviews.review_header: Did what it said it would!
reviews.review_text: I'm liking this pressure washer. I must admit that it's the first time owning one, however, I had an idea what to look for. Here is what I think about the AR Blue Clean: Pros: 1. It's sturdy 2. The pressure is adequate for domestic use (cars, windows, deck etc) 3. The length of the electric cord was most impressive. 4. Uses about a 1/4 of the water I normaly use to wash my car (>water=$). 5. Setup is easy once you follow the manual. Cons: 1. The plastic adapter leaks heavily. Luckily I bought a metal one. 2. While in use the hoses can become a bit annoying. All in all I would recommend it any day to a DIYer like myself. Great job!

Bought this and after the 4th use the product no longer functions. This comes with a GFI breaker on the plug - Nice idea as it is used in a wet environment but the GFI breaker will no longer reset making this worthless. I am one week outside Amazon's return policy as well. I would not buy this

I bought this unit a couple of months ago and used it on one occasion to clean out a very long driveway. It worked flawlessly. I was worried that others had leakage problems, but my unit had no problems whatsoever. I've used gas powered ones in the past prior to painting the exterior of my home so this unit in comparison obviously is not on the same league but for weekend chores (ie car washing, deck cleaning, etc) this one will work well. I liked that it isnt very loud and only runs when the trigger is pulled. Time will tell about durability but so far it has met my expectations.

reviews.review_header: arrived as promised and worked well to wash the exterior ...
reviews.review_text: arrived as promised and worked well to wash the exterior of our home - including aluminum gutters & eaves & wood decks & rails - enough power to reach 2nd floor eaves!

reviews.review_header: it worked great. Next day the unit tipped over and the ...
reviews.review_text: Used power washer once, and after some initial issues with the 2 piece garden hose adapter, it worked great. Next day the unit tipped over and the garden hose adapter, which is cheap hard plastic, broke. I called manufacturer, who answered in less then one minute, and they replaced part with an aluminum adapter at no charge - great service.

reviews.review_header: Works quite well - Easy to Use
reviews.review_text: This unit works quite well. It is not as powerful as gasoline powered units, but it is, cheaper, lighter, quieter and easier to use. It did a good job of cleaning the pavers on my driveway, and cleaning the bottom of my sailboat. The input connection did leak freely as others have complained. I solved the problem with a Gilmore brass double female connector. The use of eye protection is highly recommended before using any power washer.

Washer did not work! When I called to get it replaced amazon would not replace the product because it was outside of 30 days. I bought it as a gift :( The motor just kept pulsating and would not spray a steady stream. VERY disappointed with Amazon as well as the Product. Do not buy!

Like others have said, the quick disconnect is fragile, but hasn't broke on me yet. I will eventually get a metal replacement at my local hardware store. The hose reel is a bit cumbersome too. Overall works good!

reviews.review_header: Respectable and usable for the money
reviews.review_text: I'd buy it again. I saw reports that the bib between garden hose and unit frequently leaked, but we haven't experienced that. It cleans our concrete sidewalk just fine. I'd agree w/ other reviewers that the limited number of wand tips is a drawback, but the tip with which it comes is adjustable, and so far has met our needs. One just has to fiddle with the adjustable tip's settings to find what works for you. Multiple tips would be a "nice to have." We've owned it now for six months and it's worked as advertised. My wife likes that it's very lightweight. It's also very compact, which is good. Although not perfect, which is how come it gets 4 stars, for the money, it's a solid buy.

reviews.review_header: Five stars with a couple of reservations
reviews.review_text: Five stars with a couple of reservations. The small reel is useless, even if you can get the hose on the reel, it winds it way too tight. The GFI will not plug into an outside receptacle, you will need an additional extension cord. The good news is it's a great power washer, has two nozzles and does a great job, quiet, and at a great price, this is the important part and why I gave it five stars.

I INITIALLY HAD TROUBLE FIGURING OUT THE INSTRUCTIONS SO I CALLRF THE NUMBER FOR BLUE CLEAN. I CANNOT SAY ENOUGH GOOD THINGS ABOUT THE PERSON I SPOKE TO. HE WAS PATIENT AND TOOK A LOT OF TIME GOING OVER A LOT OF IMPORTANT INFORMATION WITH ME. I SPENT MANY HOURS AFTER USING IT, AND I AM THRILLED AT HOW WELL IT WORKS. THAN YOU, BLUE CLEAN FOR HAVING GREAT EMPLOYEES TO HELP PEOPLE LIKE ME.

reviews.review_header: updated 4/9/14...My Husband is a very picky man when it comes to his "BIG BOY TOOLS" :D
reviews.review_text: My husband and son love it still. Still works great. Remember to use only cold water OR the pump will turn off. SOOO Far so good. I bought this for my husband for Christmas, and He has been outside when cold temps allow for using it. He uses to clean the ATV and whatever else he could find in this cold weather we have been having. LOL.... He is VERY HAPPY with this product. He has been using it with the Pocket Hose hooked up to my sink in the utility room. If anything bad or good happens I will update.

reviews.review_header: runs quietly and very easy to use
reviews.review_text: Item is light weight, has plenty of cleaning power, runs quietly and very easy to use. Have pressure washed the siding on the house, the entire cedar deck, top and bottom, the cedar fence and the sidewalk. I even washed the cars with it. I haven't had any problems with the plastic hose connector, I just disconnect it when ever I move the washer so there is not undue strain on it. I would recommend this to my friends. i've only had it a month, will see how it holds up.

I read the reviews before I purchased and called the company about the leaking issue. They send the brass coupler with the product now. So I ordered it. The installion instructions are poor so I ended up calling to make sure that I had all the rights parts in the right place. Installed it without the extra brass coupler and it worked, with no leaking. I didn't install the accessory holder as previous reviews indicated it gets in the way. I made sure all connections were tight. It works great. I just ordered a brush and extention to help get the gutters. Customer service was great and walked me through the setup. They are revamping their installation procedures for future. I am most happy with it.

reviews.review_header: Very Nice - Light - Ease to Use
reviews.review_text: I purchased this pressure washer to clean my house siding. Does the job, but a little on the light-pressure side. I had a higher PSI unit gas engine operated, but could not get it to start this year (had it about three years) -- decided to try electric and it it easy to use -- connect the poser cord and turn on the switch -- light to maneuver -- long hose for the high spots -- highly recommend for those easier jobs -- if you have a challenge job, may want to go with a higher PSI unit! Bob

Unit has had issues from the start. Now it's pretty much useless. I can't find any information about the specific issue I've been having either. Unit 'pulses' between high and no pressure in a sinusoidal period of roughly 2 seconds. It always had done this, but it used to clear up after a few minutes of running, now it won't, and is no longer capable of performing its duties.

reviews.review_header: This pressure washer works great. After wetting down my badly mildewed deck with ...
reviews.review_text: This pressure washer works great. After wetting down my badly mildewed deck with household bleach (2 gallons be careful of foliage) I powered up the washer and used almost the highest pressure and wow in no time at all I was done and the results were just great.

reviews.review_header: 1st use it was amazing....then it wouldn't work properly.
reviews.review_text: First use it was great! No pull start which made it a simple unit to use. Second use it just stopped spraying. The motor ran nonstop, which it shouldn't do. It had pressure, water but no spray. Disappointed that I'm returning this.
If I could give it 0 stars, I would. The detergent nozzle flew off while washing my car and shattered my taillight. Fortunately, I wasn't in the way when it ricocheted and flew a good 20 feet away.

reviews.review_header: Greatest power washer out there that is reasonable to own.
reviews.review_text: This pressure washer is fabulous. I had wanted a gas powered one because the electric ones I borrowed just would not get the mold off. After careful homework on it, I did choose this electric one and it works better than the gas ones I had used. My only complaint is that the cord only works on certain outlets and I have one area that even with having purchased more hose is pretty much unreachable. But I would not trade the washer because of this. It also is really quiet so there is no bothering the neighborhood. The company is wonderful to work with and very friendly and timely in getting extra parts to the customer.

reviews.review_header: Plenty of power for heavily soiled driveways and siding. Get a hose adapter
reviews.review_text: Very happy with it. The Problem The included hose adapter will leak. Solution Get a 3/4" male to male adapter preferably with gaskets. Wrap the male end from the power washer with some teflon tape (same stuff that comes with showerheads) to ensure not a drop will leak. Add full water pressure THEN turn it on.

My experience with this item is excellent. I have pressure washed, the front porch, bird bath, riding mower, and even the glass shower doors. This thing works like a charm. No leaks and plenty of pressure. For what I bought it for its great. I know there are other higher pressure washers out there but for the life of me, I can't think of one thing this one won't do for me around the house.

I have only used this a few times and am very pleased. Driveway - no problem, Deck - No problem, Swing set - No problem. Used it for several hours one day pretty much non stop. I like that it goes to sleep when you release the handle (except when you do it by accident and it goes into a kind of half mode). It is much quieter then others I have used and seen. I bought the metal fittings as others suggested, have hardly any leakage. Never even used the plastic pieces. Also bought the 10" flat surface washer. Worth the extra money as it worked great on the driveway.

reviews.review_header: I was skeptical but I am extremely pleased with it
reviews.review_text: This little guy really works!!! I was skeptical but I am extremely pleased with it.

reviews.review_header: Works well with good pressure but set up and tear down take awhile
reviews.review_text: Works well with good pressure but set up and tear down take awhile. Fixtures are not designed for easy attachment. You need to take all attachments off to wrap up the electrical cord. Leaks water from all joints so keep it in an area where the water won't be an issue.

This is a relatively inexpensive way to make everything look new again. Our Trex deck looks like it was just built after using the power washer on it. So does our sidewalk, dock and pontoon. We'll be bringing it to a vacation home to spruce that up, too. It's powerful enough to do the job without slicing off your toes or trashing your siding - a big plus. Beats the heck out of having someone power wash - which runs $200 a pop. Love it - would buy it again, and strongly recommend it to anyone who needs to power clean anything.

Most of my pressure washer experience has been with a Sear gasoline powered unit which I still have but is currently inoperative. I've also used a friend's 1600 psi electric unit that worked but lived up to its poor reviews. The AR383 comes with a well-written manual in genuine US English. It does not have the cleaning power of a 2000+ psi gasoline unit, but its simplicity makes it a very practical tool. I particularly like the way it shuts down when you release the trigger and waits quietly until you squeeze the trigger, whereupon it promptly springs into action for as long as you like. It seems to be a well designed and well made unit.

I wanted an electric Pressure Washer so as not to deal with gas cans, smell etc. I also wanted one that was powerful enough to do driveways, mold/mildew on house etc. This does the trick. Great power for such a small unit. Easy to use and great features such as ability to change spray nozzel without turning off entire unit. Be careful not to step on the front water connection as you can break it off easily. Also, small soap container is useless. I used a spray bottle or tank sprayer to spray on soap / bleach mixture.

Works pretty much as advertised and has excellent pressure. most reviews were positive which helped in making this choice. there are a couple issues still being figured out. one is the pressure switch takes a long time to reset. when the machine shuts off it won't come to full power unless it sits for some time or the wand is removed, the maching cycled, then the wand re-installed. installing the wand became difficult, but a little grease seemed to cure the problem. overall satisified for the cost.

A great piece of equipment. Other electric PW I have used sound like they are in the process of destroying themselves when they run. This unit has a nice effective sound. The pressure is enough to clean without so much that when you slip you dig a chunk out of whatever you are cleaning. The water inlet is plastic so I was extra careful when moving it for fear the weight of a heavy hose being tugged around would damage it. Very happy with my purchase. If I had purchased this years ago, I wouldn't be replacing 1/3 of my deck next year.

This power washer works great! We use it on our stone patio, outdoor furniture, brick, siding, outside windows, and even our car. It provides a nice high pressure but it is not enough to damage your property. It has successfully removed all kinds of stains we couldn't get rid of. I have no idea why we waited so long to buy one of these! Everything looks so nice and new again. The only downside: The cord and everything is a total pain. We don't even bother wrapping the cord or the hose where it is meant to go because it doesn't work like it should. It doesn't bother us much because we have enough space in our garage.

I read reviews before making purchase, as to what to expect in putting this power washer together. The instruction book was a little vague and parts mislabled, but had the illustrations been larger I think it would have been a piece of cake to assemble. As it were, I managed to reverse the garden hose adapter, which lead to a pronounced leak until I got out the magifying glass, re-read the instructions and used common sense. Problem solved! I have been enjoying all those cleaning jobs that used to be a dreaded chore. Oh, by the way the delivery was much faster than expected! Well pleased.

This gets the job done, but just barely. If it is 1900 psi, then I would never want anything less, as the pressure is just barely good enough to do what I wanted. The types of jobs I used it for: Removing paint drops from concrete from a messy painter, removing dryed concrete residue from stepping stones, clearing old adhesive residue from veneer, cleaning a bbq grill, etc. In each case, the washer did finally get it done, but it took several passes and lots of scrubbing inbetween passes. The plastic connector and the hose reel are lame, but don't effect the usefulness of the washer.

I live near the SC coast so pollen and mildew can be a big problem. Researched power washers and decided on the AR Blue electric 1900 psi. I have used it four days in a row, and I can say every part and attachment work perfectly. Took care of mildew on porch deck and ceiling, brick steps and porch railings with all the power I need (even more). I could not be more pleased with my purchase. If a homeowner needs more power than this one, you have probably waited way too long between clean up jobs.

reviews.review_header: Easy to assemble and simple to get started
reviews.review_text: Easy to assemble and simple to get started. Based on limited experience, it appears that the 1900 psi output is significantly stronger than my previous pressure washer rated at 1200 psi. The additional pressure was one of the reasons for my selection and purchase. I was not disappointed. If this product with time proves to be durable, I would rate it an overall winner.

I agree with most about this power washer. It is very strong for an electric model. I just used it to power wash my deck. It replaced a different model that broke. This was easy to assemble. Worked without a problem. I really liked the way it stores the hoses and electrical cord. Winds up into a self contained unit that has wheels and is easy to put away. Definitely buy the brass male to male brass connector to attach the hose to the unit. Mine leaked so much with the quick connection that came with the unit that I was losing more water at the connection then the water coming out of the pressure washer. Worth the extra few bucks for the brass connector. No leak at all with the brass fitting.

No complaints. I ordered this on the weekend and it arrived by midweek. It's a very nice machine that works well. The setting up was not difficult, but you need to take your time. Actually the job itself is less time consuming than setting up and cleaning up. The machine gets very dirty but it is easily cleaned off if you gently hose it down with the garden hose.

reviews.review_header: Years of abuse- and it still works
reviews.review_text: As others note this device has certain fragility. I've broken the handle and other parts off mine over the past several years. It is ugly. But it still works and blasts as hard as the day it was new. It goes outside after the last freeze and gets used all summer. Before the first freeze in the fall I drain it and roll up the hose and bring it back inside. The GFI plug quit after a couple of years- this was a bit irritating but easily fixed. Don't cut corners on your ground fault protection.

Pros: Very convenient to use. Good pressure for an electric model. Light and easy to transport and store. Very quiet compared to gas models. No emissions! Cons: Plastic hose is very stiff - should use rubber flexible hose! Water connector is plastic and looks fragile. Soap dispenser could be improved - difficult to connect and use. Overall so much more convenient than a gas model.

My wife wanted one of these smaller (non-gas powered) pressure washers for a while now. I was hesitant thinking that the electric ones could not handle most jobs and would be a waste of money. I was wrong. We cleaned our brick patio, it was perfect for the job. Not too powerful to destroy the brick but good enough to clean. Plan to use it on the deck next with no worries. I bought this particular one based on the reviews that seemed mostly positive. My only negative is that it is difficult to read the instructions and there is not much information on how to use simple things like the hose roller and accessories holder.

i both this, AR Blue Clean AR383 1,900 PSI 1.5 GPM 14 Amp Electric Pressure from stores 123 via amazon on june 12/13 used 2 times and start to make all kind of noise, called back the seller no!! satisfaction, called the manufacture 4 weeks go still waiting to hear from. this is one junk unit stay way from it.and i got no support from,seller stores 123 manufacture or AMAZON

reviews.review_header: Excellent lightweight product for home use
reviews.review_text: I have pushed this thing as hard as I can and it just keeps doing the job. No long term review as I have only had it for a couple of weeks, but so far I am pleased. No problems with leaking fittings here. Works well for siding, cars, concrete and fencing....so far. The only complaint I would have is with how the cleaner/detergent attachment works as the stream is not powerful enough for me.

I bought this power washer for light to medium duty work around the house, It is great. I've used it to wash the fence, patio furniture, flagstone and driveway so far. It is a bit cumbersome to get it set up to use and to put up when done -- so unless you leave the hose and power cord uncoiled, it is not something that you use for a small spur of the moment job. As other reviews state, it did leak slightly at the hose connection so I purchased a brass male-to-male connector and no more leak. Overall, this is a fantastic product and I give it five stars. Definately worth the money!

I was hesitant in buying this model because of the reports from many about leaks. The unit did leak water at the hose connections point with the out of the box fittings. I ordered brass replacement fitting from amazon, but those were even worse. I used some plumbers tape on the metal theads on the machine and put the original plastic fittings back. That solved my problem. No more leaks. As far as functionality, I'm pleased. I used it a few times last year and just did some spring cleaning again this year. It works well on slate & stone. It cleaned my window screens well too. After a year of use, I'm happy with my purchase and feel this was a good value.

Very disappointing product, given the reviews. 1. The water hose won't roll onto it's reel (the reel is much too small. 2. The power chord has a transformer on the end - right at the plug - that prevents it being plugged into our outdoor GFI outlets. 3. The quick-connect leaked the first time it was used, then broke. 4. I ordered a replacement connector from AR and it leaks. In short, the unit has both design and manufacturing quality problems that are inexcusable. (I'd used a similar power washer from Home Depot for several years with very few problems, though it finally died. That's my reference.)

Although I have had the unit for 3 winters I only used it one time during each of the previous winters. I thought it was great at the time. This time when I used it, within 5 minutes it overheated and had the burning motor smell; its finished. Would have been cheaper to pay someone to pressure wash instead.

It works good, Yes it reeks of china but it works. The plastic quick connect did break on the 4th time of use. 1/26/15 Lost a star. This pressure washer didn't make it a year. For the price tag you might not expect it to but I was hoping for at least 2 years. I got it out on a warm day a few days ago to wash my car and it wouldn't pump at all. I drained it before winter the best I could.

Very impressed with the pressure on this one. It's quiet, light and simple to use. I like the auto shut off when you aren't using it. I haven't had any leaking issues like everyone else but we will see what happens. The plastic seems sturdy and held up pretty good while I was washing my truck. I wash my truck once a month so let's see if this will last.

I should say my husband loves it! He finds every reason he can to use it. Our car and the outside of our house have never been so clean. He put it together and started using it within just a few minutes. I am impressed by how strong this is for the price, but it does the job well.

reviews.review_header: Solid construction. Easy to put together
reviews.review_text: Solid construction. Easy to put together. Start, run, stop at first time and every time. There is no leaking. I have used it to wash off peeled paint from my huge deck and clean my two story high aluminum siding and gutter, it served the purpose very well. My Moen faucet cost $200, how can this complicated engine driven equipment costs less ? It is a steal at this price. I highly recommend it. The hose wheel is a toy, never try to use it:)

Bought this last week and have used it for approx. 8 hours. No complaints so far. It took off years of Florida mildew from my driveway, patio, outdoor furniture, awnings, storage shed and entire house exterior. There was no leaking as mentioned by many reviewers...not even when I removed the hose via the quick release. Took five minutes to assemble and everything snapped solidly into place. Maybe I just got lucky (?). Just make sure you wear shoes, not flip flops. It stings!

a good little pressure washer --be aware that there are ALOT of little plastic pieces, ( the main water intake connector broke after 1 use --quickly replaced by the company ), and that to store is NOT a simple pack up ---must dismantle the entire water line ( intake and outflow lines ) --also be aware that it is NOT a HIGH pressured setup --is good for lighter type jobs --car washing ( will not destroy soft surfaces or paint) --still very versatile and light

It works, I got a deal on Amazon prime and it sat in the box for six months, I finally assembled it and the darn thing did a job on my nasty dirty driveway and my four decks. Worked well on concrete, pRinted surfaces and wood decks. Felt with lots of dirt and moss.

reviews.review_header: The thing is great. Used it to strip dryloc paint off in ...
reviews.review_text: With all the reviews I can not say anything that has not been said before. The thing is great. Used it to strip dryloc paint off in the basement (no fumes). Got about 75% off but one wall was really coated good, even the 3100 PSI gas model had a time with it. Good for small projects and cars. Larger driveways may want a gas model.

Unlike some of the other reviews I had zero problems with the unit leaking. And also unlike some of the other reviews it was plenty powerful enough to blow paint off my garage. It took me 2 weeks to scrape two sides of my garage and 2 hours to pressure wash the other two sides....and the pressure washing got off way more paint than my hand scraping did. Worked great for cleaning my deck (wood looked brand new when I was done), cleaning stone pavers and my siding.

At 1900 psi, this unit works well for mid-sized jobs, including driveways and fence/siding cleaning! Make sure to get the male-to-male adapter for the connection on the front for the water hose. The only down side - if it can be considered one, is that the detergent bottle's contents don't last very long, resulting in multiple refills for large projects. Other than that, very simple to use, and very effective for the money!

Other reviewers have noted that the hose connection for the water hose sprays water and leaks. I found this to be true but the fix offered by others did not work for me. AR Blue should provide a better quality hose connection rather than the cheap plastic connection provided The second issue is the spray hose reel for whining the hose is useless. Again others complain the hose gets tangled so it is not very functional. The pump itself is top quality and works well. The washer could be improved wih brass hose fittings and a better water hose connection. . The pressure washer is superior to the one sold at Costco but has some faults .

reviews.review_header: Easy set up with clear instructions
reviews.review_text: Powerful washer. Works exactly as described and expected. Easy set up with clear instructions. Turn water on, plugged in, switched on and surprised at cleaning power with both wands. Highly recommend if you looking for electric washer. Will buy another for brother's use.

reviews.review_header: True joy when a Product operates as Advertised
reviews.review_text: AR Blue Clean is as described from beginning to End. The directions are straight forward and written by an English speaking person. Use is just as simple. Results were as good as when I paid $100 to have my drive power washed last year. Thus, two cleanings and I'm in front of the Economic curve. Moreover, I'll use it more frequently and the task will be easier and faster. Note: I live in Florida, so mold outside is a fact of life. Now I'll be able to control the situation. Should have made this purchase years ago......
Just loved, no leaking, I read few ratings about leaking just make sure you are installing in the correct way, read the manual.

This is a very good pressure washer for the price. I had been using a gas-powered, higher psi washer so naturally my new one does not clean as deeply. It is very mobile and easily transported, both when running and when storing. The wind-up mechanism is difficult to master, so I just roll up the hose and secure it with a bungy-cord. The same goes for the electrical cord in back. I do believe some "re-engineering" needs to be made on these items.

Everything works well. I like the filter attachment on the inlet however it seems to leak and being plastic. I don't want to over tighten it. The built in hose reel is OK, disconnecting the each time isn't a convenience as I usually keep thing ready to work. I just cleaned a 33' camper and this product worked very good. I would recommend this and purchase one again.

reviews.review_header: Works verywell and a good price
reviews.review_text: I bought this to clean the outsides of my gutters and to clean up a pontoon boat. This unit went together very easily and performed above expectations. It cleans noticeably better than the Karcher 1800psi unit it replaced, so the stated 1900 psi pressure seems to be realistic. I'm being careful when moving it around as the main water connection is plastic parts and could likely be damaged if banged around or tipped over just right. Works well and good value.

reviews.review_header: Motor burned out after few uses
reviews.review_text: I had this unit for a little over two years. I used it maybe 5-6 times, each time for less than an hour, and then the motor burned out. I had previously given this 5 stars because of the ease of getting through to customer service for a different (and easily solved) problem.

reviews.review_header: Cleaned front porch wood railing and rocking chairs very good. Assemble as directed and you will not have ...
reviews.review_text: Used for the first time today and machine worked flawlessly. Did not leak one drop of water anywhere.Cleaned front porch wood railing and rocking chairs very good. Assemble as directed and you will not have a problem.I bought extension hose and was glad that I did. This made job a lot better and time saving.I would recommend highly!! AAA+++

reviews.review_header: Works great for what I need
reviews.review_text: Works great. It is not the most powerful thing, but it gets the job done. Cleaned a fence quite well, and great for washing off cars, boats, etc. It works OK for cleaning cement/concrete like a patio, but it takes a while and you have to get really close for it to clean. If I were to buy another in the future, I would pick a more powerful one but for now this is fine.

AR Blue Clean AR383 1,900 PSI 1.5 GPM 11 Amp Electric Pressure Washer With Hose Reel This is a very useful washer for domestic use; it clears grime and moss from walkways and walls; it's not so aggressive that it does damage to wooden surfaces; an excellent all-round unit at a very fair price. My original unit failed after 1 year of hard use - I suspect the problem was a readily fixable fault with the auto-cutoff control. I contacted the company (AR BlueClean) and was treated extremely well. Their customer service was excellent, and they provided a replacement unit at no cost and with no quibbles (they didn't even want me to return the faulty unit. I'm very satisfied with the company and the unit.

reviews.review_header: Worked perfect...the storage leaves something to be desired
reviews.review_text: The unit had great power, was quiet (as these go) and made the "get ready for summer" cleaning of our decks (many different surfaces...concrete, flagstone and marble) and seating pavilion a piece of cake compared to previous years and other machines (always electric). My only ding is the storage set-up. The reel for the hose really doesn't work very easily. The wrap for the power cord is not very clean. The holders for the wands...not very tight.

reviews.review_header: I love this! I've used it several times and loaned ...
reviews.review_text: I love this! I've used it several times and loaned it to a friend. It does the job. The reason for 4 stars is that I find storing all the attachments to be a pain. I never got the hose wound correctly on that spool...."user impatience" and I think the plastic of the whole thing "feels cheap". But it works great around the home and if you have use for one, this is easy to use and easy to assemble.

First, if you wanted the performance of a 3,000 PSI pressure washer, buy one. But if you want to wash off the car or the deck, and don't want to fill the gas and check the oil first, go here. All the parts store on the unit, they're all there when you need them. Only thing I might have done differently is the hose connection. I'd rather have had that located where I could leave the connector attached, but it'll be vulnerable on this model if you do leave it attached.

We are really impressed with this pressure washer. My husband, who is not very handy at all (unfortunately), was able to put this together and use it with very few screw ups. He used it to wash our enclosed porch and exterior siding. It worked great and he actually enjoyed using it because it worked so well. Our water pressure is not great, but this little dynamo amped up the pressure to get the job done. Good purchase. No regrets at all. Quick delivery.
Works well and very reasonably priced. Just be warned, you will end up power washing everything in sight

reviews.review_header: Works great but needs valve as mentioned
reviews.review_text: This item works great, but I definitely agree with the other peoples postings about needing the high quality valve/adapter. It definitely leaks as they mentioned, but a quick fix at the hardware store and it makes this item worth its weight in gold. I did not let a simple little valve/adapter stop me from purchasing as I did not care if it leaked a bit as its outside anyway. Great addition to any homeowner or business owner.
Returned unit and received refund. Not enough pressure for cleaning concrete or fence. I had expected more.

reviews.review_header: but it's actually nice that it doesn't have so much power that I'd ...
reviews.review_text: Used this to clean out the gutters and clean the aluminum siding. It's got enough power to clean, but it's actually nice that it doesn't have so much power that I'd have to worry about damaging the siding. It's been easy to assemble and disassemble and I haven't had any problems with it so far.

I was very happy with this purchase. For the price, I can't see how you can go wrong. It has all the accessories you need to do most jobs. The only way you can get more power is with a gas powered washer. The washer gets 4 stars because you have to completely disconnect the hose to coil it. It would be nice to have it connected while coil and pull out as much hose as needed. I would use it a lot more because set up time would be drastically reduced. However, the required seal would be one more thing to break, so maybe its a good thing.

So the electric unit I had for over ten years finally died. Did not want the noise or need the power of a gas model. This unit performs admiably. I also bought the flat surface head and together, they rock. Lent it to a friend and they went out and bought one. The comments from previous posts regard the use of Teflon tape at the water connection point work perfect, no leaks. Highly recommend for the average homeowner looking for the unity of a pressure washer without the high cost.

reviews.review_header: Good pressure washer for the money
reviews.review_text: Just received it and cleaned the screens of our lanai. The assembly was easy and done in 15 minutes. The process of cleaning was easy, the washer produces ample of pressure and water. I like the fact that both the power cord and the pressure hose are very long. The noise level is relatively low. It was running for 2 hours without a problem which I expected. It's packed and stored. Will try it again in a few weeks and write update.

I received this product a week ago and used it twice. For an electric pressure washer I must say it got the job done on cement/concrete. I also used the accessory piece to wash my car and was great. No issues there. The unit is very nicely compacted with all the accessories. The only advice I would provide is not to try and utilize the coil wheel for the hose. You will find it easier to wrap around the unit. Also, I recommend as did other folks who provided feedback to purchase a male-to-male brass hose connector. The one provided is plastic and will leak. Overall I'm impressed with this unit, works well and pretty sturdy. A few other things that come to mind are the electrical cord should have been longer than 20ft. Great buy!

Very powerful yet lightweight system. Overall great performance for the price. At highest setting it began stripping wood off my fence. Did a great job of removing mold from bricks and old graffiti from fence. Cheap plastic fitting does leak water when hose attaches. If they provided a better fitting would have been 5 stars.

reviews.review_header: it started out looking like the deal of a lifetime
reviews.review_text: it started out looking like the deal of a lifetime. it worked great but then everything on this item started to fall apart or break after only using it a few times. couldn't find replacement parts so I just ended up throwing it out.

I've already used this twice for about 4 hrs. running time and it works great. The adjustable wand is not much good, but the "turbo" one really put out the pressure and it pluses super fast. It's painful the touch the spray with your hand, it's that strong. I'm happy to own this washer as I can work at my own pace and do several other tasks as well. When renting or, worse, borrowing a washer before, I'd really bust my keester to get the hole house done and work myself to the bone - which is not fun in S. Louisiana summers.

Decent for the price. Could be a little stronger. So fun to clean things with this. Once you start you can't stop. You do not need the brass adapter that some talk of buying. I bought it and found I didn't need it. Just spend 5 minute reading the directions and you'll see how to hook it up.

This pressure washer did not work when it arrived. Had to have it repaired - the plug with the "Reset" button was defective and had to be replaced In addition, one of the wands was missing an o-ring which caused water to spray out of handle. Since it was purchased new, it should have been working upon receipt. It was not.

The pressure washer died on it's second use. Too bad I waited 2 months before using it the first time, since I bought it so I don't have to ask a neighbor to lend me his. The second time I tried to use it, the pump was not turning on (no pump sound and no increased pressure). Wow, what a money waste!
Hose fitting leaks after 1 year of repair and I was unable to repair it after several hours of work and trips to the hardware store

I used this yesterday, what a dream machine this is. It made the power washing go so fast, and it was so easy to use. I did the driveway, sidewalks, shed, eves, and over two pallets of sand castle bricks walls, in just a few hours, and it was more fun than work. I was concerned that it may take a toll on me, seeing I am a seventy year old lady, but it didn't . The machine worked so well, and it never gave up in the many hours that I used it. I can't wait to find other uses for it.

reviews.review_header: AR Blue Will Do The Job
reviews.review_text: I got the AR Blue after becoming frustrated with a gas model that I had owned for years. A friend recommended this model which I found to be compact and powerful. My first 'outing' was our paver stone driveway which had not been cleaned in two years. It was a big job but AR Blue was up to it.

I had two problems with this powerwasher. The first one was that the quick connect provided by the company to connect the washer to the water hose. It is NOT threaded for US hoses. There are repeated reviews stating that the quick connect leaks terribly. It is simply because the threading is wrong. I would have thought that the company would have caught this by now. The second problem I had was that after 10 minutes of use, the motor ground to a halt and died. With the smell of burned electrical insulation in the air, I packed it up and shipped it back. I am currently waiting on a replacement. We will see how it goes.

Waste of money, that's what this item is. Couldn't get any pressure despite following instruction. Thanks to good Amazon returning policy, I was able to return, but shouldn't end like that, I really needed pressure washer, but not like this.

Purchased this based on other reviews, and in those reviews it was mentioned that the company was good to deal with if you had any issues. After using this it works great on light duty cleaning, and requires little to no maintenance. I live in FL and we get pollen build up on the porch and patio lawn furniture, a regular water hose will not do the trick, this dose.

This is a terrific little electric washer, we use AR Blue Cleans on the job to wash off ship hulls. I got this on sale to work around the house. This has great power for an electric unit, so be very careful on how you set it up. I was able to blast old paint out of my brick stoop with this, so it will damage siding if you are not conscious of how you have the nozzle set. The hose reel is useless, awkward and frankly a pain to use. Coil the hose separately and ignore the reel.

This AR Blue Clean Electric Pressure Washer is absolutely the best I could have chosen for me to do the work I needed done. Just recently purchased a house, and it needed a good cleaning outside. I chose this to do that job, and it is a very powerful little machine. Does a great job. Have done all the outside siding on my house, the sidewalk, and next project will be the ugly dirty garage cement floor. This pressure washer has already saved me many times over it's cost. Love it, and so glad I decided to purchase this one.

This pressure washer is great. No water leakage at all. I had fun cleaning the back of the house and watching the dirt just wash down. Can't wait to use it on the front of the house. Buy ET!! And yes I know how to spell IT :).

I have found this unit to be very reliable. It works as advertised. This spring when I got it out, one of the o- rings from where the hose plugs into the gun was gone. These are critical. I called the company and they mailed me what I needed that very day. As others have noticed, the company's customer service seems exceptional.

reviews.review_header: Have used three times. It is a bit cumbersome ...
reviews.review_text: Have used three times. It is a bit cumbersome with all the lines but I guess that is true for all pressure washers. This did work well cleaning my house siding, balcony, garage floor and car. Powerful even though its electric and not gas. So far nothing has broken and I will update my review next year once I've used it more.

After purchasing and returning 2 other more costly electric pressure washers from the big orange home improvement store, I bought an AR unit based upon Amazon users' feedback. Pro's in order of importance: 1)The instructions are literate and logical. 2) The unit actually functions first time out if you follow the manual. 3) Very powerful; unit cleaned the oxidation off the wood deck of a utility trailer while I only wanted to rinse off rubbish leakage. Will see if it will remove the feathers off a turkey next hunting season. 4) Adjustable spray wand is very convenient and effective; makes short work of thoroughly cleaning a 54 inch mower deck. Con's: None. I permanently attached a brass quick connect to the hose input eliminating other users' source of complaint. The unit easily outperforms other more expensive so-called heavy duty units.

reviews.review_header: Quiet, always starts, and is lightweight
reviews.review_text: I've used gas powered washers, and they work fine, but they are noisy, sometimes hard to start, and heavy. This electric one is quiet, always starts, and is lightweight. The gas-powered one will stay with the children - the electric washer will be my go-to power washer. Worked very well on wood decks, tile patio, and outside furniture. The power is a bit less than the gas-powered washer, but the power was very adequate for my needs.

Love this pressure washer, we did extensive research before purchasing, it isn't an overly expensive item but I hate to waste money. This power washer is really easy to use and does a great job, perfect for around the house.
Small, easy to assemble and use, stores neatly.

I used it to clean my deck, drive way, cars. For all those usage, it served very well. It has good power. Both tips worked well. Well designed and setup easily. This is update of review 3 years later. It has been used about 20 times. Still working well. Yesterday, found o-ring of the tub (connecting to the gun) was broken. Rushed to Home depot and bought #247 O-Ring. Tested today and found the new o ring worked well with it.

reviews.review_header: The hose reel is useless, if not awkward
reviews.review_text: This thing produces only 1450 psi, not 1900 as advertised! I have an old 1600 psi Karcher and this one is obviously more powerful than the AR Blue Clean AR383. The hose reel is useless, if not awkward. The hose is short. All in all, it looks like a toy, not a tool. Just got it yesterday and I am returning it right now for full refund.

reviews.review_header: rendering the whole unit useless. Anyhow
reviews.review_text: I bought this for "light duty" pressure washing. It has done the job so far. One thing that I'm not thrilled about is the plastic connection fitting for the water hose. I'm sure it's going to snap one of these days, rendering the whole unit useless. Anyhow, if you're careful, this unit does a fairly good job of pressure washing.

I was pretty impressed, I have had a gas powered power washer for a few years, but because I rarely use it, it is a pain in the rear to start and is very unreliable. I was seeking an electric, that was reliable, easy to use and powerful, this is more than adequate, but I would like even more power, but I haven' found on with any higher power on the market. The deck cleaner is a great addition, check it out, great time saver for the $$$ - AR Blue Clean 10" Deck, Patio & Flat Surface Cleaner.

reviews.review_header: Great Value - Makes it Easy to Clean
reviews.review_text: This pressure washer is a great value for the money. It is relatively easy to assemble, you hook it up to your garden hose and voila - you are ready to clean. While you can remove a good amount of debris using just water, I highly recommend using a cleaning solution made for pressure washers and spray it on first, let it soak for 15 minutes and then blast away. Cleaning up our wooden deck, masonry and concrete around the house was so much easier using this tool. You don't realize how dirty things are until AFTER you use this.

reviews.review_header: it looks like what was in the presentation
reviews.review_text: WE haven't had a chance to use it yet, it is wet here in winter, and once things dry out we will get it out. However, it looks like what was in the presentation, ad. It came early and no complaints at this time. I will make a post later for how well it works and holds up over time.

reviews.review_header: its really only good for cleaning the floor and stuff
reviews.review_text: i was expecting more power from this unit considering its 1900 psi, it cant even wash the dirt off my car. also the jet spray is very weak, i was trying to spray some corners of my exterior roof and the jet nozzle cannot even reach the height of 15 ft. its really only good for cleaning the floor and stuff.

Use it while you can, coz once those tiny little parts like those very simple rubbers "O-rings" start to break, you'll also start to throw money in the trash! esp if you don't store your washer in a nice cooled/ room temperature garage. Mine just sittin' full of dust now, decided to just spend $3.00 every car wash.

reviews.review_header: Cords do not wrap like the directions say they should
reviews.review_text: Cords do not wrap like the directions say they should. Does not appear to have 1900psi. Container for special cleaners is quite small and does not lend itseft to be used on other larger containers

I feel sorry for those that did not have good luck with this washer. I could not pass up trying it since the positive reviews way outweighed the negative review. I have used it on four occasions since receiving it last month and it has worked flawlessly. everything is as advertised, easy to assemble and easy to use. the only criticism is the method for applying soap. I was hoping for more pressure when applying the soap but if I apply it and leave it for a couple of minutes then power wash it off, it seems to work okay. Overall, very good purchase for me.

So far it works great ! I cleaned my 30 ft X 15 ft wooden deck and (8) steps in about 5 hours and it worked as good as the gas pressure washer that I borrowed 2 years ago to do the job. It does take a bit longer than the gas washer but for the price you can't beat it. I didn't experience any of the problems such as leaking that some of the other reviewers mentioned. It was simple to set up and easier to use. I'm going to use it to tackle the green mildew on my vinyl siding this weekend. Great Product as far as I am concerned.

I love this. Reviews about the connector were right. I had a cheap plastic quick release connector already and just put it on, and it works perfectly. no leaks. I used this in combination with the circular deck scrubbing tool. I did pretreat the wood before using the sprayer. I do not think high pressure water alone would work because I tried it. Looking forward to using it for other applications.

I love this washer! I researched a lot of these online, & must admit, if it blows up tomorrow I'll order a new one! I have since bought another for my Mom & on behalf of 3 friends for a total of 5 so far! Nobody with any problems! The flat surface cleaner is a must have for only $20. Walking backwards, slowly is the best approach. I should be a sales rep for this company! I don't typically write reviews, but this product deserves it!

reviews.review_header: but the materials its made out of are flimsy and it topples over easily.
reviews.review_text: This power washer does work and it works well, but the materials its made out of are flimsy and it topples over easily.

reviews.review_header: this has been the best purchase since I don't know when I had issues ...
reviews.review_text: this has been the best purchase since I don't know when I had issues with water leaking from the couplers they sent me two replacements still leaks but use it outdoors mostly as I told them it didn't matter too much to me I do know that if I find the need to use it inside I can buy couplers made of metal that will not leak but for now and outside use we are happy with this item

reviews.review_header: Two dozen duty cycles, and pffft!
reviews.review_text: This seems like a good value at first glance. But after using it about two dozen times over two years for light-duty deck and sidewalk washing, the pump failed, the wand connections became difficult to fit together, and other sections sprouted leaks. Unit was stored in a garage that never saw below 50F temperature. When I buy a replacement, it will be a different brand.

Read reviews on this item as well as several others. Took a chance after noticing poor reviews after 2010 but did notice company's statement about hooking up hose attachment properly. I can say so far it has worked just as stated. Power washed RV, house and deck without a problem. Only complaint is that the soap dispenser can be a pain to stay connected. For an electric pressure washer this works great. If you are looking for something to "blow holes though wood" get a gas unit. For 90% of chores around the house, this is a great unit. All said, I am pleased with unit and would recommend it.

I bought a gas powered pressure which started every time, but the pressure/pump housing section was poorly built and always gave me trouble. The AR Blue Clean works so much better, is quieter and cost less than the gas one we had. I used it to power wash our vinyl sided ranch style house. It is not the most powerful one so don't plan to clean your two story house without getting on a ladder, but the price was excellent and it gets the job done. I am quite happy with this machine.

reviews.review_header: Good for light duty cleaning around the house
reviews.review_text: Having a light colored pool deck I purchased the AR Blue Clean pressure washer. It does a good job for a cleaning or washing dog paw prints off the deck. The pressure is adequate for what I use it for. I prefer this electric pressure cleaner as it's only used for an occassional use. Gasoline cleaners can produce more pressure but when left unused for awhile create a problem with starting. The price was right as I usually don't buy the least or most expensive item. The price of this cleaner was in between. All in all I'm satisfied with the cleaning ability.

reviews.review_header: AR Blue Clean AR383 1,900 PSI 1.5 GPM 14 Amp Electric Pressure Washer
reviews.review_text: This AR Blue Clean AR383 pressure washer seems to work great. So far I have pressure washed my back patio, which took longer than expected. I had never pressure washed our patio since our home was built 12 years ago. This washer worked fine, but I had to focus on cleaning smaller areas at a time to get the patio clean. Now I plan to use this washer once a year to keep the patio clean. The washer was simple to set-up and use.

On my 2nd season using this. Maybe like 20 total hours. Occasionally acts up but for the price i have nothing bad to say. You make your money back by the 3rd hour of use.and its not bulky so my wife even likes it.

reviews.review_header: ar blue clean ar383 pressure washer
reviews.review_text: okay package came today fast shipping. Like others have said though the hose connector just does not do the job. Also the screen for the connector was missing. Got it all together the directions are confusing and such small print. So got it all together after about 1/2 hour Hooked the hose up to the hose connector that comes with it and water was flying out everywhere. Took it apart put it back together numerous times and was unable to stop the leak so could not even use the machine. So now I wait for the connector in brass that others said to order right away which I did ..Hoping when this connector comes I can actually use the water pressure machine and it all works.

This pressure washer is exactly what I needed for the work to be done around my home. It packs enough of a punch to get rid of problematic mold / moss that PNW weather brings, but also helped me keep from tearing up the decking that I have by containing too much power. The kit comes with everything you need and was simple to put together. Both the power cord and the hose that came with this are long enough to reach pretty much anything I would need without need an extension cord and packs up well around the unit. I was very impressed and happy I made the decision to get this!

RECEIVED THE AR BLUE PRESSURE WASHER AND FOUND SET UP QUICK AND EASY. CLEANED MY DECK AFTER SET UP AND VERY PLEASED WITH HOW WELL THE AR BLUE CLEANED. VERY EASY TO ADJUST WAND SPRAY ANGLE. TIGHT FITTINGS NO LEAKS. USED IT FOR ABOUT 3 HOURS STRAIGHT WITH NO PROBLEMS. TAKES A FEW EXTRA MINUTES TO UNDO WAND THEN WIND UP HOSE BUT A LOT NEATER THAN MY OLD PRESSURE WASHER WHERE HOSE ALWAYS A PROBLEM. ALSO ELECTRIC CORD STORAGE ALSO NICE. EVERY THING FITS NICELY ON BACK OF UNIT. WOULD RECOMMEND TO A FRIEND.

reviews.review_header: I compared it with a number of pressure washers and found that this was a good buy.
reviews.review_text: This machine works very well for the psi pressure that I ordered. I compared it with a number of pressure washers and found that this was a good buy and it would take care of general household cleaning and it does. As a matter of information, I ordered my neighbor one at the same time.

reviews.review_header: and it works wonderful. When my water hose did not get the ...
reviews.review_text: I use this equipment mainly to wash out my silk screen stencil, and it works wonderful. When my water hose did not get the job done. This was my answer to all of it! The pressure on this, you can't go wrong, because its strong enough to pick dirt, oils off ground that you did not clean for years, very powerful stuff!

This inexpensive pressure washer works BUT leaked water with the standard PLASTIC hose adapter that comes with it no matter how hard i tightened it. Like other reviewers, i had to purchase a separate (better) adapter. This OBVIOUS design flaw is serious enough to give it only 3 stars.

I just finished cleaning the pool deck with this pressure washer, and it worked flawlessly for about 3 hours of continuous operation. Setup was a breeze, and I had absolutely no problems. Pressure was adequate for my job, which was to remove mildew from the brick pavers around the swimming pool. Also, the power cord and the high pressure hose are plenty long for most jobs around the house. My only criticism is that the fitting for connecting the garden hose is plastic. It looks like if you accidentally tug the hose at the wrong angle, it will be broken.

I bought this pressure washer to replace the one that I gave to my sister. I am very impressed with the job it did on my driveway and sidewalks. It removed the dark gray and green algae just fine. I didn't have any issues with it leaking or anything and it's easy to use. The hose is a little stiff and hard to wrap up when you put it away but I will live with it. Next project is a concrete pad in the back of the house and I am sure it will do just great. I would recommend this little blue machine.

reviews.review_header: Saved me a lot of money
reviews.review_text: Works exactly as advertised. Quiet and very powerful. It's slow work with any pressure washer, but I did my entire fence in a couple days. Saved me a ton of money as some of my neighbors paid for handymen to do their fences (we all got written up by our association). Would definitely recommend for someone like me who intends to primarily use if maybe once a year for a project. Can't really comment on how it would hold up under daily use.

So far I have used it twice and it performs well. The 25 foot hose extension is worth having. No leaks so far. So far so good. The hose reel is not large enough for the stiffness of the pressure hose - it isn't designed well for the product it is meant to be used. Good idea and selling point but it doesn't work!

Good for light duty, with decent power. The hose is a little stiff and I didn't even attempt to use the storage wheel. The first time I used the washer it stopped sompletely. A quick call to the mfger. determined something was stuck in the wand, which went away after using the little wire cleaning device. The water hose could be longer and less stiff. Overall, I can do most everything I intended for the unit. If you want big time power you will need to get a gas unit and put up with the hassle they bring.

reviews.review_header: I wanted to purchase something light and easy so I could handle some small tasks around my ...
reviews.review_text: I wanted to purchase something light and easy so I could handle some small tasks around my house. I'm a petite female and the weight/bulkiness/ease of use was a concern. The unit arrived very quickly! It is certainly light but some of the connections were a little difficult. It worked like a charm and cleaned great! Overall for the price, I am quite pleased and hope it will last for several years.

I haven't had any problems with it leaking like some of the other reviews posted. Ive used it on a concrete patio,vinyl siding and cleans the cars nicely. I had a gas powered pressure washer but I like this one for quick jobs. It has enough power to do anything Ive tried around the house. I like the wand options and how portable it is to move around. The spool idea was good in theory but it doesn't work. I find that its quicker and easier to just wind it up and hang it over the handle.

reviews.review_header: Suggest the water hose connector be better marked so as to ensure which part connects to ...
reviews.review_text: Met expectations for an electric unit. Suggest the water hose connector be better marked so as to ensure which part connects to the unit and which part connects to the supply hose, Good value for the money.

The garden hose adapter for the inlet is a little flimsy and may break if the unit falls forward. I prefer the Karcher connector. Karcher also has a better soap dispenser integrated into the pump vice as a wand attachment. Overall, the unit works well and was a little cheaper than its comparable Karcher product.

reviews.review_header: Well Amazon gave Auntie Gwennie a really good deal here
reviews.review_text: Well Amazon gave Auntie Gwennie a really good deal here, and the little things works swell. Good enough to wash the truck and tractor for the first test. Plenty of pressure for cleaning. Very light to transport, no gasoline or oil needs, just pump lubricant. Wait until it shows up again of the Deal of the Day for a real savings.

reviews.review_header: Good power, good quality for the price.
reviews.review_text: And... good customer service. Of course I did not read the directions and I thought it didn't work so I called their tech support. They answered quickly and were very polite. He asked if I had pushed the "On" button, and I said "ah, well..., ahhhem.... no. I appreciate the fact that the tech person did not laugh at me.

reviews.review_header: Leaks like crazy, after 3 hours of fighting with the ...
reviews.review_text: Leaks like crazy, after 3 hours of fighting with the pressure washer trying everything the 3 of us knew. I was ready to drive over it! We went to Lowe's and bought a new one. Works great, little more money, but worth it.

reviews.review_header: The pressure is great for a electric power washer
reviews.review_text: The pressure is great for a electric power washer. But the way it's put together could of been much better. Like the hose for the power washer is not easy to take on or off, it must be remove to put the hose back on the spool. But its gets the job none.

This is one of the best washers for the price. It's quiet, powerful, and easy to setup. I used it on my vinyl siding, concrete sidewalk, brick steps, and concrete driveway. It did an excellent job on all these tasks. The only thing keeping me from giving it five stars is the plastic inlet adapter that connects your hose to the washer. There's nothing wrong with it but over time I could see this cracking. I'm going to go buy a metal one from the hardware store before my next use.

reviews.review_header: Great pressure washer for the price
reviews.review_text: Great pressure washer for the price. I wasn't sure it would have enough power to clean everything I needed, but so far I'm impressed. I use the spinner tip on sidewalk/driveway, and the flat tip on the house and yard implements.

This machine is a great buy for the price. Easy to use and does a nice job. the tool storage is not as easy as it would appear but does work. I would recommend this as a general purpose pressure washer. At 1900 PSI it is not to powerful trhat you can damage to much stuff, but does a good job at cleaning conrete and most other items.

reviews.review_header: Everything but the trigger lock mechanism works great. Since the lock doesn't work I have to ...
reviews.review_text: The unit is very compact and well organized. Everything but the trigger lock mechanism works great. Since the lock doesn't work I have to hold the trigger down the entire time. It's lightweight and easy to handle, and the water pressure is excellent. It handles both concrete driveways and vinyl siding well.

When I got this, it worked fine and I gave it 5 stars. Five months later I hook it back up and I get sprayed. The handle doesn't have a water tight seal anymore. I don't know what happened but now as soon as I turn on the water, water is spewing from the handle where you insert the hose. 1 star since it was a waste of money.

reviews.review_header: So pretty basic for non-demanding use
reviews.review_text: Works ok. Certainly not enough high pressure to get rid of tough dirt/bug on the car. No continuously feeding soap can attachment if you need that. So pretty basic for non-demanding use.

So far I've used this for about 5 hours total. It does the job a 1,900 PSI pressure washer is suppose to do. Hose and power cord are of adequate length. I do think they sacrificed quality for a cheaper price with a lot of plastic involved in the couplings/attachments. The handle feels like it is held together with only a couple of screws in only a little bit of plastic and will break at any moment. I gave it four stars for the benefit of the doubt, but I'm usually spot on with judgments in quality and durability.

Medium duty washer,exactly why I ordered this. Used to clean concrete sidewalk, driveway,privacy fence & vinyl siding. East to assemble & operate. Just what you need for simple household chores. This unit preforms well.

So far it's AWESOME!! Light, easy to change all attachments. Does everything I needed it to do!. Clean pea gravel patio, sidewalks, siding.... Just starting on the concrete drive. I'm over 50 something, not very active so that should say just how easy it is. Just wish the spray was wider? It's going to take a week or two to do the drive.
Great product. Works perfectly. Glad I did the research before buying this product. Very pleased. A+

Lightweight, compact but powerful. I only used this power washer once so far, but I am really happy with the performance and ease of use. The adjustable nozzle is a big plus as opposed to others that need to interchange nozzle heads.

Very pleased with the product and performs great, as advertised. Just don't expect the pressure of a gas model. Very easy to assemble and to use. The adjustable nozzle is easy to use and handle. The pressure hose could be longer.

Did not give this a review until I used it a lot. Washed cars-lawnmowers-tractor-house siding-vinyl deck and porch-concrete slab-wheelers and other things for my neighbors. Very good price for something that works so good. Very good pressure and wand. The only thing I do not like or use or need is the hose reel. To me its a hassle to use. So I don't.

Quick feedback here. This unit gets to max pressure within seconds. My father's Husky pressure washer takes minutes and has inconsistant pressure. The hose reel on this unit is a nice feature. It's not designed to be used when the pressure washer is in use, but more for just storing it. There is a rather large built in GFI on the plug itself, so plugging it into an outside outlet that has a cover around it can be difficult. The pressure was more than enough to remove15 years of moss build up on rocks in the front of my shady yard.
Had for a month used it once and now it quit working. Would NOT recommend anyone purchase this product.

Great product with few flaws. The garden hose adapter is not very good and constantly leaking while under pressure. The real for the gun hose is too small and kinks the hose. A hanger on the side for the gun hose would be much better.

reviews.review_header: Really easy to get going with, my first pressure washer
reviews.review_text: I decided not to get a gas washer because I just don't like taking care of motors that much. This one is strong enough to clean concrete, if you have patience, and works wonders on decks and siding. Pros Everything fits on it for easy storing/carrying You can switch wands without turning it off No leaks Cons It's not a 3000 psi washer, so don't expect it to be.

Works exceedingly well. Easy to assemble and makes into an small unit for storage. All of the fittings are well made, easy to use and should have a long life. Both the pressure hose and power cord are long, which allows use in otherwise more remote areas. Two wands attached easily to the gun-type handle and provide versatility when power washing. All components are well made and should prove durable.

I've always had a hard time starting gas powered pressure washers. This is super easy to start and use! Pressure is very good for everything I've cleaned so far. The only reason I haven't given it 5 stars is because I'm not used to the wand controlling of spray patterns. Have always had different tips I had to switch out - once I get used to the wands I'll probably like it better than the tips!

This item worked great for me for one year - I used it for two extensive jobs - then, of course just after the year warranty, I plugged it in and it worked for a short time, with inadequate pressure, and then wouldn't work at all. If you purchase this, you might want to purchase the extended warranty.

reviews.review_header: Love it. Just as powerful as my super strong ...
reviews.review_text: Love it. Just as powerful as my super strong gas washer, but so much more convenient. No mess from gas and oil and starts as soon as you hit the on button. Just one issue, the reset button on the plug is always off when I go to start it, but is just has to be pushed in and it starts right away.

reviews.review_header: Nice little maching and great value . . .
reviews.review_text: What a great product! Hubby and I opened our porch last weekend and tried out our new AR Blue Clean AR383 power washer using Krud Kutter to clean screens and painted surfaces outside the porch. It removed dirt easily from the screens, dirt and mold from the painted surfaces. In a couple of places we had to scrub lightly with a brush, but it made a back-breaking job much easier to handle. So impressed ...

Works great, no leaks at all. However I did attach the clear plastic to the hose the first time and had leaks but that's because I didn't read the manual thoroughly. Wish it had a better cable management system overall.

This item had generally good reviews so I bought it to use in powerwashing my deck. When I received the item I was skeptical due to the amount of plastic components. Nevertheless, I spent 12 hours powerwashing a large deck and the unit performed flawlessly. I am a bit concerned about the long term due to the plastic fittings, but the unit has paid for itself just by doing this one job so I'm ahead of the game!

reviews.review_header: Seems like a good product, but...
reviews.review_text: Seems like a good product but the reel doesn't work. I have no idea how to "thread" the pressure hose into the reel and I think even if I could figure it out it would compromise the hose and cause problems quickly. The auto on/off feature is great and the spinning stream wand works well. The soap dispenser is just that. It doesn't inject soap into the pressure wands, just spread the soap.
