This is only the second time I have ever pressure washed it and a gas motor was deafening and smelly. Never again. AR Blue Clean is the WAY @ GO for me for sure. I would buy this again in 1 minute!!!!!!! I love this machine. I will next get the preservative for the inside of the machine to store it between uses. It is good insurance since our water here is a bit harsh. This AR get 6 stars from this man! RC Kush

I have only used it once but it worked great. I have had several gasoline pressure washers and they have been difficult to start and sometimes they wouldn't start at all. This electric pressure washer provided all the power I needed and there was no hassle getting it started.

reviews.review_header: Not for heavy jobs; maintenance yes!
reviews.review_text: Actually a small jobs cleaner. Do not buy this w expectation that you can broadly spray your home or deck or patio if you have several seasons of mold and mildew to overcome. Hire a professional, then keep up your house with this nice product.

reviews.review_header: Great Power washer for the money!
reviews.review_text: Everything is up to par as was explained in other reviews.

reviews.review_header: Does a good job. seems to light to be durable
reviews.review_text: Does a good job. seems to light to be durable. Likes to fall over. Cord storage clumsy actually all accessories storage suffers . But so far still working fine.

reviews.review_header: Great product. Very easy to set up and use
reviews.review_text: Great product. Very easy to set up and use.

reviews.review_header: AR blue clean electric pressure washer
reviews.review_text: I purchased this pressure washer to wash the winter cover of my inground swimming pool it's 18x36. It did a great job! What use to take me all day to scrub down with a bucket and a brush, was done in no time. My back also loved it. It's a nice little machine and I would recommend this to a friend.

reviews.review_header: The pressure washing is perfect for the weekend warrior around the house
reviews.review_text: The pressure washing is perfect for the weekend warrior around the house. I so tackled the concrete in my alley way and have began to tackle my wood fence. I can't wait to see the finished project. Don't hesitate with your purchase, purx
Works very well. Storage is a bit tough though.

This little unit really packs a punch. I was pleasantly surprised at the amount of power it delivered as a small electric unit. It washed away years of gunk from a concrete patio with ease. I would highly recommend this product to anyone who needs a small reasonably priced pressure washer.
I was able to clean my deck with ease and it looks as good as when it was first installed.

reviews.review_header: Sad may not beable to use until Spring.
reviews.review_text: I think it's going to be great, however our weather has changed and may not be able to use it until spring. I'm excited to see how well the deck cleaner attachment works. The design enables good storage of items, even the additional length of line we purchased fit's nicely over the handle.

reviews.review_header: nice and light good price fast deivery a+
reviews.review_text: nice and light good price fast deivery a+

reviews.review_header: Used it first time, liked it
reviews.review_text: It was way quieter than another one I used before, and yet still powerful enough to get the job done. The hose is a little stiff, but I guess it has to be in order to handle the high pressure. Switching between the 2 spray tips, as well as connecting the garden hose, were quick and seamless.
Great little washer. Cleans well if, you take your time. RECOMMENDED
Excellent product. I call it my ladies power washer. Cleans even the high screens of the spoilage.

reviews.review_header: This pressure washer is a great value for the price
reviews.review_text: This pressure washer is a great value for the price. It is very strong, lightweight, and efficient. I'd recommend it.

reviews.review_header: its a great little power washer
reviews.review_text: we use this still today. its a great little power washer. does the job. lent it to neighbors even to do their outdoor washing needs. hahaha great purchase.

had read reviews about how it tipped over easily.I haven't found that to be true.It is an excellent machine. delivery was great.We also ordered the extra .air compressor thumb which is a metal adaptor. It is well worth the $
Very powerful pressure washer. Had to replace electrical plug because it quit working. Now it works fine again.
No pressure, cheap. Wasted my money.

I have had this unit for a few months and have had no problems with it. This replaced a very old 1500 psi gasoline washer. The power of this unit is much better than the old gas one and much quieter/cleaner to use. The light weight of the AR Blue Clean is a big plus. It is a very nice machine for the money.
Great for homeowner. Probably not enough PSI for heavy equipment cleaning. I experienced no problems with snap hose connection as noted in other reviews.
First time I used it and it leaks water from wand...........it's a piece of junk.
one of the better washer at a great price

reviews.review_header: but other than that it's a perfect washer.
reviews.review_text: Some water always leaks through the connection, but other than that it's a perfect washer.
returned not worth it at all
Love it, so easy to use and works great.
Great Little power washer for the price.
Love my little power washer! Works just fine for power washing our brick patio, driveway, outdoor plastic and rubber toys, swing set, etc.

This did a good job cleaning my car, trailer and rzr. I only gave it 4 stars because of the soap dispenser. It has no pressure, might as well just pour the soap straight onto the car. Other then that I would recommend this to anyone looking for a good pressure washer.

Pressure OK. Expected a little more power. Other reviews stated that it leaks at the hose connect. Yessss, It sure does. Why they would put out a product that is know to leak is beyond me. For the price I was expecting better quality.

reviews.review_header: A gardener friend recommended this to me so I bought one
reviews.review_text: A gardener friend recommended this to me so I bought one. My husband thought an electric pressure washer was going to be too weak, but this thing has easily cleaned everything we've hit with it. Concrete patios, flagstone, deck, etc.
It hooked up and worked well in cleaning two decks. The hook up was easy. The only drawback was there was no "lock" to keep it on while working with it -- a bit tiring on the hands.
This works ok the pressure isn't that strong but it does the job.
It works well. Easy to setup. Plastic water supply fittings are a weak point. Hose spool is hard to use. Good tool for smaller jobs.

Worked great! My deck never looked better and I didn't experience any problems as mentioned in other ratings. If you think you need the gas powered washer so that you'll have the higher PSI's don't believe it. This unit does great and it's easy to handle. I've already got people asking to borrow it!

I love this powerwasher! After many years using gasoline powered ones, which are heavy, smelly, and loud, using the AR Blue Clean was a joy. It did a great job cleaning our deck, siding and patio furniture. I highly recommend it!
The power washer was good for cleaning outside and basment. And at a reasonable price.

reviews.review_header: Very Good Cleaner for the Price
reviews.review_text: This AR Blue Cleaner Power Washer is well worth the price we paid for it.. We have a lot of mold on certain areas of our house, patio, and cement walks out front.. With the proper mixture of cleaner in the utility bottle and the power washer we can get the majority of the mold off and can re-stain our house!

reviews.review_header: It worked right out of the box
reviews.review_text: It was easy to assemble. It worked as it should and I have had no trouble in cleaning concrete and teak furniture. So far have used for about 25 hours without a problem.

reviews.review_header: No confidence in this product. Died after ten minutes.
reviews.review_text: I am pretty experienced with pressure washers. This one looked good. The reviews were good (both on and off Amazon) and for ten minutes it was doing a fine job (for a home use electric). Then it sounded like it lost back pressure internally and the motor didn't shut off when I let go of the trigger. I turned it off immediately and checked hoses and connections for leaks. I held the trigger, with the unit turned off, for a few minutes to see if any air would bleed out and none did. I turned it back on, nothing. Pulled the trigger and it ran for about five seconds, lost pressure and then shut off never to come alive again. I let it sit overnight and tried a second time but it wouldn't even make a sound. I am going with another brand as I have no confidence in this one.

some reviews found fault with the water inlet connector but so far I have had no problems. cleaned deep crevices in my concrete quickly,blasted algea from a brick edging and restored the wood on my redwood fence. seems very well made so far.

Don't even think about walking up my way. I have a gun (water) and I know how it use it. It's no fire hose but I found that it seems to do a decent job for the price. I say EH to the car wash attachment so far, but I could be using it wrong

I have only used once at this time but will say it does a good job. We are using it on the house siding, car and boat so we didnt need a very big power washer and this one does the job. i am giving it 4 stars because it is what it is. if you plan on using it for bigger jobs more often spent more money
used 1 time - will not even start
Needed a power washer and this one seemed to fit the bill. It is well-made and powerful, yet easy to operate.

I wa looking for in inexpensive washer that could still handle the daily chores around the house. Even though I have only used it twice, I think I made the right choice. I do recommend getting the brass quick connect fittings for the hose. I can see how the plastic threads on the hose attached could easily be cross threaded. I'm very pleased with this purchase so far.
Lasted all of 9 months with very light use and died. Only has a 90 day warranty so I am out the $160 I paid for it. Do not recommend this item.
The cable gets twisted and is hard to unwind for every use.

This is a great price and quality of unit. Main flaw is that the connection on the front where the house water comes in is leaky. We rigged it a bit and now it's better. Does a fine job with the attachments on 2nd floor windows/siding.

reviews.review_header: Did an awesome job- easy to use
reviews.review_text: Used to clean cement slab and Adirondack furniture. Did an awesome job- easy to use.
Great power for the money. Only issue might be the threaded hose line in the back is a really soft metal and difficult to screw on without feeling like you're destroying the threads.

this EPW does what 's expected. I have used the EPW 3 times since purchased and was pleasantly surprised. More than enough power to clean bricks on my house ,driveway, and sidewalk. I had to buy a 50ft extension cord 12/3 rated to reach every where I needed. Great buy.

reviews.review_header: AR Blue Clean Does Tge Job With Ease
reviews.review_text: No need for a gas unit with the Blue Machine, cleans house, deck and concrete to a "T". I highly recommend this machine it's a great bang for the buck.
So far so good! It works great, is easy to use and is light weight
Works well. Great little machine
The only thing they need to change is the lame plastic hose connection. My yard hose is heavy and the plastic connector leaks. I ended up purchasing a brass quick connect and all's well.
Doing a little research and reading the Amazon verified reviews proved to me how well Amazon works. The washer works, the delivery on time, and price competitive.

reviews.review_header: Clean and clean without a loud noise
reviews.review_text: Clean and clean without a loud noise

The AR Blue Clean worked great! Much quieter than the gas pressure washer I was using and every bit as powerful. I did have an issue with the quick connector cracking, but AR Blue Clean sent a replacement immediately.
It's a perfect power wash machine and would like to recommend anyone.....no complaints

I am satisfied with this. I didn't want a really high powered washer that would strip paint, but for the pool cover and misc this and that, it works great. Lots of cords and hoses to deal with, but I guess that comes with it.
Great little unit. Plenty of power. Nice design. Much lighter than another unit I had. Daily deal had a great price.

Purchased this based on the ratings and can't say that we're disappointed. The power behind this tool is amazing. Our decks and handrails look new! We are extremely pleased with this purchase. Only wish we had purchased it sooner.

Love this little beast. Cleaned my whole driveway and sidewalk, about 600 sq ft. and stripped my decks old stain off. Kids had fun with it as well ;) My only concern is that it seems to "choke" once in awhile, like its trying to build up some pressure or something so you have to lay off the trigger till it does.

reviews.review_header: price was good, product was not
reviews.review_text: i would not buy this one again. hard to attach hose. I've used once and very discouraged

We have used the AR383 to clean a wooden swing, wrought iron patio furniture and a cement patio. In all cases, the AR383 did a wonderful job. We were really surprised at how quiet the unit operated. Definitely would recommend to anyone.

reviews.review_header: Good Price for powerful and versatile machine
reviews.review_text: The machine works as advertised with plenty of power and adjustable nozzle selection. Easy to hook up with instructions. The hose reel as with other power washers is an annoyance, but I recommend the AR Blue Clean and it is a good price.

Easy to put together, super strong, took out paint stains on my cement patio and walkway. I can see I will want to clean more because what I have done already is very white clean. I am buying the walkway attachment today.

reviews.review_header: Easy to use and works well
reviews.review_text: Easy to use and works well. If you are not an instruction reader...you MUST punch the reset button on the electrical plug in EACH time you set it up for use.

reviews.review_text: saved money not extremely strong but ok

What a nice surprise to see that this washer did everything I needed...heavy moss on the driveway, discolored cement walls, aluminum siding, and discolored wood decking. It's a great power washer. And for the money, it's a real bargain.

Plastic parts are not durable. Plastic inflow parts provides no seal which greatly reduces inflow water pressure.

reviews.review_header: Slightly better than what a good hose nozzle can do

reviews.review_header: More than enough pressure for any use I have had ...

reviews.review_header: Wow! This is really powerful for such a compact ...

reviews.review_header: This is an excellent pressure washer

This thing rocks. You can't believe all the things I have cleaned. Decks, sidewalks, house cars, bench... it is an effortless way to do many, many outdoor cleaning tasks, especially as we clean everything off from the damp Seattle Winter

Great power, does a fine job. My only complaint, one of the nozzels blew off the third time I used it and I had to order a replacement nozzle. Otherwise it has great pressure and does a fine job on mobile homes.
Great pressure washer for the money. I've used it a hand full of times and it's great.
Just as I expected. Thank you

Did research on the best electric pressure washer and this one was the top! So far it has not disappointed me! Has great pressure, love the fact that the pump stops when you release the trigger. The adjustable wand is very helpful in focusing the spray to your target area! Stores easily and is light enough to travel with us when we are in our RV!

reviews.review_header: Don't buy this power washer, it will not last

So far i have used my new pressure washer twice and love it very easy to use, move around and work with the only draw back is that it does not really reach the 2nd story of a house with a lot of power The attachment for the patio works fantastic , It cleaned my Blue stone wonderfully.

reviews.review_header: Great item, very happy with it
reviews.review_text: Great item, very happy with it. Love that it is compact and gets the job done. Definitely is geared more for smaller more residential chores. Fits my needs exactly.

I am a 63 year old female and ordered this pressure washer to help my husband with outdoor chores. I couldn't believe how easy it is to use and it does a fabulous job on vinyl siding, concrete, rocks, the patio and the driveway. I highly recommend this product. I call it my "Magic Wand!"

reviews.review_header: Great power for electric, though somewhat cheaply made.

Have had this for quite a while now. I love it. I use it for everything. I'm so glad I didn't purchase a loud gas one.

purchased the unit to power wash my deck and smaller home. ran it for 7+ hours continuously with no issues. there are plastic connections so you can't throw the unit around or things will probably start breaking. the unit paid for itself in the first use. I'm sure i would have paid at least as much for rental as i paid for the unit.

reviews.review_header: Information on our new power washer

reviews.review_header: Good value. No problems with quck connect hose volume ...

I just received my pressure washer and set-up was easy and operating it is too ... no complaints so far. The pressure is great and the unit runs quiet ... I chose this unit after reading the positive reviews for it ..

reviews.review_header: Not as powerful as some of the videos show. ...

reviews.review_header: Plenty of power - easy to use and runs rather quietly

I have been occasionally renting high powered pressure washers. This was getting expensive. So I got this guy from good old Amazon and it does the trick with my deck and patio. So for this price I have eliminated all the renting and have my own.

reviews.review_header: Good unit with enough power to do my jobs
reviews.review_text: Good unit with enough power to do my jobs. I have a bigger more powerful unit, but this is so much easier to use.
Worked great while it lasted. All plastic construction. Light weight and easy to use. But like anything else it stopped working 13 months later.

reviews.review_header: Works pretty poorly. Returned after 1 use and went back ...

reviews.review_header: I feel it is a very good buy and has surpassed my expectations
reviews.review_text: Used once a week on my large patio and it is still strong and working well. I hesitated as price was much cheaper than any others I looked at. I feel it is a very good buy and has surpassed my expectations.

WORKS VERY WELL WISH IT HAD THE SIPHON SETUP TO ADD OUTDOOR BLEECH, OR SOAP AS YOU PRESSURE WASH. GET AN EXTRA LENGHT OF PRESSURE HOSE BECAUSE HOSE FITTINGS ARE PLASTIC AND CAST ALUMINUM. WHEN HOSES ARE FULL OF WATER UNIT BECOMES HEAVY AND HARD TO MOVE.

reviews.review_header: Get what you pay for, or maybe a bit less.
reviews.review_text: Had it a year and a few months. Used it for maybe 6 hours and it is at half power. Bought a used gas washer that cost more but has lots more power. Happy now.

reviews.review_header: My first power washer. My last electric. Cumbersome ...
reviews.review_text: My first power washer. My last electric. Cumbersome because of the tangle of power cord,water supply hose and high pressure hose.

reviews.review_header: I love electric pressure washers that only run when you pull ...
reviews.review_text: I love electric pressure washers that only run when you pull the trigger. Not as noisy as gas powered pressure washers and has plenty of pressure. I'd recommend this pressure washer to anyone who needs one.

Well, it was everything you said it would be for one thing. The instructions are easy to follow, it is light weight and well manufactured. I have not used it yet because of the weather but I am excited to do so. Thank you for checking! Happy New Year!

reviews.review_header: This machine was easy to assemble
reviews.review_text: This machine was easy to assemble, and works great! I have never been able to use our larger gas pressure washer; however, I can use this one with ease.
Great price, no issues

Great power washer does not disappoint. I wish the power could be a tad higher but It is what it is. Also the hose reel is totally useless. Other than that this thing is great I use it all the time and is has not failed me yet.
unit works as advertised.
Perfect for pressure washing my roof prior to applying a re-coat of sealer.
do not buy!!!! horrible pressue, about the same pressure i would get out of a good nozzle on my garden hose
Exactly what I need it works well
perfect work awesome.
Good power for cleaning flagstone patio. Easy to assemble and easy to use.
Returned due to extremely low water pressure. I could have created more pressure by putting my thumb over the end of the garden hose.

reviews.review_header: Fails repeatedly in the same place.
reviews.review_text: Bought this from Amazon to replace a Husky (Home Depot) model that I lost in a flood and was no longer available or I would have bought it again from Home Depot. This AR model is not even close to the quality of my former pressure washer. The soap dispenser is very poorly designed and the same part keeps failing - the O-ring that connects the hose to the underside of the gun. Replacements do not even last one season, and I have ordered several. You can not just buy the one O-ring that fails you must buy "the kit" which is reasonably priced except that shipping costs almost 4 times the price of the part, not to mention that you are out of commission until the replacement arrives. Look elsewhere, there are much better choices.
great price and works well
Like this unit a lot. Only complaint is that all the stuff that attached to it has trouble staying on it when it is being stored. Otherwise, it is all I expected and does a fine job.

Love the washer. The pulsating wand works great. I bought this unit to clean up the siding on my home. Couldn't be happier. The unit is just right for the job, not too powerful that would damage the siding.

The power washer was easy to put together and use. Some poeple said they had problems with the connections leaking so I used teflon tape on the threads and I haven't had any problems. Be careful with the hose, it can kink. I've used it several times and I think it was a good buy for me.

reviews.review_header: This is a great pressure washer
reviews.review_text: After reading the reviews, some people had problems with assembly and leaks after it was put together. The directions were easy to follow and assembly was easy. No problems with leaks, pressure was great and after cleaning my deck I would recommend this pressure washer to anyone.
Love it!!!! Cleaned all sidewalks steps etc. Light weight but powerful. Very great tool--wish I had bought one years ago. Would recommend to all!!
Clogged after one use and no power.

I received the AR383 very soon after ordering it from Amazon. The unit performed extremely well with the adjustable wand and it had more than enough pressure to clean a three level deck...Amazing. The only complaint I have is that the detergent adaptor bottle did not work as well as similiar units with an onboard detergent bottle.
Sat for a year plus; used it recently & it's a solid performer.
Great machine for the price. With consistent use it never quits.

Works really well. Make sure you get air out of the hose before you connect it to the pressure washer. I imagine that is the problem many are describing. Works ok on fences, maybe I'd need slightly more power.

Was thinking about purchasing a more expensive pressure washer but based on the previous reviews, took the chance on this one. Was pleasantly surprised. As mentioned by others, the connection coupling leaks, but after replacing with a brass fitting, the washer works great.
easy to use and store. I should have bought more power

I prefer electric power washers and this one does a nice job. Great for all around cleaning and good pressure. The only thing that I'm not pleased with is the plastic house coulping. I'm fearful it will crack off if the power washer is not handled with care. I will shop for a metal coupling as recommended on other reviews.

reviews.review_header: Worked very well and provided good cleaning power
reviews.review_text: The product was delvered in good condition. It was simple to install and the power heads worked fine. The water coupling is plastic a reqruies care to attach, will most likely need to be replaced soon. But otherwise, worked great on our stone patio. Good value, fine product.
Received item that had been used/returned. The attachments and machine were covered in soap. I'm disappointed. Though the machine is powerful, it does have noticeable lag time.

Not a bad little pressure washer. Good for quick clean ups but not for heavy cleaning. Since I live in Florida our mold is quite heavy and even though it is 1900PSI and 1.5 gpm just not enough. Love all the little conveniences it offers, light weight pretty well made. For the price and how I plan on using it was good buy for me.
Works good. The handle is too short and the wand and hose storage is not well thought out, but I fixed those problems and now it's a pleasure to use.

reviews.review_header: Handy for all kinds of things
reviews.review_text: Handy for all kinds of things. The ONLY negative is the stiff hose.

Used it for the first time yesterday, did a fantastic jobs cleaning my driveway, unit came on time and was very easy to assemble, I did replace the plastic fittings they give you with the metal replacement kit Amazon sells.
Works great. It is absolutely worth it.

All in all we are very satisfied with the power it expels and it cleans wonderfully. We wish it could be plugged into an extension cord though.

reviews.review_header: dead after 5 months of light usage

It's nice small and plenty powerful. The best part is my wife now loves it after i cleaned our back patio, now she wants to clean all our cement. Great performance, great price, couldn't be happier. (and it's electric so you don't have to deal with another engine.)

Needed to pressure wash deck etc. this is a great tool. Have seen lots of uses already for this tool. I highly recommend it especially for women. So easy!!

reviews.review_header: it worked beautifully, so easy to operate

I don't know what these bad reviews are about. It's really powerful and has everything you need all in the right places. It's a steal for its price!

reviews.review_header: The Worst Power Washer EVER Buyer Beware
reviews.review_text: I read all the reviews and weight them out, why I did not listen to the bad ones I am not sure but knowing the great return policy Amazon has I thought I would try this unit. I had the ones from Costco for years I means 15 year or so and went thru just two of them, but Costco doesn't sell power waters anymore. I go the unit and it cried out Cheap, Cheap, Cheap piece of cr... So buyer beware if you get this one you will only have yourself to blame. Here is the good and bad about my unit. Used it once when I got it washed 3 cars and I rated it just passable. Then I put it away, you know most people do not use them a lot or often It was just turning cold and would not have used it again for maybe 5 months but I need to clean the driveway in one spot, So I hooked it up and like other the motor was DOA. I tried to return it but Amazon said I was 4 days passed the allowed time. After very little time Amazon agreed it should still work and did take it back, but if I hadn't used it the second time it was have been 5 months later I would have been screwed. Thank GOD for Amazon So if you still go ahead and buy this unit and it dies on you like me and others after one time of using it, remeber that little bird on your shoulder will be singing he told me so. After reading several reviews that mentioned leaking at the hose connection, I decided to take a chance and ordered the AR383 along with the hose to hose swivel connector as recommended by several reviewers. AR has recently updated their product, however, and you no longer need this additional connector to eliminate leaks. They now have a clear plastic connector with a male quick disconnect end that screws onto the pressure washer. This connects to the female quick disconnect end which is the black&blue connector that connects to your garden hose. You can see this better in the one customer image that Laurie submitted. I also used pipe thread to attach the clear connector onto the pressure washer. With this set-up I had no issues with any leakage at the pressure washer or at the quick disconnect. I used the washer to clean my concrete patio and brick areas of the house. It did a great job cleaning both. Only used it one time, but I'm impressed by it so far especially for the price. After using the pressure washer, I ran some Karcher pump saver into it. Since I'm not sure when I will use it again, this will help ensure the seals don't dry out. Hopefully this helps the pressure washer last years.

I didn't order brass connectors with the unit as many had suggested and I'm glad that I didn't, as the plastic ones work fine. Yes, they do drip slowly, but it isn't anything major and, let's face it, you are going to be blasting water everywhere such that a small pool of water by the machine isn't really relevant. I don't know about the longevity of the included plastic quick connect, but since it is plastic it will likely need to be replaced. However, it includes a visible filter to prevent dirt and rocks from getting into and harming the pump mechanism itself which the brass replacements don't seem to have. So, I have to say I am on the fence come replacment time whether to go with brass or just buy another plastic OEM one for $7. As for the unit, the reviews here are spot on. Quiet, about as powerful as one gets for an electric and seemingly well-made (albeit in China). Customre service seems excellent and the power is enough for cars, vinyl siding (second floor needs a ladder to really clean well), fences, etc. I tried cleaning slate with algae and stains and the results were mixed with either of the nozzles. Gas powered washers are more powerful, but in my experience, can actually go beyond cleaning into the realm of stripping away the top layers of things. On slate and concreted, that is probably fine, but for my uses on siding, cars, chairs, etc., it is probably better off that this machine doesn't perform that level of potential damage. When using around windows and other plastic items, reduce the pressure on the wand because one can do a bit of damage to items like plastic flowerpots. All in all, very capable and worthwhile machine for the average homeowner. Enough power to do 90% of what needs to be done.

reviews.review_header: If plastic clamp breaks...you're done for day and week!
reviews.review_text: I would not recommend this power washer. First, before ever using the washer I had to go out and buy a new garden hose adapter because the water was pouring out and it really decreased the water pressure. Then after using it once, a flimsy clamp that connects the high pressure hose to the gun broke. I had no idea that I would not be able to use the washer without this small plastic piece. If this piece breaks you have to replace the entire gun, although my gun is practically brand new. Since this gun in not available in stores you have to order and wait for it to be shipped. This is a big waste of time and money and I feel it's a way for the manufacture to make more money by making such a critical part so insubstantial. I went to Lowes twice today to try and figure out how to repair. However due to the snap in effect, I was not able to repair the problem. This is problematic because I have an event coming up and have to wait for the replacement to be shipped. I even tried to purchase a brand new hose and gun set but the store did not have one to fit this machine. I went to AR North America website, the maker of Blue Clean AR383 power washer and was not able to find my gun or replacement part; therefore, I sent an email, since they are closed on weekends. After finding the part number in the Instructional Manual I checked here at Amazon and there was the gun. However, I think I'm going to take the advice of the Lowes guy, he told me to get rid of the hose and the gun and get one with couplers; otherwise, I may be buying more guns in the future.

After reading reviews of this pressure cleaner as well as helpful tips from other buyers, I bought this product and was impressed. Works great and easy to use. Now I can pressure clean my walkway and driveway and maybe windows.

I was able to assemble the washer without too much difficulty. The directions were OK. I did purchase the quick connector as recommended by other reviewers. That is where I started to run into my problem. I could not attach that very easily and the one that comes with the washer is made of plastic. After a while, I figured it out. Next, I tried to attach one of the wands - the directions are not clear as to which one give you the most pressure, I found I could not attach very easily and struggled with that. When I realized that it was not the correct wand (this one barely allowed any water to come out-a hose would have done better) I tried to remove it--impossible. The wand would not release! The directions said to push and turn counterclockwise bult it just would not budge. I finally gave up and used a garden hose to do my cleaning.Needles to say, I am not keeping it.

However, the attachements, the hose system, the connections are not exciting at all...don't expect a perfect performance as you'll have kinked hoses, leaking connection and the attachements are awkward as they do not always connect easily...once you get it working IT WORKS!

The pressure washer works fine. It cuts the cleaning time way down. I don't like Amazon telling me how much I have to write about this product. This will be the last review for me!!!!!!

This power washer has some serious issues. The first unit I received one that had a bad leak in the hose couplings. This was not related to the quick connect system. The leaks were internal. I returned that to Amazon and received a replacement system. The replacement unit seemed OK. The water system did not leak and the unit turned on and worked for a small segment of sidewalk that I tested to see if I was satisfied. This spring I got ready to powerwash my deck, got the oxyclean on and turned on the washer. I got about halfway through and I heard some decrease in the rpm. I turned to see what was going on and there was smoke pouring out of the chassis of the unit. I figured I would keep going, at this point, as there were obviously some big problems ahead. I kept going for another five minutes or so until the motor gave up the ghost. At this point the plastic covering was getting soft from the heat and the unit had a big time electrical smell. It never did trip the breaker. Now the washer is in my garbage can, obviously useless and beyond warranty. Total run time, 2 hours. I am absolutely sure that I did nothing wrong with this washer. The water line was fine, the electrical was fine (GFI outlet) and the unit was on a cement pad away from any spray. Judging from my experience, which I hope you use to guide your decisions, this is a crummy product, and probably dangerous, to boot.

The pressure washer works as advertised, or rather my experience is inline with others here on Amazon. The unit seems well built and is easy enough to set up. The wash nozzle works really well for washing cars, bikes, and general wash down work. And the high pressure wand is great for tougher stuff (but nothing too crazy). This is ideal for washing your deck, outdoor furniture, driveway, etc. More stringent jobs may be a little taxing or time consuming with this guy rather than a higher pressure or gasoline powered unit. The bad: The connector from your garden hose to the input is a poorly designed and poorly executed piece. I used mine for roughly an hour before it stopped working entirely, not allowing any water to feed into the washer. A quick trip to the depot fixed it. If you are going to buy this unit, add a good bronze assembly to your cart to fix the problem before it inevitably arises. The trigger lock on the sprayer does not work at all. This is a nice feature to have when you're doing a lot of work in one area. The hose reel is a joke. I didn't even bother trying to wind the hose on to it. More trouble than it is worth. I just wrap everything around the body of the unit.

Out of the hundreds of items that I have purchased on amazon over the past couple years, this is the worst item I have ever purchased. I bought this power washer as a Christmas present for my dad. This is the second electric power washer I have purchased. The first was a karcher. it worked ok but leaked like crazy. first slowly and then very bad. I was told the leak could not be repaired. Then I decided the AR Blue might be better. I order a lot of items from Amazon because of their return policy. I received it within three days and was anxious to try it out. I followed all instructions and attempted to connect the water input connector to my water hose. As soon as I tried to connect the two, I knew it would not connect. The cheap plastic connector male threads were bad. I did NOT strip it. The threads would not connect after I tried on three different water hose. I shipped it back the same day i received. Seems someone would make a good power washer that has brass connectors and does not use cheap plastic. They sure would sell a lot of them. Don't waste your money on this model. It is very temporary even if it does connect the first time. AR Blue Clean AR383 1,900 PSI 1.5 GPM 14 Amp Electric Pressure Washer with Hose Reel

I've used the AR383 pressure washer a couple of times so far. It works quite well, and, unlike other reviews I've seen, the fittings don't leak. It cleans off surfaces better than an older, lower pressure washer I used to have, and it stores easily in a compact space. There are, however, a few "ergonomics" issues that detract from what could have been a stellar unit. First - re potential leaks: I'm sure that mine doesn't leak because I was able to thoroughly tighten the pressure fitting at the bottom of the front of the unit. The plastic housing of the unit is molded in such a way that the fitting is too close to nearby the housing surfaces. It is EXTREMELY difficult to tighten the fitting, because there isn't enough free space around the fitting to allow your fingers to easily fit around the fitting while tightening it. Very difficult to do. So much so that I only want to do this once. Then, there's the matter of "tool" storage - The AC cord wraps around the back of the unit, in back of the mountings for the wands and accessory handle. this means that the accessories have to be removed when storing the cord, or unwrapping the cord. Lastly, the interchangeable wands are quite difficult to attach. When they lock in place, there's no positive feedback that they've been fastened securely. Several times I've had one of the wands simulating a projectile when the pressure was turned on. Fortunately, it only shoots out about 6 feet. I wonder if anyone at the factory/design house ever tried using this unit themselves. It would have been so easy to make a few minor changes which could have made this a perfect unit. All things considered, while I am annoyed at these design aspects(especially because I'm a design engineer), I still like the unit, as it does the job well.

reviews.review_header: Still going strong after 2 years of use - washing car every 2-3 weeks
reviews.review_text: I bought this 4-30-14 and its still going strong. Ok, I finally bit the bullet and bought an electric pressure washer. I waited for that one guy to post his review of his he got at Harbor Freight and he never did. I went on Amazon and bought the #1 rated washer in my price range. I was originally looking to spend about $120 and was going to get a Karcher. They don't stock them at Home Dept. They have one for 99 bucks I believe. I decided to spend a little more based on reviews. The AR383 is great. It is very quiet and I talked to the company. They are in MN and a small office of just 36 people and they pride themselves on great customer service. I bought a Foam Lance from Chemical Guys and it did not fit nor did they have fittings as the AR has special fittings. I returned it as AR sells one as an accessory on their website and it is $59.00 I believe, made in Italy and has brass fittings. It works AWESOME and you dont need a bunch of adapters. In talking to the guys at AR, they told me Karchers unit is tested to 50hours of us. The AR is tested to 100 so it should last twice as long. I talked to detail guys and they told me the Karcher cheap unit is what they used when they started out and they would get 6 months of use washing cars all day long. So I figure the AR should last a while. It is super quiet. On the reviews they talk about a plastic hose connection. I don't understand why people complain. It is actually metal. AR said that people put the adapter on backwards and it would leak and then write a review and they were in error. I find the quality and performance of the 383 to be great for the money. A TON TON TON of foam from their cannon you buy on their website. It has a super long built in cord and I think a 30 ft hose. The sprayer is adjustable so you dont have to mess with different tips. hose is a bit cheap and I bought an extension cord. There is a kink in the hose that wont go away but it only kinks when I bend that specific area. Wish the hose was a bit more flexible and higher quality. The foam cannon and unit are still going stong after a couple of years. i have replaced the plastic garden hose adapter and it wasn't a big deal to order it.

Used this heavily for about 4 days thus far cleaning mildew off a hardwood deck. Used it continuously for several hours without trouble. I've been careful with the plastic hose connector and so far nothing has leaked or broken. Very easy setup and reliable function. Variable wand is nice as is the soap container. The parts are mainly plastic, but I take care of my tools and I think this will last for some time. Not too noisy. For this type of washer, this is an awesome value! If you mainly want to clean concrete, go with gas washer - you will need the power. If you are working with wood this works well and any more power than this machine may damage the wood. Gas machines used with lower pressure valve will probably cut down on the time required, however. Also, if you want to cut your effort by 80%, get the 10 inch flat surface cleaner made to accompany this item.

I have use this only once and found it to work as stated in the reviews. I love the fact you have a soap container to used while cleaning items you don't want to damage with high pressure. I had no problems with water leaks.

reviews.review_header: Not the Best for the money
reviews.review_text: I purchased this pressure washer to replace a 10 yr old Karcher that had a bad hose and connection elbow.I primarily use it to wash vehicles and concrete.I attempted to use the soap dispenser unit and added a good quality soap for high pressure but the soap dispenses at low pressure with out the wand so that didn't work to well then hooked up spray wand and pump motor pressure was erractic,at first I thought it might be just priming but continued.I was concerned it would stop operating or cause damage,so finished spraying off soap and turned the unit off.I returned the washer for a refund,and repaired my old Karcher with a new gun and hose set with the quick connect fittings and new water elbow connect.I was very suprized with the peformance and no more leaks either.I have read some mixed reviews with the newer model Karchers but have found them to be one of the best on the market for quality and operation.

i like the power it delivers when i need it, i appreciated the little water filter,thus protecting the machine from unwanted debris,i have a well and although i,ve installed a filter the filter included is a plus

reviews.review_header: ... pressure for around the home jobs and does a nice

The thing I wanted to know, and I'm sure everyone else does too - is this thing buff enough to strip the crud off of your pavement? Yes. I've cleaned my house twice and 3/4 of the pavement around the house twice (crazy previous owners put down almost 2k sq. feet of concrete) and it's worked great. Half of that concrete is under water oaks. They leave green, black and brown scuzz spots. There was also white paint all over the concrete that easily came up with the spinner head. The spinner head will take everything off with enough patience, though it only makes a 2" strip when you get into paint/lichen. The little black spots the oaks leave are the hardest to get off. The head that makes a line goes a little faster in my opinion but doesn't take paint or the black spots off. Works great on siding for that reason. Yes, mine does leak a little at the body/hose connection but here in the south I'm leaking considerably more than this machine is. It isn't enough to detract from it's rating as I never have to put gas in it, oil in it, listen to it(!) or smell it's exhaust. I drag it out, plug it in, and it works.

I never leave reviews unless I am blown away because something is so good or so bad. Well, this product is a true embarrassment. It is so bad, and I have already wasted so much time getting it set up, that I won't waste another minute on this toy packing it up again and shipping it back. One star is one star too much for this piece of junk. I thought I was doing something wrong because the "pressure" stream was so thin and so weak. It removed NO dirt on my deck. My garden hose alone has stronger pressure. I tried the various attachments and adjustments, but NO GOOD. I asked my neighbor (a mechanic) to look at it. We both messed around with it and stood there laughing for a long time at this pathetic excuse for a "pressure" washer. Maybe it's defective, maybe not. Nothing in the owner's manual to suggest an adjustment to make it work like a "pressure" washer. Those of you who had good experiences with this toy are either better at setting it up that I am or have no expectations whatsoever about product quality. I will keep the thing until the Spring and try to give it away to someone who will take it without trying it first. Later Edit: I am editing this review because the problem has been found and solved. We took apart the thing and found a disconnected wire which we reconnected. The motor did not even engage until the wire was reconnected. I must say that the thing now has incredible pressure which is fully adjustable to adapt to any surface. It cleans deeply but, if set properly, does not damage the surface. I used it successfully on synthetic decking, and it did a great job. We should not have had to do our own repairs, but it was worth the effort.
My wife loves this!! She's been using it since it arrived to clean the cars, deck, etc....

Worked great right out of the box . No leaks , no problems of any kind . Perfect for cleaning my deck , sidewalks ect . Good quality product . The problems that I read about in past reviews have been fixed . There is no need for the extra connectors .

Also cleaned up years of crud on my sidewalks and cement stairs leading to the basement. Brightened up the cedar fence clean off not only the algae but the gray too; just have to protect the plants/dirt near the fence. Cleaned windows by using it at an angle rather than straight on. Having never used a pressure washer, I saw in the directions that the water must be on before you start it so the motor doesn't get damaged. But then if you don't turn on the sprayer, it is quiet and I thought it had stopped working but as soon as I turned on the sprayer, you hear the motor. This pressure washer does a good job. My shipping was super-fast - I ordered with Free Shipping, which usually takes longer, but it was on my porch the next day. Easy to assemble. Tried it out on my sidewalk first and it did a great job using the turbo nozzle. The next day, I cleaned all the siding on the back of my townhouse, as well as a concrete patio. Watching everything come so clean is addictive, and I find myself looking for anything else I can pressure wash! Works better with a bigger hose - originally used a narrow 1/2" hose, and when I went around back and used a fatter hose, the pressure was greater due to more water flow. Also, the unit is much quieter than a gas model. Things that could make this unit better: trigger lock to keep it on while cleaning to avoid hand fatigue; longer lances to avoid having to hunch over to clean the sidewalks; accessory storage could be a little better - everything kind of gets in everything else's way, and the lances don't "snap" into their holders so they can get knocked out easily. Also, when you let go of the trigger and then pull it again right away, the pump can't catch up so you have to let go for 1 or 2 seconds and then pull it again to get full pressure. These are minor gripes, though. For the money, I am very pleased so far.

reviews.review_header: This Is Just Right For Me
reviews.review_text: I purchased this as a homeowner and use it around the house to clean off patios, outdoor furniture, the car, etc. I previously owned a gasoline model with a higher pressure rating, and it eventually died. Here's what I like about this one: It's electric as opposed to gas; No fuel to run out; no pull starting; no noise; It runs quietly when you pull the trigger; The pressure is adequate for homeowner use; It's light and I can carry it around. The spray wands are great. They're adjustable and do the job. Previous models of this had a problem with water leaking at the inlet, but this problem has been fixed and no water leaks anywhere and the fittings go on hand tight. If this one ever puffs, I'll buy another one.

Cleaned my Patio floor very nicely, compared to a gas motor driven washer its much much quieter and only actually switches on when you pull the trigger on the gun. Have only used it twice, but seems to be just what i was looking for, and very portable.

After 2.5 years of ownership, the gun now leaks water where the quick connect hose connects to the gun. When operating, water sprays out sideways in 2 directions (both left & right) out of the gun's lock pin (used to lock the hose to the gun) so I get drenched with water whenever I try to use it now. I always stored this disassembled and took good care of it. The hose appears to be in good condition, so I must assume its the gun. The lock pin itself seems a bit flimsy, so maybe it just loosened up over time so it no longer has a tight seal. I liked the idea of being able to use water more efficiently by using less water than a regular garden hose. This pressure washer already paid for itself with the money I saved washing my own car, instead of paying for car washes. But its a shame this water leak now makes it unusable. I'm debating whether to buy a replacement gun, Blue Clean AR240 and AR383 Spray Gun (AR50968) , as I would expect to have the same problem again in a few years and I'd rather not have to keep buying replacement guns to keep this thing usable.

Had to wash my stucco home due to having green algae/mildew on side of house and black mildew below the roof shingles. Used it non-stop for 3 hours and on all the areas that needed it. Mold and mildew came right off and did not damage stucco. Than I did all my front side walks and driveway. 8 years of dirt had accumulated on both house and sidewalk. This washer took it all off with no detergent. Might use detergent next time on driveway to get off the stubborn stains. Still amazing what it took off without detergent. Also did part of my wood fence that was covered in green mold. It also came right off. Seems plenty powerful for all my needs. Figured it already paid for itself. If I would have hired someone it would have cost more than the $160 I paid, plus I still have the power washer for future needs. No leaking on my unit. It does have plastic couplings but they are working without issue. Be nice if it was brass. As long as it lasts a few years, I am very satisfied.

This last time I used it, the machine had a horrible burnt smell and smoke appeared. I confirmed the clear and black adapters were installed correctly and water was running fine. I'm an engineer and handyman around the house so I'm pretty good working with tools and maintaining them. I suspect there is a design or manufacturing flaw such that the motor just doesn't stay cool enough, or there is a bad quality part that wears out way too fast. It's now long past the 1 year mark so I'll unlikely get any kind of refund, exchange, or service on it. I'm very disappointed.

I spent a lot of time reading reviews of other units before buying this one, and I have not been disappointed. The connectors for the hoses are made of metal (brass and aluminum) with standard o-ring seals. This should mean that unlike plastic connectors they should be more durable, and the o-rings can be replaced for cents if needed down the road. The manufacturer makes a big deal that the pump pistons are metal not plastic like others. I am hopeful this will translate into more long-term durability. Maybe others who have owned for a long time could comment. I have used the unit to clean a large composite deck and was very pleased with the performance. The wand is easy to use and having both a long electric cord and a long high pressure hose (ie the hose from the unit to the wand), means that I only moved the unit itself once or twice during the whole operation. The electric plug is protected with a large GFI (ground fault interrupter) which always makes sense when you are around water. I also used the unit to clean the front and back board of a full-height basketball hoop. To do this I was standing on the top of a step ladder and using the wand. The long hose meant this operation was easy. So far I am very pleased with the unit, and I like how both the hose and electric cord have a place to be wound up and stored on the unit, which makes it compact to store away. From my experience so far I am very please with the unit.

I absolutely hate this unit. Nothing is nice about it. First the design: You have to practically have to disassemble everything on the unit to stow it. The electrical cord cannot be wrapped around the back holder easily unless you take off the pressure line. The hose winder is a joke as well, you have to unscrew both ends, then feed it just right into the goofy winder. All of the parts are cheap plastic and will break easily. Now the performance: Yes it has great pressure.....IF you need to get one particular bug off your window and have the patience to aim the miniscule jet in the right place. The "adjustable" nozzle is simply a deflector, it doesn't actually change the diameter of the spray at all. So it is useless for cleaning decks or any larger surfaces. I even bought the deck brush, this is an even bigger joke and waste of money. I had a competitor washer for four years that was 50% less and did a 100% better job at cleaning. What a waste of money.

This is the first pressure washer I have owned. After reading through many reviews on many different pressure washers, I chose this one. The reviews were very positive and many people thought it did a good job. I have to agree. No problem reading the instructions and putting it together. I have used it to clean our patio stones and it did a great job.The patio never looked better. Cleaned the grille racks and they came out great. I am looking to find more jobs for my pressure washer.

From day 1 when using the adjustable sprayer after letting go of the trigger, the machine will just pulse. You either have to remove the sprayer or wait 30+ seconds for full continuous power. I called support and they said there was something jammed in the wand and it needed to be cleared. After using the little nozzle cleaner, then a longer piece of wire, the machine would still pulse. I drilled out the nozzle and that fixed the issue, but no longer had high pressure. I purchased a new adjustable wand and right out of the packaging the same issue with the machine pulsing. Now I am live with it and it is so frustrating. Onto the little clear quick connect for the water supply hose. Forget about a good seal ever occurring. After purchasing 2 more and them not sealing, I siliconed a brass hose quick connect to the clear quick connect. That worked for a few months and now the clear quick connects consistantly break. Unless you're looking to be frustrated with every use, but something else.

Yes, it leaks slightly around the plastic fitting where the plastic adapter attaches to the machine, but my hose leaks where it attaches to the house so I am quite sure that I could purchase either a washer or a different fitting to eliminate this problem. The good news is that this minor leak does not seem to interfere with the power and efficiency of the unit! It was a snap to assemble, there is a helpful You Tube video tutorial if needed. My 15 year old deck was black with mold and this small,but mighty machine did the trick! I used it for roughly three hours straight and I am very pleased with the results! I plan to give the deck one more spot cleaning to go over some areas that I may have missed.Amazon also had the best price for this particular unit and shipping. I do admit that it was just easier to loop both the power cord and the hose cord around the top handle instead of utilizing the cord wheel to wind it around. I am delighted with the performance of this product!

reviews.review_header: Now I'm ready to try it out
reviews.review_text: I have not used this pressure washer yet except to just hook it up try it for a short time. I quickly found the same problems that other reviewers pointed out. First: Leaky & flimsy hose intake dis-connect. Fixed it by getting a Watts brand brass A-673 GH5 Hose adapter size 3/4 FH X 3/4 FIP for $5.53 & a brass Gilmour quick connect set for $ 6.97 at Lowes. Be sure to add rubber washer to fitting before installing on machine. No leaks & all brass. Second: Impossible to use hanger brackets to roll up electrical cord when wand pressure hose is still attached. Fixed by mounting lower bracket near top of handle on back side of machine. Required drilling one screw hole & two holes for locating lugs into hollow handle. Will use machine & add more to review later.

reviews.review_header: Features I do like: the pressure hose connections
reviews.review_text: I received the AR blue clean a couple of months ago. It stopped working after "30" second (literally.) The unit tripped out on GFCI which refused to reset. As a retired Electrical Service Manager I was fairly certain that it was a faulty GFCI, so I contacted the company. I received NO response at all, nothing, zip, zilch, nada. Having lost faith in the company I decided to remove and wire in a new switch, I was right. The unit run perfectly now, (no thanks to the company) Now that it works I can tell you I do not believe it works as well as the pressure cleaner I already had. It says it is 1900 PSI but it appears to be a lot weaker than my existing 1800 PSI Briggs and Stratton. Features I do like: the pressure hose connections, ( I also purchased the extension hose ) and the 10 inch disc cleaner. Don't likes: had I not been an electrician I would be sitting on a piece of plastic. My recommendation... Buy a Briggs and Stratton, costs a bit more but they stand behind their product.

This washer has good power and is easy to use. A very nice feature is that the motor stops when you release the trigger on the spray gun. I like the adjustable spray nozzle too. The unit is lightweight and maneuverable even though equipped with high quality internals. On the other hand, the provisions for storing the cord, hose and accessories are pretty awkward. The cord is long (a good thing) but too long to fit on its storage hooks and the hose reel--well don't get me started on that! It's one of those things you wish you could sentence the designer to demonstrate over and over about a hundred times until they promise never to foist such a lame feature on the unsuspecting consumer again! Also the hose is plastic and tends to curl--some other inexpensive washers have metal-lined hoses that are much easier to work with. Overall, a convenient and useful item. Don't leave it out in freezing weather though! Any power washer would be damaged by freezing.

I previously had a Karcher and it was junk. It only worked randomly after the first few times. Trying to get service was futile. Finally the input hose connection broke. I called service and ordered the part. They sent the wrong part and when contacted told me they couldn't help. So I read a lot of reviews this time and bought AR Blue Clean 383 from Amazon. It was free shipping and arrived in 3 days. The input connecter sent was not the same one shown on the instructions so it was a little confusing. The upside was that it does not leak as mentioned in several other reviews. It is easy to assemble, light and powerfull. If it keeps working as it does now, it will be a home run.

I just received this pressure washer last week. I used it over two days to help me clean off 30 years of accumulated crud from the concrete walkway around my house and a patio area. It does a great job and is pretty quiet. It comes with 2 wands, one of which has an adjustable fan spray tip that I found most useful. I haven't really used the conical spray tip that much. If you take your time setting it up (takes about 20 minutes the first time) and follow the instructions, things go pretty smoothly and the machine functions well. The only issue I had was I was afraid to crossthread the couplers for the out tube to the spray wand, and the intake filter for the hose. Take your time on those parts of the setup. Once it is setup it is easy to take down for storage or reassemble without having to look at the instructions. Uses a lot of water so be sure of your drainage, and be prepared for a big water bill. Totally useful and fun machine.

I received a replacement and the same thing happened. I am not even going to bother to contact them and request a replacement. I will buy another brand locally, the same as I had before that worked for years, and never buy or recommend one of there products again. Ease of ordering was great. Product arrived as ordered. I was initially concerned with the fact that this unit is noticeably lighter/smaller than previous pressure washers that I have purchased but this pressure is fantastic and quick to respond. I actually really enjoy the lighter weight/footprint but with the Mighty Mouse power. Hose reel, as others have posted, not the greatest. I bundle the hose over the handle and that works well. Hose a slight bit shorter than some other pressure washers but by no means a deal breaker. Note, I purchased the Quick Connect Hose Adapter but one comes with the unit so now I have spares. The in/out ports are brass which for a unit at this price is a pleasant surprise. Actually, this was one of my main buying criteria - purchased a budget type PWasher in the past with plastic inlet and garden hose kept blowing off. For the cost, this little unit rocks and is a very good purchase.

reviews.review_text: I was hesitant to buy this machine due to the previous reviews concerning the quick connection leaking or not working. The newest reviews stated this had been fixed. When my machine arrived the first thing I noticed is the connection piece that connects to the garden hose the wrong threads to connect to a standard American hose. This was seriously irritating since I had to go searching for a replacement fitting. After striking out at True Value I was able to find a compatible fitting at Home Depot (see photo). Once this was accomplished, I was able to connect the machine to the garden hose and experienced no leaks. The pressure washer itself worked well with no issues other than losing pressure every once in awhile. Overall I am happy so far minus the wrong fitting being delivered with the pressure washer. I deducted a star for the inconvenience.

The technician tried to walk me through putting the articles together. After explanation he then understood that one wand was a larger diameter than the other. He took my information and mailed me a replacement that arrived in a few days. It fit and I used the pressure washer for the first time today. It works fine. The only issue I have is the two inserts that fit in the handle of the unit do not fit properly into the storage rack on the back of the unit. They seem to be too large in diameter to fit. If I try and force them in, you can see the plastic straining and looking like it will crack. So, I just don't store them in the place they say to. Not a big deal but definitely frustrating when trying to do it.

reviews.review_text: The newer design water inlet works fine but you must wrap the hose bib on the machine with teflon tape. Easy. Stopped minor leak. Machine delivers what it promises. Seems well made and easy to move and use. My previous very old gas unit delivered about same pressure but had a little more volume. But this unit will do any and all small jobs around the house. Turbo wand is great. Adjustable wand is fine also. If you don't want a heavy gas unit, the problems starting it after a couple years of no use, a lower cost, easy storage and maneuverability, and can live with a power level that does modest jobs then this is a fine purchase. Buy a gas model if you want speed, power and high flow volume. I am delighted with this unit which will do everything I want done and will always start!
