reviews.review_header: The bad features outweigh the good
reviews.review_text: For the money this machine is ok. My complaints are that the pressure hose is so stiff ( poor quality), it will not wind up on the reel properly even in warm weather. I do not use the hose reel because it is too flimsy anyway. The power cord will barley fit in its designated spot....again on a cool day it will not flex enough to fit properly. The handle is too short so I just carry the thing around.In my opinion the wheels should be eliminated, the pressure hose needs to be better quality and the unit should just be a carry around model.The unit operates quite well as far as cleaning goes. The things I do not like are enough to keep me from recommending this machine
Nice machine for the listed price. It is easy to use, but not as powerful as I thought It would be.
Great product; met all our expectations...Worth the money!
Works well and easy to operate.
Excellent
Did the job very well
I purchased this unit in June 2012. Been using it almost everyday powerwashing the house, deck, camper and patio areas. So far it's been working great!

I used it to clean my patio yesterday and to knock the loose paint off the iron furniture before I painted it. The reel for storing the hose is not worth the trouble though, I will probably never use it. The quick connect for the water connecter is a problem as indicated it all the reviews. I got the brass fitting in the mail today and will use it next time even though it is not a quick connect. I saw the same connecter a Lowes for less money. The unit worked fine, plenty of pressure. Sometimes if you got the nozzle set to an high pressure stream make it had for the pressure to build up when starting up, so you might have to twist the spray stream a little wider to reduce the back pressure till it gets running fast. I have had to gas pressure washer and this is a lot less trouble and lighter to move around.
works even better than expected
Great for my screen printing set up!
Does a great job for the price.
I am happy I bought this. It works very well and is easy to use. I used it to clean my fence and sidewalk. Great results on both.
Bought this washer for husband. Came with no problems. Works well. He uses it to clean the car and the outside of the house. Will also use to clean deck.
It does a great job. I used it to power clean my patio and it took off all the green and dirt stains! I'd recommend this power washer to anyone.
Read reviews and the pressure washer is nice but you do need to replace the connection to stop the hose from leaking.
The AR383 is easy to use and has enough power to do light to medium cleaning. The hose real is useless. But still worth it. I whould recommend this unit.
More powerful and solid than other electrics I have used. So far so good for house siding and patio cleaning.
great power washer for the price
Too early to tell haven't had a chance to use it. Looks like a good one though. Check back later

reviews.review_header: Best one I've used. I like the wind up
reviews.review_text: I like the wind up storage plus the wand and cord storage. The hose connection can't be tightened enough to stop leaking when in use.
Does everything I need it to do. With all of the power washers on the market, I read lots of reviews before buying. Glad I picked this one!
Great machine for the price of it
Quiet, affordable, and it works great! How can you go wrong with that? You can't beat it for the price.
The hose is to stiff and hard to move.The power is good ,the hose reel is also hard to use

reviews.review_header: Its the best for the price
reviews.review_text: Its the best for the price
Excellent
Easy to use - works great!

The challenge many people have is not realizing the threads on the water input side are NOT garden hose threads. This unit is made to be used ONLY with the special connector. The metal input pipe is a metric thread. Buying a brass connector at the local adware store is not the answer. The only way to get a water tight connection is with the quick connector available from the AR company. Available in either plastic or brass. Customer service is great.
As expected
Works as intended. Very pleased.

This pressure washer was a last minute buy in order to help a local car wash I was putting on to raise money. It works well, was easy to put together, and is well worth the money. It has good pressure and the adjustable nozzle is equally useful for cleaning cars, concrete or tile. Pros: Inexpensive, good and consistent pressure from any hose, easy to transport, pretty solid Cons: Heavy draw means only heavy duty generators can be used if off grid. Also had some trouble on standard 15 AMP circuits - suppression breaker will not kick over unless it has required amperage on the line. I would recommend a gas powered one for non-grid uses. Rear adapter brackets do not hold the accessories well and the routinely fall off. I just carry them separately.
excelente
I have used many power washers in my time and this has to be the best by far. Nice long cord and hose.
I am a 70 year old woman and it is just right for my needs. Would recommend it to anyone.
MY HUSBAND LOVES IT.
GREAT WASHER. EASY TO USE.
Useful and sturdy

reviews.review_header: Defective product, will not work with standard accessories
reviews.review_text: I'm not sure why this power washer was given such high ratings. The water supply inlet (which also filters the water) is made of extremely cheap plastic and leaked heavily when I first used it. Additionally, AR Blue's non-standard parts (such as the 14mm line) means that you can't use any other wand/power washer pressurized line if you want to upgrade the wand to accomodate something such as a foam gun. Also the foam gun included in this does not produce any usable foam- a must for any car detailer. If you're looking to buy a different foam gun such as the MTM or the other similar foam lances currently on the market, they will not be compatible.
good, could be berrer
Did a great job.
Great product for the money
Great product and price. Would recommend it.
good
I really like this washer.
Get one! You'll love it. Great shot, easy to handle. I wish the cord could be a better design. Thanks
great pressure, nice long power cord and light. Winding up the pressure hose is more of a chore and it seems to pinch the hose. I just hook it over the handle instead.
Great product. No issues.
Very satisfied
thanks
works great!
Not strong that ALL!
good

If you have a small apartment patio or very small home patio this might be an option if mine was just a faulty machine. Even if yours doesn't break like mine did, if you need to power wash a driveway or large anything this is NOT for you. I tend to scan reviews but not put too much weight into the negative ones. I should have listened to these The plastic attachments broke with 15 minutes of using. Yes I understand I can go to ACE and buy copper add ons but really? Broken on first use? And then it started spraying water out the molded seams by the attachment. Maybe this was just a faulty machine but I cannot recommend.
Great little machine!
Works well!

reviews.review_header: The adapter was a bad design, not very sturdy
reviews.review_text: The QC adapter(the adapter to connect the BC with hood) was broken after first use. I am asking their customer service for a replacement, will see how they respond. The adapter was a bad design, not very sturdy, just shady plastic. Update, they send me a replacement which is not plastic. It works much better now. So I change it to 4star ================== update: I put it in under the roof for a year and used it again today. The water is leaking from the connector to the hand gun! Very disappointed, not sure if they can send me replacement again since it has been 1 year already.
Works as described good power easy set up and sustained water stream. Washer attachment sprays ok but without force. Very satisfied.
Bought this PW betting on my fellow amazon reviewers . And what a bet ! Amazing product ! Does the job. Was able to get rid of oil stains on the driveway.
Great bargain, used right after it was delivered on my siding - worked well and used for back patio since.
Gets the job done.

Spent an hour of my sunday morning trying to make it work. When I opened the box, there was water coming out of the tube. That should have been my first warning sign that this was a used unit. After following the instructions I try to turn the power washer on and nothing. Checked the GFI, no issues there. I think its poorly designed. The connector from water line (hose) to water inlet was sporting water too. I am going to return the unit and not try my luck with another unit.
Great!
iceThis item replaced my old karcher 1400 psi unit. I find it to be excellent in it's operation and use. the price was good as well.
great product
It works well.
nice
kinda stinks to role up the hose but good little power washer it is better than the gas one i have
This is a quality washer. Haven't used any others. Didn't want the smell and hassle with gas unit so bought this. Does a nice job cleaning vinyl dock at the lake.
Works great.
good product
love it
Solid portable washer.

reviews.review_header: AR North American 1900, 1.5 Gal Pressure washer
reviews.review_text: Used it a couple of times already, and it preforms better than expected. Powerful spray for up close work. Great deal, hope it lasts a while.

reviews.review_header: Very good power washer for househeld needs
reviews.review_text: I bought it as replacement for my previous power washer that was bought in Home Depot and which lasted just one year. Power hose has blown up and I have discovered that there is no compatible replacement for it. I started search for reliable PW that do not have such cons. I was surprised how powerful and suitable in use this "dandy". Usually I am trusting to stuff that have more that hundred reviews and have 4 and more stars. This is working to this power washer also. I didn't find any issues mentioned in previous reviews. Just be careful with thin water stream... I have made couple cuts on my polymer deck. It is light weight and somebody may think that this not good for power equipment but very good for my wife.

I needed a new pressure washer because my previous one produced a hole in hose leading up to the handle. I also needed a more powerful one than the one I had which was 1300psi. After reading the reviews and searching around, I chose this one. Its high power pressure does the job for me. It does it so well that it tore my skin on my hand after barely touching it. Yep, I drew blood! And as with some of the other reviews, I also had problems with where the hose meets the pressure washer in that water does leak. I purchased an adapter as recommended by others and it works great. No leaks. This product works for me and I'll recommend it.
Great
Only had a few months and only used twice. So far it seems to be holding up nice. Plenty of power

reviews.review_header: AR Blue Clean AR383 Pressure Washer
reviews.review_text: After doing research on pressure washers, I found the AR Blue Clean AR383 to have great reviews. I have used this product a few times now and it seems to do a good job on patios and driveways. Ofcourse, if you want every stain to be gone, then you should get a professional pressure washer to do the job. But, for around the house and cars, this should be just fine. I did purchase a separate hose connector with it since it DOES leak when it is connected. The parts were a little cheesy for the connection.
I have used this pressure washer cleaning wooden decks, cement steps and other cleaning. Very powerful - does a great job.. A very good buy!

reviews.review_header: Doesn't have alot of hours on it, yet, but works great.
reviews.review_text: I have used the pressure washer, for just one afternoon but it did a great job cleaning my algae covered driveway. The unit was very easy to assemble. It is lightweight and very mobile. The long hose and electric cord are probably it's best features. I have a single story home with pretty high windows, but after seeing the unit, I think I can get on a ladder, and reach up to clean them with no problem.
Works great ( starts every time lol ). I used it on siding and concrete so far and it works great.

Bought this to avoid gas powered unit but its spray is far too weak to clean my redwood decks. The spray head has to be no further than 2-3 inches from the wood to clean it at all, and this reduces the spray pattern to 2-3 or so inches wide, and even after two or three passes dirt remains in the wood, necessitating a chemical cleaner, which is what I was trying to avoid when I bought this unit. I have learned by using this machine that a more powerful 3000 psi sprayer is needed to clean wood. An expensive lesson. Anyone want a used electric pressure washer?

reviews.review_header: never got to use it, did not work on arrival. plastic garden hose connector is junk.
reviews.review_text: it arrived well packaged. Instructions were clear. Garden hose attachment is cheesy. Instructions were to hand tighten only, but i could not get it tight enough without braking out the pliers. (Otherwise water was gushing out as soon as i turned the water on.) Then i tipped the unit looking for the power switch, and the plastic popped and started gushing water again. Irritated, but felt it was my own fault, and went to hardware store and purchased a copper coupler. Came home replaced the plastic with copper, turned on the hose and all seemed OK. Plugged it in only to find the pump does not activate. Returning it, and looking for a different brand.

reviews.review_header: Absolute garbage. After assembling this for the first use
reviews.review_text: Absolute garbage. After assembling this for the first use, the unit turned on and groaned for less than two seconds and will not turn on again. This was plugged into a verified grounded GFI so it is not a simple reset the breaker issue. Something is malfunctioning internally with this unit. AR North America's customer service is only Monday through Friday so I could not even speak to someone about troubleshooting or replacement parts. Thankfully, Amazon has a great return policy.

reviews.review_header: Rough start but quite happy about it now
reviews.review_text: Initially, this thing was a total disappointment. Plastic "quick-connect" adapter for the hose was leaking badly. But the worst part is that the O-ring at the connection of the high pressure hose and the wand just fell apart and the water was spraying everywhere. I had to contact AR North America to get replacement parts. UPDATE Less than a week after I contacted AR I got new O-rings and an adapter for a hose in the mail. The adapter is made of aluminum, it is a solid part. No more leaks. Whoever is experiencing leaks at the hose quick-connect needs to get this replacement part. Now pressure washer works the way it should.

I used this item over the weekend. I had a 1600PSI pressure washer. It worked fine. I was really surprised at the difference 100 more PSI made. Maybe it's just because it's new, I don't know, but it really worked well on my sidewalks and driveway. My main reason for reviewing this is to recommend that you also by the 10 inch flat surface cleaner. I think it cut my cleaning time by 70%.

I have used it just a few times since I bought and while it is not a great unit, I am pleased with it overall. It has the power to strip paint off wood surfaces and clean old concrete slabs. For my needs I did not want to invest a lot of money in something I only use once in a while and this unit has a good price and enough power to do the basic tasks I encounter. The biggest negative for me is that the connector at the hose bib leaks substantially, but other than that I like the unit.

I would say if you have the place to store a gas powered washer, go with that one. This is a very good washer for simple tasks but if you want to clean concrete or bricks, it will take you forever. The only way to make the water pressure effective is to make the stream extremely narrow and that makes cleaning very slow. I would have been happier to pay much more for a more powerful electric washer, however among those, it seems to be that this is one of the best. Nice things about this washer: very small and light, clean with no gas or oil mess, quiet, no smells, and you can store it on a shelf or in your bedroom closet after use.

reviews.review_header: Very bad. I used it for less than 2 hours ...
reviews.review_text: Very bad. I used it for less than 2 hours and it stopped working , I cannot turn it on. I called the customer support and they said I used the 'wrong extension cord'. I have a long extension cord that I use with all my tools and never had any problem, it does not make any sense. She said the machine is damaged and I need to replace the whole thing. They want 50$ + shipping which is 60$. I told her I will buy a machine that is not that fragile.

For the price, this is a great unit. Easy to use and folds up nice and small. Though it has all of the pressure in the world, this water flow rate is low so you have to get very close to whatever you are washing. If you pressure wash once or twice a year, great purchase. The worst part about this unit is the water connector. I have no idea what type of thread it is but you can only get one of 2 threads of your hose in so it leaks the entire time. The only solution I have found is to use Teflon tape.

reviews.review_header: Biggest Piece of Cr@p I've ever bought
reviews.review_text: I bought this in April and it worked well the 5 times I used it. This morning I tried using it and the pressure hose no longer stays in place. You turn on the power and it pops out. I checked with the manufacture and get this, the unit is under warranty for 1 year, BUT the gun is only under warranty for 90-days! Yea. Guess they figured out their gun was a piece of cr@p long before I did. Now this becomes another wonderful product for the landfill.

I read reviews carefully and then decided to order this Pressure Washer. I am very very very pleased. It is easy for me to handle. I am a woman in my 60s. I had some reservations about dangers of pressure washers, etc. But I wanted to be able to clean our deck and driveway. It was easy to assemble. I did read the directions! My deck looks fabulous! I used only water on the driveway and I will use a concrete cleaner the next time but I was really pleased. I saved money with this machine and the effort was worth it. This is exactly what I was looking for. Also, I had no issues with leaks.

I normally don't write reviews but this time I decided to make an exception. I don't understand why this product has bad reviews. I think it is a very good pressure washer and it performs its job very well. Are some of the criticisms incorrect, such as that the connection with the water hose will leak? No, most of the criticisms are probably accurate. But the bottom line is that this is a relatively inexpensive product that acomplishes what it is supposed to do extremely well. It is not perfect, but it clearly gets the job done. If needed I would definitely purchase this product again.

reviews.review_header: Forget Going To The Car wash...
reviews.review_text: I bought a much more powerful gas powered 3000+ psi pressure washer for cleaning stuff around the house, like the concrete of the patio. but i also wanted a pressure washer to wash the car and one where i wouldn't be afraid of causing any damage to the paint. well this 1900 psi electric pressure washer was just perfect for that. its great for getting off that dark road grit/grease from the wheels and works just as great when spraying the rest of the car. others may have a different opinion, but for me it feels just like the pressure washer you'd find at the local roadside car wash.

Just used the Power Washer and found it to be very user friendly! I am almost 70 yrs. young and wanted something lightweight and easy to use but nevertheless does a through job of cleaning brick walks and patio. Am very pleased, it did so with only water! I expect to use a detergent on my house to remove mildew although not immediately (have to wait on hurricane season to pass us by on the coast of NC). Don't know what I'd do without Amazon, have come to rely on them for most of my shopping as I am just not a shopper per se. When I need something I just 'click'.

reviews.review_header: very good if you know its limitations and your applications
reviews.review_text: Yes I like it alot because I have many uses for it...but one of the main reasons I purchased it was to clean the grease off of hood filters. The ARblue works very well on light grease but on heavy stuff it will also work but take some additional time to work it off. So the three stars is actually my fault for not knowing that I needed something with more psi...but like I said it will work but just take some time.

This machine is very powerful and more than does the job and grimy and filthy decks etc. My only complaint is the plastic connection for the hose - feels like it could break if Im not careful, and I often get a leak at the connection when I move the unit around - even with the brass connection adaptor that people recommend. All in all a great product though.

Bought this item based on the reviews. Sorry I did. Powerful pump for the price but that is all. Cheap parts that will break with a fair amount of use. The cleaner dispenser did not work well for me. Can be hard to keep track of for big jobs. The plastic hose coupler is also of poor quility.

reviews.review_header: AR Blue Power Washer Inferior to my previous washer.
reviews.review_text: The AR Blue Power Washer is inferior to the Karcher I previously owned, for over a decade. The quick release connector is poor quality plastic and leaks. The manufacturer should have provided a quality metal quick release connector to the basic important component of the unit, even if it necessitated a slight increase in price. Water availability is critical world wide and preventable wastage is engineering design negligence. Consumer Reports ought to provide customer ratings including consumer testing under actual usage rather than laboratory conditions.

I received this item and got right to putting it together, following the instructions in the included manual and 'quick start' guide. My plan was to use this with some TSP to clean my roof in preparation for elastomeric coating this weekend. After getting it all together, again, using the included documentation, I decided to see how it does on my driveway before hauling it up on the roof. Hooked up the hose, turned water on, and gave it power and we were in business...for less than 5 minutes. After about 2 minutes of use I felt a noticeable drop in pressure, so I stopped using it for a minute or so and then gave the trigger another squeeze. Still, lower pressure than I had started with but decent, so I tried to get some paint spots on my driveway off and it worked with ease.. for another 2 minutes. After about 2 minutes of hitting the driveway I started to smell that wonderful smell of burnt electronics. I glance at the unit and smoke is pouring out of the rear vents. I immediately put the wand down and ran to the plug and pressed the reset button (THE UNITS GFCI PLUG DID NOT TRIP WHILE THE UNIT WAS BURNING UP) and then turned the switch on the unit to off. I will post a picture of the smoky unit. Of course, Amazon customer service is second to none and processed my return and refund right away. But I still have to go through the hassle of taking it apart, draining the remaining water, boxing it up, and being available for UPS to pick it up. Oh, and now I'm without a pressure washer for my roof project and will have to visit a big box store and pay more then I would for a [different] unit from Amazon if I still plan to get this done this weekend. Disappointing to say the least. This product has some amazing reviews, so maybe I just had really bad luck. Buyer beware.

I am so glad we did some consumer research first and ended up going with this item. It was easy to assmble and worked perfectly from the start. I have now pressure washed my entire 2 story house, large back deck, driveway and all the side walks in front of my house and it did not faulter one time. As a woman who likes to do jobs herself that most others would pay to have someone else do, this was an absolute winner and would highly recommend to all others

reviews.review_header: Good for light to moderate jobs
reviews.review_text: This is good for the price and does a great job for light to moderate work like cleaning up our screens, screened in patio, outdoor patio furniture, etc. It does not do a great job on the sidewalks and driveway however. You can tell that they were done but it doesn't do the job like when we have it professionally done or when we have done it with a gas powered unit. With that being said I did not use any type of chemical cleaner with it, maybe it does a better job if those are used. It does not leak nor have we had any issues with it so far.

I am very disappointed with this product. It appears well designed and assembled easily but the unit is shoddy and the pressure hose fitting failed with the connection blowing off the hose at the compressor with less than five hours of use. The realities of warranties on an item of this value make it more trouble than it is worth to seek redress so I will just go to a store and buy a superior replacement. I am a very enthusiastic Amazon customer but this product is the exception to my usual satisfactory experience

Despite reviewers giving this machine 5 stars I will explain my experience: 1. Requires some assembly. Just enough to be a little annoying. 2. Hose is hard plastic and is difficult to both uncoil into something straight and even more difficult to wind up on the built in reel. I needed two people. The reel is a nice idea but with a hard rubber hose instead of a hose more pliable it is an issue. 3. The hose connection is not directly to the body. It is through two plastic pieces. One threads on to the body of the machine. The other is a friction lock piece. This attaches to the hose and locks to the other piece. The idea was to install a filter which again was a nice idea but does not work well in the context of all the plastic. All these connections occur about 2" off the ground and the weight of the hose torques everything to the ground. I messed around with this connection for half an hour before I gave up. Yes I did read another reviewers suggestion to buy a brass fitting for this connection and I assume abandon the filter but why should you have to buy something else to get something that you just bought to work? I think AR should review and upgrade the connection and distribution system on this machine. I know it is a competitive market place but one at least expects a product that works well (and works well for a number of years) out of the box. I returned the unit.

1900 psi no way 300 maybe, ok for small jobs like weeding open brick sidewalks, it will not clean car wheels or plastic sided sheds. It does clear mildew off of concrete basement out side walls. Wear boots and rain gear, all of the connections leak

I needed a power washer to clean a deck and for some general residential use. After looking over various makes and models I selected the AR Blue Clean AR383 based upon features but also importantly because of the good customer service that the company was supposed to provide based on some past reviews. I assembled the machine. Carefully read the manual and included quick start guide. I turned on the water, plugged in the power cord, and then turned on the switch. The pump motor ran for about 2 seconds and died. I could not get it restarted. I checked the outlet, power plug reset button and read the trouble shooting guide in the manual. Having tried everything in the guide and being unsuccessful at getting the motor to run I called the customer support line. It was Saturday and I found out the support line is open from 8am through 5pm Monday through Friday, CST. I called back at 8:05am Monday only to find that you do not get to speak with a person but get a recorded message instructing you to leave your name and number and someone will "return your call shortly". Would someone at AR North America, assuming they are still in business, please define shortly! Over the next two days I have left 4 phone messages and have received no call backs. Thankfully I bought it from Amazon and was still within the return window. I still need a functioning power washer but it will not be made by AR North America.

This is second pressure washer I've owned. First one (different manufacturer) was underpowered, leaky, and quirky to operate. This model works fantastic. It was simple to set up, has no leaks, did a great job cleaning moldy, moss covered bricks, moldy pressure treated deck, aluminum gutters and vinyl siding. I also like the compact storage feature, but it could use a bit of improvement. The wheels are very handy for moving around. I am very impressed and highly recommend this product.

reviews.review_header: IT HAS A COUPLE OF O-RINGS BAD. FIXED THE LEAX
reviews.review_text: FROM DAY ONE I HAD NOTHING BUT PROBLEMS. IT TOOK ME OVER AN HOUR TO GET IT GOING. I SOLVE ONE PROBLEM THEN ANOTHER POTS UP. EVERYTIME I USE IT, IT WAS TOUCHILY. NOW A LITTLE AFTER A YEAR SINCE I BROUGHT IT AND 6 MONTHS SINCE I USED IT; IT HAS A COUPLE OF O-RINGS BAD. FIXED THE LEAX , BUT NOW IT START AND SHUT OFF AGAIN & AGAIN. PIECE OF CRAP.

reviews.review_header: My bet is that it's only marketed in the US but made in China!
reviews.review_text: My first review....I'll keep it simple. Unit had potential, delivering basically what you paid for. However, the problem others spoke about quickly manifested itself. Unit lost over 60% of its effectiveness, owing to a fissure within the body of the pumping unit, allowing most of the water to escape. Very disappointing. Should you purchase? Seems to be a "luck-of-the-draw" situation. Yours might work...mine didn't.

I've used this washer two times. First time was ok, but it was just a plain old spraying job. The second time I needed to hook up the detergent and was unable to do so. Storing the hose is a time consuming process. Changing nozzles can be tricky. I've used several other pressure washers and never had such a frustrating experience. I would NOT recommend this!

The washer came promptly and works well. It has more power than my old Campbell Hausfield and seems to be a quality product. I have only one complaint but I should have paid better attention. The hose is shorter than the one on my old washer and I miss the extra length. If I had realized how short the hose is, I would have made a different decision.

reviews.review_header: I have really good water pressure and it worked just "ok"
reviews.review_text: I have really good water pressure and it worked just "ok". It wasn't able to get all the ick off the deck being power washed. It worked pretty well for getting gunk out of crevices of the motorhome. I didn't try it on concrete. If you really need to blast through mossy type areas that build up over a wet winter (or years of sitting) then you'd probably want a more powerful unit.

Just used it today to pressure wash and strip the house for painting. Everything was tight. No leaks anywhere. Plenty of pressure to wash the wooden siding and strip off loose paint. I called blue clean support and they said using a 15 amp extension cord was fine. I used it to get around the house. Good purchase

I think this Electric Pressure Washer AR383 is one of the best. It work right out of the box with no problem so far. I hope this will last long time. I love it and will recommend my friend to buy this product. I used this Electric power washer to wash car and deck, the pressure is just right and the price is cheaper than the Gas Power Pressure.

Spend another $80 and buy Black & Decker or another well-known brand. Every warning on this site is true -- it is a piece of junk and survived just three uses this season. Shoddy design, crappy components. I wish I had stepped up to a more reputable brand, this is going into the garbage unless AMZ will exchange/accept for return. Also the adapter some advised to buy is equally useless -- leaks and sprays water everywhere.

reviews.review_header: Broke in just over a year (Used a handful of times)
reviews.review_text: Broke in little over a year. I had used it just 3 or 4 times. Very disappointing. I was also out of warranty as I was just past 1 year. Used one spring and by the time I tried to use it next spring, motor would not start. Be careful when you buy from this company as they are not reliable. No wonder their review rating has also slipped since when I bought them.

Don't let it sit in your garage over the winter with any water in it or it will crack the plastic wand fitting that cannot be fixed. I had to buy a new wand kit on Amazon. Then my sister tipped it forward and the front plastic filter broke. I ordered three filters and found out the motor was seized. I am not putting one more penny into it.

I've always wanted one, and after reading several reviews, I decided on the AR Blue Clean AR383. This is all the pressure washer I need. It's powerful, has several different settings, easy to move around, long power cord and hose, and it works great. Gets the job done quickly! I highly recommend this pressure washer. Make sure you drain the machine when you're done using it, and make sure you dry it off as well.

I gave it a try because of the good reviews on Amazon. There were a few comments about leaks around the water hose where you connect garden hose to the unit. I figured it would be a small leak. Boy I was wrong! It spewed out more water than what was coming out of the spray gun it looked like. I returned the unit and Amazon sent a refund super fast, great service from Amazon, the product not up to par. I later bought a cheaper Ryobi model from HomeDepot, no leaks and worked as expected.

This washer is quite running. Assembles easy and seems all parts well made. Works great even though its only 1900 PSI. Seems better than that. Well engineered piece. Highly recommended. Lucky I read some of the other reviews of other units. I may have ordered one that had some bad reviews and I probably would have also been a dissatisfied purchaser. But this unit I like.

reviews.review_header: Decent enough basic pressure washer for household use.
reviews.review_text: While it does provide a high velocity water blast, it leaks at the garden hose connection, and cannot be used to provide a high velocity stream of water/cleaner mix. Cleaner can only be dispensed at normal garden hose pressure. Coiling up hose for storage is difficult, as is the jigsaw puzzle proceedure for storing all the other attachments. Don't forget, totally empty the unit of all water beforing storing (especially if unit is subjected to sub freezing temperatures during storage!!!)

reviews.review_header: Used total of 5 times and died
reviews.review_text: Absolute junk. It won't turn on, it won't do nothing. Can't return it and I am out 160 bucks. Do yourself a favor and avoid this.

You have to figure out how to use the trigger, sometimes its feels like it choking but thats until you figure out how to use the trigger (Trick is to start pressing the trigger slowly) Pros: + Great Pressure + Turns off automatically when you release the trigger, no always ON loud noise. Cons - Pipe winding is kinda flimsy - Pipe winding is a bit hard to do.

reviews.review_header: Workhouse, but detergent bottle feature is questionable
reviews.review_text: Not doubt the machine is worth the price. I power-washed slime from an entire pool (drained). The oscillating lance worked great. However, when trying to use the detergent bottle for washing my car, I discovered that it only dispenses the mixture at very low pressure. The manual says that high pressure soap is ineffective. I think they just didn't know how to engineer a solution to run soap at high pressure.

Owned a gas-powered pressure washer for years, but with a bad back, it was too hard to deal with. This is an excellent pressure washer, so far. No complaints. It gets the job done, runs quieter and easy to move around.

Pressure Washer worked for less than 3 minutes before it quit and the reset button would not work. This is apparently an issue on this brand. I heard the unit is fabulous when it works which is why I took the chance. If they would change the power cord I would try it again.

I am just so thrilled with this purchase! I've used gas sprayers in the past, and was concerned about the lower PSI, but this thing will peel paint. The adjustable nozzle is just fantastic. Runs quiet and is very easy to use. The cable storage in the middle is sort of a waste and the instructions for the unit are not very clear. But beyond that, I couldn't be more pleased. I also purchased the 10" patio and deck attachment but I don't really care for it.

This product requires multiple steps to use each and every time but that is not the major problem. The device has a locking switch for the squeeze trigger that locks it off instead of on. So if you want to use the sprayer and not have to constantly squeeze the trigger you have to do like I did and put a piece of Styrofoam in the trigger to force it to stay on. I fail to see the logic in that.

To follow up of I purchase I made about 2 years ago. This is by far the best power washer I have ever owned. Somehow the connection of the power wand was broken (after use by my wife who claims innocence) I called service told them and they replaced it gratis in 2 days. What more can you ask of a fine company. As for leaking the manual should be read before assembling. I have never had s leak since I have owned the machine. You can purchase AR products with confidence. Sandy

The Blue Clean Pressure Washer is one of the most useful products I have bought. I used it to spray down the house before painting..old paint just pealed off. I wash my drive-way with it, my truck, patio furniture, and just about anything else I don't want to scrub. The pressure psi is perfect and the hose is long enough to reach most anything I need to clean. I would definitely recommend this sprayer.

Got the AR on Friday morning and cleaned the front porch when it warmed up some, everything worked great did a good job. Saturday I was cleaning the driveway and got 3/4 done when I suddenly lost pressure I turned around to look and there was a plume of water jetting from the middle of the pressure hose. Now I have people coming Tuesday to look at the house and driveway is 3/4 cleaned. NICE! I will say this would be a good household cleaner if the pressure hose was any good.

reviews.review_header: Spend extra and get something good!!
reviews.review_text: I got this a couple of years ago but rarely used it. Every time e this summer I'd turn it on and it would work fiord about 5 seconds then turn off and I could never restart it. Tried again today...PIECE OF JUNK!!!! DO NOT BUY THIS. Spend extra and get something good!!

Have used on a number of projects, pool deck, back porch, exterior of house, roof, sidewalk and driveway. Will replace my gas pressure washer on 90% of my household jobs, it has plenty of power. It is light and quiet, I like that it shuts down when you release the trigger. I added an extension hose which makes doing large areas easy. I also use a pump protect spray after each use. It has paid for itself many times over if I would have rented a pressure washer.

reviews.review_header: Great product if you can figure it out on your own...
reviews.review_text: I'm happy to have this. It works well and saves me a lot of work. Now the bad...the manual was practically useless. It didn't have pictures to show half of what it talked about and the pictures of the product on the box weren't helpful either. Without helpful pictures/diagrams it was difficult to hook up the first time and the uses for the different wands were never explained. I had to try several different things before I got it to work correctly and without leaking profusely. After I spent about a half hour on my own, I got it figured out and it works well. But the manual is useless!

I spent half the day trying to lock and unlock the wands from the spray gun. I've owned pressure washers before, all with bayonet attachments, and never had a problem locking and unlocking the wands. Overall, the pressure washer worked okay but the poor design (or flaw) of the AR Blue Clean wand attachments was so difficult that I didn't want to change wands. Too, too much trouble. I returned the machine.

reviews.review_header: This works great. We pressure washed our front brick stairs to ...
reviews.review_text: This works great. We pressure washed our front brick stairs to our town home and they look like brand new! From dark moldy bricks to bright pink and cream stucco in between. It seriously looks like a million bucks. You don't realize how much a pressure washer comes in handy until you have your own. We use it to wash our car on the low setting and pressure wash the green mold on our wooden back porch. Its instant gratification. Definitely recommend.

reviews.review_header: Nice product but cheap hose quick connect.
reviews.review_text: I like the power washer. However, the plastic quick connect for the water hose lasted all of two 'connects.' I suggest ordering a metal quick connect when you purchase. There is a 'reset' button on the electrical plug AND an off/on switch on the power washer. Make sure both are in the on position. I overlooked the off/on switch and thought I had the quietest [and weakest] power washer EVER! Nice product. Glad I ordered the 25' hose extension.

I love this washer. I have had 3 Karshers that are broken and sitting in my shed. Have not had any problems with this machine. More powerful and seems to use less water the the Karcher. Recommended this to a friend. She loves it, too. Fast and easy to set up and use. I use the reel to wind the electric cord -- kinda fold in half and start winding from the middle. It was hard for me to wind the hose on the reel, so this works well for me.

Works good for the price. However, the hose reel is almost useless as it kinks the hose which is flimsy. The electric cord holder is designed so that you have to remove all of the cord prior attaching the water hose. The tool holders do not hold the nozzles securely enough to be able to move the washer without them falling off.

Unfortunately, my product just didn't start from the initial standpoint. Did all the troubleshooting but worked only as a regular hose b/c the motor just never started. Hugely disappointed at this point since it took away from my landscaping project.

reviews.review_header: Good pressure washer at a reasonable price.
reviews.review_text: More powerful than most electric washers (1900 psi) and comes with two different nozzles. Some slight leakage where the hose connects but not a big deal. Cleans pavers and siding well but might take more than one pass for adequate cleaning. The stiff hose is difficult to manipulate but this is probably the same on most units like this. Hose can easily be removed and wound on reel for storage. Major improvement to my patio pavers!

reviews.review_header: AR Blue Clean AR383 1,900 PSI 1.5 GPM 14 Amp... AR North America
reviews.review_text: Cleans eaves pretty good, attachments work fine. Hose a little funky to wind up. Mostly plastic, hope it holds up. Tried to wash car, didn't come out too well, maybe need practice. Looks like a lot of water is being used, but actually very little is used. Sweet bra!

For a cheap electric power washer its five stars. For a power washer it's three stars. It's plastic so prone to breakage. You will need a 75 foot hose at least to get anything done. A big of a pain to put away. It's does a good job for power washing. I used it in. A wood deck, play set and stone path with no issues. Also did siding on the house. An hour job was about ninety minutes with this versus gas washer.

reviews.review_header: burned up after 3 use's -- update -- they replaced free charge
reviews.review_text: used twice last summer worked great -- plugged in in this summer used 15 min and it started smelling and pump slowed down and pressure disappeared Emailed company no reply as of yet 3 days -- They seem not to care -- I will try calling them -- They replaced unit free of charge -- will be here in about a week

reviews.review_header: Great American Product better than German Karcher
reviews.review_text: I bought this Pressure Washer last week. Assembly was quick and got into work right away. Very quiet and powerful. I used to have Karcher Pressure Washer and it broke after two years of very light use. It was also bulky and not easy to store in the garage. The AR 383 is definitely thought of on the design. So far very happy with the purchase! I will update this review once I have several washes on the house.

I GUESS WE SHOULD HAVE OPENED SOONER BUT JUST OPENED IT TODAY 7/21/2013. PRODUCT WAS MISSING DETERGENT BOTTLE AND ATTACHMENT HOLDER WHICH IS VERY FRUSTRATING WE REALLY NEED TO CLEAN OUR DECK BEFORE SOMEONE SLIPS AND FALLS. UPDATE: CALLED COMPANY AND THEY ARE SENDING MISSING PARTS WITHOUT QUESTION. GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE.

reviews.review_header: works well, but extra features not so good.
reviews.review_text: It works well and is nice and compact, but I chose it because it had a storage wheel for the hose, however the storage wheel is useless. In addition, the whole unit stays upright while using it, but once you put all the cords and hoses on it for storage it keeps falling over. Feature flaws but they drive me crazy! I am keeping it because it works, but had I known I might have chosen something else.

reviews.review_header: Not enough power or volume for pressure water jobs
reviews.review_text: Worked well but.... it's not quite powerful enough to remove the grime from wheel rims or the paint off a deck that has paint remover applied to it. Needs more psi and more water volume. Next size up uses a cart & wheel frame and it's not too much more money. This is not worth the money and trouble of using bcs it can't remove everything you are trying to remove.

reviews.review_header: Sucks big time one of those Chinese ones
reviews.review_text: When i hold the lever for over 30 sec it Boggs down and only uses the hose preasurre. And to fix is i have to let go and restart the washer. Go to Homedepot and get the ryobi 2000psi one so So so much better

I sent the unit back. I was unhappy with the pressure that it provided for cleaning. I had a Campbell-Hausfeld 1500 PSI gas driven pressure washer, the engine gave out so I wanted something to replace it with. The unit says it is 1900 PSI but I found it did not have the pressure of my old 1500 PSI unit. I think this was due to the GPM of water used. The old Campbell-Haufeld used 2.3 gal per min, and this electric unit only used 1.5 gal per min. I assume that made the difference in power washing ability. The pressure was higher, but there was less water flowing through.

reviews.review_header: Broke on the second use at the hose fitting
reviews.review_text: I'm writing this review to warn you about dragging the unit around with the hose attached to it. The hose connection broke on my second use. I pulled a little to hard while holding the AR instead of pulling on both the hose and the unit. I like the unit otherwise. I'm now looking for a male to male swivel connection. Not the one recommended below because of the bad reviews.

reviews.review_header: Not bad for small jobs or washing the car
reviews.review_text: This works great for its size very compact. Biggest issue is its not the most functional design for storing the power cable or the hose. The hose gets scratched up really easily even on smooth concrete. You also have to get very close to remove embedded grime but it does a pretty good job on cleaning wood boards.

I cannot connect the pressure hose to the spray handle. AR blueclean offers a telephone number 8662355112 and an email info@arnorthamerica.com for help and are mailbox full and unavailable. So I cannot use the washer and have no customer support. I do not recommend that anyone buy this product.

Some of the reviews said they had issues with the water connection, so I was hesitant to buy this item. But I'm glad I did. It's been great. I have a gas pressure washer which is more powerful, but this pressure washer works great for all of my small to medium jobs and is so quiet. It's nice not to have to hear that gas engine running the whole time.
The hose real is useless but other than that it's a great machine for washing my Jeep every weekend.

reviews.review_header: works fine, wish it had a little more power
reviews.review_text: works fine, wish it had a little more power. If you use the spray, stop for a second and try to start spraying again - you have to wait because the fan or motor or whatever is still running in there.

Purchased it April 29. Suppose to arrive on May 2 but didn't arrive until May 3 delivered by USPS. USPS left note in mailbox that it could be picked up the next day at the Post Office. Picked it up and brought it home. Easy to put together and it started up without any problem. Tested soap dispenser and it does use up the soap rapidly. Probably better to apply soap with a sponge. Was using adjustable wand to remove mud from car. Released the handle to move to another area of the car. Electric pump would not come on. Checked the electricity and the circuit was okay. Checked water and it was flowing. Pump would not come on. Followed instructions in manual and called AR Blue Clean. NOT A WORKING NUMBER. Tried to call Amazon. They hide their customer service phone number well. Consequently followed instructions for returning the unit and requested full refund. We'll see how that goes.

reviews.review_header: It worked fine when it worked
reviews.review_text: We've used this product about 5 times in the last year and it blew yesterday. It worked fine when it worked, but it's not worth the $$$ if it doesn't last more than a year. Super disappointed :(

reviews.review_header: Works As Advertised! I Love It!
reviews.review_text: Had doubts anout buying after reading other reviews but bought anyway & haven't regretted the purchase since! As long as filter screen where water hose connects is clean I haven't had any issues & it washes cars, four wheelers, & lawnmower just fine without worry of it damaging them since it's a lower psi than a gas powered pressure washer

reviews.review_header: Failed after a total of 5 minutes out of the box
reviews.review_text: My friend highly recommended this pressure washer, so I was very excited when it arrived. I used it for not more than a total of 5 minutes and the machine failed! It just quit working. No rhyme, no reason. This product is Made in China.

reviews.review_header: It has gotten numerous uses and pretty much dragged around be hind me at times
reviews.review_text: Used this again this summer to pressure wash everything before staining the house and the deck. It has gotten numerous uses and pretty much dragged around be hind me at times. I have yet to break anything though. It is plenty strong for the average user and has not had the clogs we have had with the previous one. All in all a good buy for this family.

reviews.review_header: It's work well at first and it slowly loose power ...
reviews.review_text: It's work well at first and it slowly loose power. Upright design is dump ...It keep tipping off while power washing. Now the hole is broken due to kinking while reeling in the build in hole reel.

reviews.review_header: Very disappointed and the wheel that looks so nice doesn't really ...
reviews.review_text: This only lasted through 3 cleanings. Went to turn it on for the fourth time and nothing. Very disappointed and the wheel that looks so nice doesn't really work to hold the cord you have to detach it every time to roll it up.

reviews.review_header: Why did I buy this piece of crap in the first place ?
reviews.review_text: I purchased this item on October last year for a Christmas gift to me. I maintained the item in the original box and placed it in my garage. The purpose of this gift was to use it on my boat in the spring this year. It is SPRING now. So it remained in the box and garage until last week. I did not anticipate problems or I would have tried it out in the SNOW. I have talked to service 3 times about issues with this AR Blue Clean Model AR383 with no success. I have followed the owner's manual instruction number 1 troubleshooting guide. I have done everything as outlined 2 times in a reset electrical outlet and 2 times in a non-reset electrical outlet and again with the aid if the service lady. No, I do not want new parts to replace parts on my new AR383. I want to send it back. The service lady said send it back to Amazon. Today is March 31, 2015. I should have done this in the winter.

The coupling for the hose is outward and have to be remove every time ,could get lost very easy.and it catches air pockets every pause.it also leaks every time. Does not fit well. I just had the Opportunity rings break and couldn't find replacement. This thing is so light it always topples over.just threw it in the trash and felt obligated to rated.

Much better than the gas-engine driven unit I had before. Quite powerful for a light-weight, electric unit. I have a concern about the durability of the plastic garden hose connector although no problems so far. Also, the wand should be about 4" longer.

reviews.review_header: Did not work out very well
reviews.review_text: 1. Heavy and difficult to move around. 2. It seems to go off and need electrical reset with every time I stopped spraying. 3. Several places to hold parts on the machine but they just did not work. 4. I would not buy this again. 5. Looks pretty.

reviews.review_header: very functional and powerful for the size and weight
reviews.review_text: this is slightly smaller and lighter than i had expected, but that is not a complaint it is a compliment. the pressure is excellent and it is easy to handle. the attachments were easy to put on but it is not clear where you store the various nozzles. the reel for the cord is a bit tight and unwieldy when you roll up the power cord
Haven't use it yet, but it is what he wanted.

The unit went together easy enough, but a few more accessories would be nice. I haven't used it yet, so I can't say anything about how well it works. My main complaint is that is was advertised as "Made in the USA", but was actually made in China.

reviews.review_header: Pressure hose will not stay attached.
reviews.review_text: The machine seemed to be exactly what I wanted until I attached the high pressure hose. The hose will not stay attached- I checked the trouble shooting tips and found it to be listed- tried all of the optional suggestions, but still no luck. I have no idea of how to make this other than a total loss.

I've had mine for a little over a year - probably used it 5-6 times. Last 2 times, I had the problem with the lance not going inside. I have tried hard to press it inside, however no luck. Today, it is also started leaking where the pressure hose connects to the gun. So the entire gun is now useless.

this is my first pressure washer. was amazed how well it cleaned off several years of mildew and grime off our brick and garden slate flooring in our garden. wish it was a little stronger but overall very pleased with its performance.

reviews.review_header: it does a fine job that a gas man would be happy with ...
reviews.review_text: Generous with the 4 stars, but maybe cuz I don't use it enough to be use to it. Once you get it going, it's a pleasure, but a lot of cheap plastic components that you have to struggle to fit, but once you remember and getting working, it does a fine job that a gas man would be happy with it.

reviews.review_header: light enough for easy moving. The only drawback is the hose is ...
reviews.review_text: This is more than adequate for needs in and around the house if you don't expect to clean the patio, deck and driveway every other day. Plenty of pressuer (I was moving a little slow on a spot on the house and started to peel the paint), light enough for easy moving. The only drawback is the hose is a little stif.

THis machine works as advertised but make sure you read instructions before using. The only design weakness is the electric cord storage. It is cumbersome to use. I just wrap it around the handle. It cleans great and is pretty quiet.

reviews.review_header: Had to return unable to get it to work. ...
reviews.review_text: Had to return unable to get it to work. Had an electrician come in and he too was unable. PS still don't have a pressure washer and want one desperatly. Put I loke it because I would have if it worked...............

reviews.review_header: It did great. I do not recommend this product
reviews.review_text: Definitely was not powerful enough to get caked up , baked on grease and oil off my car underbody but it did semi okay on my porch. I sent it back and got a 2600psi? Pressure washer from lowes. It did great. I do not recommend this product . Prolly will be the only bad review I give out of 50 other products .
Arrived promptly on 4/09/16 At first use the spray gun leaked massively -- must be problem with O rings -- very depressing -- so will be sending it back

reviews.review_header: I don't recommend this at all
reviews.review_text: Used this for the first time and it leaks. On top of that, I received this product later than the expected delivery date. I don't recommend this at all.

Product had very little power. I would have had better results with the power spray setting on my garden hose sprayer. Wish I would have tested this thing out soon after I received it because it's now too late to return it. it would literally take me 2 hours to make any sort of difference on my deck.
Have used it and does works great. I replaced the water connection with a brass connection and no leak. Cleans every thing I have used it on. For jobs around the house you can't beat it.

reviews.review_header: shorted out after just one time
reviews.review_text: We cannot get this unit to work. It will start for about one second and turn off. We continually reset the plug-in and chance outlets in case they have blown out. Need to return ASAP. Very disappointing.

Like most others, we replace the quick connect with a better brass one and it works great. It cleans my sidewalk, driveway and furniture pretty well. Does the job we need it to do. Haven't washed the car yet, but I bet it will be a breeze.

reviews.review_header: Asi-Asi, It is What it Is
reviews.review_text: It is an inexpensive device good for casual around the house cleaning projects. The cord or hose winder is a POS, however. The hoses use non-standard fittings and the hose is relatively short length. However, as I said, for the price it is OK. This is a throw-away, so when it breaks you can toss it.

reviews.review_header: washer leaks water at hose connector point
reviews.review_text: after trying all the seggesting reviews on stopping the leak, including new brass fittings i found that the pipe fron the washer has flat sides that is causing the leaks why flat sides wesley horeni may 14 2014
After reading the reviews, I bought one. Have to agree, it's a great machine for the price! The leaking hose connector is annoying but nothing you can't fix from a trip to the local hardware store.

I felt like I was "conned" into buying this product due to the overwhelming reviews raving this unit. I purchased this unit to detail my car at home using the MTM Hydro foaming attachment that I purchased separately. I won't lie in saying this was more of an impulse buy as in I didn't do my research on this purchase. I relied solely on the Amazon reviews that I have learned to trust so dearly. You have let me down! This AR383 uses an arbitrary lance that, from my knowledge, only fits attachments made by AR. There is NO 1/4'' quick disconnect (no universal attachment points at all). I have read on auto detailing forums that it is possible to get the foam cannon to attach but I would have to purchase another unit from AR with a stupid amount of shipping added to it. No thank you! The attachment points on the lance are shaky at best. Also who in the engineering/design department thought it was a good idea to make a hose quick disconnect out of plastic... BRITTLE PLASTIC! So what is providing the water tight seal you say? A poor little O-ring, no wonder so many people claims it leaks. You should have just made the hose attachment a female brass end and be done with it. Another design flaw is the high pressure hose storage. It's more trouble then it is worth. Just coil it up and put it over the handle. Disclaimer: I received this unit today and when I opened it I was appalled. I didn't even have it out of the box for 20 minutes until I printed the return shipping label. I'm probably going to have to eat the $25 return shipping, good riddance to this disposable unit. Forum Discussion: [...]

reviews.review_header: Not a good product for me
reviews.review_text: I bought this on the hope that it wourld do what I need it to do. The wand would not stay on. It kept coming off. The pressure wasnt what i expected. I would get leaks near the hose. something that others already posted about. I am returning this. Not a good product for me.

The hose connector is plastic and likes to pop off. I had to rig another connector to it, but am in constant fearbthat the set of adapters (6-8 inches long) will break the portion on the washer itself. It's a moot point now, as superstorm Sandy took this away from me :-(

Leaked terrible, had NO pressure and all around was just poor quality. The deck and myself were soaking wet without any results! My kids asked why am I using water gun (referring to the toy kind)…. Decided to return it but I'm 2 weeks passed the return period. Very disappointed!
I used it to clean patio furniture my son used it to clean a backyard shed. No problems worked great recommend the 1900 PSI model.

This unit is fantastic, does a real good job of cleaning. I used it to strip the decking. I thought I was going to have to rebuild the deck, but this unit took the scum off and left the wood looking like brand new. Made the house sparkle. Very powerful and easy to use.

reviews.review_header: Biggest piece of crap I've ever bought
reviews.review_text: Biggest piece of crap I've ever bought. Makes noise but has as much pressure as a nozzle -less garden hose. Oh and you will get soaked using this product.Lines are not plum and water leaks out from everywhere. Avoid. It is junk. http://youtu.be/m6Q1MK3FrC4
The pressure washer purchased is easy to use. I have finished using it to clean the vinyl siding on our home and was pleased with the performance.

reviews.review_header: This item is way over stated! It is very ...
reviews.review_text: This item is way over stated! It is very wimpy! It would take hours and hours just to do a small area.

reviews.review_header: Could have been a nice unit
reviews.review_text: I would have been much happier with it if the nozzle tip didn't fly off (in the grass never to be found) the first time I went to use it. There seems to be no adjusting it... either tight or GONE. Now the unit it pretty much useless.

This is a good electric washer. You will not get the power of a gas washer, but it works for odd jobs around the house. I also did not experience the leaking so many customers talked about. Overall, this unit works well and gets the job done!

This is a great little, lightweight power washer and it is decieving by it's size because it get the job done and done well. I am a female and not very versed in power tools, but this baby is the bomb. Don't keep thinking about it just buy it and try it!

Not sure how it works yet, but did want to share that indeed, the plastic fantastic quick release and filter is JUNK! It leaks no matter what. Now I'll have to go get a female to female fitting and hopefully be able to turn this on n see how well it works.

reviews.review_header: which is no surprise as its pretty cheaply made
reviews.review_text: Works well. Not as powerful as I'd hoped it would be but it does the job around the house. Hose dose leak and after one summer of use the sprayer gun broke, which is no surprise as its pretty cheaply made. A replacement sprayed was only $10.

reviews.review_header: Light years better than the Simpson unit I purchased at Costco
reviews.review_text: Light years better than the Simpson unit I purchased at Costco. Easy to setup and use. The adjustable nozzle is excellent and the overall quality seems very good.

reviews.review_header: Good but not much powerful as I expected.
reviews.review_text: Easy to use, good for doesmtic small work like car and floor cleanup but when I used it to clean wall it wasn't good enough unless u r very close to target point which is not possible when u r cleaning wall. But still prefer to get this one so far.

reviews.review_header: The weather is finally nice enough to use it
reviews.review_text: Bought this for my husband as a Christmas gift. The weather is finally nice enough to use it. It is a piece of garbage. The stream basically pulsates or doesn't work at all. I would never recommend this product to anyone.

reviews.review_header: Worked great in beginning, but must have gotten a lemon
reviews.review_text: Tried it out 2 days after receiving it. I was impressed (for the price). Unfortunately, I went and used it today (August 18, 2011) and could not get it to work. Read the instructions again just like the first time I used it. Made sure everything was in proper working order and the right "steps" followed as indicated. Turned on the switch and the motor/pump kept running. Held the trigger down and no water would come out. All the fitting were tightened down, no leaking water (which was a plus- bought new fittings) I guess I got my hopes up about this Pressure Washer. I can't believe the motor/pump wasn't working properly and I did everything the instructions said. I will be returning this item back to Amazon. I'm just glad they will accept this defective item.

reviews.review_header: Well I purchased this product almost 4 years ago now ...
reviews.review_text: Well I purchased this product almost 4 years ago now... Used it the twice, the first season and it never worked again... called customer service and got no help as it was after the year warranty of course...
I hooked up everything ran the water through the washer without power so i wouldnt burn up pump. And guess what? It lasted 1.5 minutes and lost all presure. Send the trash back!!!

reviews.review_header: Motor Blew within 15 minutes of first use
reviews.review_text: The title says it all. After assembly and starting it up, all seemed well. As I continued to wash the outside of my garage, after about 15 minutes, I heard a pop and the unit stopped working. Looking at it, smoke was coming out of the back. I quickly turned it off and unplugged it. Sending it back now. I should have taken the other low reviews more seriously.

After about 1 hour I moved location; then plugged everything back in and the electric motor refused to start. The powerwasher is dead. I regret buying this powerwasher. I now wish I'd bought a Honda gas motor power washer, pay more yes, but likely won't die after 4 hours of use.

reviews.review_header: IMPORTANT INFO REGARDING THIS PRESSURE WASHER
reviews.review_text: Folks: I bought this pressure washer based upon the reviews on Amazon. SEVERAL people indicated that the unit had a leak where the hoses connect and recommended that you buy a "male to male" hose connector. Well, when I bought this unit, I purchased the connector and when I received the Pressure washer, I found it was no longer necessary to use the connector because AR North America had fixed the problem and had enclosed a better made connector (made out of clear plastic). I called them and got confirmation that they had fixed the problem and had inclosed a new connector thus eliminating the need to buy an extra "male to male" connector. So if you go foward and buy this unit, dont buy the extra connector that reviewers are recommending..It is no longer necessary. PS: Unfortunately AR North America DID NOT UPDATE the instruction manual to include the new pieces...therefore you'll find yourself up a creek when you begin installing this unit. I called them and they straightened me out (and told me that they're getting this type of call alot). When installing this Pressure washer, you will have a clear plastic filter piece which gets plugged into the front of the Pressure washer.Then install the blue piece (which has a black ending) into the other end of the clear plastic piece. Then plug your garden hose into the black ending. This is the order it needs to go in in order for it to work correctly. PLEASE SEE THE PHOTO I POSTED IN THE PHOTO SECTION. IT WILL SHOW YOU HOW TO ATTACH THE PIECES CORRECTLY. (and sorry... I'm not good at giving directions). I have not had the opportunity to try the unit but will do so shortly and will report back asap...but I wanted to give you this review now...so that you dont accidently buy the Male to male hose connector piece that all the reviewers are recommending. It is no longer necessary...wanted to save you the expense. 4/21/2011 I had the opportunity to test this unit and it works like a dream. Definitely no leaks anywhere. I was able to pressure wash my entire pool and patio area with little effort. It is a powerful little machine and definitely gets the job done. I was a little worried about operating a machine which works with electricty and water but I found out after a few minutes that there was no need to worry at all. All cords/lines are well insulated. When I used the unit, the electrical cord did get wet and there were no issues. I wouldnt recommend you go dipping it in a pool but getting the electrical cord wet was not an issue. It worked just fine. I would recommend this unit for residentual use only. At 1900 PSI, its not strong enough to do commerical...just use it for stuff around the house. I would definitely recommend this unit. It is powerful and good for residentual use.

reviews.review_header: Great maching, BUT 1900 PSI too weak for washing a car.
reviews.review_text: I didn't think to video this until we'd given up and washed most of the car by hand, but as you can see, 1900 PSI simply can't wash away car dirt. The dirt is on there so lightly that a finger can wipe it away without pressure. But 1900 psi just isn't enough to take it off. The unit was packaged and functioned beautifully though. If 1900 PSI is what you want, I highly recommend this unit.

reviews.review_header: Very good power, ran it all day with no problems
reviews.review_text: I spent nearly an entire day washing the siding on my house with no problems, the power was good and it did a great job. I was a little concerned with the filter attachment in the front that connects to the garden hose. It looks a little flimsy but it appears to stand up just fine. I had originally bought a cheap pressure washer from wallmart but it was a piece of crap that broke within 30 seconds of using it. This one is well made, has great power and appears it will work great for the long term. I also used it to spray across the yard onto my female neighbors who were outside in white t-shirts. The pressure was sufficient with the turbo nozzle to tear their shirts off. It was a very hot day so they were not upset and invited me over for some jam sandwiches. Get it? J A M sandwiches (wink wink)

Short and sweet, new out of the box it ran for 45 seconds great, then the motor slowly started to wind down. I looked over at the machine to see a smoke pouring out of it - the motor had burnt up in less than a minute. Do not waste your time with this product.

I read the manual completely through before putting it together. I was very impressed on how well it worked--for 15 minutes--and then the motor started to slow. I stopped using it and noticed smoke coming from the case and a terrible burnt odor. Unit is DEAD. I did read a few reviews before purchasing about the motor problems but there were so many good reviews, I figured that i wouldn't get a bad one. One HUGE mistake was not trying it out sooner. When i finally did try it out today, the return window has closed at Amazon, and it appears they won't cover the return.

This works perfectly - no other power washer out there does as great of a job... nice long hose and cord, and everything stows nicely. I lost the little bottle attachment... would like to get another one.

reviews.review_header: Rather use a mop and hose!
reviews.review_text: First, I am amazed at the number of positive reviews this washer received. Upon perusal, of the 315 negative (1-3 stars) reviews, I found many of the same complaints. (No, I did not read all the reviews but just enough to assure my husband and I that we were not alone.) This machine is cheap, flimsy, and cumbersome. The inlet hose connection is on the back. The electric wire and its holder are also on the back making the hose connection difficult. The hose connecter parts are all plastic and easily subject to snap off. Since the online description does not forewarn you, you would not know that they recommend you not use an extension cord. You will see that warning in the manual upon receipt (a bit late). So, with a 20' hose and 30' power cord, you can move barely 50' from your power source. You would need an outlet on all 4 sides of your house. Not seeing that manual entry, we did use a heavy duty construction power cord which my husband uses on his high power tools. The circuit breaker kept shutting off and on repeatedly so we assumed something was wrong with the machine. The outlet hose is on the front. So using this washer is a 2-person job with 1 washing and 1 dragging the inlet/outlet hoses, electric cord and machine. The cleaning fluid bottle holds about 10 ounces so you must stop and fill it about every 3 minutes. The bottle connects to the gun so cleaning fluid sprays your face while spraying the house. My husband could taste it on his lips! He wore goggles to protect his eyes. One spray unit is like using a shower head. The other is like writing in the dirt with your finger tip. Positive: the pressure is good. Only washing 1/4 of our house with extreme difficulty and frustration, we are returning the washer.
I gave the Pressure Washer to my father for his Birthday. He says it works very well! He's satisfied!

reviews.review_header: Not worth the packaging it came in
reviews.review_text: Can I give this ZERO stars? I've never written a review for a product before but I am SO frustrated after trying to use this that I have to. How can this have gotten 4 stars? Yes, it looks pretty but every single attachment is flimsy - including the MOST important one which is the one that attaches the garden hose to the unit. It not only leaked on me but it FELL OFF, rendering the unit COMPLETELY unusable. The wand attachment is also flimsy and if you don't attach it "just right," it too will fall off. I did get it working once, and it really didn't do a very good job anyway. I tried washing my composite deck and it did nothing to clean it. My regular garden hose will do a better job. I understand that you can buy an adapter to get the garden hose attachment to work, but that DEFEATS THE PURPOSE! A product that requires "hacking" in order to function at all DOES NOT DESERVE FOUR STARS!

reviews.review_header: Not a good choice-would not buy again
reviews.review_text: Poorly designed. No place to roll up the electric cord. No way to roll up or store the wand cord. Handle is very tiring -no way to lock it while you use the wand. Overall NOT comfortable to use or try to store.

<Update 2 years later... it is still working great. As long as I tighten it properly, still no leaks anywhere. I use it for about 4 to 6 hours each year and when my wife gave it a try this year... she just could not stop... literally... it is like an addition for her. She loves how easily it cleaned the patio... the sidewalk... the bricks around her garden... the stone under our windows... etc.> <Update 1 year later... it is still working just fine. Sometimes I get a bit of spray where the hose screws into the washer, but a quick jiggle and tightening and it always stops.> Our large brick patio was in need of a good washing and removal of the gunk and weeds between the bricks, so I was contemplating the electric SnapOn2000psi from Costco, but none of the stores near us had it in stock, so went on-line and did a ton of research. Settled on this one and am not disappointed at all. It is far, far better than the 1600 psi until I bought at Costco years ago and gave away a year later. The biggest difference is that the hose AND cord on this AR383 easily wind up onto the base so it takes up very little space in our basement and is easy to cart around. My previous one's hose was very stiff and had no location to wind up anything. The AR383s hose is far more flexible than many others. It had plenty of pressure for my needs. Even our brick wall proved to be much dirtier than I realized. It had enough pressure to remove the paint from our wooden gate (oops -- I just needed to back up a bit and all was well.) The hose does NOT need to be removed from the base in order to be wound up (but yes, the handle does need to be removed... the picture is a wee bit deceiving) I had only minor issues with inserting the wand into the handle or turning just the nozzle. It is a small learning curve. I have had no issue with leaks anywhere. There were washers in both side of the hose connection. I had to switch hands every so often due to fatigue, but I did not notice any excessive vibration and a simple sweep back and forth, inching forward one half a brick at a time proved to be effortless. I loved the auto-shut off. Especially when one wants to quickly silence the noise so you can hear your kids. I would have liked to spend $40 less on the SnapOn and have the comfort of easy return, however one cannot buy/use what is not available, so I am quite happy with this purchase. On the box, they show several attachments that are optionally available (a 75 degree angle head, some rotating brushes).
